jobText: TXT/50524844.txt	§Weighbridge Administrator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Weighbridge Administrator§§Advertiser: §Oji Fibre Solutions Pulp and Paper§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Other§§§§§§Fullcircle is a division of Oji Fibre Solutions (NZ) Ltd and is a market leader specialising in the collection of kerbside and commercial waste paper for supply to our New Zealand Pulp & Paper Mills and export customers. Here at Oji Fibre Solutions we are committed to delivering innovative, sustainable products, and developing solutions that add value to our customers' businesses.§  §We are seeking a permanent §Weighbridge Administrator§ to join our Fullcircle team in Penrose, Auckland. Reporting to the Finance Manager, this position is responsible for the daily management of the weighbridge database, Salesforce.§  §Key responsibilities:§ § §Timely tracking of all key entries, ensuring data sets are accurate and complete§ §Daily manual entry of dockets and transporter records into the database§ §Reviewing and checking automated transactions and updating as required§ §Effective and efficient month end reporting for data validation for stakeholders and audit purposes§ §Professional handling of calls and resolution of queries from stakeholders, both internal and external§ §Skills and experience:§ § §Ideally qualified in bookkeeping, a business course, database management or with suitable experience§ §Solid ability to work with numbers, preferably minimum NZCEA Level 1§ §Understanding of key accounting principles, experienced in Accounts Payable/Receivable§ §Proven user of Microsoft suite (word/excel) with capable excel reporting skills§ §Clear and concise communicator, both verbal and written§ §Understand the importance of meeting deadlines and expectations§ §Positive team contributor and enjoy problem solving§ §Benefits:§ § §Positive, supportive and professional work environment§ §Competitive salary§ §Enhanced superannuation, subsidised medical insurance, disability and life insurance§ §Penrose location with free onsite car parking§ §Monday to Friday, 40-hour week§ §In accordance with company policy, applicants are required to undergo a pre-employment Ministry of Justice criminal history check, credit check and medical examination and drug testing. Oji Fibre Solutions will meet these expenses.§  §Please apply via the below link with an up to date cover letter and CV: https://ojifs.careercentre.net.nz/Job/Weighbridge-Administrator/Auckland/3966§  §Applications close Friday, 9 October 2020.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50525850.txt	§Manager Alliance Française Christchurch§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Manager Alliance Française Christchurch§§Advertiser: §Alliance Francaise de Christchurch§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Sept 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Other§§§§§§About Us:§  §Alliance Française is a worldwide network of non-profit associations dedicated to the promotion of the French language and the culture of Francophone countries around the world.  Founded in 1959, Alliance Francaise Christchurch (AFC) prides itself on a tradition of excellence in French language tuition and promotion of cultural activities.  Find out more from our website at www.afchristchurch.org.nz§  § §  §About the role:§  §Starting in January 2021, we have a fantastic opportunity for a full time, permanent role of §Manager Alliance Française Christchurch (fluent in both French and English) §to lead our team based in central Christchurch. With the support of the Executive Committee, this role is pivotal to our success and takes overall responsibility for the day to day leadership and management of the staff, students, members, facilities and activities of Alliance Française Christchurch; the second biggest Alliance Française in New Zealand.§  §Key responsibilities include:§ § §Provide oversight and strategy to all staff to achieve AFC’s goals after consultation with the President and the Executive Committee§ §Develop and manage all AFC staff – teachers, administrative support, interns§ §Plan, organise and oversee the implementation of the activities of AFC which include: § §French Language classes and workshops§ §A diverse programme of Social and Cultural activities§ § § §Responsible for the marketing and communications of AFC to drive sustained increases in student and member numbers§ §Raise the profile of AFC, via the effective promotion of the language and cultural activities, fostering links with businesses and French diplomatic circles, developing partnerships with educational and cultural organisations§ §Manage administration and financial matters; including developing policy and procedures, budgeting and financial planning§ §Take responsibility for the health and safety of AF staff and customers by maintaining a safe and healthy work environment§ §You are a confident, highly organised leader who is totally at ease wearing the different hats this varied role requires (people management, marketing and communications, finance, events organisation etc).  You have proven skills in managing relationships at all levels with diplomacy and professionalism. You have an approachable, unflappable and friendly disposition that will immediately put both customers and colleagues at ease and build great morale. You lead by example, demonstrating personal drive & motivation, flexibility, attention to detail, excellent customer service and plenty of common sense; if you don’t know the answer, you take the initiative to draw support from those with the specialist knowledge to help you.§  §Role Requirements:§ § §Post secondary qualification (Diplôme (Fr), Licence (Fr), Tertiary Degree or other) required.§ §Relevant experience of leading a business unit and team highly desired.§ §Fluent in French and English§ §Demonstrated ability to lead a team; recruit, manage and develop talent effectively§ §Highly organised & detail orientated with sound financial acumen§ §Excellent customer service, marketing and communication skills§ §Proactive and have proven effective networking skills§ §You are also a New Zealand citizen or resident (or hold a valid New Zealand work visa for a minimum of two years remaining), and possess a valid driver’s license§ § §  §How to Apply:§  §If this sounds like you and you want to be a part of this exciting and growing charitable society, send your CV and covering letter to §president@afchristchurch.org.nz§.  §Closing date for applications is 23 September, 2020.§  §Applicants should currently be in New Zealand and hold a current work visa / residency or NZ citizenship, also a NZ driver’s licence.§  §Please note: we do not always work to fixed closing dates and may start considering applications as they are received so we encourage you to apply early.§  §Please note that all applications are reviewed but only shortlisted candidates will be contacted. If you have any questions about your application please feel free to send an email to §president@afchristchurch.org.nz§.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§

jobTitle: Chief Organiser Job in Otago - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50525990.txt	§Chief Organiser§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Chief Organiser§§Advertiser: §Ahika Consulting§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Sept 2020§§Location§§Otago§, §Dunedin§§Salary§§$50,000 - $64,999§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Administrative Assistants§§§§§§§About us§Join a small purpose-driven business that is committed to helping create sustainable futures.  §Ahikā is a Māori word relating to sustaining the fire and keeping the home fires burning. For us, it means sustaining and enhancing our place and our communities.  We work in areas significant to community well-being, including biodiversity and conservation; carbon, waste and energy management, and community development.  §We believe that by working together, we shape places where nature and communities thrive forever.  We bring vision and leadership to every stage of our projects and with our skilled team’s multi-disciplinary approach, we will uncover the richness in every client's project.§§Qualifications & experience§§Be highly organised, energetic and capable.§High attention to detail, and ability to fill in the gaps.§Enjoy working in a small, agile team and alongside key clients (both NGOs and corporate), whilst also being able to drive projects autonomously.§Be fantastic at developing high trust relationships with a wide range of stakeholders.§Have a broad understanding of the conservation, environmental and sustainability sectors (technical knowledge or experience is a bonus).§Be excited about creating ideas for sustainable futures, and getting projects going.§Have a broad base of project management skills - use Office 365, Xero, WorkFlow Max, manage spreadsheets, payroll systems.§Familiar at working with external contractors and clients closely.§§§Tasks & responsibilities§§Project and organisational management, both within Ahikā and some priority projects.§Contract management, reporting to project sponsors and clients.§Supporting our Managing Director to deliver quality outcomes.§Office support and administration.§Managing key projects & contractors.§Information management.§Bookkeeping, budgeting & reporting.§Payroll and employee contract management.§§§Benefits§§Join a small purpose-driven team that is committed to helping create sustainable futures.  §Flexible hours and place of work though ideally working from our Dunedin office 3-4 days per week.§12-month initial contract with the potential to extend to an ongoing position.§§§§§

jobText: TXT/50526439.txt	§Administration Roles - Kiwi Lumber Gisborne§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Administration Roles - Kiwi Lumber Gisborne§§Advertiser: §Kiwi Lumber§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Sept 2020§§Location§§Gisborne§, §Gisborne§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Office Management§§§§§§ABOUT US:§  §Kiwi Lumber is a privately owned, growing and progressive sawmilling company marketing Radiata Pine to the USA, Australia, Europe, Asia and New Zealand markets. The group consists of four modern sawmills located in Masterton, Dannevirke, Putaruru and Gisborne, and employs over 275 staff, across the four sites.§  §OFFICE ADMINISTRATOR§  §Excellent opportunity for a motivated person to take a leading role in our administration team.  Key tasks include:§ § §Data entry. § §Weekly payroll processing. § §Accounts payable. § §Monthly reporting. § §General office duties.§ §The successful applicant will be an experienced administrator who is proficient in Microsoft Excel, time-sheets and payroll duties.§  §MANUFACTURING SYSTEMS COORDINATOR§  §In this key position you will be responsible for the ongoing adherence and maintenance of our H&S, Environmental, HR and Quality compliance systems and core responsibilities will include: § § §Ensuring routine audits are completed.§ §Maintaining relevant software systems.§ §Ensuring all necessary documentation is completed.§ §Undertaking site inductions and skills gap analysis.§ §Assisting managers with associated processes/procedures.§ §The ideal candidate will have strong administration and organisational skills.  Experience in health and safety systems and processes in a relevant industry would be advantageous but not a prerequisite.§  §For both positions the successful candidate will possess:§ § §Excellent attention to detail and accuracy.§ §Well experienced in computer-based tasks in an office environment.§ §Good communication skills and a positive attitude with a friendly demeanour.§ §Be able to work in a fast-paced, results driven environment.§ §Be a team player who can manage multiple tasks.§ §Be reliable, punctual and responsible.§ §WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU?§  §As a Kiwi employee you’ll have access to subsidised health insurance options, discounted prices on our products and the opportunity to be a part of a progressive company which offers rewarding careers.§  §WHERE TO FROM HERE?§  §To apply click on the APPLY button.§  §Applicants for these positions should have NZ So it would be ideal that the perfect candidate could have flexibility in their week to accommodate this. §About Body In Motion Physio and Rehab§Body in Motion is a leading physiotherapy treatment and rehabilitation company with clinics based in Bethlehem, Pyes Pa, Papamoa, Whakatane and Mount Maunganui.§Body in Motion provides a wide range of rehabilitation services to the community. We work with ACC, private insurers and the Bay of Plenty's top sports organisations. Our team of physiotherapists and Occupational Therapists are among the Bay of Plenty's best qualified, with experienced specialists in aged health, sports medicine, occupational health, post-surgery rehabilitation and neck and back pain.§At Body in Motion, our greatest strength is the quality of our people. Their expertise and dedication are the foundations of our success. If this sounds like the role for you, please get in touch!§The Role§The receptionist's main purpose is to provide a welcoming face for the organisation and excellent customer care to our clients. This includes warmly greeting patients on arrival and checking them in, effective call handling and appointment booking. There are other administrative duties to be juggled alongside the customer service aspect of the role also.§To be successful in this role you will have to following attributes:§You will be a well presented, self-motivated individual who is bright and enthusiastic with exceptional interpersonal and customer service skills§You have prior experience in a busy administrative and/ or reception role. The ability to cope well under pressure is essential for this position§You possess excellent written and verbal communication skills including exceptional phone manner§You have the ability to prioritise work, meet deadlines and work accurately under conflicting time pressures§You have great attention to detail, organisation, accurate data entry and typing skills§Computer literacy and the ability to learn new programmes (Gensolve).§Intermediate level spreadsheeting experience desirable§A driver's license as you may be running errands§This is a great role as you will be required to deal with many different aspects of a physiotherapy clinic and no two days will be the same!§If you are seeking a long term career in a great company that offers lots of variety in a team oriented environment please send through your CV and cover letter to: §Everlyn Wray - Business Support Manager, through Seek. §Please note - only electronic applications will be considered.§In order to get recruitment and training underway, our ideal candidate would either be ready to go now, or have a very short notice period. Applications close: Wednesday 23/09/20.§ §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Do you have experience in an administration role?§Which of the following Microsoft Office products are you experienced with?§Do you have customer service experience?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§

jobTitle: Practicum Placement Coordinator - Medical Programme Directorate Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50534474.txt	§Practicum Placement Coordinator - Medical Programme Directorate§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Practicum Placement Coordinator - Medical Programme Directorate§§Advertiser: §The University of Auckland§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§9 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Administrative Assistants§§§§§§ §Use your admin and coordination skills to really make a difference§ §Work in a close-knit, supportive team§ §This is a full-time, 3-year fixed-term appointment§ §The Medical Programme Directorate (MPD) at the University of Auckland in the Faculty of Medical and Health Sciences is seeking to appoint an experienced person as a Practicum Placement Coordinator.§ §The main purpose of the role is to assist with the coordination of national and international Selective and Elective placements for the Bachelor of Medicine and Bachelor of Surgery (MBChB). They will provide professional and effective administrative support for this component of the programme whist develop and maintain relationships with the external practicum placement providers.§ §The successful candidate will have:§ § §Exceptional planning and organisational skills§ §Excellent computer literacy with a high level of Microsoft Excel skills§ §Advanced problem-solving and analytical skills§ §Excellent communication verbal and written§ §Tertiary qualification or relevant experience§ §Experience of working in an administrative role with many stakeholders§ §Experience working in an environment  requiring high levels of customer service§ §For more detailed information about the responsibilities and requirements of the role, please review the Position Description §HERE§. § §What we offer § §The University of Auckland is New Zealand’s leading university, with a turnover of $1.1bn, including research revenue of over $200m generated across eight diverse faculties and two research institutes. We employ more than 5400 academic and professional staff to support over 41,000 students, making us one of NZ’s largest employers.§ §The University is committed to providing an excellent working environment through:§ § §Flexible employment practices§ §Career development programmes§ §Discounted car parking, a generous parental leave allowance, childcare and a number of other discounts on internal and external services.§ §For more information please visit §Staff Benefits§.§ §How to apply§ §Please note we are happy to answer your questions, but we do not accept applications by email.§ §Applications must be submitted online, by the closing date of §Sunday, 27 September §2020 §to be considered. Please include your CV and cover letter outlining your suitability for this role.§ §Additional Information§ §The University is committed to meeting its obligations under the Treaty of Waitangi and achieving equity outcomes for staff and students in a safe, inclusive and equitable environment.  For further information on services for Māori, Pacific, women, LGBTQITakatāpui+, people with disabilities, parenting support, flexible work and other equity issues go to §www.equity.auckland.ac.nz§§§§

jobText: TXT/50534789.txt	§Contracts Administrator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Contracts Administrator§§Advertiser: §Body In Motion Physio and Rehab§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§9 Sept 2020§§Location§§Bay of Plenty§, §Tauranga§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Contracts Administration§§§§§§Body In Motion Physio & Rehab is a leading physiotherapy treatment and rehabilitation company based in the beautiful Tauranga and Mount Maunganui region, with a multidisciplinary team of 50 clinical staff supported by friendly and efficient administration and management personnel.§  §We are seeking a highly motivated, skilled and professional Administrator with outstanding analytical, communication and interpersonal skills to join our high performing team. The role will be required to liaise with managers and clinicians, proactively managing contracts administration and general support to the back office operations for our services.§  §We have experienced significant growth recently through our services and require a full time person to hit the ground running and support our team. This role will be both challenging and rewarding and there will be the opportunity to learn multiple aspects of the business/industry. To be successful in this role you must have at least three to five years experience in mid - high level administration.§  §In order to properly develop your knowledge and understanding of our general business operations, there will be a reception element to the role to start with while you learn. This role will ultimately become a full time back office position, so you will need to be comfortable with working in a fast paced, client facing environment too.§  § §  §Your key responsibilities will be to: § § § §Provide comprehensive contract administration and support to our clinical teams and the service managers§  § § §Liaise with management to prioritize business needs§  § § §Load, allocate and record contracts across rehabilitation services§  § § §Liaise with ACC, Insurers and other funders as required§  § § §Ensure billing is accurate and completed in a timely manner§  § § §Fill in for other key back office staff where required §  § § §  §To be successful, the right candidate will have the below expertise: § § § §A great attitude and the ability to work collaboratively alongside others§  § § §Intermediate to advanced Excel skills§  § § §Excellent and accurate data entry skills§  § § §Experience of managing debtors and creditors§  § § §Strong analytical and problem-solving ability§  § § §Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written§  § § §Previous experience in the health industry and with payroll administration is advantageous§  § § §  §Body In Motion's greatest strength is the quality of our people. Our expertise and dedication are the foundation of our success. This is recognised through excellent employment conditions and continuous professional development and support.  If you feel you have the skills and attributes we need, apply now to join us in the sunny Bay of Plenty!§  §Apply through the SEEK website with your cover letter and CV.§  §Please note: only electronic applications will be considered.§  §Applications close: 25th of September §  §Check out our website: www.bodyinmotion.co.nz §  § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§How many years' experience do you have as a contracts administrator?§Which of the following Microsoft Office products are you experienced with?§Do you have customer service experience?§How many years' experience do you have in an accounting role?§Do you have previous invoicing experience?§§§

jobText: TXT/50542852.txt	§Office Administrator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Office Administrator§§Advertiser: §Datacom§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§10 Sept 2020§§Location§§Bay of Plenty§, §Tauranga§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Administrative Assistants§§§§§§Our purpose§Here at Datacom we connect people and technology in order to solve challenges, create opportunities and discover new possibilities for the communities we live in. §Our team§This is an exciting and diverse role, where you'll be part of a dedicated team and be surrounded by great people to work with. The Administration team supports the daily functions of the building operations and ultimately, our staff. At Datacom you'll be recognised and valued for your contributions. We pride ourselves on providing our staff numerous career opportunities during their time with us, our adaptability relies on this. We provide you with life, income protection insurance and medical insurance. Plus, a supportive, fun and friendly working environment.§About the Role§This is a part time role focused on a combination of office administration and facility support. You'll take ownership of our front of office, managing our Visitor Sign In/Out function and front facing customer service. Other areas of support include car park allocation management, bookings, telephony duties, security access card administration, meeting rooms, mail sorting, facility management, ordering of catering, stationery, and kitchen supplies, etc. Hours for this role are 9:00am to 3:30pm. §What you'll bring§We are looking for a friendly, savvy administrator who has experience with the tasks listed above, ideally with experience as a Receptionist or Office Administrator. This is a front facing role, so we are looking for someone with impeccable customer service, communication and organisation skills. Datacom is a fast-paced, shifting environment, so it's crucial you'll understand urgency and can adapt to changing priorities. You'll be resourceful and solution oriented to proactively support our staff with your effective communication and customer service skills. Most importantly, you'll be enthusiastic about what you do, and love working with people - a true team player! §The Nitty Gritty§We have over 6,200 people across our global offices, and generate an annual revenue of over $1.2 billion, this makes us one of Australasia's largest professional IT services companies. We have extensive expertise in operating data centres, providing IT services, software engineering and application management, as well as payroll and customer service design and operations. With this comes a long list of significant clients Datacom is committed to hiring, developing and promoting the best talent from a diverse range of backgrounds. jobText: TXT/50545088.txt	§Immigration Adviser§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Immigration Adviser§§Advertiser: §Absolute Immigration§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§10 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Contracts Administration§§§§§§The Company – an environment where anything is possible§  §For over 19 years Absolute Immigration has provided strategic immigration services and business solutions for corporate clients and individuals. We have plenty of great success stories where we have made a significant difference to the lives of visa applicants and the companies that we work with.§  §Our team is highly experienced, passionate, driven and results focused. Challenge excites us and we thrive on solving complex immigration problems with innovative but practical solutions.§  §At Absolute Immigration we devise strategies, not transactions and partner our clients to achieve the best outcomes for their business and their people. We change lives and improve businesses.§  §The Role - We have the work and see the potential. §  §Absolute Immigration is a Melbourne based company, and will soon open it's New Zealand office in Auckland due to the high level of business from New Zealand clients. We are seeking to employ an Auckland based Immigration Adviser to work with our New Zealand Immigration Director, to manage our New Zealand clientele. §  §We want you to thrive in the role and will provide support and training to ensure you have every opportunity to succeed.§  §Our non-negotiables§ § §Minimum 2-3 years of experience§ §Are a licenced immigration adviser with a full licence§ §Excellent knowledge of various New Zealand visas§ §Demonstrated ability to identify professional risk and to mitigate those risks§ §Superior communication and customer service skills§ §Proactive, results-driven and self-motivated§ §Ability to manage work deadlines and shifting priorities§ §Confidence and self-assurance§ §Ability to work on their own§ §Can hit the ground running§ §Team Player§ §Your primary responsibilities will include:§ § §Providing immigration advice and strategic solutions to our clients§ §Managing a diverse range of clients§ §Developing strong client relationships with senior level clients§ §Preparation and lodgement of visa and appeal applications§ §Meet KPIs as per company policy§ §What’s on offer?§ § §Excellent work program that includes support with training and self-development§ §Flexible working arrangement - work some days from the office, others from home § §Work and life balance§ §Endless opportunities§ §If this sounds like you we’d love to hear from you!§  §How to get our attention?§  §Apply today with your CV and a cover letter that outlines:§ § §What excites you, what doesn't about your work§ §Your current or most recent role§ §Share the most important thing you have learned during your career§ §What your career goals are and how you see Absolute Immigration contributing to your journey§ §Please note only successful applicants will be contacted.§§§§

With offices in Auckland and Wellington, they have created a cohesive team of experts who hold themselves to high standards and achieve great client outcomes.   § §The Role§ §This is an intermediate to senior position within the Clients & Communications team, where professionalism and organisation are critical to success.  You will be supporting a busy team of Investment professionals in Wellington, and liaising with your counterpart in Auckland.   This position requires someone to work “core business hours” each day with the opportunity to discuss doing so through part time hours or flexible working.  As a key member of the Clients and Communications team, you will help new clients open their accounts and existing clients with ad hoc requests for information.  You will also facilitate meetings with clients and business partners and ensure the team is well prepared for these.   Managing multiple priorities at any one time, and working within a small team, you must be prepared to go the extra mile, and turn your hand to tasks as they arise.  Key Responsibilities include:§ § § §Responding to enquiries from potential clients§ §Helping new clients open accounts with Harbour Asset Management§ §Dealing with clients via phone, email, and occasionally face to face§ §Collation of monthly, quarterly and annual reports for clients§ §Assisting in scheduling appointments and planning client engagement activities§ §Anticipating and collating the best collateral for client meetings§ §Supporting the wider team with ad hoc projects§ §  §Your Experience§ §The key requirement of this role is a §client first §mentality.    You will be someone who loves providing clients with a proactive and tailored experience and have the strong administration skills needed to do so.   You will be a great listener and make sure to understand the needs of a client to ensure they feel heard and are efficiently and warmly supported.   You must enjoy working with a diverse group of individuals and adapting how you engage with them to best suit their needs.  In addition we are looking for:§ § § §A can-do attitude where no task is too small§ §Proven ability to apply professional maturity and judgement§ §Demonstrable experience in client and/or sales administration§ §Basic knowledge of financial products (preferred not essential)§ §Experience liaising with investors (desirable)§ §Experience of compliance regulations including AML (desirable)§ §Excellent systems knowledge, including CRMs and Office 365 suite§ §Strong communication including verbal and written.§ §Excellent attention to detail§ §    §Harbour is well-known for its supportive and friendly culture, and this is a great opportunity to join and contribute to a highly successful team  We would love to hear from you if feel this role is a fit for your skills and experience.  Please apply with a cover letter and your CV by 25th September 2020.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

Understanding and appreciation of cloud based systems, i.e. web apps and their use (CRM via cloud apps is good but not a deal breaker if not a current skill set); §3.  An interest in learning about managing a company in New Zealand and being a part of a management team in the long run.§  §You will be reporting to the General Manager who is from the United States and offers a progressive work environment that you might find in Northern California, Portland or Seattle.  Flat organization without many hierarchies and an interest in not harming the environment.§Tertiary level education is preferred.  We will consider candidates with secondary level education and work experience.§We are looking for energetic progressive people who are digital natives, business savvy, willing to help with admin (including health and safety stuff) and generally want to contribute to the growth of a company and learn from experienced managers.  §  §Yes we are located in South Auckland - near the train station if you need to commute.  Don't be discouraged by our location - you can live in Ponsonby if you wish and come to South Auckland a couple days a week on the train. jobText: TXT/50567084.txt	§Customer Care Specialist§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Customer Care Specialist§§Advertiser: §YMCA of Auckland Inc§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§15 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Rodney & North Shore§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Receptionists§§§§§§YMCA IS RECRUITING NOW!§ §This is a great opportunity to hit the ground running and make a positive difference. Reporting to the Operations Manager this role is responsible for delivering exceptional frontline customer service to our existing and new customers, assisting and encouraging programme and membership sales, carrying out administration support and much more. We require someone to work approximately 25 hours per week. The majority of the shifts will consist of evenings and weekend work. Monday to Sunday.§ § § §What will you be doing?§ § §Creating a welcoming and friendly environment for customers, both new and existing§ §Providing reception services, including customer queries and cash handling and cashing up§ §Administration, till reconciliation and data entry tasks associated with customer enrolments, memberships, bookings and subsidies§ §Promote and sell all programmes, services and retail items offered within the Centre§ §Ensuring your documentation/record keeping is correct and following YMCA process and policy§ §Working as part of a team but also on your own initiatives§ §Keeping a clean working environment§ § § §What experience/skills do you need?§ § §An ability to work in a fast paced environment§ §A good understanding of computers and membership systems is an advantage§ §An ability to convert customers to members§ §Cold calling of leads to convert to sales would be an advantage§ §Excellent communication skills, actively listens, draws out information and follows through§ §High work standards, pays attention to detail and initiates self-checking procedures, ensures high levels of accuracy and consistency§ §Ability to prioritise, plan and set objectives and goals and use time effectively§ §Credibility and professional integrity, act and dress in a manner that conveys high personal and professional standards, while engaging with colleagues, customers, parents and children§ § § §What the YMCA offers: § § §Specific job and safeguarding training with opportunities for continuous improvement.§ §A great team, organisational culture§ §Career opportunities§ §YMCA buying privileges and discounts including free gym membership§ §Onsite car parking§ § § §ABOUT THE YMCA§ §You probably know the song, but did you also know that YMCA North employs around 800 employees across Auckland, Hamilton, Tauranga and Rotorua? Our operations include facility management, health and fitness, early childhood education, before and after school care, holiday programmes, accommodation, outdoor camps, recreation, aquatic, fundraising and youth programmes. As a not for profit, for over 150 years YMCA has been about families. Join us and know that you’re contributing to building strong kids, families and communities now and for many years to come.§ § § §YMCA is able to offer great opportunities for personal development and career advancement. We provide real career pathways and job opportunities in a fun, community-focused environment.§ §We are proud to have a great mix of people of all ages and cultures within our teams who love their work and all contribute to our diverse company culture. We live by our values of Caring, Honesty, Respect and Responsibility.§ § § §SAFEGUARDING§ §YMCA North is committed to Child Protection and the safeguarding of children and young people in our care and it is our expectation that all staff will operate in a way that reflects this intent. Staff will be required to attend Safeguarding workshops, trainings and online modules to comply with YMCA North Safeguarding Policy.§ § § §The successful applicant will need to return a satisfactory Police Record Check before commencement of Employment.§ § § §TO APPLY§ §If this sounds like you, please apply online by sending your CV and cover letter to §Karen.Anitelea@ymcaauckland.org.nz§   § § § §All applicants must currently hold the right to work in New Zealand.§ § § §We will be assessing applications as they are received. Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have in the sports & fitness industry?§Do you have experience in an administration role?§Do you have customer service experience?§Which of the following Microsoft Office products are you experienced with?§§§

jobText: TXT/50572487.txt	§Time Target Rostering Administrator§§Private Advertiser§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Time Target Rostering Administrator§§Private Advertiser§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§15 Sept 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Rest of Waikato§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Data Entry & Word Processing§§§§§§The Organisation§  §ConneXu is a highly reputable charitable trust based in the Waikato/King Country and Bay of Plenty.  ConneXu facilitates support to people who require assistance/ support to live within the community. These people may have intellectual or physical disabilities, head injuries or accident related injuries. ConneXu are committed to empowering people to hold active and valued roles in their community and believe through this inclusiveness that communities will be strengthened. ConneXu are an innovative organisation continuously challenging people to live their best life. §  § §  §The Role §  §As a Rostering and Time Target Administrator you will be responsible for working closely with the Senior Payroll Administrator and a Time Target team to ensure hours for pay are correct and approve and cover all planned community facilitator leave applications. A critical component of the role is being able to update master rosters as requested by the Service Manager and cover vacancies using available casual and currently inducted employees until new appointments are made. You will be responsible for assisting the uploading of new employee details into Time Target. §  § §  §The Person §  §We are looking for an individual who has experience using Time Target or a similar rostering platform. The successful Time Target Rostering Administrator will possess strong analytical and strategic thinking skills and be an excellent communicator. The ideal candidate will have knowledge of administrative and clerical procedures and systems. They will have excellent phone manner and interpersonal skills and have a good understanding of software programs including applications and programming. §  §Previous experience in a support services organisation is an advantage. If you are interested in a challenging and diverse role then we would love to hear from you.§  §To apply for the position please send your CV and covering letter to §careers@connexu.nz§§§§

jobTitle: Practice Manager Job in Taranaki - SEEK

jobText: TXT/50575051.txt	§Practice Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Practice Manager§§Advertiser: §Devon Medical Centre§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§16 Sept 2020§§Location§§Taranaki§, §New Plymouth§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Office Management§§§§§§Practice Manager§0.8 FTE§ § § §Devon Medical Centre§ is a modern, large group general practice, committed to providing the best of care for our patients. We pride ourselves on our service delivery and ensuring that every patient knows they matter to us. The practice is transitioning to delivering services under the Healthcare Home model of care and therefore requires a Practice Manager who thrives in a changing environment.§ §The Role§ §This is an exciting opportunity to be a part of the practice leadership team. Working closely with the General Manager, Nurse Manager and business owners you will be responsible for leading the Administration Team and the operational side of the business, being the ‘go to’ person for all things operational.  You will have a key role to play in managing the outward facing relationships and in particular maintaining the high level of patient service that we pride ourselves in. You will also be responsible for providing excellent accounting, payroll services and processes to the practice. § §What we are looking for§ §We are looking for someone who has a passion for primary healthcare and has worked in the health sector. Someone who can thrive in the challenging environment of primary healthcare, PHOs, funding, capitation, enrolments and the wide range of reporting that the GP practice requires. Strong business management experience will be essential as you lead the operational side of the practice.§ §Ideally you will be an experienced practice manager, but we would consider candidates who have been leaders and managers in health-related businesses. Supporting your colleagues and delivering excellent service should motivate you. A positive attitude, energy, enthusiasm and resilience are key. § §It is important that you enjoy leadership, creating a healthy culture and developing others. Strong relationship building and communication skills are essential.§ §Additional skills should include:§ §Proven change leadership aptitude§Financial management or accounting skills.§Ability to lead and delegate to others in a constructive way§ §In return we will provide a supportive and positive working environment, as well as an opportunity to develop your career.§ §Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work permit.§ §If this sounds like an exciting career opportunity to you, please apply by 5.00pm on Wednesday 14th October 2020 with your CV and a cover letter to let us know why you will be a great fit to this job.§ §Practice Manager Vacancy§ §P O Box 461§ §New Plymouth 4340§ §recruitment@devonmedical.co.nz§  §§§§

At WSP our role is to plan, design, manage and engineer our communities to thrive. We want our work to bring long-term improvements and to future proof our cities and environments.§Based in our Wellington office, this role is critical to the smooth operation of the business. Exceptional service delivery and client support is crucial for this team. This is an interesting and busy role and no two days are the same. Vital to the success of this role is multitasking, people skills along with sound problem solving capabilities. We are looking for a confident team player who can demonstrate lots of initiative, brings a positive, flexible and adaptable attitude and a great sense of humour. §The opportunity:§·      Work with a friendly, vibrant & collaborative team§·      Ensure the smooth running of a professional, successful and busy sector§·      Be part of the valued Business Support Services team§What we are looking for:§·      Someone who can bring people together to achieve great things§·      A winning personality: proactive, friendly, approachable and professional§·      Intermediate to advanced Microsoft Office skills (Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, SharePoint, Teams and OneDrive), Indesign and photoshop.§·      Ability to pick up processes and systems quickly§·      Well organised, self-motivated with strong time management skills and the ability to multitask and prioritise§·      Someone who can challenge the status quo and a passion for business improvement§·      Switched on and calm under pressure§·      Willingness to help out the team where necessary, adaptable, with a conscientious attitude§·      Ability to work cooperatively with a variety of people and personalities§·      Previous experience in similar administrative and reception roles§You will enjoy this role if you are naturally organised, process orientated and a great multitasking who likes being busy and keep calm when the pressure is on.§Prior experience is essential, and Business or Business Administration study is advantageous. Role specific training will be provided and we welcome your experience and knowledge to our team.§About You:§·      A background and proven track record in providing a high standard of in administration and customer service§·      Experience in event management of internal and external events§·      Advanced Microsoft Skills; Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, SharePoint, Teams & OneDrive§·      Energetic and positive attitude§·      You love a good process or system, being organised and helping others to be organised§·      You have strong verbal and written communication skills, attention to detail with top level English and grammar and are able to interact positively and warmly with people §·      You know how to juggle priorities, enjoy working both autonomously and as part of a team§·      A strong customer focus and excellent relationship development skills§·      A high degree of self-confidence and self-motivation, to be open-minded, enquiring and enabling of change§·      A positive and enthusiastic approach to communicating with internal and external clients§·      A high degree of integrity and commitment§·      Enjoy a challenge and the success that comes from working together as a team§You'll be agile, invested in your career and have the administrative expertise and self-direction to contribute to our business. In return, we'll offer you a career-defining role, interesting and meaningful projects and the opportunity to work with world leading experts. At WSP we foster a culture of collaboration, innovation and success.§How to Apply:§If this sounds like you, we want you to be part of what makes us great. Are you ready to be part of WSP? §For further information, please view the position description. To apply, follow the link and apply online.§Please state in your cover letter if you are interested in either our permanent or fixed term opportunity.§§Why do you want to join us?§We’re future-focused experts who propose innovative ideas for our clients. It matters to us that our people come to work every day with curiosity, drive and a sense of purpose. Join us in doing purposeful, sustainable work that helps shape our communities and the future.§Stimulating, open working environments where everyone feels relevant, valued and supported is a catalyst for outstanding achievements in our opinion.§We know that, for everyone here, work is only one part of life, and making time for family, friends, hobbies and passions is vital. So, if working from home, working part-time or having a flexible start and finish to the day will help with this, we will try to make it happen. §Diversity of all kinds is extremely important, and so at WSP we embrace a diversity of perspectives. We welcome applications from individuals of all backgrounds, orientations, and identities.§He aha te mea nui o te ao. He tāngata, he tāngata, he tāngata.§What is the most important thing in the world? It is people, it is people, it is people.§§ §§      §      §      §    §    §WSP - Creating what matters for future generations  |  wsp.com/nz§  §§§WSP is a collaborative team of global experts who aspire every day to shape a better tomorrow.§With more than 49,000 people working in over 550 offices across 40 countries, we are one of the world’s leading engineering consultancy firms.§We value our people, our reputation, and our impact on the future. We want our work to bring long-term improvements and to future proof our cities and environments.§Based in our Wellington office, this role is critical to the smooth operation of the business. Exceptional service delivery and client support is crucial for this team. This is an interesting and busy role and no two days are the same. jobTitle: Business Support Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50576340.txt	§Business Support§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Business Support§§Advertiser: §Wise Group§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§16 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Other§§§§§§Summary§LinkPeople recognise that housing and homelessness are complex issues that require a community wide approach, where key organisations come together to work collaboratively to support people to access and retain housing. This is an important part of ending homelessness within our community. Having a home and successfully navigating social services are both critical success factors in delivering positive health and social outcomes.§The Role§This role is full-time working 40 hours per week, Monday - Friday. Based in our South Auckland Office.§Your priority will be to provide business, systems and administrative support to the LinkPeople team nationally.§You will be a “go to” person for daily systems and administrative needs, and work towards continuous improvement for national consistency. You will effectively champion related projects, train others when required and manage routine administrative functions.§In this role, you will work closely and collaboratively with LinkPeople teams, administrative staff and financial accountants. You will effectively and efficiently manage internal administration and business processes and provide business and administrative support to senior leadership as required. All the while, seeking opportunities to continuously streamline LinkPeople systems, implement changes and support and train others to improve the way we work.§You§We’d love to hear from applicants who have strong administration skills and can back this up with the relevant experience. Attention to detail is a must, you’ll be organised, systematic and methodical in your approach. You’ll be analytical with your thinking style, and have the ability to solve problems with innovation and persistence. Working knowledge of Microsoft Office suite, including Word, PowerPoint and Excel is an essential, along with the ability to learn new computer programmes and skills.§It will also be beneficial if you have experience using and managing databases, and working with financial information. Work experience in a similar role in the mental health, addiction, disability and/or public health sector would be valuable, as well as a relevant tertiary qualification.§The Benefits§In this role, you can look forward to flexible work arrangements, extra leave, subsidies for school holiday childcare and a great team around you every day working in an organisation that believes in its’ purpose. Be part of a supportive work environment where life balance is encouraged, people are valued and new solutions are the norm!§Applications close: Wednesday 30th September 2020.§ PLEASE NOTE, this advert may close if a suitable candidate is found prior to the closing date.§Position Description:§ To view a full position description, please copy and paste the following link into your browser: https://www.wisegroup.co.nz/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/LP_Business-Support-PD.pdf§Contact:§ Tom Caukwell, Regional Manager on 027 889 3264, if you have any questions.§For further information, visit our websites www.linkpeople.co.nz§**All new appointees require background checking. Under the requirements of the Vulnerable Children's Act 2014, new employees that are identified as coming under this act are required to undergo further safety checks as part of the recruitment process.§§§§

Entry of accounts payable and receivable§ - Billing and Collection§ §Ensure the day operates smoothly and efficiently by liaising effectively and efficiently with staff, on behalf of the Managing Director§ §An ideal candidate should demonstrate the following skills:§ § §Knowledge and working experience in Healthcare and general office management with a sound understanding of medical terminology§ §Computer literacy with proficiency in VIP Houston and Reckon accounting software§ §Working knowledge of handling dangerous goods and its documentation and logistics management will be a bonus§ §Excellent oral and written communication skills§ §Excellent planning, organizing and time management skills§ §The ability to multi-task and work under pressure and be able to work both independently and as part of a team§ §High personal integrity as well as a strong customer focus§ §Only suitable New Zealand residents/citizens or candidates who have full work rights in New Zealand should apply.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as an administration officer?§Which of the following Microsoft Office products are you experienced with?§Which of the following accounting packages are you experienced with?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§

jobText: TXT/50576824.txt	§Student Administrator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Student Administrator§§Advertiser: §Workforce Development§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§16 Sept 2020§§Location§§Hawkes Bay§, §Napier§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Administrative Assistants§§§§§§Workforce Development Ltd helps people develop skills they need for work or future study.  Whether they want to enter the workforce, learn new skills, get back to work or find a new career to be passionate about, Workforce Development helps them get there.§ §We’ve been providing opportunities to learn and grow for individuals, communities, businesses and government departments for more than 25 years. We offer a friendly, personalised and supportive service to guide students on their journey into the workforce and beyond.  § §This position is the first point of contact for potential students and learners.  Based at reception in the Napier and Hastings campuses you are responsible for ensuring all prospective and current students, stakeholders and visitors are well-received in a prompt and engaging manner.§ §Reporting to the Student Experience Manager, you will be responsible for the effective management of enquiries and provide programme and service information and support.§ §This position also provides both an efficient and quality student administration service (throughout the student lifecycle); ensuring compliance/process requirements are met and quality data for reporting.  Student lifecycle administration includes processing in areas such as enquiry, application, enrolment and validation, enrolment changes, resulting and graduate outcomes.  The Student Administrator also manages a range of associated inbound/outbound calling services; and provides campus support, as required.§ §This is a permanent Monday to Friday, 30 hours per week position.§ §Our ideal candidate will be:§ § §enthusiastic, friendly, approachable with strong interpersonal skills,§ §able to work independently and as part of a team,§ §computer literate with excellent administration and data entry skills with attention to detail and a high level of accuracy,§ §able to prioritise and manage workloads and have the ability to provide exceptional service,§ §adaptable with a can do attitude and effective problem solving skills, § §Full Driver's Licence§ §Applications close on Friday 09th October 2020.§ §Please note this roles works between the Napier and Hastings campuses.§ §For a full copy of the job description please visit our website www.workforce.ac.nz§ § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have experience in an administration role?§Do you have customer service experience?§Do you have experience in a data entry role?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50579997.txt	§Campus Support§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Campus Support§§Advertiser: §Regent Training Centre§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§16 Sept 2020§§Location§§Northland§, §Rest of Northland§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Receptionists§§§§§§Regent Training Centre is an organisation who makes a positive difference in the lives of our young people and their whānau every day.  We believe that every individual can learn and achieve, no matter their past, or their perceived lack of academic attainment to date.  We believe in practical, innovative teaching that adapts to the needs our rangatahi to serve them well in further education and employment. § §We are seeking a problem solving, customer services superstar who has a passion for helping rangatahi achieve. This position plays a key role in managing first impressions, and helping to create a culturally safe learning environment on campus. The successful applicant will often be the first “go to” person for both staff and students alike, while supporting some of administrative functions of our Kaitaia campus.   § §Our ideal applicant will have:§ § §a real heart for seeing our rangatahi achieve§ §demonstrated skills and experience in a front-line role, preferably within the education sector§ §great organisational skills and be well presented, approachable and confident§ §good attention to details, but not so much that it gets in the way of supporting people§ §excellent verbal and written communication skills§ §a ‘can do’ attitude and belief that ‘nothing is too much trouble’§ §a passion for making a difference in the lives of our students§ §a full, clean drivers licence§ §This is a part time position (approx. 30 hours per week) and is fixed term to the end of the year.§ §Please note, under the Children’s Act, the successful candidate will be required to undergo Police Vetting as a condition of employment.§ §If this sounds like you, click 'Apply Now' or send your CV and cover letter to Sophie Wilson at §jobs@rtc.co.nz§§§§

jobText: TXT/50580084.txt	§Personal Assistant§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Personal Assistant§§Advertiser: §Lance Lawson§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§16 Sept 2020§§Location§§Bay of Plenty§, §Rotorua§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §PA, EA & Secretarial§§§§§§We are a mid-sized Rotorua full service law firm with an excellent reputation in our community. We pride ourselves on delivering on our “Client Focused, Results Driven” motto and upskilling and developing staff within our firm. We have an opportunity for a personal assistant to join our busy and varied team on a fixed-term basis (covering maternity leave from November to July).  § §The Role:§ § §Within an open plan, modern office environment with a focus on a culture that is busy, fun and collaborative;§ §Lots of variety and responsibility, no day will be the same;§ §Assisting a partner and other team members with duties including billing, file management and word processing;§ §Preparing letters, invoices and various legal documents as required; and§ §Client liaison, making appointments and diary management.§ § § §Our ideal candidate will have:§ § §A supportive, team player attitude;§ §Outstanding organisational and time management skills;§ §High attention to detail;§ §Accurate and efficient typing skills and experience with Microsoft Office Suite;§ §Ability to cope under pressure and adapt to changes quickly;§ §Ability to multitask, prioritise, and use initiative;§ §Effective written and verbal communication skills;§ §Flexible and supportive attitude, and ability to work as part of a team; and§ §Experience as an assistant or secretary in a legal setting is advantageous.§ § § §If this sounds like you, please apply online through the Seek website by uploading your cover letter and CV.§ §Any queries can be directed to §megan@lancelawson.co.nz§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Which of the following Microsoft Office products are you experienced with?§Do you have experience in an administration role?§§§

jobText: TXT/50580156.txt	§Word Processor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Word Processor§§Advertiser: §Dentons Kensington Swan§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§16 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Data Entry & Word Processing§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Word Processor §      §        §Dentons Kensington Swan is one of New Zealand's leading commercial law firms, and following our combination with Dentons this year, we are now part of the world’s largest law firm. We have the largest global reach of any firm in the New Zealand market with unparalleled access, not only to lawyers but also our support teams. This means the opportunities are endless for our people!§        §As a challenger brand, we are not your ordinary top-tier commercial law firm. We are looking for one or two experienced and dedicated Word Processors for an afternoon and evening shift. §        §WP continues to be a critical function within the firm and the role is a key member of the Legal Practice Coordinators team. Providing assistance to the Legal Practice Coordinators, Partners and Authors in formatting of documents, typing and dictation is the core function. Other tasks include, assisting with AML and filing and being helping hand to our busy Business Development team.§        §You must have a strong attention to detail and be an expert navigating the Microsoft suite. Additionally you need to be confident processing large volumes of incoming data, cross checking spreadsheets and databases, taking calls and be quick and nimble when entering data into our databases. §        §To apply, please click "apply now" and include your resume and cover letter alternatively contact Katy Lloyd at §Katy.Lloyd@dentons.com§ for a confidential discussion. Please clearly note in your cover letter your availability.  §      §      §      §    §  §§§Dentons Kensington Swan is one of New Zealand's leading commercial law firms, and following our combination with Dentons this year, we are now part of the world’s largest law firm. We have the largest global reach of any firm in the New Zealand market with unparalleled access, not only to lawyers but also our support teams. This means the opportunities are endless for our people!§As a challenger brand, we are not your ordinary top-tier commercial law firm. We are looking for one or two experienced and dedicated Word Processors for an afternoon and evening shift. §WP continues to be a critical function within the firm and the role is a key member of the Legal Practice Coordinators team. Providing assistance to the Legal Practice Coordinators, Partners and Authors in formatting of documents, typing and dictation is the core function. Other tasks include, assisting with AML and filing and being helping hand to our busy Business Development team.§You must have a strong attention to detail and be an expert navigating the Microsoft suite. Additionally you need to be confident processing large volumes of incoming data, cross checking spreadsheets and databases, taking calls and be quick and nimble when entering data into our databases. §To apply, please click "apply now" and include your resume and cover letter alternatively contact Katy Lloyd at §Katy.Lloyd@dentons.com§ for a confidential discussion. Please clearly note in your cover letter your availability.  §§§§

jobText: TXT/50584658.txt	§Senior Administration/HSEQ Advisor - Rotorua§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Administration/HSEQ Advisor - Rotorua§§Advertiser: §Talent ID Business Systems Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§17 Sept 2020§§Location§§Bay of Plenty§, §Tauranga§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Other§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Senior Administration/HSEQ Advisor - Rotorua §      §        §He mahi ngātahi – Working in partnership§ §        §Come and join the team at TRILITY based in the heart of the Bay of Plenty, Rotorua. TRILITY are an established industry leader, who for over 25 years have been solely dedicated to the delivery of water, wastewater and reuse solutions across New Zealand and Australia’s municipal, industrial and resource sectors.§ §        §This leadership has been created through their very capable and experienced people who are striving to provide high-quality solutions to their public and private sector clients. Their full range of services includes financing, design and construction, operations and maintenance, asset management, utility services, and equipment solutions. Their capabilities span the full life cycle of water, delivering services to millions of people every day.§ §        §TRILITY, in partnership with Rotorua Lakes Council, is looking to fill the dual role of Senior Administration/HSEQ Advisor. This is a new role, within a brand-new team for a brand-new client, so you’ll have a real opportunity to make your mark and add lasting value.§ §        §Reporting to the Contract Manager with a dotted line report to the HSEQ Manager, you will be responsible for providing both senior administration support to the Rotorua contract as well as  assisting the HSEQ Manager in the development, implementation and improvement of TRILITY’s integrated management system. You’ll also be responsible for conducting incident investigations where appropriate, reporting and auditing, providing advice and guidance on HSEQ related matters and an advocate for safety and quality culture through the TRILITY Group.§ §        §Key aspects of the role include;§ § §  §        §          §Financial Administration§          §Health, Safety, Environment and Quality advice§          §Reporting – compiling and editing of reports, minute taking and minute reporting§          §Project and site support and general administration  §        §        §This role is crucial to the day to day running of the Rotorua contract, therefore it is critical that the incumbent has a high level of administrative skills and is able to perform the requirements of the role to a consistently high standard within the TRILITY guidelines.  It is also critical that the successful candidate has the ability to build strong working relationships both internally and externally, foster teamwork and demonstrates a strong customer/client focus.  § §        §To be successful in this role you will need to be an experienced and technically competent administrator, and some experience within a health and safety role would be highly regarded.   Prior experience liaising with Government departments and customers/clients, along with suppliers and key stakeholders would be advantageous, as would purchasing and supplier contract experience. Some knowledge of resource consent obligations in a contractual context, along with experience in (or a strong willingness to learn) health, safety, environment and quality management principles and standards are also key requirements.  Being familiar with and understanding the Iwi perspective of water quality compliance is also part of this role.     § §        §You’ll be an expert user of the Microsoft suite of applications and prior experience using SAP or a similar system would be desirable.  A critical thinker with sound research and analytical reasoning ability who can work autonomously whilst managing a range of conflicting demands and priorities.  With a high level of attention to detail you will be focussed on quality and improvement throughout all areas of your work.§ §        §Commercial business acumen, along with excellent communication skills and a fluent understanding of financial administration with regard to contacts is key to the success in this role, and should you also have knowledge of the water or wastewater sector that would be a real advantage. § §        §If you seek a challenging new role where you will be part of a brand new team, you are ambitious, smart, adaptable, motivated and always striving to achieve your best whilst demonstrating sound judgement then this could be the role for you.   It is preferred that the successful candidate resides in the Rotorua region.§ §        §A fantastic opportunity to join this progressive company, based in a vibrant and thriving city with an abundance of lifestyle activities and outdoor pursuits on offer.  Please send your application letter and CV online to Kellie Hamlett, Recruitment Specialist at Talent ID Recruitment Ltd.  Applications close Friday 2nd October 2020 and will be treated confidentially.§      §      §Kellie Hamlett §    §    §  §§§He mahi ngātahi – Working in partnership§ § §Come and join the team at TRILITY based in the heart of the Bay of Plenty, Rotorua. TRILITY are an established industry leader, who for over 25 years have been solely dedicated to the delivery of water, wastewater and reuse solutions across New Zealand and Australia’s municipal, industrial and resource sectors.§ § §This leadership has been created through their very capable and experienced people who are striving to provide high-quality solutions to their public and private sector clients. Their full range of services includes financing, design and construction, operations and maintenance, asset management, utility services, and equipment solutions. Their capabilities span the full life cycle of water, delivering services to millions of people every day.§ § §TRILITY, in partnership with Rotorua Lakes Council, is looking to fill the dual role of Senior Administration/HSEQ Advisor. You’ll also be responsible for conducting incident investigations where appropriate, reporting and auditing, providing advice and guidance on HSEQ related matters and an advocate for safety and quality culture through the TRILITY Group.§ § §Key aspects of the role include;§ § §  § §Financial Administration§ §Health, Safety, Environment and Quality advice§ §Reporting – compiling and editing of reports, minute taking and minute reporting§ §Project and site support and general administration  § §  §This role is crucial to the day to day running of the Rotorua contract, therefore it is critical that the incumbent has a high level of administrative skills and is able to perform the requirements of the role to a consistently high standard within the TRILITY guidelines.  It is also critical that the successful candidate has the ability to build strong working relationships both internally and externally, foster teamwork and demonstrates a strong customer/client focus.  § § §To be successful in this role you will need to be an experienced and technically competent administrator, and some experience within a health and safety role would be highly regarded.   Prior experience liaising with Government departments and customers/clients, along with suppliers and key stakeholders would be advantageous, as would purchasing and supplier contract experience. Some knowledge of resource consent obligations in a contractual context, along with experience in (or a strong willingness to learn) health, safety, environment and quality management principles and standards are also key requirements.  Being familiar with and understanding the Iwi perspective of water quality compliance is also part of this role.     § § §You’ll be an expert user of the Microsoft suite of applications and prior experience using SAP or a similar system would be desirable.  A critical thinker with sound research and analytical reasoning ability who can work autonomously whilst managing a range of conflicting demands and priorities.  With a high level of attention to detail you will be focussed on quality and improvement throughout all areas of your work.§ § §Commercial business acumen, along with excellent communication skills and a fluent understanding of financial administration with regard to contacts is key to the success in this role, and should you also have knowledge of the water or wastewater sector that would be a real advantage. § § §If you seek a challenging new role where you will be part of a brand new team, you are ambitious, smart, adaptable, motivated and always striving to achieve your best whilst demonstrating sound judgement then this could be the role for you.   It is preferred that the successful candidate resides in the Rotorua region.§ § §A fantastic opportunity to join this progressive company, based in a vibrant and thriving city with an abundance of lifestyle activities and outdoor pursuits on offer.  Please send your application letter and CV online to Kellie Hamlett, Recruitment Specialist at Talent ID Recruitment Ltd.  Applications close Friday 2nd October 2020 and will be treated confidentially.§§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§

Head office is based in Palmerston North.§ § § § § §About the role§ § § § § §We are looking for an organised team player who wants to be part of our growing business. This role will suit someone who is thorough, versatile and after variety within a small office environment.§You will be required to take ownership of all incoming orders including receipting and dispatching, general office administration, customer service, processing & co-ordination of orders with our warehouse team.§ §We are looking for a person with a high level of reliability, thoroughness, energy and enthusiasm who is comfortable using a computer and possesses good typing skills.§There is a need for good verbal and written communication skills and a positive can-do attitude. §Attention to detail is a must as well as following processes.§ §Responsibilities include but are not limited to;§ §Customer order entry§Answer Customer calls and emails§Sales reporting§Sales team and customer support§Upgrading of critical information tools§Co-ordination of product releases to customers and sales force§Excel reporting§Updating of sales and customer records§General Office and Administration support§ §You will be delivering a diverse range of assistance with general administration and business support that requires a good eye for detail. § §In today's business environment we also look for a team member who is both computer literate and savvy.  It is an absolute must that you are very confident with Microsoft and have a minimum Intermediate capability with Excel.§ § § § § §Benefits and perks§ § § §Excellent modern working conditions alongside a great small team§ § § §Skills and experience§ § § §Previous experience in a Distribution business would be an asset (but not necessary).§ § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have customer service experience?§Which of the following Microsoft Office products are you experienced with?§§§
