jobText: TXT/50585398.txt	§Executive Assistant to Global Management Team§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Executive Assistant to Global Management Team§§Advertiser: §Universal Business Team Recruitment§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§17 Sept 2020§§Location§§Manawatu§, §Palmerston North§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §PA, EA & Secretarial§§§§§§UBT Recruitment provides professional talent acquisition services to a broad range of organisations across Australia & New Zealand. We are currently partnering with a high-growth global professional services organisation, who provide business advisory and group buying services to a large and diverse network of SME companies across 5 continents.§In a key appointment designed to provide high level operational and administrative support to the Global Management Team, we are currently seeking a high calibre candidate to manage and drive the effective and efficient functioning of global departments.§  §§The Company§Fast-paced and on a high-growth trajectory, our client is committed to developing the best products and services to equip its clients, predominantly small to medium sized businesses, with the skills and knowledge to grow and prosper. Leveraging global scale to partner with leading 3rd party suppliers of products and services, and with an in-house business advisory team offering consulting services across finance, human resources, digital marketing and technology, my client serves its customers via a network of offices in 19 countries, and has global revenues approaching of over NZD $500m.§The Role§A very hands-on role, the Executive Assistant will support the Global Management Team, providing continuous, high quality Executive support through effective organising and coordination of diaries and schedules, as well as alignment of strategic objectives, to ensure the Executives have time freed up to focus their efforts on successful management of their business units.§Key responsibilities will include:§§Assist the Global Managing Director, the Senior Executive Assistant to the Global Managing Director, and Global Heads of business units in managing outputs, workflows, operating work cycles and deadlines by being across strategic imperatives and priorities§Analyse and reconcile expenses and invoices§Provide continuous, high quality Executive support by organising and maintaining calendars, coordinating meetings, catering and events whilst keeping abreast of priorities, changes, and conflicts§Conserve Global Heads' time by monitoring and effectively managing incoming communications§Arrange corporate travel for Global Heads and the extended team whilst adhering to company policies with respect to cost and appropriate travel times§Coordinate all tasks/projects from an administrative support perspective§Format and collate board reports on behalf of the Global Heads§Maintain a high level of confidentiality and react to sensitive information in a professional manner§Be proactive and resourcefully manage and prioritise the competing demands of a wide range of duties and responsibilities§Be flexible around the scheduling of meetings given the global nature of the role§Assist with ad-hoc projects as and when required§§What we are looking for:§§Proven experience in a senior administration support or EA role; ideally for Senior Executives and preferably in a global organisation§Previous experience within a Professional Services / Corporate environment§Experience managing/coordinating projects would be highly advantageous§Advanced skills in MS Office§Strategic view aligned with first-class operational delivery§Emotional intelligence with a can-do attitude and the ability to effectively manage conflicting priorities§A resilient individual who is a patient and respectful influencer§§What is in it for you?§§Exciting and unique opportunity for an experienced and dedicated EA to make a real difference§Free, delicious, hot lunch provided every Wednesday§Medical Insurance included§Laptop and phone provided§A company with an enviable culture upheld by a premium customer experience§§ §§§§

jobText: TXT/50587328.txt	§Controller, Document (Senior & Mid Level)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Controller, Document (Senior & Mid Level)§§Advertiser: §CPB Contractors NZ§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§17 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Rest of Wellington Region§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Records Management & Document Control§§§§§§CPB Contractors is a leading international construction company and a member of the CIMIC Group.§We combine the construction track record and expertise formerly delivered by Leighton Contractors and Thiess, and we also include the people and projects of Leighton Asia.§In conjunction with our clients and partners, CPB Contractors is delivering important and iconic projects across all key sectors of the construction industry, meaning we offer significant and diverse work opportunities.§We are building on the strong foundations of our unique history to create a successful and sustainable future. Safely delivering next-generation infrastructure that better connects people and transforms communities is at the heart of what we do.§Project introduction§The CPB HEB Joint Venture (CPB HEB JV) is responsible for the Design and Construction of Transmission Gully - being the 27 kilometre four-lane motorway which will run from Mackays Crossing to Linden, through Transmission Gully. Four interchanges and two new link roads will connect the route to Mackays, SH58, eastern Porirua and Kenepuru.§We welcome applications from experienced Civil Construction Quality focussed professionals with roadworks experience – particularly pavement/concrete, general earthworks, road furnisher and finishing to support our current operational teams at Transmission Gully.§Your Opportunity§As a Document Controller, you will be responsible providing effective document and data control services that ensure project management records and management system documentation are integrated, accessible, timely, collected and filed. This opportunity will allow you work with industry leading quality management systems and demonstrate your previous success, learnings and knowledge, gained from a successful career and develop it to the next level.§Core accountabilities include:§§Design, implement and manage Document Controls Procedures§Control the registration, identification and distribution of documentation§Oversee the hard copy Document Control Filing system§Setup, implement and maintain the Project Standards library§Ensure compliance with Document Control procedures.§Build and maintain relationships with key stakeholders§Foster a culture of inclusion, responsiveness, honesty and accountability§§Selection criteria:§§A Tertiary Qualification in any Business Course or a Certificate in Total Quality Management or related discipline§Minimum of 3 years’ experience in Document Control position, at least 2 years minimum experience in the Construction industry§Experience with INCITE Keystone collaboration platform would be advantageous§Attention to detail and initiative§Ability to learn and develop new systems quickly§§As the successful candidate you will need to be a self-starter who is highly motivated, well organized and committed to the highest possible work standards. You can build strong relationships with internal stakeholders, clients and subcontractors.§All potential CPB Contractor’s employees will be require the right to work in New Zealand and complete a range of pre-employment checks, including Ministry of justice checks, Reference checking and qualification checks.§In return, we offer rewarding careers, genuine opportunities to develop and grow, and a workplace culture that values and recognizes effort and contribution.§We are committed to workplace diversity and to providing flexible work opportunities on our project. We support women in construction, and we encourage people of all cultural backgrounds to apply.§Opportunities on this project are being sourced directly through the CPBHEB Joint Venture and we will not accept applications via external recruitment agencies.§We thank you for your interest and look forward to communicating with you soon about this exciting project. You can stay up to date with what is happening on Transmission Gully at https://nzta.govt.nz/projects/wellington-northern-corridor/transmission-gully-motorway/§§§§

jobText: TXT/50588159.txt	§Client Business Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Client Business Manager§§Advertiser: §INSIDE Recruitment§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§17 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Office Management§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Client Business Manager §      §        §          §Autonomous role that embraces wellbeing and flexibility§          §Newly created position§          §Auckland or Wellington location§        §        § §        §At Umbrella wellbeing we are proud to be clinical psychologists sharing our wellbeing expertise with organisations throughout New Zealand and internationally. We support leaders and their people to create positive, high performing workplaces that enhance employee wellbeing and organisational resilience. §        § §        §Our psychological expertise alongside our business nous means we are skilled at taking best-practise scientific research and tailoring it to be relevant and engaging for different work environments. §We have a passion for making psychology relevant and real for people, where each interaction we have makes a positive difference.§        § §        §Umbrella are currently in a period of growth, to allow us to continue to be successful, we welcome highly credible professionals with a growth mindset as we strive to be a diverse, industry leading organisation. §        § §        §A unique opportunity has become available to provide operational support and be the first point of contact for our clients.  This role requires someone with strong business management skills to work across our workshops, the clinic, wellbeing assessments and supporting with the logistics, scheduling, administration and reporting in partnership with our customers. §        § §        §The successful applicant will have exceptional communication skills, be efficient and effective in their way of working and will love the variety of the role scope - no two days are the same. You’ll be tech savvy and have proven experience managing scheduling systems. You need to be willing to step outside your comfort zone and be naturally curious by nature collaborating with others regularly and improving operational efficiencies in addition to being the first point of contact for the business. §        § §        §The ideal person will possess the following:§        §          §Proven administration management experience, ideally in the health sector§          §Strong communication and relationship skills§          §Proven experience using Microsoft and a range of scheduling software systems§          §Strong attention to detail across processes, reporting, project management and scheduling systems. §          §Be confident, professional and comfortable working in a range of business environments§          §Passionate about wellbeing at work and assisting people to improve theirs§        §        § §        §In return you’ll have the opportunity to work with every part of the organisation, so the variety and job scope will be interesting. You’ll have the autonomy and freedom to create business operational efficiencies and work in an environment that promotes flexibility and wellbeing and genuinely has a passion for making a difference. §        § §        §To submit your application, please click the 'apply' button below. For more information please contact Sarah Humm on §09 913 0178§. Please note all applications will be acknowledged electronically.§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§ §Autonomous role that embraces wellbeing and flexibility§ §Newly created position§ §Auckland or Wellington location§ § § §At Umbrella wellbeing we are proud to be clinical psychologists sharing our wellbeing expertise with organisations throughout New Zealand and internationally. We support leaders and their people to create positive, high performing workplaces that enhance employee wellbeing and organisational resilience. § § § §Our psychological expertise alongside our business nous means we are skilled at taking best-practise scientific research and tailoring it to be relevant and engaging for different work environments. §We have a passion for making psychology relevant and real for people, where each interaction we have makes a positive difference.§ § § §Umbrella are currently in a period of growth, to allow us to continue to be successful, we welcome highly credible professionals with a growth mindset as we strive to be a diverse, industry leading organisation. § § § §A unique opportunity has become available to provide operational support and be the first point of contact for our clients.  This role requires someone with strong business management skills to work across our workshops, the clinic, wellbeing assessments and supporting with the logistics, scheduling, administration and reporting in partnership with our customers. § § § §The successful applicant will have exceptional communication skills, be efficient and effective in their way of working and will love the variety of the role scope - no two days are the same. You’ll be tech savvy and have proven experience managing scheduling systems. You need to be willing to step outside your comfort zone and be naturally curious by nature collaborating with others regularly and improving operational efficiencies in addition to being the first point of contact for the business. § § § §The ideal person will possess the following:§ § §Proven administration management experience, ideally in the health sector§ §Strong communication and relationship skills§ §Proven experience using Microsoft and a range of scheduling software systems§ §Strong attention to detail across processes, reporting, project management and scheduling systems. § §Be confident, professional and comfortable working in a range of business environments§ §Passionate about wellbeing at work and assisting people to improve theirs§ § § §In return you’ll have the opportunity to work with every part of the organisation, so the variety and job scope will be interesting. You’ll have the autonomy and freedom to create business operational efficiencies and work in an environment that promotes flexibility and wellbeing and genuinely has a passion for making a difference. § § § §To submit your application, please click the 'apply' button below. For more information please contact Sarah Humm on §09 913 0178§. Please note all applications will be acknowledged electronically.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50589028.txt	§Project Administrator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Project Administrator§§Advertiser: §ATL Group§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§18 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Manukau & East Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Contracts Administration§§§§§§ATL is a specialist demolition and asbestos management and removal company and we are currently looking for an admin superstar to assist our operational team at our head office. § § § §This is a fantastic opportunity for an experienced administrator with a high level of computer literacy and an excellent eye for detail. You will work closely and collaboratively with the Regional Manager and the Accounts team to take care of the daily administrative tasks involved in running the teams and projects and assist with the monthly financial reporting. § § § §It is essential for the successful candidate to have:§ § § §Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.§ § § §The ability to think on your feet and willing to go the extra mile.§ § § §Excellent computer skills and the ability to learn computer software quickly.§ § § §Great time management skills and self motivated.§ § § §Attention to detail, analytical skills, and accuracy.§ § § §Reliable and willing to pitch in as required.§ § § §The flexibility and adaptability to step in and out of different tasks quickly. § § § § §    It is desirable for the successful candidate to have:§ § § § Good understanding of Google Docs, Sheets, and Gmail.§ § § § Experience in construction, demolition, and the asbestos environment. § § § § §   Some of the tasks include but are not limited to:§ § § §Champion the correct use of our job costing and inventory software to accurately track jobs, costs, and consumables.§ § § §Timely and accurate issuing of all invoices relating to projects.§ § § §Providing correct and up to date data for the monthly financial reporting for the board and executive meetings.§ § § §Assisting with the preparation of other site paperwork and auditing of project paperwork to ensure accuracy, reliability, and compliance.§ § § §Assisting the project manager with the scheduling of ‘accepted’ jobs, and assisting with the completion of the paperwork associated with new projects. § § § §Managing timesheet collection and review for payroll.§ § § §Liaise closely with the accounts team in regards to payroll and jobText: TXT/50590951.txt	§Office / Client Administrator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Office / Client Administrator§§Advertiser: §Perpetual Guardian§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§18 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Rodney & North Shore§§Salary§§Includes life and health insurance§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Administrative Assistants§§§§§§§§§  §    §      §      §        §Office / Client Administrator §        §          §About the Business§          §Perpetual Guardian is the result of the coming together of two of New Zealand’s oldest trust companies, Perpetual Trust and Guardian Trust. With over 130 years of experience, we've helped thousands of Kiwis meet their unique asset protection and preservation needs. §          §A great team is our most valuable asset, we recruit, train, empower and reward our people to deliver excellence in comprehensive financial solutions and services. Our people are passionate about what they do and have a genuine interest in the wellbeing of our clients.§          §About the Role§          §The Client Administrator will be a key part of our team, providing excellent office and client administration support to the Takapuna branch. We need a proactive, highly organised and solutions focused Client Administrator who will:§          §            §Take calls, respond to emails and interact with internal and external stakeholders.§            §Coordinate diary appointments; arrange meetings / events, conference room bookings and catering.§            §Manage office supplies and ensure the office is professionally presented.§            §Print, collate and send information packs and documents to clients or event attendees.§            §Arrange paperwork, information and reports for Branch Manager and Client Managers as required.§            §Attend client meetings to take minutes or witness document signing.§            §Assist with creating internal and external communications and templates.§            §Filing, payments and other general administration duties.§          §          §About You§          §You will have strong experience in administration roles requiring attention to detail and you will demonstrate the ability to keep pace with a busy office. While it is not essential for you to possess specialist knowledge in our industry (Wills, Trusts, Enduring Power of Attorney), what you must be able to demonstrate is a drive and a track record of providing the highest level of service to your stakeholders.§          §Skills and Experience:§          §            §3+ years administration experience, preferably in financial services.§            §Excellent communication skills – verbal and written.§            §Strong computer skills (including Microsoft Office) and experience working with CRM systems (or those of similar nature).§            §Excellent attention to detail.§            §Ability to work under pressure and meet tight deadlines.§            §A flexible working style with the ability to excel when working independently and as part of a team.§          §          §In return for your efforts...§          §You will join an organisation that is passionate about its vision, purpose and values and a team of professionals who proactively provide excellence to our clients.  §          §Ongoing training and development opportunities will be provided to grow your career and in addition, you will have access to perks associated with being part of Perpetual Guardian. This includes medical and life insurance cover, discounts on company products and products through our commercial business partners.§          §Next Steps§          §Applications must include an up to date CV as well as a Cover Letter addressing the selection criteria above. We will accept applications §up until end of day 2 October 2020§.§          §Note: Only candidates who are legally entitled to work in New Zealand will be considered.§        §        §If you have any questions regarding the role, please email §HRSupport@pgtrust.co.nz§. Applications submitted via email will not be considered. §      §    §  §§§About the Business§ §Perpetual Guardian is the result of the coming together of two of New Zealand’s oldest trust companies, Perpetual Trust and Guardian Trust. With over 130 years of experience, we've helped thousands of Kiwis meet their unique asset protection and preservation needs. §  §A great team is our most valuable asset, we recruit, train, empower and reward our people to deliver excellence in comprehensive financial solutions and services. Our people are passionate about what they do and have a genuine interest in the wellbeing of our clients.§  §About the Role§ §The Client Administrator will be a key part of our team, providing excellent office and client administration support to the Takapuna branch. We need a proactive, highly organised and solutions focused Client Administrator who will:§ § §Take calls, respond to emails and interact with internal and external stakeholders.§ §Coordinate diary appointments; arrange meetings / events, conference room bookings and catering.§ §Manage office supplies and ensure the office is professionally presented.§ §Print, collate and send information packs and documents to clients or event attendees.§ §Arrange paperwork, information and reports for Branch Manager and Client Managers as required.§ §Attend client meetings to take minutes or witness document signing.§ §Assist with creating internal and external communications and templates.§ §Filing, payments and other general administration duties.§ §About You§ §You will have strong experience in administration roles requiring attention to detail and you will demonstrate the ability to keep pace with a busy office. While it is not essential for you to possess specialist knowledge in our industry (Wills, Trusts, Enduring Power of Attorney), what you must be able to demonstrate is a drive and a track record of providing the highest level of service to your stakeholders.§  §Skills and Experience:§ § §3+ years administration experience, preferably in financial services.§ §Excellent communication skills – verbal and written.§ §Strong computer skills (including Microsoft Office) and experience working with CRM systems (or those of similar nature).§ §Excellent attention to detail.§ §Ability to work under pressure and meet tight deadlines.§ §A flexible working style with the ability to excel when working independently and as part of a team.§ §In return for your efforts...§ §You will join an organisation that is passionate about its vision, purpose and values and a team of professionals who proactively provide excellence to our clients.  §  §Ongoing training and development opportunities will be provided to grow your career and in addition, you will have access to perks associated with being part of Perpetual Guardian. This includes medical and life insurance cover, discounts on company products and products through our commercial business partners.§  §Next Steps§ §Applications must include an up to date CV as well as a Cover Letter addressing the selection criteria above. We will accept applications §up until end of day 2 October 2020§.§  §Note: Only candidates who are legally entitled to work in New Zealand will be considered.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have experience in an administration role?§Which of the following Microsoft Office products are you experienced with?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§

In this role you will undertake a wide range of duties associated with organising trades and subcontractor staff.  You will also be required to manage day to day workflow, handling queries and maintaining and updating documentation and systems all form part of the position.§ § §Key responsibilities:§ §Provide clerical and administration functions to service team on site§ §Administer all experience (Pronto would be an advantage)§ §Ability to manage and prioritise your workload, multi-tasking when necessary whilst still maintaining a high level of accuracy.§ §Demonstrated experience in communicator§ §Drive and enthusiasm, with the ability to respond to change with agility and flexibility§ §Positive can-do attitude§ §Job Specifics:§ §Mon – Fri 7:30am to 4:00pm§ §Working 4 days a week In this position, you will coordinate the day-to-day administration needs of the Branch.§  §Specific Job Duties:§ § §Answer incoming internal calls in a pleasant and professional manner, ensuring enquiries are dealt with fairly and promptly.§ §Monitor, maintain and order all office consumables§ §Organise the maintenance of all branch equipment and supplies, coordinating with contractors as and when required§ §Collect and distribute daily mail and act as key contact with local courier companies§ §Process travel and accommodation bookings for all Penske New Zealand employees via a suppliers website§ §Order new and replacement employee uniforms§ §Provide administration support to all departments within the Tauranga branch§ §Provide service administration support to the Service Administrator to ensure that all processes are completed in a timely manner and work in progress is reduced to minimum levels§ §Process supplier invoices for payment§ §Work closely with and provide back-up support to the Service Administrator, ensuring warranty claims for both Tauranga and Christchurch are entered and submitted within set timeframes§ §Provide H&S support to the Tauranga and Christchurch branches§ §Organise branch appointments and internal and external meetings§ §Organise staff morning teas and lunches as required§ §About You:§  §You will offer sound knowledge of general office procedures with a minimum of 2 years administration experience. You will be able to demonstrate competency in the use of MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook.  Your natural style will be to communicate information in a positive and accurate manner, i.e. clear, logical and helpful to both customers and colleagues and you will be capable of working without supervision.  This is a varied and busy position, which will suit an individual who can think on their feet, handle multiple tasks at any one time and who thrives under pressure.§  §The position is currently 20 hours per week with flexibility for how the work hours are arranged going forward, with a maximum of 25 hours per week on offer.§  §Why choose Team Penske?§  §At Penske, we know that it is our people who are at the heart of our success and we want to make sure you have everything you need to do a great job. That is why as well as a great work environment, we offer the following benefits:§ § §Accredited Training & Development Programs;§ §Commitment to providing the highest levels of safety, technical and leadership training;§ §Competitive Remuneration;§ §Reward and Recognition Programs;§ §Employee Referral Program – generous employee referral fees;§ §Employee Assistance Program;§ §Family Friendly Benefits including Paid Parental Leave.§ §Be ambitious. We are.§  §If you want to join a dynamic international company with strong values, where you will be more than a number and have a real voice, hit the "§Apply now§" button and submit your CV!§  § §  §We reserve the right to remove job postings prior to the stated closing date, therefore, if you are interested in applying for this vacancy please submit your application as soon as possible§.§§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Which of the following Microsoft Office products are you experienced with?§Do you have experience in an administration role?§Are you willing to undergo a pre-employment medical check?§§§

jobText: TXT/50594243.txt	§Customer Service Administrator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Customer Service Administrator§§Advertiser: §Universal Business Team Recruitment§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§18 Sept 2020§§Location§§Manawatu§, §Palmerston North§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Client & Sales Administration§§§§§§UBT Recruitment provides professional talent acquisition services to a broad network of SME businesses across Australia & New Zealand. An exciting opportunity exists for an experienced Customer Service Administrator to join a company who are going through a period of exponential growth.§ §§The Company§We are currently partnering with a high-growth retailer, with a global portfolio of stores ranging from small stores through to larger premium supermarkets, with a focus on the sales of items such as fresh produce, groceries, and other household items.  They have significant growth plans, focusing on expanding store sizes, multiplying locations and expanding their online presence and are in the midst of an exciting change journey, professionalising and consolidating finance, strategy, and operations on a global scale across their retail network. With over 200 stores across 6 global regions, based in various sites including the campuses of one of the world's largest independent schooling networks, there is a significant opportunity for the team to deliver impressive growth from both a revenue and margin perspective.§ §§The Role§This is a fantastic opportunity for a strong administrator who is customer-centric and passionate about service delivery.  Here you will be part of a small, high performing team where your contribution will be highly valued.  Your customer base is a team of volunteers who manage and run the day to day activities of supermarkets across New Zealand.§Your key responsibilities will be assisting customers and internal stakeholders with general enquiries via phone and email through a ticketing system.  You will also be accountable for processing orders, following up on progress, working with other departments and ensuring a smooth transaction and experience for every customer.§To be successful in this role, you will have strong attention to detail, high accuracy and good computer skills to manage customer queries promptly, as well as having a natural warmth when you communicate.§Other Key Responsibilities include:§§Timely and accurate processing of invoices, reconciliations, and purchase orders§Proactively communicate with suppliers via phone and email and the ability to deal with high volumes§Maintaining and updating records of customer queries§Provide timely feedback to the company regarding service failures or customer concerns§Respond to emails and process all requests from a centralised ticketing system§Partner with other teams to meet and exceed customer service expectations§Write and distribute emails, correspondence memos, letters and forms to both internal and external stakeholders§§ §§What we are looking for: §§High attention to detail and a resilient nature§Strong customer service skills and an excellent telephone presence which is professional, welcoming, and helpful§Microsoft Office product experience; primarily Excel, Word, and Outlook§Ability to work independently and as part of a team§A resilient and proactive approach to change §Knowledge of office and accounting management systems such as NetSuite is desirable§§ §What is in it for you?§§Competitive salary§A company with an enviable culture where the customer's needs are put first§Making a positive change to the local community§Be part of a company which is on a journey of growth§§ §If you are an experienced Customer Service Administrator with a can-do attitude and are keen to join a purpose driven organisation on an exciting journey of expansion, we want to hear from you.§§§§

jobTitle: Receptionist/Duty Manager Job in Auckland - SEEK

jobText: TXT/50596920.txt	§Receptionist/Duty Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Receptionist/Duty Manager§§Advertiser: §Hopper Developments§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§20 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Rodney & North Shore§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Receptionists§§§§§§About the business§ § § §Country Club Huapai in development and has 15 completed villas and our main building with 46 apartments and community facilities due to finish in October.  Upon completion the  village will have around 220 units and is part of the Hopper Living group. Hoppers are a family owned and run company formed in 1956, well known for its expertise in creating comprehensively planned lifestyle developments. § §Situated on the site of the Nobilo winery, this is a unique retirement village with a lifestyle ideal for the independent and active retiree.§ § § §About the role§ § § §We are looking for several part time Receptionist/Duty Managers who can provide an exceptional first impression for our residents and visitors, and who can help grow our exceptional village. These are key roles where you will be the first point of contact for prospects, visitors and residents, so you will need to be able to adapt quickly to whatever is required of you in the moment. As these are new roles you will be able to influence the culture of the village and you will need to be able to think and act outside of the square.§ §You will need to be empathetic as you deal with our Residents and help us develop a thriving community for them to live in. We need someone with exceptional people skills, the ability to handle customer queries, strong organisational capability and  who is willing to be "hands on" when required. Knowledge of Retirement Villages would be helpful and your experience dealing with people will important.§ §There are 4 positions available to ensure our front desk is covered seven days a week. You will be working either 3 or 4 days per week, including one weekend day. We need people to cover mornings and/or afternoons in shifts of 5 hours.§ § § § § §Benefits and perks§ § § §Huapai is located 10 minutes north of the North West Mall and is part of the North West wine country. This stunning area will be the envy of many, close to beaches and wineries this is an amazing semi rural location.§ §The role is supported by an experienced senior management structure with Head Office located in Orewa, Auckland.§ §The company encourages personal development and opportunities to upskill.§ § § § § §Skills and experience§ § § §We are seeking someone who has the following skills:§ §Empathy with residents and the ability to interact with people showing, credibility, confidence and sensitivity.§Excellent Customer service manner.§Great people management skills to establish key relationships with residents, prospects, visitors, staff & others§Good computer skills, especially in Microsoft Word, Excel and Outlook§Previous experience in the retirement industry would be advantage but is not essential.§ § §§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Which of the following Microsoft Office products are you experienced with?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§

jobText: TXT/50597000.txt	§Office / Client Administrator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Office / Client Administrator§§Advertiser: §Perpetual Guardian§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§20 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Salary§§Includes life and health insurance§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Administrative Assistants§§§§§§§§§  §    §      §      §        §Office / Client Administrator §        §          §About the Business§          §Perpetual Guardian is the result of the coming together of two of New Zealand’s oldest trust companies, Perpetual Trust and Guardian Trust. With over 130 years of experience, we've helped thousands of Kiwis meet their unique asset protection and preservation needs. §          §A great team is our most valuable asset, we recruit, train, empower and reward our people to deliver excellence in comprehensive financial solutions and services. Our people are passionate about what they do and have a genuine interest in the wellbeing of our clients.§          §About the Role§          §The Client Administrator will be a key part of our team, providing excellent office and client administration support to the Remuera and Queen Street branches. While the role will service two branches, it will be based in our Remuera office. We need a proactive, highly organised and solutions focused Client Administrator who will:§          §            §Take calls, respond to emails and interact with internal and external stakeholders.§            §Coordinate diary appointments; arrange meetings / events, conference room bookings and catering.§            §Manage office supplies and ensure the office is professionally presented.§            §Print, collate and send information packs and documents to clients or event attendees.§            §Arrange paperwork, information and reports for Branch Manager and Client Managers as required.§            §Attend client meetings to take minutes or witness document signing.§            §Assist with creating internal and external communications and templates.§            §Filing, payments and other general administration duties.§          §          §About You§          §You will have strong experience in administration roles requiring attention to detail and you will demonstrate the ability to keep pace with a busy office. While it is not essential for you to possess specialist knowledge in our industry (Wills, Trusts, Enduring Power of Attorney), what you must be able to demonstrate is a drive and a track record of providing the highest level of service to your stakeholders.§          §Skills and Experience:§          §            §3+ years administration experience, preferably in financial services.§            §Excellent communication skills – verbal and written.§            §Strong computer skills (including Microsoft Office) and experience working with CRM systems (or those of similar nature).§            §Excellent attention to detail.§            §Ability to work under pressure and meet tight deadlines.§            §A flexible working style with the ability to excel when working independently and as part of a team.§          §          §In return for your efforts...§          §You will join an organisation that is passionate about its vision, purpose and values and a team of professionals who proactively provide excellence to our clients.  §          §Ongoing training and development opportunities will be provided to grow your career and in addition, you will have access to perks associated with being part of Perpetual Guardian. This includes medical and life insurance cover, discounts on company products and products through our commercial business partners.§          §Next Steps§          §Applications must include an up to date CV as well as a Cover Letter addressing the selection criteria above. We will accept applications §up until end of day 4 October 2020§.§          §Note: Only candidates who are legally entitled to work in New Zealand will be considered.§        §        §If you have any questions regarding the role, please email §HRSupport@pgtrust.co.nz§. Applications submitted via email will not be considered. §      §    §  §§§About the Business§ §Perpetual Guardian is the result of the coming together of two of New Zealand’s oldest trust companies, Perpetual Trust and Guardian Trust. With over 130 years of experience, we've helped thousands of Kiwis meet their unique asset protection and preservation needs. §  §A great team is our most valuable asset, we recruit, train, empower and reward our people to deliver excellence in comprehensive financial solutions and services. Our people are passionate about what they do and have a genuine interest in the wellbeing of our clients.§  §About the Role§ §The Client Administrator will be a key part of our team, providing excellent office and client administration support to the Remuera and Queen Street branches. While the role will service two branches, it will be based in our Remuera office. We need a proactive, highly organised and solutions focused Client Administrator who will:§ § §Take calls, respond to emails and interact with internal and external stakeholders.§ §Coordinate diary appointments; arrange meetings / events, conference room bookings and catering.§ §Manage office supplies and ensure the office is professionally presented.§ §Print, collate and send information packs and documents to clients or event attendees.§ §Arrange paperwork, information and reports for Branch Manager and Client Managers as required.§ §Attend client meetings to take minutes or witness document signing.§ §Assist with creating internal and external communications and templates.§ §Filing, payments and other general administration duties.§ §About You§ §You will have strong experience in administration roles requiring attention to detail and you will demonstrate the ability to keep pace with a busy office. While it is not essential for you to possess specialist knowledge in our industry (Wills, Trusts, Enduring Power of Attorney), what you must be able to demonstrate is a drive and a track record of providing the highest level of service to your stakeholders.§  §Skills and Experience:§ § §3+ years administration experience, preferably in financial services.§ §Excellent communication skills – verbal and written.§ §Strong computer skills (including Microsoft Office) and experience working with CRM systems (or those of similar nature).§ §Excellent attention to detail.§ §Ability to work under pressure and meet tight deadlines.§ §A flexible working style with the ability to excel when working independently and as part of a team.§ §In return for your efforts...§ §You will join an organisation that is passionate about its vision, purpose and values and a team of professionals who proactively provide excellence to our clients.  §  §Ongoing training and development opportunities will be provided to grow your career and in addition, you will have access to perks associated with being part of Perpetual Guardian. This includes medical and life insurance cover, discounts on company products and products through our commercial business partners.§  §Next Steps§ §Applications must include an up to date CV as well as a Cover Letter addressing the selection criteria above. We will accept applications §up until end of day 4 October 2020§.§  §Note: Only candidates who are legally entitled to work in New Zealand will be considered.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have experience in an administration role?§Which of the following Microsoft Office products are you experienced with?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§

jobText: TXT/50597146.txt	§Office Administrator / Kiripaepae§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Office Administrator / Kiripaepae§§Advertiser: §Te Rūnanga of Ngāti Whakaue ki Maketū§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§20 Sept 2020§§Location§§Bay of Plenty§, §Rest of Bay of Plenty§§Salary§§$20 - $24.99 per hour§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Administrative Assistants§§§§§§Te Rūnanga of Ngāti Whakaue ki Maketū is looking for a reliable and motivated person to fill the part-time role of Kiripaepae (Office Administrator). §  §This will be a chance to join a small team of people committed to influencing positive outcomes for the people and environment of Maketū and surrounding districts. As an Iwi based entity, knowledge and understanding of tikanga is essential, and fluency in te reo Māori is strongly preferred.§  §The position will report directly to the Manager and help the Rūnanga implement the Iwi Management Plan. The Kiripaepae will be responsible for the administration and co-ordination of Rūnanga activities, ensuring efficiency and compliance with Rūnanga policies.§  §The position is varied and requires a broad range of skills. Key tasks include (but are not limited to):§ § §Clearing mail and emails§ §Arranging meetings and hui§ §Taking minutes at board meetings§ §Providing technical support to the board§ §Fielding enquiries from members, stakeholders and the general public§ §Maintaining and increasing a database of members§ §Keeping the website and other digital media up to date§ §Supporting the administration of project contracts§ §Assisting in preparation of reports including monthly board reports§ §Assisting in invoice preparation and processing§ §Preparing funding applications§ §Filing and maintaining a professional office environment § §Other administration duties as required§ §To be considered for this role you must be able to demonstrate a range of skills and attributes including:§ § §Previous experience in a similar role§ §Sound knowledge of MS Office suite§ §Professional written and verbal communication skills with the ability to communicate effectively§ §Familiarity with a range of social media platforms§ §A positive “can do” attitude§ §Reliability, self-motivation and ability to work without supervision§ §Excellent relationship skills§ §Commitment to the Maketū community§ §An understanding of environmental issues, including the impact of climate change§ §An understanding of well-being through a kaupapa Māori lens§ §Knowledge and understanding of tikanga is essential§ §Fluency in te reo Māori is strongly preferred§ §This is your chance to work within an Iwi organisation that is making a difference. §  §Hours of work are from 10.00am to 3.00pm three days per week with some evening and weekend work required. The hours required may increase over time.§  §To make an application please email your CV along with a covering letter to: manager@maketu-runanga.iwi.nz §  §Applications close Friday 16 October 2020.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have experience in an administration role?§§§

jobText: TXT/50597426.txt	§Executive Assistant to the ELB & SLT§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Executive Assistant to the ELB & SLT§§Advertiser: §New Zealand Police§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§20 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Other§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Executive Assistant to the ELB & SLT §      §        §Executive Assistant, it starts with you! §        §          §2 Fixed-Term positions available (1 x 12-month FT, 1 x 7-month FT covering parental leave)§          §Salary starting from $66.757,00 §          §Reports to the Team Leader Executive Services§        §        § §        §About the role§        §As§ §an§ Executive Assistant, §you will contribute to the overall leadership of the Police Executive by providing high level, professional executive assistance and management support. This position will be supporting Deputy Commissioner/Deputy Chief Executive and Assistant Commissioner/Executive Director executive members. §        §Your role will involve managing the day-to-day office systems such as diary management – proactively managing the time and availability of your executive members, meeting management coordination, organising national and international travel, and ensuring executive members have all relevant material to achieve their objectives – this includes briefings and papers. §        §You will be providing strategic executive support including the proactive management of Action Points and reviewing governance papers to ensure they are fit for purpose and meet quality standards. You will have the ability to identify and mitigate risk, be proactive, and ultimately be solutions focused. §        §The purpose of leadership in this role is to support the Police Executive to deliver on Our Business. To ensure this is met you will need to have a thorough understanding of the priorities of the Deputy Commissioner/Deputy Chief Executive and Assistant Commissioner/Executive Director.§        § §        §Key Accountabilities:§        §          §Provide executive support services §          §Commitment to continuous process improvement and risk management§          §Understanding the priorities of the Police Executive§        §        § §        §What you’ll bring§        §Being part of the Police whānau is about being our best to ensure our communities are safe and feel safe. Our Core Competencies provide a shared understanding of the behaviours, leadership and technical competence required for success at each level of Police. Whilst we are looking for skills, knowledge and experience relevant to the role, we also place high importance on your state of mind, the alignment of your values with ours, your ability to contribute to and build high performing teams, and the way that you lead yourself or others. §        §          §Experience in supporting executive levels is desirable§          §Hold a current full driver's license as you must be able to drive police vehicles and transport the Executives to and from meetings within business hours§          §Experience in the Public Sector, with an understanding of the machinery of government§          §A strong grasp of the Microsoft product suite - in particular: Outlook, PowerPoint and Excel.§          §Ability to obtain and maintain a Security Clearance§          §Acts with integrity and loyalty, maintaining confidentiality and discretion §        §        § §        §This role is set at Individual Contributor level, this means your key purpose is “to deliver or enable others to deliver Our Business”.§        §We will ask you questions based on “How we will deliver Our Business – Core Competencies” and the appropriate role level, i.e. Individual Contributor. §        §        §For more information on Our Core Competencies, please copy and paste this URL:  https://www.police.govt.nz/sites/default/files/publications/core-competencies-how-we-will-deliver-our-business.pdf. §        §        §These questions will be unique and specific to the role, focusing on the aspects the hiring manager believes are most important for that position at the time. §        §For more information on Our Values, please copy and paste this URL: https://www.police.govt.nz/sites/default/files/publications/nzp-our-values.pdf§        §        §To view the position description for this role please copy and paste this link into a new browser:§ §https://teams.sp.police.govt.nz/pac/od/pd/Documents/Strategy%20and%20Partnerships%20Group/Executive%20Assistant%20to%20members%20of%20the%20Executive%20Leadership%20Board%20and%20Senior%20Leadership%20Team.pdf§        §        §About us§        §Our mission is to be the safest country by delivering services that ensure New Zealand communities are confident, safe and secure. §        §Working Flexibly§        §Your wellbeing inside and outside of work is important to us. jobText: TXT/50597473.txt	§Front Desk Role Medical Rec§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Front Desk Role Medical Rec§§Advertiser: §Equilibrium§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§20 Sept 2020§§Location§§Tasman§, §Nelson§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Receptionists§§§§§§Front Desk Role in busy wellness practice§ §Do you have a proactive positive attitude?§Do you love providing exceptional customer service?§Are you passionate about Health and Wellbeing?§ §Equilibrium is a modern wellness practice in the heart of Nelson City. Our committed team of professionals are passionate about helping people by offering specialist care, a range of quality products and services and friendly advice to support total wellbeing. We now have a fabulous permanent part-time opportunity for a bright, highly organised and outgoing receptionist to be the front face of our business and champion the smooth and efficient function of our practice. § §In this busy and varied role you’ll be dedicated to providing clients with a warm, welcoming and supportive experience. You’ll be responsible for meeting and greeting clients, managing enquiries and scheduling appointments. In addition to this you’ll provide a range of administrative support to the wider team so a team player is a must. The ability to multi-task, work under pressure and thrive in a busy environment is paramount to this position. § §This permanent part-time role is spread throughout the week and includes alternating Saturdays mornings. You may from time to time be required to cover additional hours such as sick leave/annual leave so you’ll need to be flexible and adaptable. A warm positive attitude, great phone manner, strong computer skills and a genuine interest in health and wellbeing would ensure a good job fit. Ideally you’ll have some reception and administration experience but this is not absolutely essential as full training will be given. §If you would you like to be part our team in a busy and supportive environment where wonderful customer service is paramount and enthusiasm for your work is essential then this could be the perfect opportunity for you.§Please e-mail your CV with a covering letter detailing why you believe you are perfect for this role to §admin@equilibriumnelson.nz§ §We look forward to hearing from you. §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have customer service experience?§§§

jobTitle: Commercial Support Coordinator Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50597477.txt	§Commercial Support Coordinator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Commercial Support Coordinator§§Advertiser: §The Warehouse Group§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§20 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Rodney & North Shore§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Administrative Assistants§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Commercial Support Coordinator §      §        §TWG is a New Zealand success story, founded by Sir Stephen Tindall and evolved from a single The Warehouse store to become one of the largest retailing groups in New Zealand with $3 billion in sales. TWG consists of six core retail brands: The Warehouse, Warehouse Stationery, Noel Leeming, Torpedo7, 1-day and TheMarket.§        §Each business unit of TWG has a commercial division which operates through the TWG Business programme. TWG Business allows a consolidated shopping experience for businesses nationwide, allowing a wide range of product and service procurement through a central group. The vision is that a business can procure technology, stationery, appliances, furniture, sporting, outdoor, apparel, FMCG, services and many more categories; through one central supplier.§        §The Role§        §We now have a great opportunity for a strong administrator to join the team as our new Commercial Support Coordinator.§        §In this role, you will provide a high level of service supporting the operations for our Commercial services team across all commercial sectors.§        §The Commercial Support Coordinator is responsible for all administration activities including:§        §          §Delivery of monthly invoicing & client statements for Commercial Services§          §Managing the Commercial teams fleet vehicles§          §CRM (Salesforce) Management§          §Management of Commercial Services website§          §Reporting§        §        § §        §About You§        §To succeed in this role, we are looking for a thoroughly customer focused individual who is able to remain composed in all situations. You will have strong admin skills, excellent phone manner with written and verbal skills to match together with strong time management skills. You will take pride in building good relationships & delivering a memorable experience to our customers.§        §Above all, we are looking for a passionate team player who showcases key agile attributes such as growth mindset, collaboration and performance driven in order to drive the business forward.§        §What's in it for you? §        §We offer a dynamic, supportive team environment within a business that cares about and recognises individuals. The business is at an exciting point in its life story.  By empowering our teams and increasing cross-collaboration, we aim to make TWG New Zealand’s best place to work! §        § §      §    §    §twg.co.nz§  §§§TWG is a New Zealand success story, founded by Sir Stephen Tindall and evolved from a single The Warehouse store to become one of the largest retailing groups in New Zealand with $3 billion in sales. TWG consists of six core retail brands: The Warehouse, Warehouse Stationery, Noel Leeming, Torpedo7, 1-day and TheMarket.§ §Each business unit of TWG has a commercial division which operates through the TWG Business programme. TWG Business allows a consolidated shopping experience for businesses nationwide, allowing a wide range of product and service procurement through a central group. The vision is that a business can procure technology, stationery, appliances, furniture, sporting, outdoor, apparel, FMCG, services and many more categories; through one central supplier.§ §The Role§ §We now have a great opportunity for a strong administrator to join the team as our new Commercial Support Coordinator.§ §In this role, you will provide a high level of service supporting the operations for our Commercial services team across all commercial sectors.§ §The Commercial Support Coordinator is responsible for all administration activities including:§ § §Delivery of monthly invoicing & client statements for Commercial Services§ §Managing the Commercial teams fleet vehicles§ §CRM (Salesforce) Management§ §Management of Commercial Services website§ §Reporting§ § § §About You§ §To succeed in this role, we are looking for a thoroughly customer focused individual who is able to remain composed in all situations. You will have strong admin skills, excellent phone manner with written and verbal skills to match together with strong time management skills. You will take pride in building good relationships & delivering a memorable experience to our customers.§ §Above all, we are looking for a passionate team player who showcases key agile attributes such as growth mindset, collaboration and performance driven in order to drive the business forward.§ §What's in it for you? § §We offer a dynamic, supportive team environment within a business that cares about and recognises individuals. The business is at an exciting point in its life story.  By empowering our teams and increasing cross-collaboration, we aim to make TWG New Zealand’s best place to work! § § §§§§

jobText: TXT/50597660.txt	§Placement Specialist l Join a growing, Kiwi-owned company!§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Placement Specialist l Join a growing, Kiwi-owned company!§§Advertiser: §MedRecruit§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§20 Sept 2020§§Location§§Otago§, §Queenstown & Wanaka§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Administrative Assistants§§§§§§MedRecruit is growing and we're on the hunt for exceptional people to join our Placement Team!§  §As a §Placement Specialist §you will sometimes have one of a kind problems to solve! You will love structure and processes. You crave order in your work and take pride in dotting all the 'i's' and crossing all the 't's' before going home for the day.§  §Yet despite these preferences you are the type of person who can deal with a last-minute curve ball with a smile on your face and re-prioritise your tasks to get whatever needs doing done!§  §You’ll love working at MedRecruit because of:§ §The support.§ Work collaboratively in a team to achieve results – be fully supported and interact with people who have navigated this journey before.§ §The people.§ Be surrounded by some of the most friendly, kind and passionate leaders and teams – people who are driven but also love to celebrate and have a bit of fun along the way!§ §The location. §Work in a modern, professional environment with a great vibe – you can live the Queenstown lifestyle and enjoy a healthy work/life balance.§ §The training.§ We have an onboarding training program to help you hit the ground running, setting you up for success.§ §The impact.§ Have an impact on the lives of doctors and the people they serve – you will help save people’s lives.§ §Your role at MedRecruit:§ §In this varied and fast-paced role, you will be responsible for coordinating all logistics and documentation to facilitate the successful commencement and completion of doctor’s work placements.§  §You will develop and nurture meaningful relationships with our:§ § §Doctors§, by understanding their professional and lifestyle preferences and assisting them in navigating the documentation requirements and logistics of their work placements.§ §Hospitals/Health Services§, by understanding their workforce regulatory requirements and assisting them to ensure all compliance legislation is met.§ §In doing so, you’ll position yourself as an expert in your market and provide an exceptional experience to the people we serve.§  §Some of your key tasks will also include:§ § §Coordinating complex travel and accommodation arrangements across multiple placements.§ §Interpreting and managing the accurate completion of compliance and regulatory documentation.§ §Maintaining doctor and client records in line with legislative requirements.§ §Preparing final reports outlining details of work placements.§ §Working 40 hours per week, this full-time role will include a variety of weekday shifts, covering standard business hours across Australia (11:00- 19:30) and New Zealand (08:30 - 17:00).§  §A successful Placement Specialist is:§ §A persuasive communicator who relishes the opportunity to build lasting relationships.§ §Highly organised with exceptional attention to detail and time-management skills.§ §A natural problem solver who is solutions focused.§ §Comfortable multitasking and balancing continuously shifting priorities.§ §Able to negotiate successfully whilst maintaining integrity with all parties.§ §Articulate and professional in all forms of communication.§ §Able to work autonomously, within a team.§ §Someone who enjoys working in a dynamic, fast-paced environment.§ §Experienced in providing exceptional customer service and support to others.§ §Experienced in working in a commercial environment, with direct exposure to clients.§ §Tertiary qualified.§ §About MedRecruit:§ §At MedRecruit we help doctors and healthcare organisations discover what exceptional means to them. We are proud of the personal yet professional service we provide and take great pride in making a difference to the careers and lives of the doctors we place and healthcare organisations we support.§  §We are a privately owned, innovative, thought leader in the doctor staffing industry with big aspirations. Known for our high energy and driven, yet supportive, culture, MedRecruit is the perfect choice for ambitious and talented individuals. §  §At MedRecruit changing the world and having an impact starts with our team. We believe being successful and having fun aren’t mutually exclusive, so we have a great time whilst doing great things to serve our customers; that’s how we #BeMedRecruit!§  §What to do next:§ §To apply, please follow the steps below:§ § §Copy the below link into your web browser and then submit your CV and Cover Letter.§ §https://medworld.bamboohr.com/jobs/view.php?id=31 §  §Please note that we will only accept applications that are received via the above channel (and not via Seek). §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have experience in an administration role?§Do you have customer service experience?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50599154.txt	§Office Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Office Manager§§Advertiser: §StarNow.com§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§21 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Office Management§§§§§§The Company§ §StarNow (www.starnow.com) is an award-winning, global auditions and jobs website for the entertainment industry. We've just celebrated our 16th birthday, so we've been in the game a while, but we still know how to have fun (free coffee and a much loved foosball table feature in the daily life at our Allen St. office). We're committed to being the world’s best platform for simple, safe and accessible casting.  § §We're searching for someone to support the busy team at HQ,  who will take pride in making sure that our staff have everything they need to do a great job.§ §No job will be too big or too small – from keeping us supplied with milk, to supporting the Executive Leadership team.§ §The Role§ §The Office Manager works in a wide range of areas, including: HR, office administration, facilities, recruitment and staff engagement. People are our priority, so you'll need to be a natural at connecting and maintaining great working relationships with a diverse range of people.§ §You’ll be responsible for:§ § §Operational HR support: annual and sick leave management, staff onboarding and offboarding, contract variations, document management etc. § §Recruitment support: assisting managers with things like posting job ads, screening applicants, attending interviews, reference checks, drafting contracts and offer letters, etc. § §Creating and implementing staff engagement initiatives to keep engagement and productivity high.§ §Planning and organising events: company parties, strategy meetings, workshops, team off-sites, etc.§ §Maintaining a strong knowledge of StarNow’s company policies and advising staff on policies when needed§ §Facilities management – overseeing cleaning contracts, liaising with our security company and landlord as needed§ §Administration and support for the leadership team as needed§ §Who Are We Looking For?§ §Ideally, you'll have had at least 2-3 years of office/admin experience as well as some experience in HR and/or recruitment.  § §To nail this role, you’ll need:§ § §High level office administration skills§ §Ability to work independently, prioritise and meet deadlines§ §Great time management and the ability to prioritise a wide range of tasks§ §Excellent interpersonal skills and the ability to build good working relationships with every team member§ §Attention to detail and a high level of accuracy§ §Sound judgement and a high level of integrity and professionalism, especially when working with confidential matters§ §An interest in building good workplace culture§ §It would be an added benefit if you also had:§ § §HR experience, or equivalent experience working with a diverse range of people and meeting their needs§ §Recruitment experience§ §Understanding of the entertainment industry (or genuine willingness to learn)§ §Awesome company perks include:§ § §A warm, welcoming workspace – we value our company culture and we put our people first§ §An awesome light-filled office including a sunny deck with a peek of the harbour§ §Unlimited free coffee from our in-house espresso machine – master those barista skills!§ §A well-stocked kitchen that includes all you can eat Pics peanut butter§ §An individual training and development allowance§ §This role is a permanent position, Monday-Friday.  §This could be a fulltime role, or for the right person, we are open to considering part time hours.§ §Please include a cover letter (addressed to Katie) with your application, that explains why you think you’re our perfect candidate, and describe the single biggest contribution you believe you can make to our team.§§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§

We need someone with a wide range of skills to help us achieve our goals.§  §What We Believe In:§ § §Extreme Ownership: §We take responsibility for our own lives. We don't blame others for things not going our way.§ §Client Success is Paramount: §We are committed to serving our clients to the highest level.§ §If It's Not Fun We're Not Doing It: §We work hard and we play hard and we share a lot of laughs along the way. If you're not having fun, what is the point?§ §Doing Epic Stuff: §We do things at work and in life that push us outside our comfort zone.§ §Being Resourceful: §We are a team of doers and we ALWAYS find a way.§ §Constant Improvement: §We are committed to growth. We actively look for ways to improve what we do and then implement them.§ §High Standards: §Attention to detail is EVERYTHING - to ensure we are always doing the best for our clients§ §Position§  §Position:              Client Liaison and Administrator§  §Role:§  §This position will support all staff members by being the glue that sticks us all together! In this role you will provide administration support and will often be the first point of client contact. We need someone who can bring a wide range of skills and can wear a few different hats.   §  §Responsibilities:§ § §First point of client contact – responsibility for answering telephone calls and greeting clients in person. This is an extremely important role in our professional environment.§ §Maintaining our website and working towards building our online presence. Some marketing or business social media experience would greatly assist in this area, or a willingness to learn§ §File management – opening and closing files, preparing letter templates, assisting with client on-boarding for AML/CFT, and client data management§ §Diary management - arranging client meetings recording other things like court dates§ §Assist in creating firm procedure and policy documentation§ §Managing deeds and file storage systems§ §Invoicing and debtor management – creating invoices, sending statements.§ §Letter and court document formatting§ §Trust account administration assistance§ §Petty cash and stationery management§ §Personal qualities§ § §Can act in a serious professional manner when circumstances require but also has a sense of humour§ §Proactive and always looking for systems or strategies that can be created or improved.§ §An interest in technology and forward-thinking ways of doing things.§ §Delivers ahead of deadlines.§ §Takes ownership of everything they do§ §Enjoys researching and understanding our business and industry§ §Seeks out information about our target market by reading what is current§ §Displays a great, positive attitude, and is open to feedback and suggestions.§ §Pivots quickly and is communicative of any hold ups or roadblocks § §Requirements §  §As we're looking for an ideal fit, our new Client Liaison and Administrator will have:§ § §Excellent communication skills (written and verbal).§ §Excellent organisational skills and ability to prioritise workload.§ §Critical thinking, analytical, & problem-solving skills.§ §Ability to learn new software quickly§ §Ability to work in a dynamic environment that it sometimes fast and stressful but with periods of downtime.§ §Ability to prioritise multiple tasks under pressure.§ §Willingness to work a flexible schedule if required.§ §Passion for working with others (being collaborative) and helping our team members grow and learn.§ §Problem solving skills and think ahead to ensure any challenges don't greatly impact project progress or outcomes.§ §Ability to set goals and develop achievable timelines to hit them.§ §Not afraid to ask questions or to ask for help.§ §Application Instructions§  §Keen? Awesome - please send an email to §careers@swarbricks.co.nz§ by 30 September 2020 (keep in mind we will begin interviewing potential candidates immediately, so we highly recommend applying as soon as possible) with the following details:§ § §Respond to this posting by email only with: § §Your CV;§ §A cover letter about why we should hire you; or§ §1-2 minute video about why we should hire you;§ §Write only the word "Cat" in the subject line of your email (so we know you've been paying attention).§ § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§

We will accept applications §up until end of day 6 October 2020§.§  §Note: Only candidates who are legally entitled to work in New Zealand will be considered.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have experience in an administration role?§Which of the following Microsoft Office products are you experienced with?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§

jobText: TXT/50605356.txt	§Operations Support§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Operations Support§§Advertiser: §Bachcare§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§21 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Administrative Assistants§§§§§§Operations Support - Bachcare Holiday Homes§  §Do you love everything about travel, tourism and property!  If so this role could be for you! We're on the lookout for the next superstar to join our fast-paced Operations Support team, who dedicate their days to supporting our Operations department, so that Bachcare can deliver a world-class experience to our guests and owners.
