Together you will ensure the smooth working of core processes, resolve homeowner matters, support our holiday manages and focus on communication and administration. They play an instrumental part in ensuring all processes that are connected to Operations are updated, disseminated, and improved upon where necessary. We are looking for someone who would be happy to predominately work Tuesday through to Saturday. §  § §  §Important skills to have:§ § §High school certificate or equivalent§ §Operations experience§ §Excellent interpersonal communication skills§ §High levels of professionalism§ §Strong problem solving§ §Ability to multitask and remain calm under pressure, especially during peak hours or intense situations§ §Exceptional verbal and written communication§ §Good conflict resolution skills§ §Adaptable to change§ §Decisiveness and attention to detail§ § §  §Our Culture:§  §We are a team that is happy to roll up our sleeves to get the job done!  We're honest and humble, curious and innovative, and most importantly we deliver amazingness in everything that we do.  We are fully supportive of a flexible working environment too, so we are happy for your time to be spread between our Support Office in Parnell and your home office, if remote working is your jam. We've proudly been selected as finalists for The Westpac Business Awards' Employer of the Year, 2020.§  § §  §About Bachcare Holiday Homes:§  §Since 2003, Bachcare has been helping holiday home owners and holidaymakers find their happy place. We fully manage the holiday home on behalf of the owner - they simply give us the keys and we will deliver them a return and take care of everything else, including listing on multiple booking sites. Not only are we now managing over 2000 holiday homes nationwide (the largest in New Zealand), but we also have a high performing guest site where over 2 million holidaymakers visit every year and can directly book a Bachcare Holiday Home.§  §Ready To Apply? Send your CV and cover letter through via Seek.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have experience in an administration role?§You have to choose one holiday destination within New Zealand to visit for the rest of your life. Where would you choose, and why?§What's the most interesting thing you've done to celebrate someone else's birthday?§§§

jobTitle: Executive Assistant Job in Canterbury - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50605383.txt	§Executive Assistant§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Executive Assistant§§Advertiser: §Little Recruiter§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§21 Sept 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Timaru & South Canterbury§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §PA, EA & Secretarial§§§§§§The company§Whether it’s the soil, the seed or anything in between, at Wholesale Seeds we are dedicated to solving farmers’ needs through innovative agronomy, underpinned by the spirit of a family business and driven by a genuine love of the land. We are currently looking for a part time Executive Assistant to join our busy administrative team at our head office based in Ashburton.§The role§20 hours per week - Monday to Friday§Assisting the management team with their day-to-day tasks, acting as a first point of contact and freeing them up to grow the business forward.§Coordination of marketing with our external marketing partners§Supporting the Sales Operations team as a secondary role as required§Contribute to the wider administration team, carrying out general administrative tasks in a collaborative manner§What you’ll need to succeed§You will be an experienced administrator, preferably having worked in a sales-focused organisation previously. Proficiency in Microsoft Office is a must, as is the ability to pick up new IT platforms with ease. Effective communication skills, both written and verbal, are at the heart of the role, as is impeccable confidentiality, organisation and time management. As the “gate keeper” to the team you will have a confident and strong personality whilst maintaining a professional and respectful candour. Proactive and a genuinely nice person, you will have an interest in the agriculture sector and be eager to learn new things.§What’s in it for me§In return for your hard work and commitment you will receive a competitive remuneration package with great perks, part time employment within a supportive environment and have the opportunity to be part of a team who enjoy coming into work every day. §To apply§If this sounds like the perfect role for you, click on the “apply” button below and submit your up to date CV along with a brief cover letter. §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Which of the following Microsoft Office products are you experienced with?§§§

jobText: TXT/50605709.txt	§Human Resources and Payroll Administrator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Human Resources and Payroll Administrator§§Advertiser: §INSIDE Recruitment§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§21 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Contracts Administration§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Human Resources and Payroll Administrator §      §        §          §Agricultural not-for-profit§          §New and exciting HR team§          §Career growth opportunity, make the role your own§        §        § §        §Established in 2013, OSPRI is a not for profit organisation existing in partnership between primary industries and the Government. It is an integrated service provider, providing end to end disease management expertise at a national level, protecting and enhancing the reputation of New Zealand’s primary industries.§        § §        §As OSPRI moves through the implementation phase of a new and improved operating model, driven by a newly appointed Chief Executive and Board, nothing is more important now than the continued development and success of their people. Following the successful recruitment of the HR Business Partner and a Senior Human Resources Advisor, OSPRI are now searching for a Human Resources and Payroll Administrator to deliver operational payroll processing and broad HR coordination and support to the wider team.§        § §        §As the new HR and Payroll Administrator, you will have primary responsibility for the successful management and running of OSPRI’s fortnightly payroll process. You will produce informative dashboard reports and provide meaningful analytics for the business, utilising tools such as PowerBI, relating to all matters HR and payroll. Using this information, you will work with the team to identify and introduce process and efficiency improvement across the function. You will also play a critical role in the preparation and implementation of a new payroll system, as part of the broader HRIS implementation early next year. Beyond Payroll, you will become the ‘engine room’ of the HR team, providing coordination and administrative support towards recruitment, remuneration, performance management, policy development and L&D.§        § §        §OSPRI are looking for a customer focused HR and Payroll administrator to join a growing, fun and enthusiastic HR team. You will bring at least 1-2 years of hands on experience managing payroll processes, allowing you to hit the ground running when you start. You will have clear competency working with Microsoft suite, ideally with experience in PowerBI and/or strong Microsoft Excel skills. As part of a small team you will work with and support all areas of the business, so you will need strong communication and relationship management skills. OSPRI are outcome focussed, however believe in having fun at the same time; as the key support person in the team, you will be someone that can navigate the enjoyable, people facing elements of the role, along with the busy administration components.  §        § §        §As the Human Resources team at OSPRI grows in line with the broader expansion of the organisation, there is now a need for either an up and coming HR professional with experience in payroll management, or an established HR and payroll administrator looking for a new challenge.§ §        §To submit your application, please ‘Apply’ now. For a confidential discussion please call Jeremy McLeod on §(04) 974 8490§.§        §Please note all applications will be acknowledged electronically. Applications for this role close on Monday 12th October at 5pm.§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§ §Agricultural not-for-profit§ §New and exciting HR team§ §Career growth opportunity, make the role your own§ § § §Established in 2013, OSPRI is a not for profit organisation existing in partnership between primary industries and the Government. It is an integrated service provider, providing end to end disease management expertise at a national level, protecting and enhancing the reputation of New Zealand’s primary industries.§ § § §As OSPRI moves through the implementation phase of a new and improved operating model, driven by a newly appointed Chief Executive and Board, nothing is more important now than the continued development and success of their people. Following the successful recruitment of the HR Business Partner and a Senior Human Resources Advisor, OSPRI are now searching for a Human Resources and Payroll Administrator to deliver operational payroll processing and broad HR coordination and support to the wider team.§ § § §As the new HR and Payroll Administrator, you will have primary responsibility for the successful management and running of OSPRI’s fortnightly payroll process. You will produce informative dashboard reports and provide meaningful analytics for the business, utilising tools such as PowerBI, relating to all matters HR and payroll. Using this information, you will work with the team to identify and introduce process and efficiency improvement across the function. You will also play a critical role in the preparation and implementation of a new payroll system, as part of the broader HRIS implementation early next year. Beyond Payroll, you will become the ‘engine room’ of the HR team, providing coordination and administrative support towards recruitment, remuneration, performance management, policy development and L&D.§ § § §OSPRI are looking for a customer focused HR and Payroll administrator to join a growing, fun and enthusiastic HR team. You will bring at least 1-2 years of hands on experience managing payroll processes, allowing you to hit the ground running when you start. You will have clear competency working with Microsoft suite, ideally with experience in PowerBI and/or strong Microsoft Excel skills. As part of a small team you will work with and support all areas of the business, so you will need strong communication and relationship management skills. OSPRI are outcome focussed, however believe in having fun at the same time; as the key support person in the team, you will be someone that can navigate the enjoyable, people facing elements of the role, along with the busy administration components.  § § § §As the Human Resources team at OSPRI grows in line with the broader expansion of the organisation, there is now a need for either an up and coming HR professional with experience in payroll management, or an established HR and payroll administrator looking for a new challenge.§ § §To submit your application, please ‘Apply’ now. For a confidential discussion please call Jeremy McLeod on §(04) 974 8490§.§ §Please note all applications will be acknowledged electronically. Applications for this role close on Monday 12th October at 5pm.§§§§

jobTitle: Frontline Media/Marketing Office Super Star Job in Otago - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50605827.txt	§Frontline Media/Marketing Office Super Star§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Frontline Media/Marketing Office Super Star§§Advertiser: §Wilkin River Jets§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§21 Sept 2020§§Location§§Otago§, §Queenstown & Wanaka§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Administrative Assistants§§§§§§Operating from the timeless land of Makarora,  Wilkin River Jets along with Backcountry Helicopters have been delivering exceptional wilderness experiences to travelers from all around the world since 1968. Known as the timeless land Makarora is a truly special place, with stunning snow capped mountains, ancient river valleys and pristine native beech forest.§  § We are looking for a Frontline Marketing/Media person to join our team.§  §Being only a 35 min drive to Lake Hawea , 45 mins to Wanaka 2 hours to Queenstown, and 1 hour to the West Coast Makarora is ideally situated to all the play grounds that these areas have to offer.§  §Commencing Oct 2020 - End of April 2021 Full time Seasonal with some weekend work required. The successful applicant will be required to organize § § §Daily helicopter and jet boat logistics,§ §Client check in's§ §Reservations§ §Provide admin support§ §Take over the Marketing portfolio and be proficient on managing social media and pushing the domestic market.§ §Statistics and data processing.§ §.Ideally you will have some experience within the tourism industry and working with people, be able to adapt and take on other roles should the need arise. This is a multi faceted role that would suit someone ready to take on any task and adapt accordingly. Strong computer skills especially in Excel and Word would be an advantage.§  §The two companies have a dedicated commitment to delivering  unique wilderness experiences to their clients and sharing their passion for the Region that they are lucky enough to work and live in. A high level of customer service and interface is required to achieve this.§  §Some of the benefits associated with the role are that the successful candidate will enjoy many of the activities that our clients do, the Mt Aspiring National Park ,rivers and lakes are all at your doorstep....and although small in size we have a great crew who are fantastic at what they do and share a mutual passion for everything outdoors. §  §If this sounds like you, email:  Danyel Watson §info@wilkinriverjets.co.nz§ .§  §We look forward to hearing from you!§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have in a marketing role?§How many years of people management experience do you have?§Do you have experience in a sales role?§§§

jobTitle: Operations Coordinator and/or 1:1 Support Worker Job in Bay of Plenty - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50606796.txt	§Operations Coordinator and/or 1:1 Support Worker§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Operations Coordinator and/or 1:1 Support Worker§§Advertiser: §St Chads Communication Centre Trust§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§22 Sept 2020§§Location§§Bay of Plenty§, §Rotorua§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Office Management§§§§§§St Chads Charitable Trust has a great reputation for supporting persons with a disability to live their good life. We currently have an opportunity that may be worked by one person or by two people in separate roles.§  §Operations Coordinator: 20+ hours per week. § This is a new role to support a growing organisation with future development options likely.  Responsibilities include Volunteer Coordinator, Health and Safety Coordinator, EA for Leadership Team, Rostering and more.  Previous Human Resources, Health and Safety, Finance and/or Management knowledge and experience an advantage.  The successful candidate will be organised and efficient, have above average computer/technology skills and be able to communicate effectively with a diverse range of people.  Proven experience delivering to deadlines is essential.§  §1:1 Support Worker: 15+ hours per week. § Support, encourage, teach and develop the people we support to enable them to achieve their goals and life aspirations. Personal confidence, great initiative and relationship building skills are vital as you will need to relate with a wide range of people and think on your feet.  Familiarity with disability equipment such as wheelchairs, hoists and providing personal cares, however full training will be provided to the successful candidate. A Level 4 qualification is preferable however the successful applicant will receive support to pursue study opportunities. Experience working in alignment with Enabling Good Lives principles is advantageous. Being flexible to meet the support needs of people outside of usual hours is sometimes required and being available for additional days/times as part of our casual team, is an advantage.§  §For both roles, a belief in the potential for people with disabilities, a full drivers licence, willingness to abide by a code of conduct, reliability and passing a police check are all necessary requirements of the role.§  §This role is based in Rotorua. §  §If you want to work with a great team and know you’re making a difference in the lives of others, please apply via the SEEK platform, clearly stating whether you are applying for both roles or only one, by Wednesday 7th October 2020.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§How would you rate your English language skills?§§§

jobText: TXT/50608014.txt	§Health Care Home Project Coordinator - 1 year fixed term§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Health Care Home Project Coordinator - 1 year fixed term§§Advertiser: §Western Bay of Plenty Primary Health Organisation§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§22 Sept 2020§§Location§§Bay of Plenty§, §Tauranga§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Administrative Assistants§§§§§§ § §WBOP PHO is a not-for-profit health care organisation focused on supporting and delivering community-based primary health care and wellness services to an enrolled population exceeding 197,000 people through 31 General Practices located in the Western Bay of Plenty and Whakatāne districts.§ §The Health Care Home (HCH) Model of Care is designed around a whānau-centric approach which enables primary care to deliver a better patient and staff experience, improved quality of care, and greater sustainability.  Consistent implementation of the HCH model in general practices nationally is important so that all patients enrolled in HCH practices can expect the same standard of service.§ §We have a one year fixed-term full-time opportunity to join our HCH project team, working with practices in the Western and Eastern Bay of Plenty as the Health Care Home Project Coordinator. Based in Tauranga and reporting to the HCH Project Lead, the successful applicant will have the following skills and attributes:§ § §a commitment to Māori health equity§ §able to show initiative and solution focussed § §task orientated with a can-do attitude§ §excellent planning and organisational skills§ §confident and effective communication ability§ §high proficiency in the Microsoft Office suite§ §a focus on quality and improvement with attention to detail§ §the ability to converse in Te Reo Māori would be highly desirable§ §a full NZ driver's licence§ §the ability to work unrestricted in NZ§ §Duties will include;§ § §Supporting the Project Lead to successfully deliver the objectives of the HCH project§ §Represent and deliver the equity focus and values of the project§ §Plan and undertake activities on special projects§ §Coordinate, collect and analyse data associated with the project§ §Prepare and review submissions and reports for different management groups§ §Manage IT platforms for sharing documents both internally and externally§ §To co-ordinate the key deliverables of the contract including meetings, visits, and events§ §Support project team meetings and other project related events on both local and national scales (e.g. agendas, minutes, recording, and managing actions raised)§ §Develop and deliver presentations§ §Process monthly HCH practice payments§ §If you have a passion for high quality and sustainable primary health care, this could be the role for you.§ §We are proudly a smoke-free workplace§ §Applicants must already be able to work unrestricted in New Zealand§ §Applications close Thursday 8th October§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have experience in an administration role?§Which of the following Microsoft Office products are you experienced with?§§§

As well as any other administrative duties as required.§ §This is a permanent contract and flexible hours may be possible for the right candidate.§ §Specific Duties:§ § §Providing administrative support to the Curtain Bank Manager and Installers.§ §Establish strong relationships with referral providers AWHI and Noho Ahuru for the Curtain Bank, including resolving any issues with referrals.§ reports, interventions, closing off cases) is inputted in a timely and concise manner.§ §Provide reception phone cover if required.§ §To act as an ambassador for Habitat for Humanity and to uphold the policies and procedures. § §Habitat Values§ § §Ensure our values are kept alive and all interactions are with these in mind. § §Do the right thing (Tika)§ §Respect (Manakitanga)§ §Unity (Kotahitanga)§ §Excellent written and verbal communication skills § §Good at juggling tasks and prioritising § §Organised with high attention to detail § §Experience or knowledge of Salesforce, our customer relationship management tool would be preferred but not essential, as training will be provided. § §Some prior knowledge / experience of the construction industry would be preferred but is not essential.§ §Willingness to learn and take on new challenges. § §Please submit your covering letter and CV before the 27th of October 2020.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have experience in an administration role?§Do you have customer service experience?§§§

As New Zealand’s largest recruitment agency, we’ve been connecting Kiwis for more than 20 years. jobTitle: Retail Coordinator Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50608641.txt	§Retail Coordinator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Retail Coordinator§§Advertiser: §Natural Sugars§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§22 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Administrative Assistants§§§§§§The Role:§  §Natural Sugars is a 100% New Zealand owned and operated company whose objective is to deliver quality products on time, every time.§  §As the Retail Coordinator you will be the first point of contact for Natural Sugars, servicing our customers by providing any required product information, processing orders/deliveries and assisting with any issues.  §  §Key Requirements:§ § §Provide outstanding customer service to improve customer satisfaction and relationships§ §Handle the processing of all orders with accuracy and timeliness§ §Monitor product order shipments to ensure on-time delivery to customers.§ §Alert customers of unforeseen delays or problems§ §Maintain a competent understanding of company’s products, their functions and alternatives§ §Coordinate, analyse and improve customer service functions to meet company goals§ §Handle incoming phone calls and greet guests into the office in a professional manner§ §Maintain and build strong relationships with our local providers and seek competitive rates§ §Assist with other areas within the Operations team as needed§ §Prepare retail presentations as required, including one page product info sheets for the sales team§ §Manage and coordinate retail promotions§ §Arrange couriers and order samples as required§ §Manage retail stock take of office stock§ §About You:§To be successful in this role you will be a highly customer focused individual with strong attention to detail and a willingness to get the job done.  You will need to display initiative alongside robust admin skills, excellent written and verbal communication skills together with strong time management. As a cornerstone of our business, you will able to build strong relationships both with the internal team and our customers.§  §Above all, we are looking for a passionate team player who has a “yes” attitude. The more proactive you are, the more successful the whole team will be.§§§§

jobTitle: Administration Support- Logistics Team Job in Gisborne - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50609090.txt	§Administration Support- Logistics Team§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Administration Support- Logistics Team§§Advertiser: §Pultron Composites Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§22 Sept 2020§§Location§§Gisborne§, §Gisborne§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Administrative Assistants§§§§§§Administration Support - Logistics Team§ §Based in Gisborne, we are a world class manufacturer of fibre-reinforced polymer products, with a second production facility in the Middle East and a third planned for the USA later this year.  Our growing business serves a diverse domestic and international customer base, across a broad range of industries.§ § § §We require an organised administrator, with experience of working in a busy & dynamic office.   This is a vital support role for logistics to ensure we continue to provide our customers with an excellent and rapid professional service. This is a full-time position, 8am to 5pm, Monday to Friday.§ § § §The successful applicant will be able to demonstrate:§ § §Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite especially Excel§ §Great attention to detail & accuracy, while juggling multiple tasks and conflicting priorities § §Excellent verbal, written, listening & interpersonal communication skills§ §Ability to thrive in an ever-changing innovative environment§ §Ownership and accountability for tasks and events§ §Ability to solve problems using own initiative§ §Commitment to meet deadlines§ § § §As part of our Logistics team you will be responsible for arranging freight, shipping documentation & the dispatch of Customer orders both domestic and export.  Experience with Accredo software & freight documentation would be an advantage but is not essential as training will be provided.    § §The ideal candidate will have experience in a similar role, be organized, meticulous, flexible and happy to provide team support.  Our culture embraces the Pitch in and Help ethos, as One-Team we are Stronger Together.§ §If you can legally work in New Zealand, are a warm friendly professional with common sense and a drive to become part of a global business experiencing high growth, we would love to meet you. § § § §To apply, email your CV and cover letter to recruitmentnz@pultron.com§ §Applications close:  Monday 12th October 2020§ § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have in the logistics, freight & delivery services industry?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§

jobTitle: Commercial Administrator (28 hrs/week) Job in Tasman - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50610487.txt	§Commercial Administrator (28 hrs/week)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Commercial Administrator (28 hrs/week)§§Advertiser: §FSL Foods§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§22 Sept 2020§§Location§§Tasman§, §Nelson§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Administrative Assistants§§§§§§FSL Foods is a family owned, Nelson based company with a passion for food. As a company, we pride ourselves on exceptional customer service, bringing true innovation to market and having a ‘one team’ culture. Competing in both grocery and foodservice, we have marketing leading brands that are loved by our consumers. Our major FMCG categories we compete in are frozen fruit & vegetables, flat breads and the Mexican category. In all these categories, we have delivered significant growth over the past few years and as a privately-owned company we are the makers of our own destiny. Looking forward, we are excited about our business outlook and the growth plans we have in place.§ §We are looking for a true go-getter to manage our customer orders and accounts. You will report into the Commercial Manager and will work across the accounting and sales functions. You will have a bubbly personality and will love to be part of an open office environment. You will be our main point of contact in our head office and will know how to make our customers feel valued. You will be an expert at managing our internal stakeholders and be able to make the right decisions for the business. You will have an eye for the detail but be agile enough to keep up with our fast-paced business. § §To be successful you will be able to demonstrate you have the following skills and qualities§ § §At least 2 years’ experience in a similar level role§ §A university degree or a relevant level of learning for the role§ §Outstanding people skills and a desire to be an integral part of a dynamic team§ §Has amazing attention to detail and but agile to move as fast as our customers§ §A moderate understanding of financial statements, computers & technology and the supply chain§ §We will reward you with a market related remuneration package, technology tools to do the role and the training & development to let you succeed. There is also future growth opportunities for the right person.§ §The role will be approx. 28 hours per week, spread across 5 days. Some flexibility will be possible.§ §If you think you are the person that we are looking for then please send a CV to us by email §tom@fslfoods.co.nz§ If you require additional information, then please call Tom O’Neill on §021654258§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Do you have experience in an administration role?§Which of the following Microsoft Office products are you experienced with?§Do you have experience in a data entry role?§How many years' experience do you have in an accounting role?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§

You will be responsible for providing high-level administration support to the Pathways team and you will love being the ‘go to person’ in the office.§Pathways§Transforming mental health and addictions through fostering strong, compassionate, self-supporting communities.§ §The Team§You’ll be reporting to the General Manager and joining our Pathways Midland team.§You§Are you a super organised people person? Do you love having your finger on the pulse and pride yourself on delivering outstanding results? If so, this could be the position for you! We’re looking for an innovative self-starter to join our team and help ensure the smooth running of our regional office. We encourage people with experience of mental illness to apply.§**All new appointees into Pathways require background checking. jobText: TXT/50613522.txt	§Executive Assistant§§Private Advertiser§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Executive Assistant§§Private Advertiser§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§22 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Manukau & East Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §PA, EA & Secretarial§§§§§§We are seeking an exceptional EA who enjoys being involved and at the forefront of significant work and projects while simultaneously anticipating and meeting the needs of our busy CEO and leadership team.  Every day will be a busy workday and you will enjoy a rapidly evolving workplace.   § §About us§ §We are a team of hard-working professionals who thrive on challenges, who are service/sales focused and are proud of our significant achievements.  We are stable and successful with a work environment that is fast paced and collaborative.§ §The role§ §You will actively manage the CEOs day and ensure it runs smoothly. This includes providing sound judgement and timeliness they can depend on, diary management, meeting and event management, internal and external communications. You’ll also be responsible for the management of the Auckland office to ensure that all administrative, financial and organisational tasks are completed in a timely manner. § §Your tasks will include§ § §Assist the CEO will their daily tasks.§ §All everyday business support and EA duties that helps the business to succeed.§ §Manage and maintain the schedule of the CEO § §Manage/coordinate project work.§ §Organization, planning and prioritization of work, tasks and meetings.§ §Support the Executive Management team § §About you§ § §Proven experience in a similar role providing varied support at an executive level§ §Intermediate to advanced Microsoft Office skill§ §A highly skilled problem solver with excellent planning and organisational skills§ §Empathetic and supportive § §Outstanding communication skills, spoken and written§ §An ability to build effective relationships with internal and external stakeholders§ §A high level of integrity and discretion§ §The ability to work autonomously as well as a strong team orientated approach and positive attitude to get the job done no matter how big or small§ §On offer§ §There is huge scope for development in this pivotal role and for you to make it your own!   You will work in a genuine and engaged team environment and with a solid executive team.  We are a stable and successful company. Highbrook Location§ §To apply§ §If you have the drive, brilliance and energy follow the appropriate links to apply providing your CV and covering letter.  We look forward to receiving your application!§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as an executive assistant?§Which of the following Microsoft Office products are you experienced with?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§

The Headmaster role is focused on developing and executing strategy. It ensures the school continues to innovate and provide pre-eminent educational, cultural, sporting and service opportunities through astute decision-making and strong relationship building.§  §About St Paul’s Collegiate School§  §Established in 1959 St Paul’s Collegiate School is a private Anglican secondary school offering a unique structure. Located in Hamilton the school has 750 students. Boys are welcomed from Years 9-13, Girls from Year 11-13, as day or boarding students. The senior school at St Paul’s offers co-ed learning while the junior school, Years 9 and 10, is a single-sex boys’ school.§  §The Candidate:§  §Candidates should be passionate secondary school educators with a strong track record of innovation and a commitment to excellence. Broad strategic, commercial and general management skills are essential as are well-honed communication and influencing abilities. An understanding of the uniqueness and responsibilities of outdoor education programmes and the importance of boarding is essential. Most importantly, the successful applicant will be able to articulate and demonstrate a commitment to St Paul’s Collegiate School mission as an Anglican institution: ‘Preparing students for life in the global environment by providing challenging educational experiences that realise their full potential through faith, virtue and excellence in performance.’§  §To apply in strict confidence now, click ‘Apply for this job’ or email your cover letter and CV to §cvakl@sheffield.co.nz§ quoting A7279sk. Applications close on 26 October 2020. Emails will be electronically acknowledged and further correspondence may be by email.§  §Please click here to view the § Position Description§.§  §For more information please phone Ian Taylor on +64 27 487 7424 or Raewyn Brown on +64 021 917 203.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50615689.txt	§Information Management Advisor - Fixed Term§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Information Management Advisor - Fixed Term§§Advertiser: §Environmental Protection Authority (EPA)§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§23 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Records Management & Document Control§§§§§§Make history with us§  §As New Zealand’s environmental regulator, the work we do today helps shape the future of Aotearoa.§  §The purpose of the Science and Strategy Group is to provide high-level strategic leadership and operational level advice to the Chief Executive and wider Executive on matters relating to science, strategy, information management and environmental issues. The group scans and researches emerging issues, trends and innovations that potentially impact the New Zealand environment or from a regulatory context.§  §The opportunity §  §We are seeking an experienced Information Management Advisor to join our small, friendly Information Management team. §  §This is a fixed term role based in our Wellington office. In this position you will be responsible for assisting the members of the IM team with records management and managing library resources and services, and as part of the Science and Strategy group.§  §What we can offer you§  §This is a full-time position based in our central city offices on Lambton Quay. The role provides plenty of variety, interesting and challenging opportunities, working with colleagues focused on making a difference.§  §Some of the benefits of working with us include on-site weekly Māori language lessons and regular workshops to develop staff understanding and appreciation of Te Ao Māori; talks on a variety of topics from fascinating external speakers; and a range of clubs and groups. §  §We also offer our staff extra leave on top of the standard legislative requirements.§  §About you§  §The successful candidate will have the following skills:§ § §A relevant tertiary quality in information management or be working towards one§ §Demonstrated experience in information management and records management, preferably in the public sector§ §Demonstrated experience in responding to information requests§ §Records management skills§ §Reference, inter-loan and cataloguing skills§ §Be familiar with Liberty and SharePoint§ §Be proficient in the MS Office suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook)§ §Strong verbal and written communication skills§ §Self-motivated with the ability to plan, prioritise and undertake your own work§ §A customer focused, can do attitude§ §Strong organisational skills and attention to detail.§ §How to apply§  §For a copy of the job description or further information, please contact Julia Holman, Recruitment Advisor §julia.holman@epz.govt.nz§  §Check out the careers section of our website for more information at www.epa.govt.nz§  §Applications close 5pm 7 October 2020§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§

perfect start for a rewarding career!§ §About our business§ §Our 100% NZ owned distribution company is growing rapidly!  Our environment is fast paced and collaborative.  As a team we are high performing, love having a good time, taking risks and achieving great outcomes.  We own it, we care, and we say it like it is!  Our close team of 200 winners are genuine, welcoming and professional. § and supply chain.§ §It is a fast paced, dynamic & fascinating world of merchandise, procurement, marketing, customer experience, sales and warehousing (and of course finance and HR) – everyday creates new opportunities and challenges.§ §Your initial and day to day role will be to provide business support to our brilliantly unique and energetic CEO and second to this you will support our General Managers of operations, sales, HR, merchandise, finance and marketing coordinating high level communications, weekly and offsite team meetings and all urgent and classified  business matters.  Your ability to use office programmes and technology will be exceptional.   You will be privy to everything that happens at the leadership table, so your confidentiality is very important.§ §As a graduate you will join an 18-month program designed to provide you with a holistic understanding of our business.  Initially you will complete 12 months of business support to our CEO and leadership team.  You’ll create strong relationships and develop a good understanding of our overall business while also developing commercial skills.  Following this, you will transition into a Marketing, Sales or jobTitle: Regional Coordinator - South Island Job in Canterbury - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50621532.txt	§Regional Coordinator - South Island§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Regional Coordinator - South Island§§Advertiser: §New Zealand National Party§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§23 Sept 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Administrative Assistants§§§§§§ §Diverse position covering customer service, communications, events, admin and stakeholder liaison§ §Fun, friendly and outgoing team§ §Part time, 32 hours per week§ §Since 1936, The National Party has had enthusiastic and active people working to support the Party's values and vision to build a better, stronger, more prosperous society where all New Zealanders can succeed.§ §We have an exciting part time position (32 hours per week) working as our Regional Coordinator for our Mainland electorates (South Island)§ §The political field is dynamic and ever-changing, and we are looking for someone who wants to join our team. This has recently been a ‘work from home' role based in Christchurch, however it may be that consideration is given to other areas, including being based from our Service Centre based in National House in Wellington. Travel to other areas of both the North Island and throughout New Zealand for meetings, conferences and other events will be required for this role.§ §You will be in the centre of the action, taking the lead on the relationship between our Service Centre (HQ) in Wellington and the regions. This is a core operational role that is pivotal to our Party, with responsibility for regional membership development, event management, stakeholder management, and election campaign readiness.§ §Key duties include, but are not limited to:§ § §Assisting electorates and branches in the regions to achieve their annual objectives and performance measures§ §Supporting local teams with event coordination§ §Working proactively and collaboratively on a wide range of campaign-related activities§ §Managing email communication between Party members, volunteers, MPs, and other Party employees§ §Supporting our leadership team with general admin​§ §Building capability and capacity within our local teams§ §​​§About you:§ §To be successful in this role, you will bring excellent administrative skills with top-notch organisational skills and a strong customer focus to match. As this is a hands-on role working with our extensive volunteer network, experience working within volunteer or membership-based organisations will put you in good stead. Due to the nature of the role, you will need to be flexible with your hours, including evening meetings and weekend events.§ §Additionally, you will bring:§ § §Good understanding of the New Zealand political landscape§ §A proactive, can-do attitude§ §Natural ability to engage and communicate with people from all walks of life§ §NZ driver's licence and vehicle§ §Commitment to the values and vision of the New Zealand National Party§ §The New Zealand National Party offers a fabulous place to work; we provide a fun, friendly and outgoing team environment and a workplace that people love being a part of.§ §To apply for this job go to: nznationalparty.recruitmenthub.co.nz§§§§

§Prosecutions Support Officer §      §        §Prosecutions Support Officer §        § §        §Auckland Central Police Station, Auckland District§        §Permanent, Full-time§        §Police Employee§        §Starter Salary: $50,633.00§        §JR 24041§        § §        §About the role§        §NZ Police are offering an opportunity to join the Police Prosecution Service (PPS) as a Prosecution Support Officer (PSO) based in Auckland City.§        §In your role you will provide administrative support to the PPS office, to enable its effective operation. §        §Responsibilities include: working with, processing, and administratively managing prosecution files, including recording and extracting relevant information, checking accuracy and completeness, administering necessary follow ups (including as directed by PPS staff), use and management of databases and spreadsheets, and responding to and/or directing queries that come into the PPS office. §        §Through building an excellent knowledge of Police and Ministry of Justice processes, data bases, and operating procedures you will be an important part of the Criminal Justice Sector.§        §Ultimately, if you want district and national office staff, and external stakeholders §          §Decision Making - Having the critical thinking and problem solving skills to make sound decisions, identify problems early and Striving to be the very best in all that we do, using Office Management, Justice Sector databases and process, and your knowledge of key New Zealand Statutes. §          §Individually Responsible and Accountable - Being accountable for your performance and taking responsibility for your contribution and development.§          §Enabling through self-leadership - Ability to seek opportunities to develop your own skills, knowledge and experience §  §        §        §Additional Information: §        §          §Applicants must be a NZ or Australian citizen, or a permanent NZ resident§          §Successful applicant is required to undergo Police Vetting and Reference Checks§          §Successful applicant must reside in Auckland§        §        § §        §What you'll bring§        §Being Our Core Competencies provide a shared understanding of the behaviours, leadership and technical competence required for success at each level of Police. Whilst we are looking for skills, knowledge and experience relevant to the role, we also place high importance on your state of mind, the alignment of your values with ours, your ability to contribute to and build high performing teams, and the way that you lead yourself or others.§        §This role is set at an Individual Contributor level: this means your key purpose is to deliver (or enable others to deliver) "Our Business".§        §We will ask you questions based on “How we will deliver Our Business – Core Competencies” and the appropriate role level, i.e. Individual Contributor. $49,999§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Contracts Administration§§§§§§GJ Gardner Homes Rodney West are looking for the next Contracts Administrator / Receptionist to join our team and provide that all important organisational support.§  §The role is fixed term for 9 months to cover the present incumbent whilst they are on maternity leave. §  §The role will provide plenty of variety and challenge on a daily basis with the opportunity to grow and learn in the home building industry.§  §Applicants will require the following skills:§ § §Passionate about delivering excellent customer service§ §Computer literate with Google docs, Microsoft, Word, Excel, etc§ §Comfortable with learning new systems and processes§ §Understand the importance of accuracy§ §Organised and proactive§ §Day to day tasks of the role are varied and include§ § §First point of contact at reception and phone calls§ §Support to the Sales Team and Co Directors§ §Preparation and presenting to new home build clients contract documents, build plans and submission to council for building consent.§ §Preparation of marketing and newsletter material§ §General office duties§ §Hours of the role are 9.00am to 5.00pm five days per week for a period of 9 months, subject to change.§  §If you  would like to join a progressive team committed to results and having fun along the way with opportunities to develop your knowledge, then forward your expressions of interest no later than 1st October 2020 to:§  §Rachael.lelean@gjgardner.co.nz§  §0274128917§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as a contracts administrator?§Do you have customer service experience?§How would you rate your English language skills?§§§

jobText: TXT/50624687.txt	§Administration Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Administration Manager§§Advertiser: §Madison Recruitment Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§24 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Salary§§NZD75000 per annum§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Office Management§§§§§§The purpose of this role is to co-ordinate key client liaision, general administration, health and safety administration, and accounting needs of the company and assist in the promotion and marketing of the company.§ The Administration Manager is expected to drive best practices in financial management, human resource management, H&S administration and lead the administrative management within the organisation to maximise efficiency and growth.§ §Key Responsibilities:§Work as a key person contact to resolve issues or disputes with clients, contractors and staff§Work with the Operations Administrator in Payroll Management to undertake the preparation of weekly payroll, obtain approval and process to bank.§Develop and manage human resources and H&S procedures with the management team§Working closely with the Directors, the role has significant input into:§Human Resources§H&S, risk management and compliance§Strategic planning§Web management§Marketing§Support Operations Supervisor and Team Leaders in relation to recruitment processes and human resource matters§Working with the Directors in the developing, documenting and implementation of quality systems and processes§Manage processes to record and reconcile expenses against income and provide regular management reporting including fortnightly P&L and Trial Balances§Work with the Assistant Manager to insure the following:§Creditors are paid as per their terms and conditions§Debtors invoicing is produced and checked against budget before submitting withing one week of job completion§Job contracts are signed by directors and emailed§Work with Operations and Admin staff to ensure SSSP documentation is recorded, forward and worked through with staff§Communication with clients and testing laboratories§Maintain the asset register§Work with the Directors to streamline job quotations§Work with the Director and Accountant to file tax and statutory returns§Other ad hoc duties§Competencies Required to be successful:§Previous administration management experience§Strong computer/technical skills§Microsoft Office, Xero and WorkflowMax§Adaptable and flexible approach§Manage workloads within timeframes and balancing conflicting priorities§Team player with a sense of humour!§Benefits:§Attractive Salary§Car Space§Great company culture§§§§

jobTitle: Personal Assistant to Partner Job in Hawkes Bay - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50624787.txt	§Personal Assistant to Partner§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Personal Assistant to Partner§§Advertiser: §Somerset Smith Partners§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§24 Sept 2020§§Location§§Hawkes Bay§, §Napier§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §PA, EA & Secretarial§§§§§§About Us§ § § §Somerset Smith Partners was founded in 1934 and provides specialist investment advisory services, financial planning, share-broking and wealth management including portfolio administration services. Our main office is located in the heart of Napier City and we have a branch office in Havelock North.§ § § §Your Role§ § § §The role fits within the team offering secretarial and support services to the Partners and Advisers.  This particular role assists one of the Partners of the Firm in maintaining positive relationships with clients.  This includes providing efficient, accurate and friendly client communications.  The role requires a high level of administration and secretarial support to the Partner involved, along with assistance with Reception duties.§ § § §You will be working in:§ § § §A friendly and supportive workplace environment§ §Recently renovated modern office§ §Located in Napier near shops, cafes and the sea§ § § §To succeed in this role you will need :§ § § §PA or secretarial experience§Proven experience and expert knowledge of Microsoft Office, in particular Word, Excel and Outlook is paramount§Proven interpersonal and communication skills with an excellent phone manner§Excellent organisation and planning skills with an ability to prioritise§Accuracy and impeccable attention to detail in all elements of work§To be a team player§ §I§f you believe that you have the skills and attributes required and are interested in joining our team then please apply by sending a cover letter outlining your suitability for the role and your CV to §viv@somsmith.co.nz§ §Please only apply if you have the legal right to work in New Zealand. § § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as a personal assistant?§Which of the following Microsoft Office products are you experienced with?§Do you have experience in an administration role?§Do you have customer service experience?§§§

jobTitle: Māori Impact Coordinator - ESR Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50625155.txt	§Māori Impact Coordinator - ESR§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Māori Impact Coordinator - ESR§§Advertiser: §ESR§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§24 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Porirua & Kapiti Coast§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Administrative Assistants§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Māori Impact Coordinator - ESR §      §        §Māori Impact Coordinator§        §He Pūtaiao He Tangata Māori Impact Team§        §ESR is a Crown Research Institute, working with and for clients and stakeholders to deliver enhanced scientific research services for the economic, environmental and social wellbeing of New Zealand. ESR has approximately 400 staff with sites across New Zealand.§        §We're undertaking an ambitious programme of transformation to achieve greater impact from our science and research; we are investing in deeper, more strategic research with Māori communities across the motu for better health and environmental outcomes. We have recently established the flagship Wai Programme, working in collaboration with iwi and to support this work we need a Coordinator to support our team and the delivery of this work.§        §Your new role§        §Reporting to the General Manager Māori Impact you will play an important role in providing Executive Assistant support to the GM, as well as administrative support to the wider Wai programme and He Pūtaiao He Tangata Māori Impact team.§        §You will be an important point of contact for the team, supporting logistics and arrangements for hui, wānanga, meetings and travel. In addition; you'll be able to draw on your previous experience in supporting projects to support the design and implementation of project management processes.§        §With a significant work programme ahead of the team, you'll be engaging broadly across the organisation and beyond and will be comfortable and confident juggling multiple priorities. You'll ensure systems and processes are in place to support the broader team and will provide an outstanding level of customer service to all your stakeholders.§        §To be successful in this role we need you to bring§        §          §An understanding of Te Ao Māori and the ability to engage effectively with tangata whenua; the ability to speak te reo Māori would be an advantage.§          §At least five years previous experience in a relevant administrative role.§          §Ideally; a relevant tertiary qualification§        §        §What you can expect from us§        §You will be part of a new team who are transforming research to strengthen communities and the environment through Mātauranga Māori and western knowledge systems and you'll contribute to making a positive difference in wellbeing as we engage with multiple iwi to support their environmental aspirations. You will also get to be part of a very unique institution that supports the wellbeing of the community and wider New Zealand.§        §ESR promotes active work/life policies including family-friendly initiatives and flexible hours. You'll receive ongoing personal development, free car parking as well as access to a Southern Cross group membership scheme.§        §To apply§        §We welcome the opportunity to speak with you about this opportunity; if you'd like more information please contact Jymal Morgan, General Manager Māori Impact on 021 872 590§        §Apply on line at https://www.careers.sciencenewzealand.org/esr/esr-jobs§        §Applications close on at midnight on 11 October 2020§        §Please note the successful applicant will be required to complete a pre-employment drug-screen and police records check as conditions of employment§      §      §      §    §  §§§Māori Impact Coordinator§He Pūtaiao He Tangata Māori Impact Team§ESR is a Crown Research Institute, working with and for clients and stakeholders to deliver enhanced scientific research services for the economic, environmental and social wellbeing of New Zealand. ESR has approximately 400 staff with sites across New Zealand.§We're undertaking an ambitious programme of transformation to achieve greater impact from our science and research; we are investing in deeper, more strategic research with Māori communities across the motu for better health and environmental outcomes. We have recently established the flagship Wai Programme, working in collaboration with iwi and to support this work we need a Coordinator to support our team and the delivery of this work.§Your new role§Reporting to the General Manager Māori Impact you will play an important role in providing Executive Assistant support to the GM, as well as administrative support to the wider Wai programme and He Pūtaiao He Tangata Māori Impact team.§You will be an important point of contact for the team, supporting logistics and arrangements for hui, wānanga, meetings and travel. In addition; you'll be able to draw on your previous experience in supporting projects to support the design and implementation of project management processes.§With a significant work programme ahead of the team, you'll be engaging broadly across the organisation and beyond and will be comfortable and confident juggling multiple priorities. You'll ensure systems and processes are in place to support the broader team and will provide an outstanding level of customer service to all your stakeholders.§To be successful in this role we need you to bring§An understanding of Te Ao Māori and the ability to engage effectively with tangata whenua; the ability to speak te reo Māori would be an advantage.§At least five years previous experience in a relevant administrative role.§Ideally; a relevant tertiary qualification§What you can expect from us§You will be part of a new team who are transforming research to strengthen communities and the environment through Mātauranga Māori and western knowledge systems and you'll contribute to making a positive difference in wellbeing as we engage with multiple iwi to support their environmental aspirations. You will also get to be part of a very unique institution that supports the wellbeing of the community and wider New Zealand.§ESR promotes active work/life policies including family-friendly initiatives and flexible hours. You'll receive ongoing personal development, free car parking as well as access to a Southern Cross group membership scheme.§To apply§We welcome the opportunity to speak with you about this opportunity; if you'd like more information please contact Jymal Morgan, General Manager Māori Impact on 021 872 590§Apply on line at https://www.careers.sciencenewzealand.org/esr/esr-jobs§Applications close on at midnight on 11 October 2020§Please note the successful applicant will be required to complete a pre-employment drug-screen and police records check as conditions of employment§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

Refresh","variation":{"index":0,"name":"Control"},"_links":{"conversion":{"href":"\u002Fexperiments\u002F7ECFDBF9-347F-476E-AD8E-8ED0A564D514\u002Fvariations\u002F0\u002Fparticipants\u002Feb07b1b4-927f-4946-8db9-c9186d3788f1\u002Fconversions"},"impression":{"href":"\u002Fexperiments\u002F7ECFDBF9-347F-476E-AD8E-8ED0A564D514\u002Fvariations\u002F0\u002Fparticipants\u002Feb07b1b4-927f-4946-8db9-c9186d3788f1\u002Fimpressions"}}}},"featureFlags":{"branchBannerPreview":false,"homepageBanners":undefined,"isBranchEnabledFlag":false,"retireDisplayAds":undefined,"showCareerAdvicePromo":false,"showInfoBanner":false,"isInUjmExperiment":true},"jobdetails":{"fraudReport":{},"jobPending":false,"result":{"id":50625535,"listingDate":"2020-09-24T04:32:03.000Z","expiryDate":"2020-10-24T12:59:59.000Z","title":"Administration Manager","teaser":"Be responsible for the day-to-day administration operations, and provide leadership and guidance to the administration team for Rotorua\u002FEBOP. ","advertiser":{"id":24665609,"description":"IHC","searchParams":{"keywords":"IHC"}},"locationHierarchy":{"nation":"New Zealand","state":"New Zealand","city":"Bay of Plenty","area":"Rotorua","suburb":""},"locationId":5089,"stateId":3108,"workType":"Full Time","classification":{"id":6251,"description":"Administration & Office Support"},"subClassification":{"id":6256,"description":"Office Management"},"salary":null,"salaryType":"AnnualPackage","automaticInclusion":false,"isLinkOut":true,"isScreenAssigned":false,"isSelectionCriteriaEnabled":false,"status":"Expired","isRightToWorkRequired":false,"hasRoleRequirements":false,"roleRequirements":[],"mobileAdTemplate":"\u003Cp\u003EAn exciting opportunity is available for an experienced \u003Cstrong\u003EAdministration Manager\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E to provide support, guidance, direction and leadership to the administration team to successfully deliver exceptional administration services to the IDEA Services Rotorua Branch.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\u003Cp\u003EReporting to the Area Manager, we are seeking someone who can demonstrate strong organisational skills and forward planning initiatives, excellent customer service, and the ability to build positive working relationships quickly in order to meet required outcomes.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\u003Cp\u003EWithin this hands-on role, you will be responsible for the day-to-day administration operations, including the involvement in payroll functions, reception duties, reporting, maintenance of operation manuals and office filing systems, appointment\u002Fcalendar maintenance, with a focus on promoting the Mission of the organisation.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\u003Cp\u003ELocated on Hinemoa Street in Rotorua, this position will be offered on a permanent full-time basis of 80 hours per fortnight working core business hours Monday - Friday.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003ERequirements\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\u003Cul\u003E\u003Cli\u003EExperience within an administration, and\u002For accounting position.\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\u003Cli\u003EPrevious leadership experience, and ability to motivate, support and guide others.\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\u003Cli\u003EAbility to solve problems and respond effectively under pressure.\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\u003Cli\u003EIntermediate (minimum) Microsoft Office suite knowledge.\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\u003Cli\u003EStrong verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills.\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\u003Cli\u003ECommitment to providing a positive customer service experience.\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\u003C\u002Ful\u003E\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EBenefits\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\u003Cul\u003E\u003Cli\u003EA collaborative and inclusive culture with a focus on our people's wellbeing.\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\u003Cli\u003EWarm and welcoming team environment with approachable and supportive management.\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\u003Cli\u003ECompetitive remuneration and employee benefits including attractive discounts with leading retailers\u002Ffitness centres, eyecare and insurance benefits.\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\u003Cli\u003EOngoing learning and development opportunities.\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\u003C\u002Ful\u003E\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EAbout IDEA Services\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\u003Cp\u003EIDEA Services supports adults of all ages with intellectual disabilities to live in their own homes and enjoy life as part of their communities. jobText: TXT/50626152.txt	§Personal Assistant§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Personal Assistant§§Advertiser: §NetYourJob§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§24 Sept 2020§§Location§§Otago§, §Queenstown & Wanaka§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §PA, EA & Secretarial§§§§§§Frankton, Part Time, Admin/Office§Please Quote Reference Number 77295§§Part time hours - 20-30 hours per week depending on applicant profile and exp.§Great team culture§Rare local opportunity to progress your career in marketing and administration§Bayleys prides itself in delivering excellent customer service. Our Sales Consultants and the incredible administrative team behind them work hard every day and innovate to be at the forefront of the industry. By joining Bayleys, you are joining an extended family where successes are celebrated, work wellness is key and hard work rewarded. If you want to be part of this exceptional team, then read on.§We are looking for a Personal Assistant to support one of our top achieving Sales Consultants.§Duties will include ensuring Bayleys standards are maintained at all times, ensuring all advertisements and marketing collateral are created, proofed and ready within deadlines, creating relevant documents including submissions and Sale and Purchase Agreements, and social media management. §Working as part of a high performing team, your communication skills, time management and organisational skills are second to none. Your can-do attitude and willingness to learn and support your agent along with your exceptional attention to details and ability to multi-task and prioritize, are what make you stand out. §You will be highly confident using the MS Office Suite, and experience with creating and manipulating digital creative content would be valuable.§It is essential that you are highly confident and proactive with a can-do attitude and growth mindset. You will take great pride in your personal presentation and standards.§In return for your dedication and a committed work ethic we offer a competitive salary and an outstanding team culture with lots of projects on the horizon.§Due to the high level of applications, only those we wish to interview will be contacted.§Applications will be reviewed as they are received.§To Apply§: §Email your CV to §serena.mars@bayleys.co.nz§ or apply through the online application form.§All applications will be dealt with in the strictest confidence. Only those with the right to work in New Zealand will be considered.§§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years experience do you have in Office Administration?§How would you rate your computer skills on a scale of 1-10?§What is your hourly rate expectation for this role?§Do you have previous experience within the Real Estate industry?§Where are you currently living?§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50627256.txt	§Helpdesk Coordinator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Helpdesk Coordinator§§Advertiser: §Colliers International§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§24 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Administrative Assistants§§§§§§ § §Company Description§ §Colliers International is a global property services company operating across 68 countries. We have a workforce of more than 17,000 professionals who think differently, share great ideas and provide service excellence to their clients. § § § §Job Description§ §We have a great opportunity for a Helpdesk Coordinator to join the Corporate Solutions team in our Wellington CBD office. We are looking for a confident professional with administrative experience to take ownership of the Facilities Management Helpdesk.§ §Please note that this is an administrative support role, not an IT service desk role.§ §This role is §20 hours per week§, preferably Monday - Friday 3pm - 7pm, or to be agreed with the successful candidate.§ §Responsibilities§ § §Assist with enquiries and fault requests via phone, email, and system generated requests§ §Provide a high level of personalised and professional customer service§ §Liaise with Facilities Managers and contractors§ §Maintain the Facilities Management database§ §Support the Operations Manager and wider team as required§ § § §Qualifications§ § §Strong written and verbal communication skills§ §Strong organisational and priority management skills§ §Strong attention to detail and accuracy§ §The ability to cope under pressure§ §Team player§ §Proactive and flexible§ §Intermediate to advanced Microsoft Office skills§ §Willingness to learn and master our property-based system§ § § §Additional Information§ §Our enterprising culture empowers our people to do their best work, collaborating with our global experts to maximise every opportunity and lead the industry. For you, this means a world of opportunity and the platform to learn, grow and succeed.§§§§

Therefore the successful candidate will have to be comfortable multitasking and achieve the tasks proactively. §Job Overview and benefits. §Reporting to:§ Director and owner of the company.§Salary:§ Ordinary Time: $25.5 / hour§Work Hours:§ Full time position. Minimum 40h, can go up to 50h / week.§Day of work: §from Monday to Friday. §Hours of Work (Weather depending):§ 7am-5:30pm. §Candidates must be available at the office from 7am for daily briefing on tasks for and from the director and available after 5pm for 30mins for a debriefing.§Candidate must be reachable anytime on normal hours of work and outside of regular hours, in case of emergency. §Location:§ Office in Newtown. Small travels around Wellington region due to the activity, using thecompany’s vehicles. §The Successful Candidate will be able to show the following skills and experience:§Previous experience as a Team Administrator/Personal Assistant.§Landscaping and gardening experience. Comfortable driving utes with trailer, as well as backing trailer and ute into required parking spaces.§Advanced skills in Microsoft Office. Microsoft Access is mandatory.§Efficient communication skills, in order build network of strong working relationships both internally and externally §Strong ability to diary manage, take minutes and complete general administrative tasks.§Outstanding attention to detail §Proactively coordinate Site Visits, booking jobs, travels§Liaise with clients and stakeholders and deal proactively with incoming correspondence §Exercise confidentiality, discretion, and personal sensitivity§Marketing experience would be an advantage but not essentia§l§Strong ability to diary manage, take minutes and complete general administrative tasks.§Invoicing and accounting skills and systems administration experience.§§§§
