jobText: TXT/50628673.txt	§FM Contracts Coordinator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§FM Contracts Coordinator§§Advertiser: §DOWNER NZ§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§24 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Manukau & East Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Administrative Assistants§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §FM Contracts Coordinator §      §        §Downer New Zealand has a proud history that can be traced back to 1870, and today we are NZ’s leading provider of integrated services.  Our commitment is building long-term relationships and supporting our customers with high calibre services and solutions.  The key to our success is our people who, on a day-to-day basis, they stand and deliver the company's core values of Excellence, Courage, Collaboration & Integrity across a diverse landscape of markets. We are proud of what we do, and that we support the well-being of the communities we work, live and play in§.§ §        §About the role:§        §We currently have an opportunity for an experienced Property/Facilities Management (FM) Administrator who is looking for the next step in their career to join our National Property team based in our Wiri offices.   §        §You will have some understanding commercial property management but importantly you will have strong administration and accounting skills, enjoy project work and have excellent written and verbal communication skills. You will be a team player, have high levels of attention to detail and most of all enjoy being busy! Administration responsibilities include:§        §          §Ensure invoices are processed accurately and paid in a timely manner§          §Work with the Property Team to ensure the accuracy and completeness of the leases database§          §Ensure compliance with internal/external policies and procedures§          §Develop relationships with depot coordinators so they know you are their first point of contact for any questions regarding leasing or facilities services§          §Work with our national call centre to ensure they are sending the right subcontractors to any job§          §Provide support to the National Property Manager and National Finance team§          §Reviewing and preparing documents and correspondence§          §Collaborating with other teams (internal and external) to ensure the smooth day to day property operations and development§        §        §What we offer:§ §        §This is an outstanding opportunity to work in our diverse business. The environment is challenging and rewarding. We offer the opportunity to join our diverse and inclusive culture, and be part of a great team working in a collaborative environment. We offer a competitive remuneration package, flexible working arrangements, and our focus for our people is training and development, so this gives excellent opportunities to enhance your skills and advance your career.   §        §If this sounds like the opportunity for you, head to §www.downercareers.co.nz§ and enter reference number 573351 to apply. §   §        §Downer NZ is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating a diverse and inclusive culture. §        §Our workplaces are drug and alcohol free - all successful applicants will be required to undertake a Pre-Employment drug test and medical.  §        §Due to the fast-paced nature of Downer, our vacancy close dates may be subject to change, so don't delay and make sure you apply as soon as possible.§ §        §Please note we have an in-house recruitment team that manage all our vacancies. No candidates presented through an agency will be considered for any of our roles advertised, unless previously arranged. We would strongly encourage all candidates interested in these roles, to apply directly online through the portal provided otherwise your application will not be considered.§      §      §      §    §    §www.downer.co.nz§  §§§Downer New Zealand has a proud history that can be traced back to 1870, and today we are NZ’s leading provider of integrated services.  Our commitment is building long-term relationships and supporting our customers with high calibre services and solutions.  The key to our success is our people who, on a day-to-day basis, they stand and deliver the company's core values of Excellence, Courage, Collaboration & Integrity across a diverse landscape of markets. We are proud of what we do, and that we support the well-being of the communities we work, live and play in§.§ §About the role:§We currently have an opportunity for an experienced Property/Facilities Management (FM) Administrator who is looking for the next step in their career to join our National Property team based in our Wiri offices.   §You will have some understanding commercial property management but importantly you will have strong administration and accounting skills, enjoy project work and have excellent written and verbal communication skills. You will be a team player, have high levels of attention to detail and most of all enjoy being busy! Administration responsibilities include:§§Ensure invoices are processed accurately and paid in a timely manner§Work with the Property Team to ensure the accuracy and completeness of the leases database§Ensure compliance with internal/external policies and procedures§Develop relationships with depot coordinators so they know you are their first point of contact for any questions regarding leasing or facilities services§Work with our national call centre to ensure they are sending the right subcontractors to any job§Provide support to the National Property Manager and National Finance team§Reviewing and preparing documents and correspondence§Collaborating with other teams (internal and external) to ensure the smooth day to day property operations and development§§What we offer:§ §This is an outstanding opportunity to work in our diverse business. The environment is challenging and rewarding. We offer the opportunity to join our diverse and inclusive culture, and be part of a great team working in a collaborative environment. We offer a competitive remuneration package, flexible working arrangements, and our focus for our people is training and development, so this gives excellent opportunities to enhance your skills and advance your career.   §If this sounds like the opportunity for you, head to §www.downercareers.co.nz§ and enter reference number 573351 to apply. §   §Downer NZ is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating a diverse and inclusive culture. §Our workplaces are drug and alcohol free - all successful applicants will be required to undertake a Pre-Employment drug test and medical.  §Due to the fast-paced nature of Downer, our vacancy close dates may be subject to change, so don't delay and make sure you apply as soon as possible.§ §Please note we have an in-house recruitment team that manage all our vacancies. No candidates presented through an agency will be considered for any of our roles advertised, unless previously arranged. We would strongly encourage all candidates interested in these roles, to apply directly online through the portal provided otherwise your application will not be considered.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50628725.txt	§Team Coordinator Monitoring and Inspection§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Team Coordinator Monitoring and Inspection§§Advertiser: §CAA/Avsec§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§24 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Other§§§§§§§§§  §    §Team Coordinator Monitoring and Inspection §    §      §Company description:§        §If you’ve ever been to an airport in New Zealand you may have met some of our team but you may not know who we are.§        §There are two parts to our business – the regulatory arm (Civil Aviation Authority), which is responsible for the safety oversight of the civil aviation system, and the security arm (Aviation Security Service) who you would have met if you’ve travelled by plane in New Zealand. We’re a Crown entity and we’re responsible for the safety and security of New Zealand’s civil aviation system.§Job description:§        § §Would you like to be apart of Monitoring and Inspection unit?§        §          §Wellington Based Role §          §Across from the Wellington Train Station §        §        §The Team Coordinator role will provide administrative and coordinator support to the new Monitoring and Inspection Unit. This role will work closely with the Inspectors and Technical Support to provide support to the day to day functioning of the unit which includes; reviewing and updating the unit’s work schedule, liaising with aviation participants and stakeholders around requests and enquires, completing quality checks of work and addressing documentation issues, and seeking opportunities to improve the unit’s systems and processes.§        §We are looking for an experienced administrator who has worked in an administrative or support-based role in a large organisation. A sound understanding of the regulatory environment of the NZ civil aviation system would be advantageous along with the ability to plan, prioritise and organise work efficiently and effectively to deliver results in a fast-paced and changing environment. Someone who is highly motivated, has excellent interpersonal skills and is a great problem solver would fit in well here.§        §Please take a look at the §Position Description §(or please copy and paste this link; §https://www.aviation.govt.nz/assets/careers/Job-Descriptions/Team-Coordinator-Monitoring-and-Inspection-PD-July-2020-v3.pdf?vid=3)§ for this role to find out if you have the relevant skills and experience, and apply now! §        §Applications close Sunday 11 October 2020. §        §Due to Covid19 we are not accepting applications from overseas. §      §      §      §    §    §  §§§Company description:§If you’ve ever been to an airport in New Zealand you may have met some of our team but you may not know who we are.§There are two parts to our business – the regulatory arm (Civil Aviation Authority), which is responsible for the safety oversight of the civil aviation system, and the security arm (Aviation Security Service) who you would have met if you’ve travelled by plane in New Zealand. We’re a Crown entity and we’re responsible for the safety and security of New Zealand’s civil aviation system.§Job description:§ §Would you like to be apart of Monitoring and Inspection unit?§ §Wellington Based Role § §Across from the Wellington Train Station § §The Team Coordinator role will provide administrative and coordinator support to the new Monitoring and Inspection Unit. This role will work closely with the Inspectors and Technical Support to provide support to the day to day functioning of the unit which includes; reviewing and updating the unit’s work schedule, liaising with aviation participants and stakeholders around requests and enquires, completing quality checks of work and addressing documentation issues, and seeking opportunities to improve the unit’s systems and processes.§We are looking for an experienced administrator who has worked in an administrative or support-based role in a large organisation. A sound understanding of the regulatory environment of the NZ civil aviation system would be advantageous along with the ability to plan, prioritise and organise work efficiently and effectively to deliver results in a fast-paced and changing environment. Someone who is highly motivated, has excellent interpersonal skills and is a great problem solver would fit in well here.§Please take a look at the §Position Description §(or please copy and paste this link; §https://www.aviation.govt.nz/assets/careers/Job-Descriptions/Team-Coordinator-Monitoring-and-Inspection-PD-July-2020-v3.pdf?vid=3)§ for this role to find out if you have the relevant skills and experience, and apply now! §Applications close Sunday 11 October 2020. §Due to Covid19 we are not accepting applications from overseas. §§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Office Administrators Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50628972.txt	§Office Administrators§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Office Administrators§§Advertiser: §SOLGM§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§24 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Administrative Assistants§§§§§§We are looking for two amazing administrators to join our Wellington based team. Due to our expanding work programmes we are reshaping our organisation which includes the creation of two new administration roles.§  §If you would you like to work for an organisation that prides itself on being relevant and responsive, then one of these roles could be for you:§ § §Membership and Events Administrator§ §Accounts and Systems Administrator§ §Who are we?§  §SOLGM is the national membership organisation for local government professionals. Our purpose is to promote and support professional management in local government.§  §We focus on providing professional leadership, promoting innovation and excellence in management practice, and developing local government capability to enhance service delivery to our local communities, throughout NZ§  §We are small team, but we punch well above our weight!§  §www.solgm.org.nz §  §What are the roles?§  §As one of our Office Administrators, you will play a vital part in providing a customer focused administrative service to both internal and external stakeholders. These are roles that involve a mix of administration and customer service, providing you with variety, challenge, and responsibility. §  §The Membership and Events Administrator will be responsible for administering our membership and stakeholder database, carrying out membership administration, and providing customer support for participants enrolling in our training programmes and events. §  §The Accounts and Systems Administrator will be responsible for the day to day processing within our accounting system, and for administering our LG TXT board, discussion group platform, as well as providing customer support for users of these systems.§  §In either role you will be responding to customers over the phone, via email and in person, supporting the wider team with delivering excellent all-round customer service.§  §About you§You will:§ § §be a methodical process-orientated person with fantastic communication skills. § §have excellent attention to detail§ §have a strong customer service focus§ §be flexible in your approach to your work with a ‘can-do’ attitude.§ §A sound working knowledge of Microsoft Office is required, and familiarity with IT Systems, and CRM membership databases would be an advantage.§  §These roles are a great opportunity for someone looking to further their administration experience in an established organisation.§  §How to apply§  §If you are interested in working for us, we encourage you to apply below.  Please submit your CV, along with a short cover letter telling us why you would love to work with us, and how your skills, knowledge and experience fit the role you’re applying for  §  §For any enquiries, or any questions about either role please email vacancy@solgm.org.nz §  §Applications close Sunday 11th October 2020.§  §Please note that eligibility to work in New Zealand is mandatory, and due to current boarder conditions, we will not be accepting overseas applicants at this time.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have experience in an administration role?§Which of the following Microsoft Office products are you experienced with?§Do you have customer service experience?§Do you have experience using Xero?§§§

jobTitle: Administration Officer Job in Canterbury - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50629393.txt	§Administration Officer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Administration Officer§§Advertiser: §New Zealand Police§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§24 Sept 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Other§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Administration Officer §      §        §Integrated Safety support, it starts with you! §        §        §          §Fixed term 9 months§          §Part time (15hrs weekly)§          §From $50,633 Negotiable §        §        §        §        §About the role§        §        §The Integrated Safety Response team part of a government multiagency response to Family Violence. You will be part of a small team whose role is to support multi-agency collaboration and working.  As an Administration Officer your role will support the Integrated Safety Response team to run effectively with ensuring administration of applications for funding, assisting reception and general administration duties such as printing documents and making up packs. §        §        §Key Accountabilities:§        §•           Administration of Flexi-Fund Applications§        §•           Assisting with Reception §        §•           Typing of meeting minutes§        §•           Printing documents§        §•           Making up information packs§        §•           Booking flights and accommodation§        §•           Booking venues and ordering catering§        §•           Maintain records and database for core team documents§        §        §What you'll bring§        §Being part of the Police whānau is about being our best to ensure our communities are safe and feel safe. Our Core Competencies provide a shared understanding of the behaviours, leadership and technical competence required for success at each level of Police. Whilst we are looking for skills, knowledge and experience relevant to the role, we also place high importance on your state of mind, the alignment of your values with ours, your ability to contribute to and build high performing teams, and the way that you lead yourself or others. §        § §        §        §In order to be successful in this role you will bring high levels of integrity, have excellent interpersonal and communication skills. You will be a self-initiator who is solution focused.§        § §        §        §As the successful applicant you will demonstrate high levels of resilience, as you will be working in an environment which deals with sensitive and distressing information. jobTitle: Operations Manager - Property Services Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50629625.txt	§Operations Manager - Property Services§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Operations Manager - Property Services§§Advertiser: §Hunter Campbell Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§24 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Office Management§§§§§§§§§  §    §      §      §        §Operations Manager - Property Services §        §Goodman Group§ With operations in 17 countries, Goodman is a global property group. They own, develop and manage industrial real estate assets, with assets under management of $51.6B. The portfolio consists of high-quality properties in key locations, with dedicated local teams who manage all aspects of property, asset and investment management. Goodman’s investors include sovereign wealth, pension and large multi-manager funds. In New Zealand, Goodman manages the NZX listed Goodman Property Trust with a portfolio of $3.1bn§   § Goodman is known as an employer of choice, attracting and retaining high calibre employees. These employees are central to Goodman’s success, ensuring customers and investors receive high quality service, as well as innovative property and investment solutions.§   § §The Opportunity§ The Operations Manager is a new position, due to the continued growth of the Goodman business. Reporting through to the Director – Investment Management, you will have overall responsibility for the systems and processes for the Property Services team, ensuring reporting is accurate and concise.§   § Key responsibilities include:§          §            §Management and enhancement of Goodman’s property management systems§            §Act as the lead for review, improvement, and implementation of systems§            §Oversee and manage administrative responsibilities for Property Services§            §Work to continuously improve Goodman’s management of its contractor base§            §Reporting on capital and operational expenditure on the stabilised portfolio§            §Reviewing processes and procedures, and presenting best practice solutions across the group§            §Asset register management§            §Proactive identification and improvement of processes and procedures for Property Services§          §   § §Your Profile§ Goodman is known for hiring exceptional talent, with an abundance of professional development opportunities through additional responsibilities and formal training. We are targeting a proven Operations Manager, with a track record within a professional services or corporate environment. Experience within the property sector is not required, however familiarity with property will be viewed favourably. Due to the breadth of systems at Goodman, significant experience with managing and improving systems is imperative. Experience with procurement, contractor management, and facilities management are all viewed as highly desirable.§   § You will be comfortable working across a broad base of internal stakeholders and managing projects through to a successful outcome. You will show initiative, be proactive in your approach, excel at building relationships, and be driven to be your best. § §   § §On Offer§ A seat in a global powerhouse, with a proven track record of developing and promoting employees both locally and internationally. In addition, a globally recognised brand, exceptional leadership team, and a position in the fast-paced property industry.§ If the above sounds like you, please submit your CV by following the link below. We welcome diversity, in all its forms, in fact we consider it a strength.§        §Join us and become part of a Community where your skills, experiences and ideas are valued and you're encouraged to be curious, to share your ideas and of course, have fun along the way.§        §If you're up for the challenge, become §Beyond Ordinary§ with us.§        §Our Programme Delivery Team delivers business and capability development while ensuring our investment in technology and other capabilities is prioritised to deliver successful outcomes for our community. We are always looking for new perspectives, fresh ideas and innovative ways of doing things.§        §This is an exciting opportunity for someone with experience in project or team coordination to join the team, providing high quality project support coordination.§        §In this role you will use your excellent organisational skills and be the glue that holds complex pieces of work together. You won't stand still with us as we're committed to ongoing learning and continuous improvement. We're also committed to your wellbeing. We want our people to be the best they can be, both at work and at home. We offer our people comprehensive benefits, access to staff networking groups, flexible working and great work-life balance.§        §If you want to love coming to work each day, let us help you become §Beyond Ordinary§.§        §Applications close on Sunday 11 October 2020.§        §To be eligible for employment within the NZIC you must have been a NZ citizen for at least 10 years. Ordinarily to obtain this level of clearance candidates must have a 15 year checkable background in countries where meaningful and reliable checks can be undertaken. jobTitle: Personal Assistant Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50631495.txt	§Personal Assistant§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Personal Assistant§§Advertiser: §Environmental Protection Authority (EPA)§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§25 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §PA, EA & Secretarial§§§§§§Are you the sort of person who can pay attention to small details, while never losing sight of the bigger picture? We’re looking for a Personal Assistant to provide high-quality administration support to the EPA’s General Manager CME and the wider CME team.§  §Make history with us§  §As New Zealand’s environmental regulator, the work we do today helps shape the future of Aotearoa.§  §The Compliance, Monitoring and Enforcement (CME) group helps everyone - from small businesses to big organisations – understanding and comply with environmental regulations to help protect communities, the environment and people. The CME group’s functions underpin the overall strategic direction and goals of the EPA - protecting people and the environment, delivering the right decisions and strengthening trust in the EPA.§  §As part of recent changes made within the CME group we are looking for a range of passionate and forward thinking professionals to join us on to move to a more cohesively-aligned, strengthened, and active CME Group.§  §The opportunity §  §We are looking for a highly-organised individual with strong attention to detail, who can hit the ground running. This is a busy role that would best suit a dynamic individual, with multi-tasking skills that has knowledge of (or experience in) work as a Personal Assistant or Executive Assistant. You will be working to support the General Manager CME and their leadership team by providing administrative and logistical services, documentation control and financial administrative services.§  §The role would suit someone who has an interest in compliance, monitoring and enforcement and/or the environmental regulation with a willingness to develop research skills relevant to the EPA’s core activities, and a flexible, can do attitude.§  §What we can offer you§  §This is a permanent full-time position based in our central city offices on Lambton Quay. The role provides plenty of variety, interesting and challenging opportunities, working with colleagues focused on making a difference.§  §Some of the benefits of working with us include on-site weekly Māori language lessons and regular workshops to develop staff understanding and appreciation of Te Ao Māori; talks on a variety of topics from fascinating external speakers; and a range of clubs and groups, from gardening to adventure running, that cater to the diverse interests of our staff.§  §We also offer our staff extra leave on top of the standard legislative requirements.§  §About you§  §The successful applicant will be focused on delivering exceptional internal customer service and always able to lend a hand where necessary. We are looking for someone who:§ § §has knowledge/experience in providing a range of administration and support services§ §is discreet and tactful when dealing with confidential, commercially sensitive and personal work related information§ §is exceptionally well organised with a strong ability to plan effectively and manage busy workflows in a timely manner§ §has developed interpersonal, oral and written communication skills§ §has a strong ability to build and maintain effective working relationships§ §is proactive, flexible, has great attention to detail and is willing to go the extra mile§ §has advanced knowledge of MS Suite (Word, PowerPoint, Excel and Outlook)§ §has an active interest in the work that the team is doing and an interest in continuous improvement and develop to aid in the CME programs of work.§ §How to apply§  §For a copy of the job description please contact Julia Holman, Recruitment Advisor §julia.holman@epa.govt.nz§  §Check out the careers section of our website for more information at www.epa.govt.nz§  §Applications close 5pm 9 October 2020§  § §§§§

jobTitle: Office Manager Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50632238.txt	§Office Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Office Manager§§Advertiser: §Soundtech 2018 Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§25 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Office Management§§§§§§Job Description – Office Manager §Soundtech is an Audio and Visual contractor located at Parliament. Our focus is Monitoring, Maintenance and Events that are held on precinct. §The ideal candidate will fit into a fast paced and ever changing work environment so being flexible is vital. §The position will start at 20 hours per week with the opportunity for hours to be increased.§Duties include general administration, accounting and financial reporting work as needed for Soundtech in consultation with the Director, Operations Manager and staff including:§Accounting and Xero Accounting§Invoicing through Xero. Reconciling Bills§Paying Bills through Xero§Daily Reconciliation of Xero payments and receipts§Weekly monitoring of Xero bills payable, receivables and Quotes for follow-up§Monthly reconciliation of GST using Xero, Payment of GST to IRD within correct timeframes§Daily/weekly - arranging and setting payments/automatic payments through Bank Account according to timeframes§Daily Events Log recording for monthly invoicing §Daily monitoring and managing Maintenance Log §Monthly invoicing estimates to clients §Daily/weekly recording and managing cash incomings and outgoings/cashflow forecasting for business planning purposes§Preparing financial breakdowns and reporting as required§Xero Payroll Management and Payment of PAYE/ Employer Deductions (DEDS)§Setting up/checking automatic payments for wages§Daily/weekly Timesheet checking for fortnightly Xero payroll§Reconciliations and Xero Payroll administration for correct Staff payments and PAYE§Assisting with staff contracts, on-boarding staff, staff terminations, Tracking Leave, Sick leave and Bereavement leave, Tax Rates, Kiwisaver and Leave Liability§Lump sum/bonus payments, Leave, Holiday Pay, relevant employer legislation and guides and how to apply these§Filing of Fortnightly payroll with IRD within correct timeframes §Daily Email Management, Administration and Calendar Scheduling §Processing, answering emails for Events and Maintenance/Projects§Scheduling upcoming events in team calendar§Cross referencing approval letters and online bookings§Event client liaison/emails and phone calls to ensure smooth cohesive events§ § § § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§How many years' experience do you have as an office manager?§Which of the following Microsoft Office products are you experienced with?§Do you have experience using Xero?§Do you have customer service experience?§How many years of payroll experience do you have?§§§

jobTitle: Admin and Sales Support Person Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50632261.txt	§Admin and Sales Support Person§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Admin and Sales Support Person§§Advertiser: §People Passion§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§25 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Papakura & Franklin§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Client & Sales Administration§§§§§§Are you looking for a varied and rewarding role closer to home? Look no further!§ §A rare opportunity has arisen with our client, to join their team as a savvy Admin and Sales Support person now! Based in Karaka, this is an exciting opportunity to join the professional and fun team at Harcourts, who are innovative leaders in the Real Estate industry.§ §In this varied role, you will be responsible for managing all day to day real estate administration, with an emphasis on leading the marketing and social media side of the business. Experience running websites, or exposure to graphic design or advertising in a previous role would be preferred in order to hit the ground running. We need someone who is professional, well presented, and with a great sense of humour in order to fit in with their small and dynamic team.§ §About you§ §Ideally, you will have worked in a similar role in the past, with a knowledge of the Real Estate Industry preferred but not essential. Most importantly you will:§ § §Have excellent communication skills, both written and verbal with a great phone manner§ §Be professional, bubbly, enthusiastic and approachable§ §Be proficient with Microsoft Office Products at an intermediate-advanced level§ §Have high attention to detail and organisation and able to juggle a varied workload§ §Have the ability to use initiative and be self-motivated§ §Be reliable, honest and punctual§ §Be flexible, happy to adapt to different situations§ §Be a quick learner and IT savvy, with the ability to adapt to new systems quickly§ §Be willing to lend a hand and go the extra mile for the team and clients§ §Able to maintain accuracy and great customer service under pressure§ §This role is full-time, working between the hours of 9am-5pm, Monday to Friday, however if you are looking for fewer hours, we are willing to be flexible for the right candidate. You will also need a valid NZ driver’s license as you may be required to travel to our Papakura branch from time to time to cover for absences.§ §What’s in it for you?§ §We offer flexibility and a fun working environment where you will genuinely enjoy coming to work every day. If you’re ticking all the boxes, we want to hear from you! Apply online now, or for a confidential chat, give our HR partner, People Passion a call on 0800 HR FORU.§§§§

jobTitle: Receptionist Job in Otago - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50632280.txt	§Receptionist§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Receptionist§§Advertiser: §Deloitte - NZ§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§25 Sept 2020§§Location§§Otago§, §Dunedin§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Receptionists§§§§§§We are looking for an experienced part-time Receptionist to take charge of our main client reception in Dunedin. § §*Please note to be eligible for this opportunity, you’ll be based in New Zealand and hold a valid Work Visa that allows you to be employed in New Zealand*§ §What will your typical day look like?§ §As the face of our Dunedin office, you will be on the front line of our business, responsible for creating a welcoming and professional first impression for our guests, clients and visiting staff.§ §There is also further potential for you to support the business in additional ways as the opportunity arises, developing further skills along the way.§ §About the team§ §The Deloitte Dunedin office brings together around 80 staff, mainly accountants across our Tax & Private and Assurance & Advisory service lines, as well as Consultants.  We are a team of high-energy professionals who strive for the highest level of service for our clients, while also enjoying a social and supportive working environment.  § §Enough about us, let’s talk about you§ §With a professional yet personable character and experience in a sole charge role, you will be confident, and client focused with the ability to communicate at all levels. § §You are someone with:§ § §A positive attitude with excellent communications skills§ §Microsoft Word, PowerPoint, Excel and Outlook experience§ §Diary Management§ §Ability to work efficiently and accurately§ §Ability to multi-task and adapt to unexpected situations§ §An outgoing personality – comfortable dealing with senior business people§ §A customer-centric approach § §The successful candidate will be joining a business of passionate and driven professionals. As part of our dynamic team, you will use your own passion for people as well as your proactive attitude to provide a warm and welcoming environment for our clients and guests and provide an exceptional standard of customer service to both internal and external people. § §Next Steps§ §Sound like the sort of role for you? Apply now.§ §If you’ve got any questions or wish to have a confidential conversation about this role, contact Kate Park from the Talent Acquisition team at §09 303 0792§. We’d love to hear from you!§ §Deloitte is an equal opportunity employer (EOE) and we are committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values diversity and inclusion. Knowing that people work best in different ways, we are happy to discuss alternative arrangements if the working pattern you are looking for is not specifically indicated.  If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to advise us at the time of application to assist you through the recruitment process. §§§§

jobText: TXT/50632512.txt	§Operations Support§§Private Advertiser§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Operations Support§§Private Advertiser§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§25 Sept 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Salary§§$45,000 - $59,999§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Administrative Assistants§§§§§§About OSSIS§ §OSSIS is a Christchurch based company that leads the world in the design of custom orthopaedic implants, using high-end software systems and additive manufacturing. Ossis' orthopaedic implants are 3D printed in titanium by ISO 13485 approved suppliers and finished in New Zealand by accredited service providers. Ossis distributes its products in New Zealand, Australia, USA and Europe.§ § § §About The Role§ §In this newly created role, you will be responsible for the daily operations management including working closely with multiple suppliers and the design, quality, and logistics personnel to ensure the custom implants are delivered efficiently meeting all quality regulations.§ §OSSIS is in a growth phase and the company processes and systems need to be updated to keep up with the growth and quality regulations. This is your chance to add your mark on the business working with others to create or improve current processes and will require you to bring a high level of organisational and process control skills and an exceptional eye for detail to the business.§ § § §About You§ §This is an operations management position ideal for someone with strong project management skills. You must be highly driven to develop new process and complete all the relevant paperwork document controls and training to implement these processes effectively.§ §You must have a strong eye for detail, excellent written and verbal communication skills, the ability to work independently without supervision and. work effectively across multiple teams.§ §You will be able to organise yourself and others well, bringing these skills to the business you will be required to keep track of multiple other projects in the OSSIS team and ensure deadlines and timelines are communicated well.§ §Skills and experience§ § §Project management experience with the ability to juggle multiple tasks at once§ §Highly proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook§ §Background in Medical Device, Engineering or Design preferred§ §Understanding of medical terminology and medical device regulatory requirements preferred§ §Proven experience in document and process control§ §Experience in supply chain logistics§ §Supplier relationship management§ §Inventory and stock management§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§

jobTitle: Customer Solutions Associate Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50632627.txt	§Customer Solutions Associate§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Customer Solutions Associate§§Advertiser: §Transpower§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§25 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Client & Sales Administration§§§§§§Use your commerciality and intellect to provide exceptional customer service§Work enterprise wide to optimise customer experience and outcomes§Be part of an engaging agile team working to enable Aotearoa's energy future§Build exceptional relationships and enjoy a challenging and stimulating 'business to business' role with truly meaningful work!§Transpower's Whakamana i Te Mauri Hiko - Empowering Our Energy Future reports outlines that electrification and renewable generation can provide over 50% of the non-forestry emissions reductions to achieve New Zealand's net carbon zero target by 2050 while significantly reducing household energy bills. Transpower's customers will be central to delivering this bright energy future.§About the opportunity§Due to our CSA taking on a new challenge within Transpower, we're seeking a Customer Solutions Associate to join our Customer Services team. You'll proactively manage the strategic relationships and day to day operations with our customers and stakeholders who connect directly to the grid, as well as developers and Infrastructure companies, for the benefit of New Zealand. §You'll be part of a tight knit agile team, working closely with the other Customer Solutions Associates and Relationship Managers, to establish and maintain positive relationships between Transpower and our customers.  §The role is varied and includes the following:§Understanding the regulatory context within which Transpower operates§Operational customer and stakeholder management - you'll be the first point of contact for varied enquiries and problem resolution§Monthly bill preparation for existing customer contracts which is then passed to finance§Preparing reporting including insights and trend analysis§Interpreting and preparing contracts§Supporting our Relationship Managers to deliver key account plans§To be considered, your previous experience, CV and cover letter will demonstrate:§well-developed communication and relationship management/customer centricity§commercial/financial literacy§an ability to interpret and prepare contracts§the ability to manage expectations and balance multiple priorities at pace, ideally in a corporate environment§experience working with cross functional teams to deliver for your customers and stakeholders.§While not essential, the following experience will be highly regarded:§Experience with customer relationship management systems and agile tools (e.g. JIRA)§Electricity or Utility industry exposure§Process/continuous improvement experience§Why Transpower?§It's exciting! The scale, criticality and complexity of our enterprise is both stimulating and challenging. We are an equal opportunity employer and value the diversity of thought that comes from our people of over 28 nationalities.§How we are approaching our work is changing. We are looking to alternative ways of working which ensure business engagement that supports automation and efficiency goals.§You'll join a fun, hardworking team with great employee benefits - check them out here https://www.transpower.co.nz/about-us/careers/benefits and on the job professional growth and development over time.§Next steps§We are committed to playing our role in helping to deliver a net zero carbon future for Aotearoa. To join our Customer Solutions Team within our Strategy Division, and enjoy working towards a new energy future, please review the position description below/via our website https://careers.transpower.co.nz/search  and apply without delay.§Role closes Sunday, 11 October 2020 however applications will be reviewed as they are received, and you may be asked to complete a video interview so we can get to know you better!§NB: Due to international border restrictions, we are only able to consider candidates currently residing in New Zealand with full work eligibility.§To apply for this job, please click 'apply now' or go to our job site and enter the job code 21109SK.§§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

Transpower's customers will be central to delivering this bright energy future.§About the opportunity§Due to internal secondment, we have an opportunity for a Customer Solutions Associate to join our Customer Services team for an 18 month fixed term. You'll proactively manage the strategic relationships and day to day operations with our customers and stakeholders who connect directly to the grid, as well as developers and Infrastructure companies, for the benefit of New Zealand.§You'll be part of a tight knit agile team, working closely with the other Customer Solutions Associates and Relationship Managers, to establish and maintain positive relationships between Transpower and our customers.§The role is varied and includes the following:§Understanding the regulatory context within which Transpower operates§Operational customer and stakeholder management - you'll be the first point of contact for varied enquiries and problem resolution§Monthly bill preparation for existing customer contracts which is then passed to finance§Preparing reporting, including insights and trend analysis§Interpreting and preparing contracts§Supporting our Relationship Managers to deliver key account plans§To be considered, your previous experience, CV and cover letter will demonstrate:§Well-developed communication and relationship management/customer centricity§Commercial/financial literacy§An ability to interpret and prepare contracts§The ability to manage expectations and balance multiple priorities at pace, ideally in a corporate environment§Experience working with cross functional teams to deliver for your customers and stakeholders§While not essential, the following experience will be highly regarded:§Experience with customer relationship management systems and agile tools (e.g. JIRA)§Electricity or Utility industry exposure§Process/continuous improvement experience§Why Transpower?§It's exciting! The scale, criticality and complexity of our enterprise is both stimulating and challenging. We are an equal opportunity employer and value the diversity of thought that comes from our people of over 28 nationalities.§Next steps§We are committed to playing our role in helping to deliver a net zero carbon future for Aotearoa. To join our Customer Solutions Team within our Strategy Division, and enjoy working towards a new energy future, please review the position description below/via our website https://careers.transpower.co.nz/search and apply without delay.§Role closes Sunday, 11 October 2020 however applications will be reviewed as they are received, and you may be asked to complete a video interview so we can get to know you better!§NB: Due to international border restrictions, we are only able to consider candidates currently residing in New Zealand with full work eligibility.§To apply for this job, please click 'apply now' or go to our job site and enter the job code 21108SK.§§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

The Centre works with educators, artists, activists, policymakers and communities to research the power of the arts for social transformation. To further develop our ongoing success, we are seeking a pro-active individual as our next §centre manager.§ You will have advanced stakeholder management skills, a strategic mindset and exceptional organisation skills. This is currently a 12 month fixed term contract§ §If you want to contribute to research which seeks to uncover how the arts have the potential to make a more socially just and equitable world through improving the quality of life of all citizens, please apply today!§ §Te Whiwhinga mahi | The opportunity§ §Our centre manager supports the overall work through effective project management, administrative support and by providing budget oversight. You will also be providing administrative support to our Centre Director, §Professor Peter John O'Connor§. Your work will predominantly involve managing projects, timelines, team deadlines. as well as the promotion of our centre by maintaining our online presence and event promotion.§ §If you would like to understand the tasks in more detail, please refer to the §position description.§ §He kōrero mōu | About you§ §In many ways, you will be integral to the ingoing success and smooth running of the day to day operations in addition to executing and developing our long term strategic direction. To succeed in this position, you will have:§ § §exceptional §organisation skills§ to manage yourself and other’s day to day operational activities§ §the §tenacity §required to get things moving, and keep projects going§ §a forward thinking §strategic mindset§, always looking ahead to improve processes and increase opportunities§ §some §experience managing projects§ through from conception to execution§ §confidence and professionalism§ required to engage with internal and external leaders while representing the University of Auckland.§ §Exposure to the university environment or working in a similarly §complex organisation§ will be advantageous§ §Mō tō mātou rōpū | About the team§ §While fairly new, our centre is the product of a great deal of hard work and passion. We come to work each day to make a difference for our community. Our working environment is one that we are incredibly proud of, and the successful candidate will hold the same values. We're not afraid to push the boundaries, and remain flexible and malleable to take make projects work and take them to the next step.§ §Ngā āhuatanga kei a mātou | What we offer§ §The University of Auckland (42,000 students) is New Zealand’s leading university and maintains significant computational, laboratory and analytic facilities. Auckland itself is frequently rated as one of the world’s most liveable cities.§ §The University is committed to providing an excellent working environment through:§ § §Flexible employment practices§ §Career development programmes§ §A competitive salary with five weeks’ annual leave§ §Company superannuation scheme, discounted car parking, a generous parental leave allowance, childcare and a number of other discounts on internal and external services.§ §For more information please visit §Staff Benefits§.§ §  Me pēhea te tuku tono | How to apply§ §Applications must be submitted online, by the closing date of §9th of October §to be considered. Please include your cover letter and CV highlighting your relevant experience and suitability for this role.§ §_§ §The University is committed to meeting its obligations under the Treaty of Waitangi and achieving equity outcomes for staff and students in a safe, inclusive and equitable environment. For further information on services for Māori, Pacific, women, LGBTQITakatāpui+, people with disabilities, parenting support, flexible work and other equity issues go to §www.equity.auckland.ac.nz§ §_§ §In accordance with our commitment to equitable recruitment, the University welcomes applications from all suitably qualified and experienced candidates. In response to COVID-19 the New Zealand Government has imposed a travel ban and are currently only allowing New Zealand Residents, Citizens and visa holders meeting a strict exception policy  to enter the country, all of whom must currently enter Government approved quarantine for two weeks on arrival.  § §It is uncertain when these border restrictions will change, and this may impact the degree to which an off-shore candidate can engage in the interview process; or be available to commence in a new position. For more information and updates on the border restrictions visit the §Immigration New Zealand website§ or the §New Zealand Government’s official Covid-19 website§. §§§§

forecasting & budgeting to maximise return on investment§ §Build & maintain positive relationships with all stakeholders§ §Preparing project schedules in consultation with the Department Manager§ §Assigning and managing technician schedule on daily basis§ §Hands-on field experience to train the team demonstrate techniques§ §Develop strategy with Department Manager to improve profitability§ §Process improvement with the Department Manager§ §Team handling capabilities§ §Maintain Health & Safety Standards with HSEQ department§ §Quality audits with Department manager support§ §Working with HR for selection, performance reviews, assist in training§ §Responsible for profitability of the project and generating revenue§ §Any other work as assigned by the Department Manager§ §Work with the Department manager to ensure all crew are fully utilized, paperwork is up to date and progress is communicated sufficiently to the Operations Manager§ §All dispatching should be per the company KPIs and guidelines§ §Ensure Sales KPIs are achieved§ § § §The Successful Applicant will have: § § §Demonstrate leadership abilities working in a fast-paced environment while maintaining a high level of customer satisfaction§ §Strong sense of urgency during service outages.§ §Individual must be highly collaborative and demonstrate strong interpersonal and team building skills.§ §Strong organization skills.§ §Strong managerial and work coordination skills.§ §Self-motivated team player.§ §Excellent problem-solving ability.§ §Solid written and verbal communications skills.§ §Experience of dispatching and administration § §An intermediate to excellent MS office experience§ § § §Benefits:§ § §Progressive remuneration increases as you progress and provide more value.§ §You will gain experience by working with a leading technology company alongside one of the most experienced technicians and engineers in the industry§ §Free on going coaching and training programs to be professional technically also in customer services, health and safety and even you will go through a personal growth mastery program so you will be far ahead of anyone else in the industry.§ §Friendly work environment. We take great care in looking after our installers and staff and treat them like an extended family.§ §Potential for great career to progress with a fast growing company§ § § §If you think this role is challenging and what you are looking for, please send in your applications now!  § § §§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as a project coordinator?§§§

jobTitle: Administrator, Intelligence & Reporting Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50639360.txt	§Administrator, Intelligence & Reporting§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Administrator, Intelligence & Reporting§§Advertiser: §Environmental Protection Authority (EPA)§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§27 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Administrative Assistants§§§§§§Make history with us§ §As New Zealand’s environmental regulator, the work we do today helps shape the future of Aotearoa.§ §The Compliance, Monitoring and Enforcement (CME) group helps everyone - from small businesses to big organisations – understand and comply with environmental regulations to help protect communities, the environment and people. The CME group’s functions underpin the overall strategic direction and goals of the EPA - protecting people and the environment, delivering the right decisions and strengthening trust in the EPA.§ §As part of recent changes made within the CME group we are looking for a range of passionate and forward thinking professionals to join us on a move to a more cohesively-aligned, strengthened, and active CME Group.§ §The opportunity § §The Administrator for the CME Intelligence and Reporting team provides administrative, logistical, financial and process support and leadership to enable the team, and the wider CME group, to perform efficiently, sustainably and effectively in all of our CME activities. § §Tasks and duties to be undertaken are varied, fast paced and dynamic and will facilitate the CME leadership team and wider team manage and deliver a busy workflow with often shifting priorities. We are looking for someone who thrives in this type of work environment.§ §What we can offer you§ §This is a permanent full-time position based in our central city offices on Lambton Quay. The role provides plenty of variety, interesting and challenging opportunities, working with colleagues focused on making a difference§ §Some of the benefits of working with us include on-site weekly Māori language lessons and regular workshops to develop staff understanding and appreciation of Te Ao Māori; talks on a variety of topics from fascinating external speakers; and a range of clubs and groups, from gardening to adventure running, that cater to the diverse interests of our staff.§ §We also offer our staff extra leave on top of the standard legislative requirements.§ §About you§ §We are looking for a positive and organised person with the following to join us:§ § §An interest in science, environmental or international regulation§ §Experience working with legislative requirements§ §Skilled user of Microsoft Office products, Word, Excel and Outlook§ §Strong communication skills, and a focus on providing good customer service§ §A supportive, positive attitude§ §Self-motivated, driven to deliver, able to manage multiple tasks and have strong attention to detail. Sound judgement, common sense and a pragmatic approach are key§ §Have the ability to work, and deliver, under pressure, set priorities, and achieve results in tight deadlines§ §How to apply§ §For further information and a copy of the job description, please contact Julia Holman, Recruitment Advisor §julia.holman@epa.govt.nz§ §Check out the careers section of our website for more information at www.epa.govt.nz§ §Application close 12 October 2020§§§§

jobText: TXT/50639620.txt	§Early Childhood Centre Administrator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Early Childhood Centre Administrator§§Advertiser: §Kew Pacific Island Early Learning Centre§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§27 Sept 2020§§Location§§Southland§, §Invercargill§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Administrative Assistants§§§§§§Kew Pacific Island ECE Centre is a well established service in Invercargill, governed by the Pacific Island Advisory and Cultural Trust (PIACT). The centre provides education and care for children from babies to school age and is licenced for 30 children including 10 up to the age of two years. The majority of the children enrolled have Pacific or Māori heritage.§The role of  Administrator plays a significant role at our centre, providing support for the Centre Supervisor, and being the first point of contact for our whanau and tamariki.§The Administrator role will have responsibility for the smooth running of the centre's administration systems.  You will also ensure the early childhood management system of records covering children's bookings, attendance and contact details is maintained to provide accurate information to families, management and the Ministry of Education.§Aspects of the role are detailed below;§Reception§Invoicing, banking and credit management§Managing staff rosters§Dealing with customer queries§Providing general administrative support to the teaching team and Centre Supervisor§The successful applicant will have knowledge of accounts, be tech-savvy and have exceptional attention to detail.  We are looking for a friendly, warm, approachable person that shows a genuine interest in children and their families.  Knowledge of early childhood management systems such as APT and Ministry of Education funding requirements will be a huge advantage.§This is a part-time permanent position of 16.5hrs per week, with flexibility in days and hours to accommodate school hours. January 2021 Start date.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50640393.txt	§Support Officer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Support Officer§§Advertiser: §Ministry for Primary Industries§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Sept 2020§§Location§§Northland§, §Whangarei§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Administrative Assistants§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §        §Whatungarongaro te tangata toitu te whenua§          §As man disappears from sight, the land remains§        §        §Support Officer §        §          §Kōrero mō te tūranga - About the Role§          §We are looking for a Compliance Support Officer to provide administrative and technical support to the Regional Compliance teams. This position is based in Whangarei.§          §Some functions of the role include:§          §            §Facilitates the smooth running of the relevant Regional Compliance teams and contributes to the delivery of the team's outputs by providing general administrative, technical and logistical support.§            §Provides clients, stakeholders and the public with prompt, efficient, excellent customer service experiences; including accurate information and guidance.§            §Contributes to the delivery of technical outputs by assisting with the coordination of technical processes and acting as a super user for relevant MPI systems and databases.§            §Identifies system and process improvement opportunities by carrying out scheduled audits, reviewing internal protocols and recommending enhancements on behalf of and in agreement with the District Team Leader.§            §Facilitates system and process improvements by coordinating and/or participating in support forums and documenting agreed system and process changes in accordance with MPI policies and standards.§          §          § §          §Mōu - About You §          §To be successful in this role you will need to:§          §            §Proven organisational skills with experience in the maintenance of administrative systems§            §Experience in an office environment§            §Knowledge of administration and business support systems and processes§            §Experience working with records management systems§            §Data entry and reporting tools§            §High level of interpersonal skills and the ability to communicate and negotiate effectively in both spoken and written form with a wide range of people, e.g. MPI, industry and the general public.§          §          § §          §Mō te Manatū Ahu Matua - About MPI§          §The Ministry for Primary Industries is helping to seize export opportunities for our primary industries, improve sector productivity, ensure the food we produce is safe, increase sustainable resource use, and protect New Zealand from biological risk.§          § §          §Ahurea - Culture §          §We are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive culture. We are fair in our behaviour and our policies promote equal opportunity for all. We provide numerous training programmes and opportunities for people to continuously improve their skill sets and keep up to date with global best practices. MPI has a focus on career pathways so this is the first step in your career with us and we will help you grow.§          § §          §Ngā hua o te Mahi i te Manatū Ahu Matua: - Benefits of working at MPI§          §            §Up to three additional (MPI holidays) leave days§            §Career development and internal opportunities across the branch and organisation§            §Wellness benefit for employees§            §Parental leave ex-gratia payment§            §Bi-annual MPI-paid eye test and contribution to the costs of corrective lenses/frames§            §Flexible working - we support work life balance and flexible work arrangements whenever possible§          §          § §          §To find out more about the Ministry and what we do please click §here§          § §          §The salary for this role is circa $50,000 to $59,000 depending on skills and experience §          §See the benefits of working at MPI§          §To join a diverse and interesting organisation that offers a wide range of career opportunities click on our link below!§          § §          §Me pēhea te tuku tono - How to Apply§          §To view the position description and/or apply for the role please click "APPLY FOR THIS JOB" or visit the MPI Careers Site. For tracking and reporting purposes, all applications must be submitted through our online careers portal.§          §To apply for this role you must hold the right to work in New Zealand or be eligible to obtain it - click §here§ to find out more about work visa eligibility and options.§          §The closing date is Sunday 11th October 2020§          §If you have any questions about the role, please email §jessica.bradley@mpi.govt.nz§  §          § §          § §          § §          §The Ministry for Primary Industries is committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values inclusion and diversity. Your unique talents and experience will help us deliver exceptional services to our communities in Aotearoa. In return you'll enjoy an inclusive and flexible working environment in a diverse team of people while you're growing your career here in NZ and internationally. We actively encourage applications from all backgrounds. If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to tell us when you apply so that we can assist you through the recruitment process.§          §§        §        §        §      §    §    §  §§§Kōrero mō te tūranga - About the Role§We are looking for a Compliance Support Officer to provide administrative and technical support to the Regional Compliance teams. This position is based in Whangarei.§Some functions of the role include:§§Facilitates the smooth running of the relevant Regional Compliance teams and contributes to the delivery of the team's outputs by providing general administrative, technical and logistical support.§Provides clients, stakeholders and the public with prompt, efficient, excellent customer service experiences; including accurate information and guidance.§Contributes to the delivery of technical outputs by assisting with the coordination of technical processes and acting as a super user for relevant MPI systems and databases.§Identifies system and process improvement opportunities by carrying out scheduled audits, reviewing internal protocols and recommending enhancements on behalf of and in agreement with the District Team Leader.§Facilitates system and process improvements by coordinating and/or participating in support forums and documenting agreed system and process changes in accordance with MPI policies and standards.§§ §§Mōu - About You §To be successful in this role you will need to:§§Proven organisational skills with experience in the maintenance of administrative systems§Experience in an office environment§Knowledge of administration and business support systems and processes§Experience working with records management systems§Data entry and reporting tools§High level of interpersonal skills and the ability to communicate and negotiate effectively in both spoken and written form with a wide range of people, e.g. MPI, industry and the general public.§§ §§Mō te Manatū Ahu Matua - About MPI§The Ministry for Primary Industries is helping to seize export opportunities for our primary industries, improve sector productivity, ensure the food we produce is safe, increase sustainable resource use, and protect New Zealand from biological risk.§ §Ahurea - Culture §We are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive culture. We are fair in our behaviour and our policies promote equal opportunity for all. We provide numerous training programmes and opportunities for people to continuously improve their skill sets and keep up to date with global best practices. MPI has a focus on career pathways so this is the first step in your career with us and we will help you grow.§ §Ngā hua o te Mahi i te Manatū Ahu Matua: - Benefits of working at MPI§§Up to three additional (MPI holidays) leave days§Career development and internal opportunities across the branch and organisation§Wellness benefit for employees§Parental leave ex-gratia payment§Bi-annual MPI-paid eye test and contribution to the costs of corrective lenses/frames§Flexible working - we support work life balance and flexible work arrangements whenever possible§§ §To find out more about the Ministry and what we do please click §here§§ §§The salary for this role is circa $50,000 to $59,000 depending on skills and experience §§See the benefits of working at MPI§To join a diverse and interesting organisation that offers a wide range of career opportunities click on our link below!§ §Me pēhea te tuku tono - How to Apply§To view the position description and/or apply for the role please click "APPLY FOR THIS JOB" or visit the MPI Careers Site. For tracking and reporting purposes, all applications must be submitted through our online careers portal.§To apply for this role you must hold the right to work in New Zealand or be eligible to obtain it - click §here§ to find out more about work visa eligibility and options.§The closing date is Sunday 11th October 2020§If you have any questions about the role, please email §jessica.bradley@mpi.govt.nz§  § § § §The Ministry for Primary Industries is committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values inclusion and diversity. Your unique talents and experience will help us deliver exceptional services to our communities in Aotearoa. In return you'll enjoy an inclusive and flexible working environment in a diverse team of people while you're growing your career here in NZ and internationally. We actively encourage applications from all backgrounds. If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to tell us when you apply so that we can assist you through the recruitment process.§§§§

jobTitle: Case Manager - Dynamic Case Manager role in Takapuna Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50640451.txt	§Case Manager - Dynamic Case Manager role in Takapuna§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Case Manager - Dynamic Case Manager role in Takapuna§§Advertiser: §NZDRC§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Rodney & North Shore§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Administrative Assistants§§§§§§Our business is growing and we need to add to our Case Management/Admin team. § §We are looking for a process driven administration superstar with high attention to detail who is looking for the 'next step' in their customer focussed admin career.§ §There is a high degree of autonomy in this role and you will need to be able to manage your workload efficiently. However, you will also need to be able to work together with others to achieve deadlines and manage workloads so a genuinely helpful and cooperative team player with a can-do attitude is who we are looking for. § §If you would like your application to be considered you MUST upload a properly formatted cover letter in PDF format addressed to Nikki Grindley outlining why you believe you are the person we are looking for as well as an updated copy of your CV. § §ICRA§ §The Independent Complaint and Review Authority (§ICRA§) is a provider of private ACC Dispute Resolution services in New Zealand and is a wholly owned subsidiary of NZDRC (The New Zealand Dispute Resolution Centre www.nzdrc.co.nz).  As such, it is critical that all applicants are able to work in an environment where professionalism and confidentiality is paramount. § §Candidates will have highly developed oral and written English language skills, strong communication and relationship building skills and be able to understand and explain complex issues clearly and precisely.  You must be confident in handling complex emotionally charged enquiries and display high levels of empathy with our clients who are working through life changing issues.§ §The Role§ §This role is perfect for you if you are a 'problem solver' by nature and enjoy juggling a varied workload as the role combines case management and general office administration. § §Key tasks include:§ § §Case Management duties:§ Responding to inquiries, providing support to our dispute resolution professionals, case management of individual cases, organising hearings and mediation conferences, data and statistical analysis and reporting.§ §Administration: §You will be responsible for formatting and editing documents and spreadsheets so your MS Office skills must be first-class as a very high standard of literacy and accuracy is expected.§ §People skills:§ You will have excellent people skills and be able to maintain a professional profile while managing a highly variable range of stakeholders.§ §Skills and experience§ §You §must have§ more than 4 years administration experience and an eye for detail to apply for this role. You will also need to demonstrate:§ § §flexibility and a true can-do will-do attitude.§ §outstanding oral and written English language skills as your job will entail writing and editing documents§ §a high level of familiarity with all MS Office products, particularly Word and Excel;§ §an eye for detail § §strong communication and relationship building skills;§ §the ability to work independently and proactively with an organised and structured approach to all tasks;§ §the ability to earn the confidence and respect of our stakeholders;§ §an ability to multitask and work to deadlines; and § §an empathetic and helpful telephone manner § §Who are we looking for?§ §You will need to have an outgoing personality, the maturity and confidence to interact with people from all walks of life, and the ability to switch between tasks effortlessly. You will often be speaking with people regarding highly sensitive matters and who are experiencing life changing and emotionally draining situations, you must be prepared to handle such challenging cases.  Every work day can be quite different so we are looking for someone who is able to work on a number of on-going cases as well as manage every-day admin tasks and new enquiries; this is the role for someone who enjoys juggling multiple tasks. The workload will often be high so you will need to be able to remain calm and focused and work well under pressure.§ §How to apply?§ §If you would like your application to be considered you MUST upload a properly formatted cover letter in PDF format addressed to Nikki Grindley outlining why you believe you are the person we are looking for as well as an updated copy of your CV. If you do not include a properly formatted and relevant cover letter pertaining to this position your application will not be considered.§ §Please note: ONLY applications from those currently residing in NZ with appropriate permanent working entitlement will be considered. All applicants must have a clean criminal record and pass drug testing and be able to work full time from our office in Takapuna. This is a PERMANENT full time position and not something to be tackled as a 'temporary role' whilst waiting for another industry or business to pick up again. §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have customer service experience?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§How many years' experience do you have as an office administrator?§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

You'll be responsible for ensuring our website information is up-to-date and accurate so our customers can make informed decisions. § §About the role§ §As the Product Admin, you’ll be responsible for creating and maintaining the product listings on our website, assisting the Product Admin - Team Leader with updating pricing and various other activities that improve integrity of our online listings.§ §You'll also provide back up to our Warehouse team during staff absences and busy periods.§ §This role is based in the office at our warehouse in Kenepuru, Porirua.§ §Your tasks on an average day might include:§ § §Adding new product listings to the website§ §Maintaining and editing existing product descriptions§ §Liaising with suppliers to locate new stock§ §Checking supplier websites and product feeds to maintain pricing accuracy§ §Setting up price comparers to ensure our pricing is competitive§ §Managing tasks that improve customer experience with product listings, such as finding product photos and checking listing availability§ §Providing back up to our Warehouse team including: § §Picking products for customer orders§ §Packing orders for postage§ §Shelving and organising stock.§ § § §You will occasionally be asked to provide support and back-fill for the Product Admin - Team Leader, so you should be comfortable taking charge when required.§ §About you§ §To be successful in this role, you will have the following:§ § §Confident communication skills, both written and verbal, to deal with suppliers and other staff effectively§ §Strong organisational skills and the ability to take initiative and prioritise workloads§ §Able to manage high volume tasks while maintaining attention to detail§ §Comfortable working independently, including problem solving and making quick decisions§ §Good computer literacy and understanding of systems§ §Experience with data entry would be an advantage (but not essential)§ §An interest in audiovisual or photography technology and equipment is a bonus.§ §As there is a requirement to provide back up in our warehouse, you should also be comfortable lifting items up to 16kg and being on your feet for most of the day some days.§ §About Rubber Monkey§ §Rubber Monkey is New Zealand's premier provider of professional audio, video and photography technology products to commercial, government, education and creative industries. § §Our goal is to shatter the idea that because New Zealand has a small population, we should pay more and get less. We are driven to compete with global pricing and provide our customers with the fastest delivery we can.§ §We are a Wellington owned and operated company.§ §How to apply§ §If this role sounds like you, click ‘Apply for this job’ and submit a copy of your CV and a cover letter stating why you think you'd be a great fit.§ §For more information about this role, please email §jimmy@rubbermonkey.co.nz§. Please do not send applications to this address.§ §We'll be reviewing applications as they come in so apply today.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§
