It is also important for our Receptionist to portray a calm demeanour whilst being culturally sensitive and supportive to the diversity of our visiting Tauranga Community.§The skillset required for this role is listed below and the successful applicant will need to:§Exude personality plus.§Display well-developed interpersonal and communication skills.§Be highly organised and efficient.§Triage a wide range of enquiries.§Possess a high level of resilience and discretion.§Display a high level of attention to detail.§Handle multiple priorities.§Be proactive and assertive in relation to increasing the effectiveness of systems and processes.§Communicate in a professional, friendly manner, in person and via telephone/email.§Resolve simple enquiries and transactions.§Operate easily within the Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook) and digital systems generally.§Preferably, utilise previous Reception experience at a busy people-facing business.§No two days are the same in this role and you will need to be happy to roll up your sleeves and get stuck in tasks that may not necessarily fall in to the job description, but rest-assured our Service Centre Team are a very supportive and fun team to work alongside.§If this sounds like you then we look forward to receiving your application.§Applications close on Monday 12th October 2020 at 11:55pm.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50640861.txt	§Clinic Administrator/Receptionist - MOTUS Russley§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Clinic Administrator/Receptionist - MOTUS Russley§§Advertiser: §Motus Health Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Sept 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Receptionists§§§§§§CLINIC ADMINISTRATOR/RECEPTIONIST  §  §PART-TIME  §  §MOTUS RUSSLEY (567 Wairakei Road) §  §MOTUS Health Network are a group of Physiotherapy Clinics committed to consistent, quality and personalised healthcare that can be relied on.  We are active people who want to keep people active and we’re looking for an enthusiastic self-starter to provide high-quality reception and administrative support for our Clinic team.  §  §The MOTUS Clinic Administrator/Receptionist is key to the positive and warm welcome that each patient receives and links us to our local communities.  With this in mind, the MOTUS Clinic Administrator/Receptionist follows five key Principles: § § § §Principle #1:  Reception is like a family kitchen – it is the heart of the clinic as a kitchen is the heart of a home. §  § § §Principle #2:  Looking out for those who look after our patients – supporting our clinicians to do the best job for their patients. §  § § §Principle #3:  Part of a well-oiled machine – pride in undertaking tasks on time and performing them accurately and efficiently. §  § § §Principle #4:  Rock in the river – creating stability and support, like a stepping stone, to assist patients, physios and managers to navigate their river.  §  § § §Principle #5: Water off a duck’s back – To be able to bring kindness, a lightness of touch and keep your humour is essential. §  § §To be successful in this role, you’ll need to possess a friendly, flexible approach with a proven commitment to excellence in customer service. Solid computer skills with the ability to learn new systems quickly is important along with accurate administration skills and a high level of attention to detail. In turn, we offer a friendly, supportive and cohesive working environment and the opportunity to be part of a highly reputable multi-disciplinary team. §  §The hours of work for this part-time position are 27 per week, Monday to Friday between 7am – 7pm, working a roster of fixed mornings and afternoons shared with another Clinic Administrator/Receptionist.  §  §So, if you’re someone with a positive ‘can do’ attitude, a great sense of humour, the ability to work with a wide-ranging customer base, and are looking for a new challenge, then we would love to have you on our team! §  §If you’re interested, apply now on SEEK or by sending a cover letter and a copy of your CV to hr@motushealth.co.nz by 9:00am Monday 5th October 2020. §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have experience in an administration role?§Do you have customer service experience?§Which of the following Microsoft Office products are you experienced with?§§§

jobTitle: Faculty Administrator Job in Bay of Plenty - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50641048.txt	§Faculty Administrator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Faculty Administrator§§Advertiser: §Toi Ohomai Institute of Technology§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Sept 2020§§Location§§Bay of Plenty§, §Tauranga§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Administrative Assistants§§§§§§  §Faculty Administrator §Permanent Full Time (1.0 FTE) 37.5 hours per week§Faculty of Business, Design and Service Industries§Tauranga §Toi Ohomai delivers quality vocational education and training to both domestic and international students, across five main campuses in Rotorua, Tauranga, Taupō, Tokoroa and Whakatāne, and 68 delivery sites across the Bay of Plenty and South Waikato. Toi Ohomai is now a subsidiary organisation for NZ Institute of Skills & Technology (working name) and part of a transformational change unifying all 16 Institutes of Technology and Polytechnics across Aotearoa; together with other work-based, provider-based and online learning. Collectively we will be NZ’s largest tertiary education provider with national and regional reach enabling learners and employers to move between workplaces and other educational offerings and between locations as their needs change.§The Faculty Administrator role will be based at the Windermere campus in Tauranga. The role is both stimulating and multi-dimensional and the successful applicant will proactively support staff and students through providing essential administrative, logistical and practical support.  This is a busy and varied role which requires strengths in customer service, organisation, time management, technical competency and more. §Reporting to the Faculty Operations Manager, this role will contribute significantly to the Faculty of Business, Design and Service Industries by:§  §Providing efficient and timely administrative, logistical and practical support to Faculty management, staff and students§  §Providing exceptional customer service, accurate information and advice, and a positive contribution to students, internal customers, external parties and the wider Faculty team§  §Contributing to the Faculty work environment in order to provide a strong focus on quality, continuous improvement, and health and safety §Key to your success in this role will be your demonstrated ability to:§  §Provide prompt, friendly and customer-oriented responses to all telephone, face to face and email enquiries;§  §Display a strong commitment to customer service, empathy with customer’s needs and problems and desire to help people;§  §Exhibit excellent computer literacy skills;§  §Draft and prepare correspondence, reports, presentations and related documentation;§  §Show excellent time management skills, accuracy and efficiency, and ability to work under pressure;§  §Establish and maintain positive working relationships with people at all levels;§  §Be self-managing and to work effectively individually and within a team;§  §Display a high level of professionalism, confidentiality and ethical conduct;§Experience within the Tertiary Sector is a bonus, but not essential.§Importantly you will be able to demonstrate strong alignment and commitment to our Toi Ohomai Values.§As a responsible employer and education provider, Toi Ohomai Institute of Technology is committed to the protection of children and vulnerable persons and applies relevant policy and practice to meet this commitment. Successful candidates will be required to undergo relevant vetting and employment checks.§Applications close: Friday 09 October 2020§For a copy of the Job Description visit §F-Admin-JD---August-2020-Faculty-BDSI.docx§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50641907.txt	§Team Administrator - Mount Maunganui§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Team Administrator - Mount Maunganui§§Advertiser: §The Gap 2014 Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Sept 2020§§Location§§Bay of Plenty§, §Tauranga§§Salary§§$45,000 - $49,999§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Administrative Assistants§§§§§§Team Administrator, Mount Maunganui§  §We’re helping progressive accounting firms embrace value-add Business Development and Advisory services to better serve the small business community.  We need an administration champion to support the Team in maximising efficiency across all departments. §  §This is your opportunity to be part of the reinvention of the accountant and enjoy working with a passionate team who are united in a clear purpose.§  §About us:§  §The Gap works with accounting firms, enabling them to deliver (and monetise) a broad range of Business Development services to the small business community. §  §We are primarily a content organisation, with a comprehensive marketing arm, education programme and bespoke portal that integrates with Xero.  Our brand promise encompasses practical and proven systems, to provide soft skills for life and sustainable recurring revenues for our member firms, and their clients.§  §This role is for applicants seeking to broaden their skillset and gain transferable experience working with programs such as HubSpot, Xero, GoToWebinar, Zoom, Microsoft Teams, Trello, PowerPoint, GoogleDocs, BOMA and our own bespoke Portal.§  §Perhaps you’re ready for your first full time role, have recently completed studies and are after valuable experience, or simply wish to join a supportive working environment.  This role is a great opportunity for a keen learner to carve out a well-rounded CV and join a fun team, operating in an exciting business niche.§  §You’ll need a positive outlook, and the ability to self-manage your tasks and deadlines. Whist you’ll require a fair bit of support as you learn your key processes and programs, from there you’ll enjoy some autonomy.  All we ask is that you raise your hand when you need help and be agile to team and client requests. §  §Key Responsibilities:§ § §Supporting the team with general admin tasks§ §Member onboarding and support§ §HubSpot database maintenance§ §Finance administration§ §Webinar and masterclass administration§ §Content formatting, publishing and testing§ §Event collateral co-ordination§ §Being a Gap brand ambassador§ §Our company is growing fast.  We’re looking for an agile team player who enjoys collaboration and is happy working in a fast-paced office.  Your success is our success and this role will provide opportunity for growth within the admin department.§  §We recognise the importance of hiring the right person for our team.  Organisational fit is more important than experience, skills or qualifications. §  §If you§ love§ administration and are passionate about supporting a global team, we want to hear from you.  Please apply with a cover letter.  §Applications close on Monday, 13th of October, 2020.§  §Do your due diligence on us here: www.thegapportal.com§  §All applicants must apply with a cover letter.  Email zoe@thegapportal.com if you need more information or a copy of the Job Description.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§

Their mission is to provide customers with fit-outs that enhance safety and maximise productivity. As the company is on a path of growth, there will be plenty of opportunities to develop your knowledge and skills, and we would love to hear from candidates with a real desire to grow.§  § Sound like you? jobText: TXT/50642106.txt	§Retrofit Customer Service & Sales Co-Ordinator - Wellington§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Retrofit Customer Service & Sales Co-Ordinator - Wellington§§Advertiser: §Metro Performance Glass§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Porirua & Kapiti Coast§§Salary§§Competitive salary, health insurance, n3 benefits§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Client & Sales Administration§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Retrofit Customer Service & Sales Co-Ordinator - Wellington §      §        §Retrofit is part of Metro Performance Glass and we are NZ's leading flat glass supplier to the commercial and residential construction markets. With ACC, you'll be supporting people in Aotearoa to stay safe by minimising the incidence and impact of injury, as well as helping them recover from injury if an accident does happen. Join us - an organisation that grew out of bold thinking and has an enduring commitment to care for others at work, home and play.§We are looking for someone who has strong administrative skills and a real focus on supporting a team. This role will be a varied and challenging one and no two days will be the same. Our business unit will benefit from your support and sense of urgency, including meetings, managing finances and supporting senior managers with their busy roles. If you are someone that always impresses with your organisation and attention to detail, not to mention your ability to work to tight timeframes and operate effectively under pressure then look no further. Apply now!§Key responsibilities of the role and what you need to be successful:§You must have a strong customer focus and be able to work with people at all levels of the organisation to get the best results for everyone§You will anticipate people's needs, focusing on solutions rather than problems§Be computer savvy, highly organised and a self-starter who is capable of working to multiple demands and tight deadlines§Your professional manner in handling confidential information will ensure you're a success in this position, as will your detailed and accurate approach to your work and high standard of written and oral communication skills§Working at ACC§We know that a diverse and inclusive team helps us meet the needs of our customers, and we welcome applications from people of every ethnicity, national origin, gender orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, and/or status as an individual with a disability. It's important to us that people bring their whole selves to work.§To support an inclusive workplace we have:§Employee networks§- Pride@ACC§- Ability@ACC§- Women's Network§- Cross-Cultural Network§ACC's Māori Strategy, Whāia te Tika§Development opportunities in te reo Māori me ngā tikanga§Advocates in the disability sector§Diversity and Inclusion Approach§Support Māori by partnering with iwi and other Māori entities.§Applications will run through to Friday, 9 October but please note that if an ideal candidate is found during this time we will move forward with screening and interviewing sooner. Applications can only be accepted when submitted through our ACC career website. jobTitle: Document Management Advisor Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50642508.txt	§Document Management Advisor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Document Management Advisor§§Advertiser: §Land Information New Zealand§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Records Management & Document Control§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Document Management Advisor §      §      §      §        §          §Are you committed to helping LINZ improve the way we capture, share, access and use our knowledge as a strategic asset?§          §Would you like the challenge of administering a critical enterprise information system?§          §Do you enjoy delivering excellent customer service that specialises in information management solutions?§        §        § §        §About the Company §        §At Land Information New Zealand (LINZ), our key role is to ensure New Zealanders have accurate information about where people and places are, that people have confidence in their property rights and that Crown property is well managed for future generations.§        § §        §From the best way to develop farmland, build a new suburb, manage a high-country farm or navigate on land or at sea, our work and location information help people make better decisions and create economic, social, environmental and cultural value for New Zealand.§        § §        §The Document Management Advisor role is responsible for administering LINZs Electric Content Management System (ECMS) and ensuring our system continues to meet the current and ongoing information needs of the business. With your established Information Management skills, you will add significant value to the business as you help our LINZ staff to safely comply with established information management legislation, processes, policies and standards.§        § §        §You will manage a help desk service for ECMS users. Working with system technical specialists and the Senior Information Advisor you will become a system expert providing consistently excellent customer service. You will pro-actively identify opportunities for system and process improvements and follow through on these as appropriate. You will work with the Business Owner, Senior Information Advisor, vendor and IT teams to prioritise, plan and implement system improvements and upgrades.§        § §        §With your understanding of NZ Government record keeping requirements and legislation, you'll join a small but supportive team and assist your Knowledge Management colleagues in supporting LINZ to effectively use other Knowledge Management information resources such as Confluence, Promapp and Liberty databases. You'll balance your technical knowledge with your commitment to providing excellent customer service as you work with the wider Knowledge Management team to design and deliver high quality, fit-for-purpose solutions to meet LINZ's knowledge management challenges and opportunities.§        § §        §Skills and Experience §        §          §Experience in records or information management§          §Understanding of NZ government recordkeeping environment and accompanying legislation§          §Proven track record of excellent customer service§          §Ability to learn, use and adapt to new computer technologies, systems and processes§        §        § §        §To apply, please click §"Apply Online."§ You'll be taken through to our LINZ Careers Centre where you'll be able to review further information about the responsibilities and accountabilities of this role in the Position Description. You'll be able to complete your online application form and upload a copy of your CV/Cover Letter. Please keep in mind when including your CV to specifically highlight the capabilities and skills listed in the above ad and the position description. §        § §        §Applications close Sunday 11th October§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§§§Are you committed to helping LINZ improve the way we capture, share, access and use our knowledge as a strategic asset?§§Would you like the challenge of administering a critical enterprise information system?§§Do you enjoy delivering excellent customer service that specialises in information management solutions?§§ §About the Company §At Land Information New Zealand (LINZ), our key role is to ensure New Zealanders have accurate information about where people and places are, that people have confidence in their property rights and that Crown property is well managed for future generations.§ §From the best way to develop farmland, build a new suburb, manage a high-country farm or navigate on land or at sea, our work and location information help people make better decisions and create economic, social, environmental and cultural value for New Zealand.§ §The Document Management Advisor role is responsible for administering LINZs Electric Content Management System (ECMS) and ensuring our system continues to meet the current and ongoing information needs of the business. With your established Information Management skills, you will add significant value to the business as you help our LINZ staff to safely comply with established information management legislation, processes, policies and standards.§ §You will manage a help desk service for ECMS users. Working with system technical specialists and the Senior Information Advisor you will become a system expert providing consistently excellent customer service. You will pro-actively identify opportunities for system and process improvements and follow through on these as appropriate. You will work with the Business Owner, Senior Information Advisor, vendor and IT teams to prioritise, plan and implement system improvements and upgrades.§ §With your understanding of NZ Government record keeping requirements and legislation, you'll join a small but supportive team and assist your Knowledge Management colleagues in supporting LINZ to effectively use other Knowledge Management information resources such as Confluence, Promapp and Liberty databases. You'll balance your technical knowledge with your commitment to providing excellent customer service as you work with the wider Knowledge Management team to design and deliver high quality, fit-for-purpose solutions to meet LINZ's knowledge management challenges and opportunities.§ §Skills and Experience §§Experience in records or information management§Understanding of NZ government recordkeeping environment and accompanying legislation§Proven track record of excellent customer service§Ability to learn, use and adapt to new computer technologies, systems and processes§§ §To apply, please click §"Apply Online."§ You'll be taken through to our LINZ Careers Centre where you'll be able to review further information about the responsibilities and accountabilities of this role in the Position Description. You'll be able to complete your online application form and upload a copy of your CV/Cover Letter. Please keep in mind when including your CV to specifically highlight the capabilities and skills listed in the above ad and the position description. § §Applications close Sunday 11th October§§§§§

jobTitle: Court Registry Officer Job in Waikato - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50642628.txt	§Court Registry Officer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Court Registry Officer§§Advertiser: §Ministry of Justice§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Sept 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Thames & Coromandel§§Salary§§$48,853 and $57,473§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Administrative Assistants§§§§§§Thames District Court§§ §§We are looking for a talented individual to come join our District Court as a Court Registry Officer in Thames.§§ §§Te āhuatunga a te tūranga/About the Role§Court Registry Officer - in this role you will work with a team responsible for the successful operation of the Court. You will liaise with multiple stakeholders who are interacting with the Justice system. This includes being able to communicate confidently with Judges within the courtroom and their chambers, as well as other members of the judiciary.§In both roles, the tasks include but is not limited to:§Court Taking - this is the facilitation of running the court. This includes introducing Judges (in English and Te Reo Maori), working closely with them in the Courtroom and Chambers, managing jurors and general administration of the court.§Case management - taking responsibility for ensuring that the Judiciary and case parties have all the information they need, and that logistics are in place to ensure cases are heard in a timely and effortless manner§Travel to Hearing Courts therefore must have a full clean New Zealand drivers licence§ §Mō te tīma/About our Team§At Tāhū o te Ture - the Ministry of Justice, we're committed to working together for a fair and safe Aotearoa.§Creating a continuous learning environment is important to us. As the successful applicant, you will bring your thirst for knowledge and improvement. You will have an individual training plan and be supported to carry out the role. As a Court Registry Officer this includes exercising Deputy Registrar Powers. §As an organisation we empower our people with building their wellbeing knowledge, offering a range of wellbeing tools and support.§ §§Joining the Ministry of Justice means you will become part of an inclusive organisation that values you and the communities we serve. §It's our promise to ensure our workplace is one where our people feel healthy and safe, supported and able to be themselves at work. We value respect as the foundation for building a positive workplace culture and one where diversity is welcomed and celebrated. §§ §§He pūkenga tou/Skills and Experience§With pride in your work, you will strive to deliver a service to our customers with high accuracy and professionalism.§Our customers are diverse, and our workforce reflects this. This role is no different and would suit a variety of backgrounds. Whether you have an interest in the Justice system, have a passion for working with customers or looking for a new challenge this is your chance to join us on our journey to deliver people centred justice services for all.§To be successful, you will need to be:§§Detail orientated and observant - the court has many different processes and case information needs to be accurate§Self-aware -our participants are unique, and you will be confident working, both individually and as a team, across a range of situations§Multi-task -some of our processes are repetitive, but you'll be able to manage conflicting priorities and move from one task to another quickly§Willing to learn - legislation and processes in the courts is always changing and you will be able to adapt and maintain knowledge capital§Resilience - there are times when working in the courts, you will be working on sensitive cases and sometimes at high volume§§ §Tono mai/How to Apply§If successful, you will be invited to an interview in Hamilton on a date to be confirmed. Please note that we cannot progress your application if you are not able to attend.§Starting salaries are generally between $48,853 and $57,473 and are dependent on skills and experience.§Only applicants with the right to work in New Zealand will be considered for this position.§To apply, click the Apply button below to be directed to our Careers Website. You can view a detailed position description at the site, as well as complete an online application form by attaching your CV and cover letter.§For tracking purposes, all applications must be submitted via our online process§Applications close on 12th October 2020§If you have any questions please contact §recruitment@justice.govt.nz§ §§§§

jobTitle: Operations Manager/Board Secretary Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50642730.txt	§Operations Manager/Board Secretary§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Operations Manager/Board Secretary§§Advertiser: §Bishop Associates Recruitment§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Office Management§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §        §Operations Manager/Board Secretary §        §The NZ Association for Migration and Investment (NZAMI) has been the leading professional body for immigration advisors for the past 30 years.  Working closely with Immigration NZ, Government, and the Immigration Advisors Authority it plays a significant role in building the professionalism of the immigration industry in NZ. The Association is governed by a Board of Directors, elected by the members annually.  Membership is vast, consisting of a diverse group of highly experienced immigration advisers and lawyers along with Partners and Sponsors of the Association.  Members are located throughout NZ as well as in a number of countries overseas.§ As the glue that cements the Association, the position of Operations Manager/Board Secretary has now become vacant for the first time in many years. This is a unique and exciting position, where you have the luxury of your office being from your home (or wherever you happen to be at the time in NZ) as well as travel to scheduled meetings throughout NZ at various times through the year.§ Reporting to the elected Chairman, this position will provide administrative support to the Board as well as being the Associations’ hub for all communication from members and stakeholders.  This position also has one remote working, part-time direct report who will assist in administration functions.§ As well as a wide range of co-ordinating administrative tasks this position is responsible for achieving targets and budgeted results for the Association as set by the Board. A large portion of the role will involve medium to large scale event management,  day to day financial management, overseeing the membership database, updating various social media and website platforms as well as taking calls/emails around membership and identifying potential new business partnerships.  This is a diverse and complex organisation where no two days are the same. This is an opportunity where you can genuinely be involved and make a significant difference and impact around immigration.§ Our ideal applicant will have a genuine passion, understanding and interest in working with a diverse range of nationalities and cultures.  Tenacity, diplomacy and empathy are key to the success of this role as are the following skills and attributes:§          §            §A number of years in a similar senior administrative position.§            §In depth understanding of office and business practices, administration policies, systems and procedures including accounts, project management and computer programmes.§            §Highly proficient with MS-Office (Outlook, Word, Excel, and PowerPoint) and familiarity with other platforms including social media (LinkedIn and Facebook) and website management.§            §Proven ability to complete research and present well written, grammatically correct, and professionally presented documents and reports as required.§            §Experience in minute taking and an understanding of an organisation’s practices and regulations.§            §Extensive experience in event management, coordinating conferences and AGM’s, booking accommodation, flights, venues, etc.§            §Proven ability to juggle various tasks whilst keeping your sense of humour.§          § As well as the above, this position requires an individual who thrives on supporting others, is highly organised, efficient, is self-directive and disciplined in supporting a team remotely.  This position is the gateway to the Association and for that reason requires someone with exceptional customer service, confidence, agility, and a “can-do” attitude. § § To be considered for this position you must have NZ Residency or NZ Citizenship.  All applications must be made via Seek with an up-to-date CV and Covering Letter detailing your reasons for applying for this position. §Please note: this is a full-time, “work from home” position.§        §        §Jo Mackenzie§0212466661§ §      §      §    §  §§§The NZ Association for Migration and Investment (NZAMI) has been the leading professional body for immigration advisors for the past 30 years.  Working closely with Immigration NZ, Government, and the Immigration Advisors Authority it plays a significant role in building the professionalism of the immigration industry in NZ. The Association is governed by a Board of Directors, elected by the members annually.  Membership is vast, consisting of a diverse group of highly experienced immigration advisers and lawyers along with Partners and Sponsors of the Association.  Members are located throughout NZ as well as in a number of countries overseas.§ As the glue that cements the Association, the position of Operations Manager/Board Secretary has now become vacant for the first time in many years. This is a unique and exciting position, where you have the luxury of your office being from your home (or wherever you happen to be at the time in NZ) as well as travel to scheduled meetings throughout NZ at various times through the year.§ Reporting to the elected Chairman, this position will provide administrative support to the Board as well as being the Associations’ hub for all communication from members and stakeholders.  This position also has one remote working, part-time direct report who will assist in administration functions.§ As well as a wide range of co-ordinating administrative tasks this position is responsible for achieving targets and budgeted results for the Association as set by the Board. A large portion of the role will involve medium to large scale event management,  day to day financial management, overseeing the membership database, updating various social media and website platforms as well as taking calls/emails around membership and identifying potential new business partnerships.  This is a diverse and complex organisation where no two days are the same. This is an opportunity where you can genuinely be involved and make a significant difference and impact around immigration.§ Our ideal applicant will have a genuine passion, understanding and interest in working with a diverse range of nationalities and cultures.  Tenacity, diplomacy and empathy are key to the success of this role as are the following skills and attributes:§ § §A number of years in a similar senior administrative position.§ §In depth understanding of office and business practices, administration policies, systems and procedures including accounts, project management and computer programmes.§ §Highly proficient with MS-Office (Outlook, Word, Excel, and PowerPoint) and familiarity with other platforms including social media (LinkedIn and Facebook) and website management.§ §Proven ability to complete research and present well written, grammatically correct, and professionally presented documents and reports as required.§ §Experience in minute taking and an understanding of an organisation’s practices and regulations.§ §Extensive experience in event management, coordinating conferences and AGM’s, booking accommodation, flights, venues, etc.§ §Proven ability to juggle various tasks whilst keeping your sense of humour.§ § As well as the above, this position requires an individual who thrives on supporting others, is highly organised, efficient, is self-directive and disciplined in supporting a team remotely.  This position is the gateway to the Association and for that reason requires someone with exceptional customer service, confidence, agility, and a “can-do” attitude. § § To be considered for this position you must have NZ Residency or NZ Citizenship.  All applications must be made via Seek with an up-to-date CV and Covering Letter detailing your reasons for applying for this position. §Please note: this is a full-time, “work from home” position.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§Do you have experience in an administration role?§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have jobTitle: Administrator Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50642761.txt	§Administrator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Administrator§§Advertiser: §Arborlab Consultanc­y§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Rodney & North Shore§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Administrative Assistants§§§§§§Arborlab are New Zealand’s leading consultancy company specialising in Arboriculture, Ecology and Green Space management since its establishment in 2002. We are committed to creating and advancing the sustainable development of our cities’ green open spaces to build a brighter future. We work alongside clients to provide expert solutions utilising the latest technology and expertise. §  §You will be working with a passionate team committed to delivering in the areas of consultancy, project management, auditing and monitoring for our varied client base at every stage of a project. This is a great opportunity to join a leading and dynamic consultancy company.§  §About the role:§  §We are seeking an individual to fill the role of a full time Administrator. As the sole Administrator for the business, you have full responsibility for the day-to-day oversight of the office. You will generally the first point of contact for all new projects that come into the business, requiring you to identify and delegate the projects as necessary. You will be responsible for setting up and coordinating the delivery of a programme of minor works and other key activities across the contract by coordinating the end-to-end delivery of projects, including client liaison. You will also support managers and employees through a variety of tasks related to organisation and communication. The Administrator job scope includes communicating via phone and email ensuring that all administrative duties are completed accurately and delivered with high quality and in a timely manner.§  § §Other duties will include:§ § §Oversight and coordination of project delivery;§ §Promoting positive client interactions and relationships;§ §Collaboration with service division teams to ensure customer needs are met;§ §Maintenance and development of system documentation;§ §Office management, general administrative and office support;§ §Assisting in invoicing and maintaining files and databases;§ §Assist in preparation of reports, presentations, memorandums, quotes, proposals and consents;§ §Assist in the development of efficient and effective systems and procedures;§ §Answer telephone, screen and direct calls, take and relay messages, provide information to callers;§ §Ensure all emails are checked, responded to, and distributed amongst the team appropriately.§ §This is a busy and varied role that will suit someone who is responsible, team focused, highly organised, has initiative and takes pride in their work, ensuring that clients’ requests are managed before problems arise.§  § §  §Essential requirements, skills, and experience§ § §Proven admin or assistant experience (minimum of 3 years) with strong knowledge of office management systems and procedures;§ §High attention to detail in all aspects of the role;§ §Highly organised with the ability to deliver on set tasks;§ §Ability to coordinate projects across teams in order to meet deadlines;§ §Excellent time management skills and ability to multi-task and prioritise workload;§ §Oversee documentation creation, quality control and delivery;§ §Ability to assist with tender responses i.e. design, submission and review;§ §A strong work ethic with an aptitude and willingness to learn new skills;§ §Excellent interpersonal skills and the ability to maintain positive internal and external relationships;§ §Comfortable working in an autonomous environment;§ §Attention to detail and problem-solving skills;§ §Excellent written and verbal communication skills – a strong grasp of correct spelling and grammar is essential;§ §Experience in optimising and improving processes;§ §Proficiency in MS Office and internal databases.§ § §  §Desirable§ § §Experience delivering projects using agile methodologies, to deliver business solutions within quality and budget expectations;§ §Experience in health and safety management.§ § §  §Please send all applications to §office@arborlab.co.nz§. Applications close Friday 9th October, 2020.§  §Note – this is a fixed term contract until mid-May 2021.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as an administration officer?§Do you have customer service experience?§How would you rate your English language skills?§How many years' experience do you have with project planning and scheduling?§§§

jobText: TXT/50644244.txt	§Project Administrator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Project Administrator§§Advertiser: §Meridian§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Sept 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Administrative Assistants§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Project Administrator §      §      §      §      §        § §        §Company Description§        §At Meridian, sustainability is in our DNA.§        §We generate electricity from 100% renewable sources – wind, water and sun. That’s really important to us, because we believe it’s the only way forward for the future of our planet.§        §We also retail electricity to homes, farms and businesses across the country.   We’re committed to being good for the environment, and good to people. We’re proud Principal Partners of KidsCan, helping give Kiwi kids a decent start in life. And we support the DOC Kākāpō Recovery Programme, which aims to get this taonga species off the endangered list and back to their former natural range.                                 §        §Our purpose – our why – is ‘clean energy for a fairer and healthier world’. It’s at the heart of our business, how we operate, and how we treat each other.   §        § §        §Job Description§        §In this role you’ll provide project administration support to the Generation and Natural Resources Project Delivery Team, based in Christchurch, you’ll be supporting major projects on our hydro assets. Your key focus will be to help successfully deliver in all areas including procurement, scheduling, systems administration, training and reporting. To achieve this, you’ll be working in Microsoft Office, MS Project, Visio, SharePoint and Aconex software.§        §Key responsibilities include the following:§        §          §Procurement support including tender compilation, distribution and evaluation, contract drafting and process reviews§          §Compile project reports across the major project portfolio ensuring consistency and transparency throughout§          §Provide administrator level support for Aconex contract management system, including set-up of projects and users and support for both Meridian users and external contractors§          §Assist with the creation, issuing and approvals of project documentation§          §Assist with training and support for all users in various systems and maintain the project ‘Lessons Learned’ database along with other various administration tasks§        §        § §        §Qualifications§        §          §Previous experience in a project administration or coordination role§          §Ideally a diploma level qualification in business administration or related disciplines§          §Self-directed, resilient and with the ability to work independently§          §Well-developed analytical skills (numeric and financial)§          §Proven, well-developed communication and interpersonal skills§        §        § §        §Additional Information§        §We have an epic culture where hard work and having a good time are equally valued. We live by three ‘How to Be’s’: be gutsy, be a good human, and be in the waka.                             §        §Meridian is truly flexible, diverse and inclusive: in our workplace, you can feel comfortable bringing your whole self to work. Our flexible work options make things easier for you and your whānau. And we also offer an attractive salary package and benefits like life and income protection insurance, enhanced leave, KiwiSaver and parental leave provisions, discounts from Meridian and other organisations, and a Meridian employee share scheme. §        §All in all, we pride ourselves on being a great place to work.  If you think you’re an awesome fit not only for this role but for Meridian, apply today and tell us why!  §        §Advertising closes on October 18 (please note this is subject to change) §      §      §        §      §    §  §§§ § §Company Description§ §At Meridian, sustainability is in our DNA.§ §We generate electricity from 100% renewable sources – wind, water and sun. That’s really important to us, because we believe it’s the only way forward for the future of our planet.§ §We also retail electricity to homes, farms and businesses across the country.   We’re committed to being good for the environment, and good to people. We’re proud Principal Partners of KidsCan, helping give Kiwi kids a decent start in life. And we support the DOC Kākāpō Recovery Programme, which aims to get this taonga species off the endangered list and back to their former natural range.                                 § §Our purpose – our why – is ‘clean energy for a fairer and healthier world’. It’s at the heart of our business, how we operate, and how we treat each other.   § § § §Job Description§ §In this role you’ll provide project administration support to the Generation and Natural Resources Project Delivery Team, based in Christchurch, you’ll be supporting major projects on our hydro assets. Your key focus will be to help successfully deliver in all areas including procurement, scheduling, systems administration, training and reporting. To achieve this, you’ll be working in Microsoft Office, MS Project, Visio, SharePoint and Aconex software.§ §Key responsibilities include the following:§ § §Procurement support including tender compilation, distribution and evaluation, contract drafting and process reviews§ §Compile project reports across the major project portfolio ensuring consistency and transparency throughout§ §Provide administrator level support for Aconex contract management system, including set-up of projects and users and support for both Meridian users and external contractors§ §Assist with the creation, issuing and approvals of project documentation§ §Assist with training and support for all users in various systems and maintain the project ‘Lessons Learned’ database along with other various administration tasks§ § § §Qualifications§ § §Previous experience in a project administration or coordination role§ §Ideally a diploma level qualification in business administration or related disciplines§ §Self-directed, resilient and with the ability to work independently§ §Well-developed analytical skills (numeric and financial)§ §Proven, well-developed communication and interpersonal skills§ § § §Additional Information§ §We have an epic culture where hard work and having a good time are equally valued. We live by three ‘How to Be’s’: be gutsy, be a good human, and be in the waka.                             § §Meridian is truly flexible, diverse and inclusive: in our workplace, you can feel comfortable bringing your whole self to work. Our flexible work options make things easier for you and your whānau. And we also offer an attractive salary package and benefits like life and income protection insurance, enhanced leave, KiwiSaver and parental leave provisions, discounts from Meridian and other organisations, and a Meridian employee share scheme. § §All in all, we pride ourselves on being a great place to work.  If you think you’re an awesome fit not only for this role but for Meridian, apply today and tell us why!  § §Advertising closes on October 18 (please note this is subject to change) §§§§

jobText: TXT/50645757.txt	§Administrator/Kaiwhakarite MHAIDS Operations Centre§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Administrator/Kaiwhakarite MHAIDS Operations Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Administrative Assistants§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Administrator/Kaiwhakarite MHAIDS Operations Centre §      §        §Nau mai, haere mai ki Ūpoko ki te uru hauora.§        §Location: Porirua§        §Contract: 0.5 Mental Health Needs Assessment and Service Coordination (MHNASC) and 0.5 MHAIDS Operations Centre§        §Salary:  Grade C, Step 11 ($49,100)§        §About the role:§        §This new role will be responsible for the administration across a number of services within the MHAIDS Operations Centre.  The position is split into 0.5 administration for MHAIDS Needs Assessment and Service Coordination, and the other 0.5FTE is based with the MHAIDS Operations Centre.  The role will cover basic administration duties and support all teams with their requirements.  This is a varied and busy environment, and our ideal person will be flexible, efficient and have excellent data entry skills.§        §Duties:§        §          §Booking casual pool staff on our new online booking tool§          §Process invoices for our Needs Assessment and Service Coordination Team §          §General administration duties e.g. minute taking, organising purchases for the service, filing§        §        §Skills & Experience:§        §          §Data entry skills and experience§          §Excellent proficiency in Microsoft Office suite§          §Clean and current full drivers licence§          §Be eligible to work in New Zealand§        §        §About us:§        §Capital and Coast DHB (CCDHB) is located centrally in Wellington and has over 6,000 full-time equivalent staff, making us one of the major employers in the Wellington region. CCDHB operates two hospitals – Wellington Regional Hospital in Newtown and Kenepuru Hospital in Porirua – as well as the Kapiti Health Centre at Paraparaumu. §        §The Mental Health, Addiction and Intellectual Disability Service (MHAIDS) spans three DHBs - Wairarapa, Hutt Valley and Capital and Coast DHB’s and includes local, regional, and national services. The local MHAIDS services are provided from multiple sites within the 3DHB sub-region – greater Wellington, Hutt Valley and Wairarapa. §        §How to apply:§        §Applications will not be accepted via email. All candidates applying for any of our current vacancies must complete an online application form by clicking the 'Apply Now' button. §        §Please ensure your uploaded CV and cover letter is in either Word or PDF format. If you have queries please email §Wendy.Shardlow@mhaids.health.nz§.§        §Ma tini, ma mano, ka rapa te whai§        §By joining together we will succeed§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§Nau mai, haere mai ki Ūpoko ki te uru hauora.§ §Location: Porirua§ §Contract: 0.5 Mental Health Needs Assessment and Service Coordination (MHNASC) and 0.5 MHAIDS Operations Centre§ §Salary:  Grade C, Step 11 ($49,100)§ §About the role:§ §This new role will be responsible for the administration across a number of services within the MHAIDS Operations Centre.  The position is split into 0.5 administration for MHAIDS Needs Assessment and Service Coordination, and the other 0.5FTE is based with the MHAIDS Operations Centre.  The role will cover basic administration duties and support all teams with their requirements.  This is a varied and busy environment, and our ideal person will be flexible, efficient and have excellent data entry skills.§ §Duties:§ § §Booking casual pool staff on our new online booking tool§ §Process invoices for our Needs Assessment and Service Coordination Team § §General administration duties e.g. minute taking, organising purchases for the service, filing§ §Skills & Experience:§ § §Data entry skills and experience§ §Excellent proficiency in Microsoft Office suite§ §Clean and current full drivers licence§ §Be eligible to work in New Zealand§ §About us:§ §Capital and Coast DHB (CCDHB) is located centrally in Wellington and has over 6,000 full-time equivalent staff, making us one of the major employers in the Wellington region. CCDHB operates two hospitals – Wellington Regional Hospital in Newtown and Kenepuru Hospital in Porirua – as well as the Kapiti Health Centre at Paraparaumu. § §The Mental Health, Addiction and Intellectual Disability Service (MHAIDS) spans three DHBs - Wairarapa, Hutt Valley and Capital and Coast DHB’s and includes local, regional, and national services. The local MHAIDS services are provided from multiple sites within the 3DHB sub-region – greater Wellington, Hutt Valley and Wairarapa. § §How to apply:§ §Applications will not be accepted via email. All candidates applying for any of our current vacancies must complete an online application form by clicking the 'Apply Now' button. § §Please ensure your uploaded CV and cover letter is in either Word or PDF format. If you have queries please email §Wendy.Shardlow@mhaids.health.nz§.§ §Ma tini, ma mano, ka rapa te whai§ §By joining together we will succeed§§§§

jobTitle: Region Coordinator Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50645831.txt	§Region Coordinator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Region Coordinator§§Advertiser: §Beef + Lamb New Zealand§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Rest of Wellington Region§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Administrative Assistants§§§§§§Passion, integrity, and a genuine desire to do our best for farmers and the communities they live in is what drives us at Beef + Lamb New Zealand. We are 100% farmer-owned and funded and work on behalf of New Zealand's sheep and beef producers. Our vision is for profitable farmers and thriving farming communities, valued by all New Zealanders.§B+LNZ provides insights, tools and services to build better farm businesses. We deliver these to farmers through innovative extension systems and in partnerships with others.§We are recruiting for two proactive and professional Region Coordinator's:§One is for a 12-month fixed-term parental leave cover based in Masterton, 25 hours per week to support the Eastern North Island§One is a permanent role based in either Feilding or Christchurch, 25 hours per week to support the Western North Island and Northern South Island§You will provide administrative support to our Extension Managers and Farmer Council, assist with the administration and coordination of events, extension tools and services, maintaining our customer database for monitoring and reporting farmer engagement and driving targeted promotions of events within your regions.§If you are service focused, proactive and professional, have a minimum of five years administration experience and a high level of capability with the Microsoft Office suite then we would like to hear from you. You will also have an understanding of the sheep and beef sector and a commitment to the prosperity of our farming communities.§What we ask of you:§Excellent administration skills experience in organising events§Experience in organising events§Experience with customer relationship management systems and working with databases§Be an effective planner who manages their time and busy schedule§Most importantly you will have a positive and proactive nature, and be someone who thrives on collaboration and building a team approach to achieve shared outcomes§You will be required to travel to represent Beef + Lamb New Zealand and participate in regional and national collaborative processes or similar forums.§What we offer:§This career move builds your expertise in a field that contributes to one of New Zealand's most important export industries, and the New Zealand economy. We offer a competitive remuneration and excellent employee benefits including additional leave entitlements, a fully-subsidised life insurance policy and a work culture that values and rewards passion, integrity, professionalism and strong workplace relationships based on respect and whanau.§To apply for this role and view the full job description, go to www.beeflambnz.com/about-blnz/work-us§Please note in your cover letter which position you are interested in. §Applications close 5pm Monday, 12 October 2020. §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Are you willing to undergo a pre-employment drug and alcohol screening?§What is your expected annual salary?§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many weeks' notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

Our line of work includes, Architectural new builds, Transportable housing, Light commercial, Residential Multi Unit Buildings, Insurance Repairs/Rebuilds and Earthquake Re-strengthening.§ §Given our recent growth and steady volume of upcoming projects we are now requiring a new Office Manager/Administrator to join our team here in Christchurch.§ §About the role:§ § §Accounts Payable/Receivable§ - Assisting with our outgoing invoicing and processing incoming invoices and uploading them for approval.§ §Fleet management§ - Monitoring vehicle use and maintenance via Director GPS. Ensuring RUC's, rego are up to date and completing monthly logs of fuel use.§ §I§nitial Client Engagement §- Receiving initial enquiries from potential clients, establishing what their wants/needs are and assisting with the sales process.§ §Updating Leads Tracker§ - Ensuring all leads & client engagements are loaded to smartsheet & accurately recorded for EOM KPI reviews.§ §Issuing & compiling surveys§ - Issuing out surveys, responding to feedback and compiling these on our database§ §Health & Safety§ - Completing project health & safety documentation such as SSSP's and completing project documents packs etc... You will work in a small knit team in an mostly office based capacity.§ §If you would like to be part of a company where we encourage growth of individuals and team culture then please send your C.V to §alex@trentbuilding.co.nz§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Which of the following Microsoft Office products are you experienced with?§Do you have experience in an administration role?§Which of the following accounting packages are you experienced with?§Do you have customer service experience?§§§

jobText: TXT/50646823.txt	§Office Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Office Manager§§Advertiser: §Kin§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Office Management§§§§§§About Haunt§ §Haunt are a team of specialists that design and build development solutions across web and applications for a variety of clients based in New Zealand and Australia.  Putting their clients and customers at the centre of their work, their solutions add genuine value to businesses and are a joy to use. §   § §The Opportunity§ We're growing, and have big plans for the future. So we’re searching for a special someone who will support us to get there in the most streamlined way possible.  Things change quickly around here, so your nimbleness and flexible mindset will see this as an opportunity to learn and grow as we do. § In joining our team you’ll be based in our Wellington office, however, having truly embraced flexible ways of working you can pick and choose the days and times you’re in the office just like the rest of us.  This role could be flexible to someone wanting to work 30 or 40 hours per week. § You’ll be someone who just loves being the “go to” person in the team.  You live and breathe our values of “treating our team and clients like family”,  “supporting our team to live their best lives” and “continuous improvement” in every action you take, ensuring our clients and teams have an incomparable experience with us. §   § §Your day may look a little like this:§ § §keeping our space welcoming, warm and comfortable§ §ensuring our team have everything they need, enabling them to do their best work § §supporting our CEO with diary co-ordination, email response, travel booking§ §ensuring business systems and process are streamlined and optimised to enable a humming, happy and content workplace experience§ §supporting our project manager with any project administration tasks and overflow§ §managing the day to day facilities and operations, owning all relationships with external contractors and suppliers§ §co-ordinating and managing all client and team events§ §being the health, safety and wellbeing hero ensuring our teams remain safe and well§ §being our workplace culture champion to ensure whilst working remotely we still connect regularly and are promoting a sense of inclusion.§ § §What you will bring:§ § §a few solid years’ experience in a similar office administration or PA type role§ §a client centric mindset§ §experience and confidence to take the lead on system improvements§ §a flexible mindset that sees change as an opportunity§ §the ability to continually problem solve, anticipating the needs of our team and CEO§ §energy, drive, initiative, positivity§ §strong spoken and written communication skills§ §your humble personality, no task is too big or too small, there are no egos around here!§ § PS.  You’ll get to enjoy our summer hours of 9am-3pm, yes, you read that right!§  § If this role sounds just like you, please apply now with your CV and cover letter letting me know why you're the one we’ve been searching for.  We’d love to hear from you right away!  Applications close 14 October 2020.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50648329.txt	§Executive Assistant  to Chief People Officer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Executive Assistant  to Chief People Officer§§Advertiser: §Canterbury District Health Board§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Sept 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §PA, EA & Secretarial§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Executive Assistant to Chief People Officer §      §        §Our Purpose:§ What We're Here For§        §When you work with the Canterbury District Health Board, you're part of something very special. From the carers on the front line working directly with patients and communities, to our talented support teams who enable that care, we plan, fund and deliver health services to the almost 600,000 New Zealanders that live in the Canterbury region. And we're all about putting people at the heart of everything we do.§        §Our Culture:§ What Matters To Us§        §Ko Te Whatu Manawa Tangata§Putting people at the heart of all we do §        §For us to continue putting our communities at the centre of our health system, we're putting our own people at the centre of everything we do. Because health is ultimately all about people. You will have the skills to make a dynamic fast-paced job look easy, whilst at the same time providing you with the challenges of this key position within the Canterbury Health System.§        §Belonging Here:§ Becoming Part Of Our Story§        §Our people enjoy access to a fantastic benefits scheme, flexible working arrangements and a genuine and ongoing focus on career development.§        §We hope you'll seriously consider joining us, but if this isn't a good fit for you, please share the opportunity with your personal networks and help us find our next rock star!§        §If this particular role isn't for you, we do have other similar opportunities - please look on our careers page or give us a call to discuss.§        §Apply online, or to find out more information, please contact Tennile Toulson, §tennile.toulson@cdhb.health.nz§        §Applicants will be progressed as they apply, so if this sounds like you, please apply now! §      §      §      §    §    §  §§§Our Purpose:§ What We're Here For§When you work with the Canterbury District Health Board, you're part of something very special. You understand the Caravan and Motorhome Repair Market, and you will likely have an interest in the recreational vehicle industry. Most importantly, this role delivers a high level of service via phone, email, Skype and internet chat to exceed our customers’ expectations. § §The key activities will include:§ § §Co-ordinating repairers§ §Updating and creating Sharepoint records§ §Updating and creating Workorders§ §Collecting vehicles from repairers§ §Liaising with the Workshop Manager§ §Support the Sales team and Back of house team with admin duties.§ §Skills and Experiences§ §We are looking for a well-organised and team-focused individual with high attention to detail.§ §You should possess the following skills and experiences to be successful in this role:§ § §Advanced computer, keyboard and data entry skills§ §Outstanding customer service skills§ §Administration experience in an automotive dealership (RV and Caravan industry experience highly regarded)§ §Effective time management and organisational skills§ §Excellent verbal and written communication skills§ §The ability to work unsupervised while fitting into a team environment  § §This is a casual role with approximately 20-40 hours per week depending on work load.§ §In return, in addition to your wage, we offer:§ § §Paid camping leave (two days per year) in addition to annual leave entitlements§ §Access to product trials free of charge (Motorhome holidays anyone?)§ §Ongoing support and training§ §A fun and supportive company culture§ §If you want to be proud of what you do, be associated with renowned and iconic RV brands, be part of a business with a proven track record and be exposed to real future and development opportunities, then "apply now".§ §We are an equal opportunity employer and we aim to recruit a diverse range of people with a diverse range of talents to help us achieve our goals. Being experts in permanent recruitment and temporary staffing, we are the perfect partner to find you the best role. Our business support team are right in the heart of Wellington and we pride ourselves on great relationships with our clients and candidates.§ § §About you§ If you’re on the lookout for a new opportunity, you have just arrived back into NZ from overseas, or you’ve been affected by restructures due to Covid-19, and you have proven private/public sector EA experience, we would love to talk to you today.§ To be successful in these kinds of roles, you must have high-level experience in either Executive or Personal assistance. Preference for government roles will likely be with candidates who have public sector experience, but we can certainly talk through options with you depending on where your experience and skills lie.§ § §Desirable skills & attributes§ • Excellent communication skills§ • Strong working knowledge of the Microsoft Office Suite§ • High levels of organisation and self-management§ • Capable of building internal/external relationships§ • A great eye for detail§ • Able to work under pressure§ • Able to maintain high levels of professionalism and discretion§ § §A typical day§ • Extensive diary and email management§ • Supporting Executive Leader(s)§ • Coordinating events, meetings, conferences, and workshops§ • Written correspondence on behalf of Manager(s)§ • Document management/preparation support§ • Managing travel, accommodation, and logistics§ • Possibly assisting with the recruitment and induction of new staff members§ • Possibly supervising or mentoring junior administrators§ § §Benefits§ • You’re well represented by a team who cares about you!§ • Work in one of Wellington’s leading office environments§ • Take up an exciting assignment§ • Fixed term and permanent positions to suit your lifestyle§ § If the above sounds like you and you have strong experience in any of the aforementioned fields, please click the APPLY button or forward your CV in Word format (with minimal images) to §jessanah.betham@madison.co.nz§ and we will endeavour to get in touch as soon as possible. Alternatively, feel free to call §04 4998055§ for a confidential conversation about your job search.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50650241.txt	§Personal Assistant to General Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Personal Assistant to General Manager§§Advertiser: §Manukau Institute of Technology§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Manukau & East Auckland§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §PA, EA & Secretarial§§§§§§§Part-time opportunity (0.4 FTE)§South Auckland§As Auckland's only NZQA Category 1, Institute of Technology, MIT recognises the special obligation we have to serve the people, communities and employers of South Auckland and that achieving excellence in tertiary education is critical to both our mission and to the future economic and social prosperity of NZ.§An exciting opportunity has arisen for an exceptional and experienced Personal Assistant to support our General Manager to be based in Manukau Campus. A level-headed professional, who can think on their feet and juggle a wide workload, especially when dealing with all levels of the organisation. You will be a proactive, trustworthy and self-managing team player who can organise and prioritise well and provide outstanding administrative support.§You will also be the key point of contact for all day to day management of activities. You will be the first point of contact for the GM's office, ensuring strong coordination of day to day activities. You will help build a positive brand by delivering an excellent level of customer service to all internal and external stakeholders. Overall responsibilities include:§Providing general secretarial support to the General Manager.§Organising and maintaining General Manager's diary.§Assisting with administrative tasks as required and directed.§Overseeing budgets of the General Manager's office including reviewing expenses and raising issues where appropriate.§Assisting with People & Culture processes when required or directed.§Co-ordinating the performance review process for General Manager.§Engaging with Nga Kete Wananga Marae and the Pasifika Development Office§This is a great opportunity for a PA with a minimum 6 years' experience working in a similar role and ideally holds a Business Administration qualification. Proven proficiency with English Language in both written and verbal communications; high level of computer literacy and first class record management experience in paper and electronic are essential.§"Kua herea mātou ki te whai i te tūturutanga o Te Tiriti O Waitangi."§ We are committed to creating and maintaining a culturally sensitive work environment in relation to Te Tiriti o Waitangi.§At MIT you will work with people who are passionate about the positive impact we make to the communities we serve.We offer a work environment which values genuine people who care for others, are well-connected, open and approachable and strive for excellence in all that we do.§If you have a "can do" attitude, enjoy working collaboratively with others and have the ability to relate well to people across all areas of the Institute then APPLY NOW!§For further information please contact Jonathan Mana, People and Culture §(09) 976 0731§.§Applications close on 13 October 2020§§§§

jobTitle: Executive Assistant Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50650804.txt	§Executive Assistant§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Executive Assistant§§Advertiser: §Controller and Auditor-General§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §PA, EA & Secretarial§§§§§§§§§  §    §      §Executive Assistant §    §    §      §      §      §      §        §EXECUTIVE ASSISTANT§        §Audit New Zealand carries out annual audits of public entities on behalf of the Auditor-General. It operates a professional services model that is consistent - in many respects - with private sector auditing and assurance firms.§        §We're looking for an experienced person to provide high-level and effective administrative and secretarial support to two executives - the Executive Director and the General Manager, Operations in our Wellington office - and the Executive Leadership Team.§        §The role involves a variety of work, including:§        §          §delivering timely and highly professional administration support;§          §proactive diary management;§          §organising and supporting meetings and events;§          §planning and organising travel;§          §maintaining effective and efficient administrative systems and procedures; and§          §working effectively and collaboratively with other administrative staff.§        §        §To apply for this role, you'll have proven work experience in providing executive administrative support for people in senior leadership positions, preferably in a professional services organisation. You'll bring to this role:§        §          §strong self-management and organisational abilities;§          §the flexibility and adaptability to prioritise and handle multiple pieces of work simultaneously;§          §excellent interpersonal and relationship management skills;§          §a strong customer focus and time-management skills;§          §advanced computer software skills and experience working with a range of business systems;§          §an ability to work efficiently under pressure and maintain a positive and flexible attitude; and§          §experience working in an environment that requires a high level of discretion and sensitivity.§        §        §You must able to gain and maintain a Confidential national security clearance. Ordinarily, this means that you must be a New Zealand citizen, a permanent resident, or hold a current residency class visa and intend to become a citizen when eligible. You must have a five-year checkable background in NZ, UK, USA, Canada, or Australia.§        §For more information, please contact Sandy Hoggarth on §04 917 1500§ or §recruitment@auditnz.parliament.nz§.§        §To find out more about us, see our website: §www.auditnz.parliament.nz§.§        §You must apply online through jobs.govt.nz §(you'll find the application form and position description there, too§). §Please include a cover letter and CV with your application.§        §Applications close Sunday 11 October 2020§.§        § §        §What we stand for§        §People matter  §|§  Our independence is critical  §|§  We act with integrity and courage  §|§  We're here to make a difference§        § §        § §      §      §Please Contact: § Contact Details : Contact details here § Applications close: §        §        § PO Box 3928, Wellington 6140§      §    §    § §  §§§EXECUTIVE ASSISTANT§Audit New Zealand carries out annual audits of public entities on behalf of the Auditor-General. It operates a professional services model that is consistent - in many respects - with private sector auditing and assurance firms.§We're looking for an experienced person to provide high-level and effective administrative and secretarial support to two executives - the Executive Director and the General Manager, Operations in our Wellington office - and the Executive Leadership Team.§The role involves a variety of work, including:§§delivering timely and highly professional administration support;§proactive diary management;§organising and supporting meetings and events;§planning and organising travel;§maintaining effective and efficient administrative systems and procedures; and§working effectively and collaboratively with other administrative staff.§§To apply for this role, you'll have proven work experience in providing executive administrative support for people in senior leadership positions, preferably in a professional services organisation. You'll bring to this role:§§strong self-management and organisational abilities;§the flexibility and adaptability to prioritise and handle multiple pieces of work simultaneously;§excellent interpersonal and relationship management skills;§a strong customer focus and time-management skills;§advanced computer software skills and experience working with a range of business systems;§an ability to work efficiently under pressure and maintain a positive and flexible attitude; and§experience working in an environment that requires a high level of discretion and sensitivity.§§You must able to gain and maintain a Confidential national security clearance. Ordinarily, this means that you must be a New Zealand citizen, a permanent resident, or hold a current residency class visa and intend to become a citizen when eligible. You must have a five-year checkable background in NZ, UK, USA, Canada, or Australia.§For more information, please contact Sandy Hoggarth on §04 917 1500§ or §recruitment@auditnz.parliament.nz§.§To find out more about us, see our website: §www.auditnz.parliament.nz§.§You must apply online through jobs.govt.nz §(you'll find the application form and position description there, too§). §Please include a cover letter and CV with your application.§Applications close Sunday 11 October 2020§.§ §What we stand for§People matter  §|§  Our independence is critical  §|§  We act with integrity and courage  §|§  We're here to make a difference§ § §§§§

jobTitle: Coordinator Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50652189.txt	§Coordinator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Coordinator§§Advertiser: §DOWNER NZ§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Manukau & East Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Administrative Assistants§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Coordinator §      §        §Downer New Zealand is a leading provider of integrated services. Our commitment to building long term relationships and supporting our customers with high calibre services and solutions; the talents of our people; and consistent excellence in operational delivery sets us apart. §        §We have a great opportunity for an experienced coordinator to join our Corridor Access Request (CAR's) Team. Our CAR's team work alongside internal/external clients, as well as regional council authorities nationwide to ensure our field staff have the appropriate permits required to complete their work. §        §A bit about the role:§        §If you are an administration superstar, have a good eye for detail, and enjoy supporting busy operational groups then this role could be a great opportunity for you! As our CAR's Coordinator, you will be working in a complex and technical environment, supporting the delivery of our telecommunication services nationally.
