$84,999§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Records Management & Document Control§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Quality Facilitator/Kaihuawaere Kounga §      §        §Nau mai, haere mai ki Ūpoko ki te uru hauora.§        §Location: Wellington Regional Hospital§        §Contract: Permanent Part Time - 0.7 FTE/56 hrs per fortnight - hours will be negotiated with successful applicant§        §Salary:    $78,000 - $88,000.00§        §About the role§        §Capital and Coast District Health Board are looking for an enthusiastic Quality Facilitator to join our team in Quality Improvement and Patient Safety (QIPS) Directorate§        §The Directorate is responsible for supporting our CCDHB staff in ensuring and strengthening the quality and safety culture.  We provide staff with the information, techniques and support to improve quality of care:§        §As the Quality Facilitator you report to the Quality Manager and will be responsible for supporting the organisations services in delivery of the quality agenda, development of quality improvement and risk management capability in the services.  This includes provision of timely data reporting.§        §To be successful in the role you will have:§        §          §A strong commitment to the delivery of a quality customer focused service§          §Flexibility and ability to work through a changing environment§          §Understanding of quality and service improvements§          §Knowledge of risk management principles§          §Excellent communication skills§          §A clinical background§        §        §This role requires you to have a health related background §        §About our organisation§        §Capital and Coast DHB (CCDHB) is located centrally in Wellington and has over 6,000 full-time equivalent staff, making us one of the major employers in the Wellington region. CCDHB operates two hospitals – Wellington Regional Hospital in Newtown and Kenepuru Hospital in Porirua – as well as the Kapiti Health Centre at Paraparaumu. §        §The Mental Health, Addiction and Intellectual Disability Service (MHAIDS) spans three DHBs - Wairarapa, Hutt Valley and Capital and Coast DHB’s and includes local, regional, and national services. The local MHAIDS services are provided from multiple sites within the 3DHB sub-region – greater Wellington, Hutt Valley and Wairarapa. §        §Here at CCDHB we embrace diversity and welcome applications from people of all gender identities, ages, ethnicities, sexual orientations, disability and religions. A workforce that is diverse and inclusive means that we are better positioned to understand and serve our community.§        §CCDHB is a pro-equity Health Organisation, with a particular focus on Māori and Pacific Peoples and the Disability Community.§        §CCDHB provides a range of specialist services including neurosurgery, oncology, neonatal intensive care and community-based services including district nursing, rehabilitation services, social work, alcohol and drug services, and home support services to a population of around 900,000 people.§        §How to apply§        §Applications close Sunday 18th October 2020 and can only be accepted when submitted through our CCDHB Careers Website. For further information on this role, email §recruitment@ccdhb.org.nz§ and indicate the job title and vacancy number vacancy number in the subject line.§        §Ma tini, ma mano, ka rapa te whai§        §By joining together we will succeed§      §      §      §    §    §capitalhealth.careercentre.net.nz§  §§§Nau mai, haere mai ki Ūpoko ki te uru hauora.§  §Location: Wellington Regional Hospital§  §Contract: Permanent Part Time - 0.7 FTE/56 hrs per fortnight - hours will be negotiated with successful applicant§  §Salary:    $78,000 - $88,000.00§  §About the role§  §Capital and Coast District Health Board are looking for an enthusiastic Quality Facilitator to join our team in Quality Improvement and Patient Safety (QIPS) Directorate§  §The Directorate is responsible for supporting our CCDHB staff in ensuring and strengthening the quality and safety culture.  We provide staff with the information, techniques and support to improve quality of care:§  §As the Quality Facilitator you report to the Quality Manager and will be responsible for supporting the organisations services in delivery of the quality agenda, development of quality improvement and risk management capability in the services.  This includes provision of timely data reporting.§  §To be successful in the role you will have:§ § §A strong commitment to the delivery of a quality customer focused service§ §Flexibility and ability to work through a changing environment§ §Understanding of quality and service improvements§ §Knowledge of risk management principles§ §Excellent communication skills§ §A clinical background§ §This role requires you to have a health related background §  §About our organisation§  §Capital and Coast DHB (CCDHB) is located centrally in Wellington and has over 6,000 full-time equivalent staff, making us one of the major employers in the Wellington region. CCDHB operates two hospitals – Wellington Regional Hospital in Newtown and Kenepuru Hospital in Porirua – as well as the Kapiti Health Centre at Paraparaumu. §  §The Mental Health, Addiction and Intellectual Disability Service (MHAIDS) spans three DHBs - Wairarapa, Hutt Valley and Capital and Coast DHB’s and includes local, regional, and national services. The local MHAIDS services are provided from multiple sites within the 3DHB sub-region – greater Wellington, Hutt Valley and Wairarapa. §  §Here at CCDHB we embrace diversity and welcome applications from people of all gender identities, ages, ethnicities, sexual orientations, disability and religions. A workforce that is diverse and inclusive means that we are better positioned to understand and serve our community.§  §CCDHB is a pro-equity Health Organisation, with a particular focus on Māori and Pacific Peoples and the Disability Community.§  §CCDHB provides a range of specialist services including neurosurgery, oncology, neonatal intensive care and community-based services including district nursing, rehabilitation services, social work, alcohol and drug services, and home support services to a population of around 900,000 people.§  §How to apply§  §Applications close Sunday 18th October 2020 and can only be accepted when submitted through our CCDHB Careers Website. For further information on this role, email §recruitment@ccdhb.org.nz§ and indicate the job title and vacancy number vacancy number in the subject line.§  §Ma tini, ma mano, ka rapa te whai§  §By joining together we will succeed§§§§

jobTitle: Administrator - (Project Team) Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50653601.txt	§Administrator - (Project Team)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Administrator - (Project Team)§§Advertiser: §Apex Environmental Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Manukau & East Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Administrative Assistants§§§§§§§WOULD YOU LIKE TO JOIN A SPECIALIST COMPANY MAKING A DIFFERENCE IN WATER & WASTEWATER TREATMENT?  LOOK NO FURTHER.§  §Apex Environmental are leaders in Water and Wastewater treatment.  Through our specialised design, build, installation and commissioning process we are committed to helping New Zealand grow sustainably, thereby preserving our environment for future generations.  Apex employs a unique approach to projects through one point of accountability.  We work with some of NZ's most well-known companies in municipal, dairy, food & beverage and wine.§  §The success of Apex Environmental is its people.  Loyalty, trustworthiness, motivation and a "can do" attitude are at the top of our list.   We look for staff with the right personality to fit into our close-knit team, as well as the right skills and experience to do the job. Join our team and help us make a difference.§  §What's the job?§  §We are looking for a highly motivated and experienced Administrator to join the Apex Project Team at our Auckland office in East Tamaki. In this role you will work alongside the Project Management and Design Teams, providing administration support in all aspects to ensure they deliver on time, every time. §  §You are a great multi-tasker, and you are comfortable working through a high volume of tasks whilst liaising with multiple Project Managers. IT skills are one of your many strengths and Microsoft Office is a breeze to you meaning you will have everything organised and under control at the click of a mouse. The role is wide ranging and will include activities like, administering the Health & Safety database,  working with the Proposals Manager preparing & compiling tenders and working with the project team to prepare site safety plans, compile project documentation and other general admin tasks. In addition  you will be working with the General Manager to meet monthly reporting requirements and carry out other general PA type tasks.§  §As a team player you'll thrive in this environment, assisting with development of processes and any other tools that are required, supporting the team and the delivery process. §  §We want someone who:§ § §Displays excellent communication and writing skills§ §Has the ability to work under pressure to a high standard§ §Is a consistent team player with the ability to work with a variety of people.§ §Is a Microsoft Office whizz with intermediate to advanced Excel and Word skills.§ §Is a Self-starter, prepared to take the initiative.§ §Has previous experience in H&S and in the engineering or construction sectors§ §Is able to do overnight travel from time to time and has a clean driving record.§ §To express your interest in this position, or for a copy of the job description email: donna@apexenvironmental.co.nz§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as a project administrator?§Do you have experience in an administration role?§Which of the following Microsoft Office products are you experienced with?§How many years' experience do you have in the construction industry?§§§

jobText: TXT/50653661.txt	§Health Improvement Practitioners Fixed Term 30 June 2021§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Health Improvement Practitioners Fixed Term 30 June 2021§§Advertiser: §Raukura Hauora O Tainui§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Sept 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Hamilton§§Salary§§$65,000 - $79,999§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Administrative Assistants§§§§§§ § §This is an innovative and exciting new role!  We are looking for a team of Health Improvement Practitioners to support our work and improve the health and wellbeing of our Kirikiriroa (Hamilton) whaanau.§ §At Raukura Hauora o Tainui, our qualified and experienced staff provide an extensive range of primary and community health care services within our communities, for all ages and backgrounds. As a Maaori health organisation, we have a strong tikanga maaori based approach to providing better health solutions for all. § §Based in Waikato, you will be in a team alongside Health Coaches and Kaiarahi Tautoko to provide assistance for whaanau to access advice and services.§ §You will need relevant life and work experience and be registered as a health professional (e.g. psychologist, nurse, occupational therapist, social worker) with a current annual practicing certificate.  You will also have clinical experience working in a mental health setting (primary and/or secondary) providing evidence-based psychological intervention and knowledge of behavioural medicine and the relationship between medical and psychological systems.§ §Ideally, you will also have experience working in a health organisation and have a sound knowledge or familiarity of Te Reo Maaori and Tikanga Maaori and working in a range of Maaori settings.§ §For any further questions or queries, please contact us at Careers@raukura.com.  If you would like to be part of our team, please submit your CV, cover letter and any other relevant documents.  Applications close 04 October 2020§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§

Successful applicants will deliver excellent customer service to our students and support our staff through outstanding administration, organisational and communication skills and undertake secondary school liaison and general marketing tasks.§  §We are looking for someone with:§  §*    Passion for promotion of primary industry§  §*    Demonstrated knowledge of the primary industry§  §*    Experience in a marketing role§  §*    Experience in an office administration role§  §*    Excellent communication and interpersonal skills§  §*    Ability to coordinate different stakeholders to reach goals§  §*    Proven competence with the Microsoft suite of programmes§  §*    Knowledge and understanding of databases§  §*    Effective organisational/time management skills§  §*    Ability to work unsupervised§  §*    A full NZ driver’s license§  §The successful applicant will need to demonstrate flexibility and adaptability in the workplace and be comfortable working in a culturally diverse and inclusive student environment and be able to undertake occasional travel within New Zealand, sometimes overnight.§  §You must have the right to work in New Zealand to apply for this position.§  §For a job description and application form please contact:§  §                                          Human Resources§  §                                          Private Bag 90114§  §                                          Invercargill§  §                                          Phone    0 §3 211 2606§  §                                          e-mail     §hr@sit.ac.nz§  §with whom applications close on 15 October 2020§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§What's your expected annual base salary?§What's your highest level of education?§§§

jobTitle: Bookings and Administration Assistant Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50653708.txt	§Bookings and Administration Assistant§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Bookings and Administration Assistant§§Advertiser: §YMCA of Auckland Inc§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Papakura & Franklin§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Administrative Assistants§§§§§§YMCA IS RECRUITING NOW!§  §The Bookings and Admin Assistant role is to maximise opportunities for customers booking in for camps through excellent customer service and simple effective processes and to assist in the day to day administration operation of the camps.§  § §  §This is role part time, for 16 hours per week, working Monday to Thursday. §  § §  §What will you be doing?§ § §Assist in managing customer visits to YMCA Outdoors facilities§ §Assist in administering and managing all YMCA Outdoors and holiday programme bookings§ §Assist the Outdoors Administration Manager with data entry, pety cash, Accounts Receivable, Accounts Payable and other financial administration§ §Assist the Outdoors Administration Manager with all internal and external  reporting requirements§ §Assist with ensuring service information and promotional material for all YMCA Outdoors activities and services are accurate, meet YMCA Brand Guidelines and maximise buying opportunities by customers.§ §Actively promote and market all programmes and services offered by YMCA North to maximise buyer opportunity§ §Assist in delivering excellence in customer service at all and respond to all queries within eight working hours§ §Ensure complaints are minimised and handled politely and professionally§ §Assist in liaising with customers regarding activity programme design working with the relevant programme team for bespoke options§ §Assist in actively obtaining customer feedback§ § §  §What experience/skills do you need? § § §Competent level of computer literacy, including intermediate to advanced working knowledge of Microsoft based programmes§ §Knowledge of outdoor activity programming outcomes helpful§ §Having sales capability to convert enquiries into bookings§ §Cash handling and reconciliation experience§ §General accounts/office skills and experience§ §Customer Service experience – min 6 months§ § §  §What the YMCA offers: § § §Specific job and safeguarding training with opportunities for continuous improvement.§ §A great team, organisational culture§ §Career opportunities§ §YMCA buying privileges and discounts§ § §  §ABOUT THE YMCA§  §You probably know the song, but did you also know that YMCA North employs around 700 employees across Auckland, Hamilton, Tauranga and Rotorua? Our operations include facility management, health and fitness, early childhood education, before and after school care, holiday programmes, accommodation, outdoor camps, recreation, aquatic, fundraising and youth programmes. As a not for profit, for over 165 years YMCA has been about families. Join us and know that you’re contributing to building strong kids, families and communities now and for many years to come.§  §YMCA is able to offer great opportunities for personal development and career advancement. We provide real career pathways and job opportunities in a fun, community-focused environment.§  §We are proud to have a great mix of people of all ages and cultures within our teams who love their work and all contribute to our diverse company culture. We live by our values of Caring, Honesty, Respect and Responsibility.§  § §  §SAFEGUARDING§  §YMCA North is committed to Child Protection and the safeguarding of children and young people in our care and it is our expectation that all staff will operate in a way that reflects this intent. Staff will be required to attend Safeguarding workshops, trainings and online modules to comply with YMCA North Safeguarding Policy.§  § §  §The successful applicant will need to return a satisfactory Police Record Check before commencement of Employment.§  § §  §All applicants must currently hold the right to work in New Zealand.§  § §  §TO APPLY§  §If this sounds like you and you enjoy working in a dynamic team environment, please apply online by sending your CV and cover letter to §campadair@ymcaauckland.org.nz§  § §  §We will be assessing applications as they are received. Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Which of the following Microsoft Office products are you experienced with?§Do you have customer service experience?§How would you rate your English language skills?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§

jobTitle: Reception Administrator  Job in Waikato - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50653726.txt	§Reception Administrator §§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Reception Administrator §§Advertiser: §HR Connect Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Sept 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Hamilton§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Receptionists§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §Reception Administrator §    §      §        §  §        §The Hamilton Abuse Intervention Project (HAIP) was launched in 1991, with a vision for whanau and families achieving their potential free from violence and abuse. HAIP provide short term emergency housing for perpetrators of Domestic Violence; non-violence programmes; safety programmes; and are the Lead NGO for the Mana Whānau Coalition for the Integrated Service response.§        §The Role§        §Reporting to the Manager – Intervention & Community Engagement, this role will provide efficient, effective and timely data entry, administrative and reception services supporting the functions of the agency, provide backup support to the various sectors of HAIP services and Management as required. In addition, you will also assist with specific projects or pieces of work as organized by Management e.g. resource development, and other such appropriate projects that management may initiate from time to time. §        §The Person§        §To be successful in this role, you will have: §        §          §Previous experience working as an office administrator/receptionist §          §Proficient Microsoft office suite skills and a good typing speed§          §Excellent telephone manner, interpersonal and relationship management skills.§          §Strong organisational skills, attention to detail and accuracy §          §The ability to maintain a high level of confidentiality at all times. §          §Highly efficient written and verbal communication skills and be able to relate well to persons of different ethnicities, cultures, economic and social backgrounds. §          §Strong numerical and accurate data entry skills§          §Strong decision making and problem-solving skills and ability to work under pressure §          §An uncompromising approach to health and safety§        §        §We are seeking an enthusiastic, hard-working and dedicated person who thrives in a busy environment.   If you’re a person that is open to personal growth, enjoys a challenge, can work at pace and juggle a variety of tasks then this may be the job for you!§        §Please note that our recruitment process includes a pre-employment police vetting check. Applicants for this position should have NZ citizenship, residency or a valid NZ work visa.§      §      §      §      §    §    §www.hrconnect.co.nz§  §§§  §The Hamilton Abuse Intervention Project (HAIP) was launched in 1991, with a vision for whanau and families achieving their potential free from violence and abuse. HAIP provide short term emergency housing for perpetrators of Domestic Violence; non-violence programmes; safety programmes; and are the Lead NGO for the Mana Whānau Coalition for the Integrated Service response.§The Role§Reporting to the Manager – Intervention & Community Engagement, this role will provide efficient, effective and timely data entry, administrative and reception services supporting the functions of the agency, provide backup support to the various sectors of HAIP services and Management as required. In addition, you will also assist with specific projects or pieces of work as organized by Management e.g. resource development, and other such appropriate projects that management may initiate from time to time. §The Person§To be successful in this role, you will have: §  §Previous experience working as an office administrator/receptionist §  §Proficient Microsoft office suite skills and a good typing speed§  §Excellent telephone manner, interpersonal and relationship management skills.§  §Strong organisational skills, attention to detail and accuracy §  §The ability to maintain a high level of confidentiality at all times. §  §Highly efficient written and verbal communication skills and be able to relate well to persons of different ethnicities, cultures, economic and social backgrounds. §  §Strong numerical and accurate data entry skills§  §Strong decision making and problem-solving skills and ability to work under pressure §  §An uncompromising approach to health and safety§We are seeking an enthusiastic, hard-working and dedicated person who thrives in a busy environment.   If you’re a person that is open to personal growth, enjoys a challenge, can work at pace and juggle a variety of tasks then this may be the job for you!§Please note that our recruitment process includes a pre-employment police vetting check. Applicants for this position should have NZ citizenship, residency or a valid NZ work visa.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Commercial Sales Administrator - 6 months Fixed Term Job in Canterbury - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50653769.txt	§Commercial Sales Administrator - 6 months Fixed Term§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Commercial Sales Administrator - 6 months Fixed Term§§Advertiser: §The Warehouse Group§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Sept 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Client & Sales Administration§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Commercial Sales Administrator - 6 months Fixed Term §      §        §TWG is a New Zealand success story, founded by Sir Stephen Tindall and evolved from a single The Warehouse store to become one of the largest retailing groups in New Zealand with $3 billion in sales. TWG consists of six core retail brands: The Warehouse, Warehouse Stationery, Noel Leeming, Torpedo7, 1-day and TheMarket.§        §Each business unit of TWG has a commercial division which operates through the TWG Business programme. TWG Business allows a consolidated shopping experience for businesses nationwide, allowing a wide range of product and service procurement through a central group. The vision is that a business can procure technology, stationery, appliances, furniture, sporting, outdoor, apparel, FMCG and many more categories; through one central supplier.§        §The Role§        §In this role, you will provide a high level of service supporting the pre and post commercial sales process. This role supports the Sales Manager TWGB and the wider commercial team, who are out in the field, providing assistance with the quote and sales process for commercial orders ensuring the customer has a seamless experience throughout. You will be responsible for quoting, pricing, processing sales, monitoring stock & delivery schedules, following up on delivery, liaising with both customers and suppliers and responding to requests from the commercial sales team. §        §About You§        §To succeed in this role, we are looking for a thoroughly customer focused individual who is able to remain composed in all situations and is truly passionate about ensuring we keep the customer at the centre of everything we do.  You will have strong admin skills, excellent phone manner with written and verbal skills to match together with strong time management skills. You will take pride in building good relationships & delivering a memorable experience to our customers.§        §Above all, we are looking for a passionate team player who showcases key agile attributes such as growth mindset, collaboration and performance driven in order to drive the business forward.§        §Whats in it for you§        §We offer a dynamic, supportive team environment within a business that cares about and recognises individuals. The business is at an exciting point in its life story.  By empowering our teams and increasing cross-collaboration, we aim to make TWG New Zealand’s best place to work!   §        §Does this move sound like something you’re up for? If you’ve read this far, go the whole way and apply now! §      §    §    §twg.co.nz§  §§§TWG is a New Zealand success story, founded by Sir Stephen Tindall and evolved from a single The Warehouse store to become one of the largest retailing groups in New Zealand with $3 billion in sales. TWG consists of six core retail brands: The Warehouse, Warehouse Stationery, Noel Leeming, Torpedo7, 1-day and TheMarket.§ §Each business unit of TWG has a commercial division which operates through the TWG Business programme. TWG Business allows a consolidated shopping experience for businesses nationwide, allowing a wide range of product and service procurement through a central group. The vision is that a business can procure technology, stationery, appliances, furniture, sporting, outdoor, apparel, FMCG and many more categories; through one central supplier.§ §The Role§ §In this role, you will provide a high level of service supporting the pre and post commercial sales process. This role supports the Sales Manager TWGB and the wider commercial team, who are out in the field, providing assistance with the quote and sales process for commercial orders ensuring the customer has a seamless experience throughout. You will be responsible for quoting, pricing, processing sales, monitoring stock & delivery schedules, following up on delivery, liaising with both customers and suppliers and responding to requests from the commercial sales team. § §About You§ §To succeed in this role, we are looking for a thoroughly customer focused individual who is able to remain composed in all situations and is truly passionate about ensuring we keep the customer at the centre of everything we do.  You will have strong admin skills, excellent phone manner with written and verbal skills to match together with strong time management skills. You will take pride in building good relationships & delivering a memorable experience to our customers.§ §Above all, we are looking for a passionate team player who showcases key agile attributes such as growth mindset, collaboration and performance driven in order to drive the business forward.§ §Whats in it for you§ §We offer a dynamic, supportive team environment within a business that cares about and recognises individuals. The business is at an exciting point in its life story.  By empowering our teams and increasing cross-collaboration, we aim to make TWG New Zealand’s best place to work!   § §Does this move sound like something you’re up for? If you’ve read this far, go the whole way and apply now! §§§§

jobTitle: Church Administrator and Accounts Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50653836.txt	§Church Administrator and Accounts§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Church Administrator and Accounts§§Advertiser: §St Stephen's Ponsonby§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Salary§§$20 - $25 per hour (depending on experience)§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Administrative Assistants§§§§§§We are a growing church in the Ponsonby/ Herne Bay area with a heart to serve our community.§  § §  §We're looking for an administrator with some accounting abilities to actively support the Minister, ministry and leadership team of St Stephen’s. Ideally we're after a systems person who can help to build administrative infrastructure that works and enhances the mission of our church.§  §The role includes administration, stock management, day to day finances, payroll, PAYE, routine clerical tasks, and miscellaneous office duties as required.§  § §  §Duties Include:§  § § § §Uses initiative to identity, create and maintain systems that enable the life of the church to run smoothly.§ §In collaboration with the Minister and worship team, creates and distributes service slides and weekly news/ e-letters.§ §Manages church contacts and pastoral database§ §Collects and records church statistics for the database and sends to Presbytery§ §Manages and produces quarterly church phone book§ §Oversees and monitors the Health and Safety policy of the church§ §Oversees and monitors church rosters including reminders§ §In conjunction with the Minister and Parish Council oversees and monitors church policies§ §Manages and replenishes church stock (cleaning products, morning tea, communion, community pantry and hospitality space requirements)§ §In conjunction with the community hub-worker administrates church bookings and invoicing (uses skedda app).§ § Pays all church bills and invoices third parties that use the church facilities ie rental income etc§ §Manages the fortnightly payroll for 4 staff, ensuring the payroll and leave records are properly§ maintained including the payroll filing requirements.§ § Receives the weekly cash collection, counting it with a second person and records the details before§ banking it ensuring all members who have provided a giving number are recorded in the Giving§ Register so we can provide the annual donation certificates. This process may change if the Treasurer is§ not regularly attending St Stephens.§ § Maintains the bank reconciliations, processing all direct credits and automatic payments as required to§ ensure our records are up to date and tidy.§ § Manages term deposits and investments in conjunction with the Parish Council (PC) expectations and§ instructions.§ § Provides regular updates to the PC regards how the church finances are tracking compare to budget.§ §Prepares the year end accounts and maintains thorough records so that the third party annual§ accounts review is a formality.§ §Prepares the annual operations budget and submits that to the PC for approval§ §Responsible for the year end filing requirements with the Charities Commission.§ §Liaises with the current Treasurer and PC regards annual re insurance renewals§ § § §Currently this job has funding for §15 hours§ per week. There is the possibility that this could increase.§  §Please note the special nature of this job necessitates the applicant to promote and embody the church’s core values and vision.§It is §essential §that you supply a cover letter stating your fit to the special nature of this job. §  § §  § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have experience in an administration role?§Which of the following Microsoft Office products are you experienced with?§How many years' experience do you have in an accounting role?§Do you have experience using Xero?§§§

jobTitle: HR / Recruitment Administrator (Fixed-Term / Part-Time) Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50654125.txt	§HR / Recruitment Administrator (Fixed-Term / Part-Time)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§HR / Recruitment Administrator (Fixed-Term / Part-Time)§§Advertiser: §Core HR Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Administrative Assistants§§§§§§About Core HR§ §Core HR is a boutique HR Consultancy Business providing support for SME's in:§ § §Human Resource Management (Core HR)§ §Health and Safety (Core H&S)§ §Payroll (Core Payroll)§ §Recruitment (Core Recruitment)§ §HR Projects (Core Consulting)§ §We are passionate about people! And pretty insistent we only work with businesses who also really care about their people.  As we support a wide range of industries, with great diversity in what services we offer, every day is different with a TON of variety and LOTS of challenges!§ §While in operation for 3 years now, we still consider ourselves much like a start-up environment, the successful person needs to be prepared to be hands-on and manage the diversity of tasks (and also be willing step outside the parameters of their role).§ §About the Role§ §We operate under a Business Partner model, acting much like the 'internal' HR department for our clients.  Our HR Business Partners spend regular contact time in our client businesses being an active part of their business.§ §This role will work directly with one of our HR Business Partners to primarily support a high volume recruitment project by:§ § §Conducting telephone screenings§ §Ensuring a high level of communication to create an exceptional candidate experience§ §Liaising with hiring managers on interviews, induction plans etc§ §Conducting pre-employment checks§ §Drafting employment contracts and letters of offer§ §Additionally, this position will also support  our HR Helpdesk functions for a portfolio of small-medium businesses, providing administrative support to HR processes, including:§ § § §Drafting employment contracts and letters of offer§ § §Responding to level 1 enquires from employees or managers§ §Creating and reviewing HR frameworks or documentation§ §Supporting HR projects§ §This role will give you some practical experience in Recruitment and HR.§ §It's a pretty amazing opportunity to get practical hands-on experience in the world of Recruitment and HR. Even better, you can work this flexibly around study or school pick ups and pick your own hours!!§ §PLEASE NOTE THIS IS A FIXED TERM OPPORTUNITY FOR THE DURATION OF THE VOLUME RECRUITMENT PROJECT (INITIALLY 3 MONTHS)§.§ §About You:§ §You will be a team-player, enthusiastic and a strong desire to provide an exceptional client experience.  You will be hands-on and willing to do what needs to be done, no matter how difficult (or monotonous) it may be.  You will be pretty tech savvy, comfortable with learning and operating a number of different systems (we love new systems and tools!) and a high attention to detail (OCD people most welcome!).§ §You could be an experienced HR or Recruitment Administrator OR a student looking to start their career in HR OR someone looking to re-enter the workforce and wanting to have work life balance OR just looking to chance pace with a new career opportunity. § §Most of all, you will have a great sense of humour, a huge amount of initiative, a lot of resilience, pretty self-sufficient, passionate about what we do and take the challenges of a 'start up' type environment in your stride.  § §What next?§ §If this sounds like you, please apply with a CV and Cover Letter.  In your Cover Letter, please tell us:§ § §What an exceptional client experience means to you;§ §What you LOVE the most about Recruitment;§ §What you DISLIKE the most about Recruitment;§ §What area of HR (other than Recruitment!) that you are the MOST interested in and why.§ §How many hours per week you would be looking for.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years of recruitment experience do you have?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§How many years' experience do you have in Human Resources (HR)?§§§

jobTitle: Office Manager / Personal Assistant Job in Wellington - SEEK

Duties will range from meeting and greeting clients to bid / tender coordination (document formatting and proofreading) and will also have a big focus on general office administration and supplier management. Further to this, you will also be the PA to the Directors, including running some personal errands and be responsible for financial admin. §The ideal candidate will ideally have 3-5 years' experience working in a corporate environment and have unparalleled organisational skills. Multi-tasking and time management will also be critical as you will be juggling a number of tasks at any given time. Exceptional MS Office skills are also required. §Benefits include working in a fun and collaborative team in modern offices. They are as busy as ever and are very stable. jobTitle: Office Manager Job in Manawatu - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50655728.txt	§Office Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Office Manager§§Advertiser: §The Factory NZ Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Sept 2020§§Location§§Manawatu§, §Palmerston North§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Office Management§§§§§§Sprout Agritech is looking for a positive, team focussed and proactive Office Manager to keep the team and operations working like a well-oiled machine. Reporting to the Chief Executive Officer, this is an excellent role for someone who enjoys variety and supporting a dynamic team.§  §About Sprout Agritech§  §Sprout Agritech is a seed-stage accelerator and globally-connected investor in world-class agri-food startups in New Zealand.§  §It backs bold agritech and future food businesses and entrepreneurs who move fast, think big, and are committed to building solutions for problems that reach from farm to fork.§  §A day in the life of…§  §As our Office Manager, your core activities will include:§ § §Providing support to the CEO, including diary, document preparation (including board reports), and expense claim management.§ §Look after our office and its interior, ensuring its appearance and overall impression are aligned with our values.§ §Work alongside our accountants and administer financial activities such as investment fund transfers, daily reconciliations, monthly accounts, staff pay, and financial reporting information.§ §Provide general administrative support to the team across subscriptions, mail, vehicle coordination, and office supplies.§ §We're looking for an open and honest communicator, who enjoys building and maintaining strong relationships both within your team and external contacts that you interact with.  §  §This is a fulltime position however we do offer a flexible working environment.§  §And where you'll be based:§  §This position will be located at Sprout Agritech’s office at The Factory, Palmerston North's innovation-focused co-working space. The original 1926 building has been recently renovated and is a wonderful mix of 90-year old industrial architecture and 21st century technology and interior.   You'll have access to an espresso machine in the shared kitchen (barista classes are included); regular Food Truck lunch-times and the building includes "The Lounge", the uber-cool onsite café which you are welcome to use to have lunch, mix with other residents, etc. §  §Sprout Agritech’s working space is a large, bright open plan environment. Our team has a wide range of strengths and diverse backgrounds. We value uncompromising commitment to excellence, making it happen, thinking big, and teamwork.§  §Requirements§ § §NCEA Level 3 (minimum) or equivalent.§ §Financial Literacy§ §Ready to apply?§  §Use the ‘apply now’ button below to apply.  If you have any questions or wish to discuss the role further, please contact §rachel@peopleworx.co.nz§.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as an office manager?§Which of the following Microsoft Office products are you experienced with?§Do you have experience in an administration role?§Do you have experience using Xero?§§§

Reporting to the Director Research Services, the role provides professional support for contracting services that optimise R&I's services from initial funding to commercialisation.§As the ideal candidate, you will have:§extensive professional work experience in a senior administrative or customer services role, preferably in a large organisation§ability to problem solve in a fast paced environment§excellent communication and interpersonal skills§experience with contracting, particularly managing intellectual property and risk management§understanding of budget formulation and basic accounting practices§operating database systems and competency in Microsoft Office programmes§If you have the appropriate experience as well as excellent time management and relationship building skills - we would like you on our team today!§Who You Will Work With§The Research & Innovation team within the Deputy Vice-Chancellor's Office supports and provides over-arching vision and leadership within UC's award-winning and prestigious research arena. As a team we work collaboratively and are skilled in creative thinking to build national and international linkages for fundamental and applied research. You can find more information on our team here: §Research & Innovation§Why UC§ §Tangata Tū, Tangata Ora - Engaged, Empowered, Making a Difference.§The University of Canterbury is committed to accessible higher education, service to community and the encouragement of talent without barriers of distance, wealth, class, gender or ethnicity. The University explicitly aims to produce graduates and support staff who are engaged with their communities, empowered to act for good and determined to make a difference in the world.§For information about the range of fantastic benefits that UC offers including flexible work practices, study opportunities and generous superannuation and leave provisions, please visit us: §http://www.canterbury.ac.nz/joinus§The University of Canterbury is an Equal Employment Opportunities (§EEO§) employer and we encourage diversity in our staffing profile. The University of Canterbury actively seeks to meet its obligation under the Treaty of Waitangi | Te Tiriti o Waitangi.§The closing date for this position is: Sunday, 18th October 2020 (midnight, NZ time)§How You Apply§Applications for this position must be submitted on our §careers website§ and should include a cover letter and resume§. §Please note, we do not accept applications by email, however we are happy to answer your queries in relation to the application process, please forward these to §WorkatUC@canterbury.ac.nz§Due to current border restrictions, you must have New Zealand Citizenship/Residency to be considered for this role. If you hold a valid work visa and are physically present in New Zealand then you may also be considered.§Click here to view the role description§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Medical Typist Job in Otago - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50656964.txt	§Medical Typist§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Medical Typist§§Advertiser: §Southern District Health Board§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Sept 2020§§Location§§Otago§, §Dunedin§§Salary§§$45,720 - $48,740§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Other§§§§§§Paediatric Outpatients§Dunedin Hospital §§Permanent opportunity - 16 Hours per week§Busy, varied and vibrant service§§About the team§You will be working within a professional multi-disciplinary team consisting of several health disciplines. Our typists provide support to each other and foster a fun and friendly atmosphere.§About the role§After a comprehensive orientation to the role, you will be dealing with patient information to transcribe operation notes and clinical letters within certain time frames. The majority of your work will be undertaken by Dictaphone, so being confident around this technology is a must. Your demonstrated typing skills and accuracy will be utilised, as well as your strong communication skills to interact and work alongside the wider team.§About you§To enjoy the Medical Typist position you'll be the kind of person who likes a fast paced environment and thrive at working to deadlines. As you’ll be dealing with patient information it is essential that you show us you have an eye for accuracy and are confident around computer systems, including Dictaphone typing.§This role requires someone with a typing speed of at least 70 words per minute and ideally you will have medical typing experience or be an excellent typist with an interest in the health field.§The salary for this position will be $45,720 - $48,740 per annum (pro rata) as per the PSA Admin MECA, and will be based on relevant experience.§About Southern DHB§Southern DHB has the largest regional coverage of all the New Zealand health boards, providing services to 350,000 people in diverse communities across a huge geographical area. We take pride in all the services we provide and our aim is to improve, promote and protect the health of our region. We believe that our dedicated and passionate staff are a significant driving force behind the achievement of these standards, and we need more like-minded people to help us continue providing for our community.§Closing date: Wednesday, 14 October 2020.§Please note we may begin shortlisting as we receive applications and if necessary withdraw the advertising at any time. For further information, please contact Tara Hobbs, Recruitment Advisor – Women's & Children's Health Directorate. Phone: §(03) 470 9357§ or Email: §Tara.Hobbs@southerndhb.govt.nz§§Children's Act 2014§Due to this position potentially having contact with children, and the SDHB’s commitment to child protection, you will be subject to ‘safety checks’ under the Children’s Act at the time of hire and thereafter as per the relevant legislation.§Pre-employment occupational health Aassessment§In the interests of protecting our people and our patients, all appointments will be subject to an Occupational Health Assessment to confirm suitability and fitness to work in the role you are being considered for.§To apply:§We only accept online applications. Please apply via our website: §www.southerndhb.govt.nz/careers/§Click here to view the role description§§§§

jobTitle: Administrator/Receptionist - Richmond Health Hub Job in Tasman - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50657130.txt	§Administrator/Receptionist - Richmond Health Hub§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Administrator/Receptionist - Richmond Health Hub§§Advertiser: §Nelson Marlborough Health§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Sept 2020§§Location§§Tasman§, §Nelson§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Administrative Assistants§§§§§§§Permanent, full-time position§Gain experience working in the health sector§Frontline role in a friendly, supportive team environment§Ngā mōhiohio e pā ana ki tēnei mahi (About this position)§We are looking for an experienced Administrator who is highly organised, pleasantly efficient and thrives in a busy environment to join our team located at the Richmond Health Hub.§Duties will vary on a weekly basis, but will include: reception, triaging calls, data entry and other administrative tasks. It will be important that you respect patient confidentiality and have demonstrated the ability to manage a busy multitasking workload, while remaining calm under pressure.§This is a full-time position, working 80 hours a fortnight. Your usual hours of work will be 10:30AM to 7.00PM Monday, and 8.00AM to 4:30PM Tuesday to Friday, however there may be some flexibility available.§Ko wai he kaitono tōtika? (Who is an appropriate applicant?)§You will be a bright, outgoing self-starter with excellent interpersonal skills and a passion for delivering high-quality customer service.§Accurate computer and data entry skills are essential, as is your willingness to learn new software and demonstrate an appropriate level of initiative.§Ā mātou rōpū (About our team)§Nelson Marlborough Health is the main health provider for the top of the south. Nearly 3,000 strong, we are Nelson and Marlborough's largest employer, which means the opportunities here are endless. Our main locations are Nelson and Wairau Hospitals but we are spread across the region and service all parts of the community. Our work can be challenging, but we are up for it. We have a great team and we work hard to make a difference. We value integrity, innovation, respect and teamwork.§Ētahi atu mōhiohio (More Information)§https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC34XErxkHJ5YAn59o6SrhnA§Ngā huanga o tēnei mahi (The benefits of this position) §We can offer you meaningful work in a busy and supportive environment in return for your commitment and personable efficiency.§Me pēhea ahau e tono ai? (How do I apply?)§For enquiries please contact our recruitment team on §vacancies@nmdhb.govt.nz§ or §03 546 1274§Keen to apply now, it's easy. Please fill in our online application form.§https://nmdhb.careercentre.net.nz§N20-401.§Applications close on Sunday, 11October 2020.§Nelson Marlborough Health strongly endorses Te Tiriti o Waitangi.§We believe that to achieve equity in health outcomes for Māori we need a workforce reflective of the population it serves. We strongly encourage applications from candidates who identify as Māori and we recruit for cultural competence.§He waka eke noa. We are all in this together§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

It may also involve some creative aspects like putting together digital presentations, newsletters, creating an event invitation or updating client documents with company branding.§ §We need someone who is comfortable with doing a variety of activities and is a quick learner – §being tech savvy is a great advantage!§ § §Part Time  Monday-Wednesday: 8:30 – 4:30§ §Proficiency in the use of the following: § §Mail Chimp, PowerPoint, PDF Expert, Google Drive, Excel, Outlook, newsletters§ § § §You need to be adaptable and flexible to the task of the day§ §Professional, good communicator, people person, energetic, self-motivated, ability to self-manage, good time management skills.§ §Attention to detail and good understanding of the English language is essential.§ §We are after a thinker and doer with a good attitude and willingness to learn to join our growing team!§ §Please note that only successful candidates will be contacted. § § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as an office administrator?§Do you have experience in an administration role?§Which of the following Microsoft Office products are you experienced with?§How would you rate your English language skills?§§§

We are responsible for providing active stewardship and leadership across the nation's health and disability system. We ensure the health system provides people with the highest levels of care, regardless of who they are or where they live.§        §You will find a copy of the position description attached or online at §careers.health.govt.nz§        §Please click 'apply for this job' to upload your CV and cover letter.§        §For further information regarding the role, please contact the Recruitment team at §recruitment@health.govt.nz§        §If you have any accessibility needs you would like to discuss, please call §+64 4 816 2478§.§        §Advertising for this role closes at midnight on Wednesday, 14 October 2020.§        §We encourage diversity and inclusion at the Ministry of Health and are committed to equal opportunity in all our employment policies and procedures. In particular, we want to ensure accessibility needs are well supported, so the recruitment process is fair and equitable for all. Therefore, please let us know if there is any support we can provide to ensure the recruitment process is fully accessible to you. You can contact us at §recruitment@health.govt.nz§ if you would like to discuss any accessibility needs you may have.§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§Provide project and administration support to the Health and Disability Intelligence group§Opportunity to have impact by helping teams manage and prioritise their analysis and research§Use your experience and learn new skills to develop strong relationships across the group and Ministry§Are you looking for a challenging and rewarding role that will improve our delivery of research and analytics?§As the Project Coordinator you will be a key member of the Health and Disability Intelligence (HDI) group. You will report to the Manager, Analytical Projects however you will provide support to all three teams across the group - Analytical Projects, Health Survey and Service Analysis and Modelling.§We are looking for an enthusiastic and experienced Project Coordinator. This is a great opportunity for you to make your mark and contribute your administration and project management skills to help our managers and their teams to co-ordinate their work programme so that we can better monitor, report on and deliver our projects.§In this position you will be expected to:§work flexibly and in a fast-paced environment where priorities can change suddenly§contribute to our various programmes of work by providing support such as budgeting, risk and issue management and monitoring our timelines§make everything work smoothly by providing administration support across HDI, including making travel and meeting arrangements, taking minutes, processing invoices, onboarding staff, proof reading, as well as assisting with data co-ordination activities§work with project leaders and Managers to plan and report on, projects and regular activities using work planning tools and methods.§To be successful in this position you must be able to demonstrate:§previous experience with document management systems, accounts/finance systems and project management tools such as Microsoft Project§strong communication, interpersonal and technical skills§an established track record in successfully planning and managing projects and working with others to deliver outputs§knowledge of administration systems, project management tools and techniques§excellent prioritisation skills along with the ability to be flexible and juggle a number of tasks simultaneously.§The Ministry of Health is the kaitiaki of the health and disability system in New Zealand. We are responsible for providing active stewardship and leadership across the nation's health and disability system. We ensure the health system provides people with the highest levels of care, regardless of who they are or where they live.§You will find a copy of the position description attached or online at §careers.health.govt.nz§Please click 'apply for this job' to upload your CV and cover letter.§For further information regarding the role, please contact the Recruitment team at §recruitment@health.govt.nz§If you have any accessibility needs you would like to discuss, please call §+64 4 816 2478§.§Advertising for this role closes at midnight on Wednesday, 14 October 2020.§We encourage diversity and inclusion at the Ministry of Health and are committed to equal opportunity in all our employment policies and procedures. jobTitle: Reception/Admin Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50658215.txt	§Reception/Admin§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Reception/Admin§§Advertiser: §Triangle Recruitment Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Administrative Assistants§§§§§§§§§  §    §      §Reception/Admin §      §        §A specialist practice that offers alternative  treatment for mainly chronic pain sufferers based city fringe. Due to increase in demand and growth over the last 12 months  they are now seeking a multi skilled person to join their small team.§        §They have a range of clients so are seeking  an enthusiastic self starter to provide high quality reception and administrative support for  their team of specialists.  This is a warm and friendly environment whose clientele can sometimes be more mature so lots of empathy is a must!!§        §About the role§        §          §Answering incoming calls and scheduling appointments §          §Inputting Data into their  Practice Management system§          §Co-ordinating patients records and inputting relevant data§          §Greeting clients and making them feel welcomed§          §Sending emails to confirm appointments§        §        §As this is a small team you will need to be hands on and be flexible as some of the time you may be there by yourself, so a proactive approach is a must.§        §To be successful in this role you will need to have excellent attention to details, flexible approach  with solid computer skills and able to learn new systems quickly.  §        §It is a varied role and does require a special person who can answer phones and input data accurately and be warm and welcoming to their range of clients.  Also keeping this small practice neat and tidy is also part of the role.§        §Great role to make it your own!!!§      §    §    §  §§§A specialist practice that offers alternative  treatment for mainly chronic pain sufferers based city fringe. Due to increase in demand and growth over the last 12 months  they are now seeking a multi skilled person to join their small team.§They have a range of clients so are seeking  an enthusiastic self starter to provide high quality reception and administrative support for  their team of specialists.  This is a warm and friendly environment whose clientele can sometimes be more mature so lots of empathy is a must!!§About the role§§Answering incoming calls and scheduling appointments §Inputting Data into their  Practice Management system§Co-ordinating patients records and inputting relevant data§Greeting clients and making them feel welcomed§Sending emails to confirm appointments§As this is a small team you will need to be hands on and be flexible as some of the time you may be there by yourself, so a proactive approach is a must.§To be successful in this role you will need to have excellent attention to details, flexible approach  with solid computer skills and able to learn new systems quickly.  §It is a varied role and does require a special person who can answer phones and input data accurately and be warm and welcoming to their range of clients.  Also keeping this small practice neat and tidy is also part of the role.§Great role to make it your own!!!§§§§

The Group includes Building Services, Building Consents, Environmental Consents, Compliance and Monitoring, Environmental Policy, Environmental Health/Liquor Animal control and Parking. §Ou wheako –about you§§To be successful in this role you must have:§§Excellent skills in the use of Microsoft Office applications including Excel, Word, Publisher & Powerpoint§ §Good time management skills§ §The ability to communicate effectively§ §Be able to work under pressure § §Good interpersonal skills.§In this role you will find yourself providing clerical support across the various functions of the Planning & Regulatory Services Group this may include: §§Processing various legal documents within statutory time frames e.g.., Code Compliance certificates§ §Creating invoices, processing claims, issuing refunds and tracking payments§ §Preparing and updating key documents and databases§ §Processing Infringement and Enforcement Notices §Our work environment is professional, progressive and supports continuous learning and development, if this sounds like you and you have the skills and attitude to be successful in this role then apply today. jobTitle: Kaitakawaenga / Court Co-ordinator (2 Positions) Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50661426.txt	§Kaitakawaenga / Court Co-ordinator (2 Positions)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Kaitakawaenga / Court Co-ordinator (2 Positions)§§Advertiser: §Manukau Urban Maori Authority§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Manukau & East Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Administrative Assistants§§§§§§Restorative Justice Court Co-ordinator (2 Positions)§ §Full-time Permanent§ § § §Manukau Urban Maori Authority (MUMA) is a progressive, dynamic community organisation that is driven by our vision, mission and values, as we strive to advance urban Maori aspirations, whilst being Kaupapa Maori Marae based and embracing Te Reo me ona Tikanga practices.§ §This is an opportunity for you to play a key part in supporting the important work of MUMA alongside its justice sector partners. You will be part of the MUMA Restorative Practices team based in South Auckland, and a key point of contact for court users.§ §In this role, you will have a good understanding of the justice system with a particular focus on restorative justice.  You will have a strong customer service focus, be process focused and methodical yet responsive and flexible enough to ensure that services are delivered in a consistently and of a high quality. § §You will also have experience working with diverse communities and understand the need to think holistically when dealing with clients and whānau.  It would be advantageous that you are already restorative justice trained and accredited, however training will be provided.§ §Exceptional customer service is essential for this role, as you will be dealing with clients and their whānau, court staff, members of the judiciary, and Police. You will be flexible in your approach and have a “can do” attitude to problem solving.  A full clean driving licence is required.§ §Our Court Co-ordinators will based at Manukau District Court, Papakura and Pukekohe Courts.§ §This position is ideal for someone who is comfortable working in a formal environment while supporting whānau through their justice obligations.  § §Candidates are encouraged to provide a Cover letter stating clearly why you should be considered to join our ‘Mau te Rongo’ RJ team, an up-to-date CV and you MUST hold a current full NZ driver's licence.§ § § §Applications CLOSE at 4.00pm on the 14th October 2020.§ § § §Shortlisted candidates will be advised after the applications close. Interviews will be arranged with each successful candidate at a suitable date and time from the§ 15th October 2020,§ and the successful candidate will be advised by§ 24th October 2020§.§ § § § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§§§

jobTitle: Document Controller - Major Projects Tauranga Job in Bay of Plenty - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50661750.txt	§Document Controller - Major Projects Tauranga§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Document Controller - Major Projects Tauranga§§Advertiser: §Fulton Hogan§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Sept 2020§§Location§§Bay of Plenty§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Records Management & Document Control§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Document Controller - Major Projects Tauranga §      §        §The Job§        §Work alongside some of New Zealand’s most talented Civil Construction professionals on a project based in Tauranga.§        §As the Document Controller, you will be the Gate Keeper of all project drafts, reports, engineering records, quotes and other confidential project-related paperwork.  This is a crucial role on any project - we value confidentiality and ensuring that the correct information is shared with the right people, without issue.§        §In addition to this, you will be maintaining the documentation/records management system and document control registers for the project, ensuring the accurate and timely records of all project-related documentation, including subsequent alterations that occur to these documents, is kept in the right place and is at your fingertips at all times.  Responsibilities will include document retention, retrieval and filing of all project documentation, issuing and distributing documentation to the right stakeholders, issue and revision control of all construction drawings.§        § §        §The Candidate§        §Do you live by the mantra “there is a place for everything and everything in its place”? Do you enjoy creating processes and procedures?  If you answered ‘yes’ to both of these questions; this could well be the perfect opportunity for you!§        §As our Document Controller, you use your organisational skills to the fullest and become the point of contact for all enquires related to important paperwork on the project.  A true team player, you will enjoy being at the heart of things, take pride in the fact you know exactly where documents are and be the expert that works closely other team members such as the Engineering and Project Controls teams to ensure they have the information they need. A Records & Information or Construction Engineering qualification will be advantageous. On-the-job training and support will be provided.§        §In this role you will be challenged and be able to apply your:§        §          §Knowledge of Microsoft Office, including Outlook and Word§          §IMS knowledge§          §Strong written and oral communication skills§          §Previous experience compiling and producing cogent procedure manuals/documents§          §Attention to detail and initiative§          §Ability to learn and develop new systems quickly§          §Prior construction experience is an advantage but not a requirement§        §        §The Company§        §At Fulton Hogan we work hard to be the best, we give it our all and we take pride in what we do. We know we’re only as good as our people, so we are committed to hiring, developing and retaining only the best to join our teams! Fulton Hogan is a major civil contracting company offering clients services in civil contracting, construction, infrastructure maintenance, quarrying and asphalt production and surfacing. We are committed to providing cutting-edge innovative, cost effective solutions for customers and for the community. §        § §        §If this sounds like the exciting next step in your career, and you are as passionate as we are about producing quality work with an uncompromising attitude towards safety, then apply today!§        §Successful applicants will be required to undergo and pass a pre-employment medical and drugs screen.§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§The Job§Work alongside some of New Zealand’s most talented Civil Construction professionals on a project based in Tauranga.§As the Document Controller, you will be the Gate Keeper of all project drafts, reports, engineering records, quotes and other confidential project-related paperwork.  This is a crucial role on any project - we value confidentiality and ensuring that the correct information is shared with the right people, without issue.§In addition to this, you will be maintaining the documentation/records management system and document control registers for the project, ensuring the accurate and timely records of all project-related documentation, including subsequent alterations that occur to these documents, is kept in the right place and is at your fingertips at all times.  Responsibilities will include document retention, retrieval and filing of all project documentation, issuing and distributing documentation to the right stakeholders, issue and revision control of all construction drawings.§ §The Candidate§Do you live by the mantra “there is a place for everything and everything in its place”? Do you enjoy creating processes and procedures?  If you answered ‘yes’ to both of these questions; this could well be the perfect opportunity for you!§As our Document Controller, you use your organisational skills to the fullest and become the point of contact for all enquires related to important paperwork on the project.  A true team player, you will enjoy being at the heart of things, take pride in the fact you know exactly where documents are and be the expert that works closely other team members such as the Engineering and Project Controls teams to ensure they have the information they need. A Records & Information or Construction Engineering qualification will be advantageous. On-the-job training and support will be provided.§In this role you will be challenged and be able to apply your:§§Knowledge of Microsoft Office, including Outlook and Word§IMS knowledge§Strong written and oral communication skills§Previous experience compiling and producing cogent procedure manuals/documents§Attention to detail and initiative§Ability to learn and develop new systems quickly§Prior construction experience is an advantage but not a requirement§§The Company§At Fulton Hogan we work hard to be the best, we give it our all and we take pride in what we do. We know we’re only as good as our people, so we are committed to hiring, developing and retaining only the best to join our teams! Fulton Hogan is a major civil contracting company offering clients services in civil contracting, construction, infrastructure maintenance, quarrying and asphalt production and surfacing. We are committed to providing cutting-edge innovative, cost effective solutions for customers and for the community. § §If this sounds like the exciting next step in your career, and you are as passionate as we are about producing quality work with an uncompromising attitude towards safety, then apply today!§§Successful applicants will be required to undergo and pass a pre-employment medical and drugs screen.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

On-the-job training and support will be provided.§        §In this role you will be challenged and be able to apply your:§        §          §Knowledge of Microsoft Office, including Outlook and Word§          §IMS knowledge§          §Strong written and oral communication skills§          §Previous experience compiling and producing cogent procedure manuals/documents§          §Attention to detail and initiative§          §Ability to learn and develop new systems quickly§          §Prior construction experience is an advantage but not a requirement§        §        §The Company§        §At Fulton Hogan we work hard to be the best, we give it our all and we take pride in what we do. We know we’re only as good as our people, so we are committed to hiring, developing and retaining only the best to join our teams! Fulton Hogan is a major civil contracting company offering clients services in civil contracting, construction, infrastructure maintenance, quarrying and asphalt production and surfacing. We are committed to providing cutting-edge innovative, cost effective solutions for customers and for the community. §        § §        §If this sounds like the exciting next step in your career, and you are as passionate as we are about producing quality work with an uncompromising attitude towards safety, then apply today!§        §Successful applicants will be required to undergo and pass a pre-employment medical and drugs screen.§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§The Job§Working alongside some of New Zealand’s most talented Civil Construction professionals, you will be exposed to a variety of different projects throughout New Zealand.§As the Document Controller, you will be the Gate Keeper of all project drafts, reports, engineering records, quotes and other confidential project-related paperwork.  This is a crucial role on any project - we value confidentiality and ensuring that the correct information is shared with the right people, without issue.§In addition to this, you will be maintaining the documentation/records management system and document control registers for the project, ensuring the accurate and timely records of all project-related documentation, including subsequent alterations that occur to these documents, is kept in the right place and is at your fingertips at all times.  Responsibilities will include document retention, retrieval and filing of all project documentation, issuing and distributing documentation to the right stakeholders, issue and revision control of all construction drawings.§ §The Candidate§Do you live by the mantra “there is a place for everything and everything in its place”? Do you enjoy creating processes and procedures?  If you answered ‘yes’ to both of these questions; this could well be the perfect opportunity for you!§As our Document Controller, you use your organisational skills to the fullest and become the point of contact for all enquires related to important paperwork on the project.  A true team player, you will enjoy being at the heart of things, take pride in the fact you know exactly where documents are and be the expert that works closely other team members such as the Engineering and Project Controls teams to ensure they have the information they need. A Records & Information or Construction Engineering qualification will be advantageous. On-the-job training and support will be provided.§In this role you will be challenged and be able to apply your:§§Knowledge of Microsoft Office, including Outlook and Word§IMS knowledge§Strong written and oral communication skills§Previous experience compiling and producing cogent procedure manuals/documents§Attention to detail and initiative§Ability to learn and develop new systems quickly§Prior construction experience is an advantage but not a requirement§§The Company§At Fulton Hogan we work hard to be the best, we give it our all and we take pride in what we do. We know we’re only as good as our people, so we are committed to hiring, developing and retaining only the best to join our teams! Fulton Hogan is a major civil contracting company offering clients services in civil contracting, construction, infrastructure maintenance, quarrying and asphalt production and surfacing. We are committed to providing cutting-edge innovative, cost effective solutions for customers and for the community. § §If this sounds like the exciting next step in your career, and you are as passionate as we are about producing quality work with an uncompromising attitude towards safety, then apply today!§§Successful applicants will be required to undergo and pass a pre-employment medical and drugs screen.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§
