With 40,000+ employees in over 100 countries, Nielsen is one of the world’s biggest data measurement companies, and we pride ourselves on providing our people with endless§possibilities and paths to grow their careers.§Simply put, we do two things at Nielsen. We measure performance for our clients and we use analytics to help our clients grow their business. At Nielsen, we make a difference by partnering with our clients and§using our data to explain what is happening with their brands and what they should do to improve business performance. We use our data to help our clients understanding of what their consumers watch on Television§        § §        §About the role§        §As an §Operations Coordinator§, you will receive data from our TV panel and undertake a range of quality control checks, identifying and investigating any issues or anomalies.§        §You will utilise your organisation and communication skills to liaise with our panel on a range of issues, and organise our technicians to provide onsite support.§ §        §Requirements§        §          §Fresh graduates are encouraged to apply §          §Candidate must possess full-time work rights in New Zealand §          §An ability to understand technical information and an eye for detail§          §Good numerical and analytical skills with experience working with multiple databases§          §Intermediate to advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel (including VLookUps and Pivot tables)§          §Excellent written and verbal communication skills to effectively liaise with a wide range of people§          §Strong organisational skills§          §Shows initiative and a strong sense of urgency§        §      §      §      §    §  §§§Be a part of something big. With 40,000+ employees in over 100 countries, Nielsen is one of the world’s biggest data measurement companies, and we pride ourselves on providing our people with endless§possibilities and paths to grow their careers.§Simply put, we do two things at Nielsen. We measure performance for our clients and we use analytics to help our clients grow their business. At Nielsen, we make a difference by partnering with our clients and§using our data to explain what is happening with their brands and what they should do to improve business performance. We use our data to help our clients understanding of what their consumers watch on Television§ § § §About the role§ §As an §Operations Coordinator§, you will receive data from our TV panel and undertake a range of quality control checks, identifying and investigating any issues or anomalies.§ §You will utilise your organisation and communication skills to liaise with our panel on a range of issues, and organise our technicians to provide onsite support.§ § §Requirements§ § §Fresh graduates are encouraged to apply § §Candidate must possess full-time work rights in New Zealand § §An ability to understand technical information and an eye for detail§ §Good numerical and analytical skills with experience working with multiple databases§ §Intermediate to advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel (including VLookUps and Pivot tables)§ §Excellent written and verbal communication skills to effectively liaise with a wide range of people§ §Strong organisational skills§ §Shows initiative and a strong sense of urgency§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§

jobText: TXT/50661961.txt	§Executive Assistant§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Executive Assistant§§Advertiser: §Asset Recruitment Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Sept 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Hamilton§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §PA, EA & Secretarial§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Executive Assistant §      §      §      §        §January 2021 Start§        §Greenlea Premier Meats is a family owned and operated company, energetic and an innovative player in the New Zealand Beef Industry.  To achieve Greenlea's Vision of “Quality Foods that Grow People and our Planet”, the organisation needs people who understand the clear responsibilities and accountabilities of their role, who demonstrate excellent performance and embody the Greenlea values of:§Integrity - Excellence - Innovation - One Team§We are looking for an experienced Executive Assistant professional, who will provide exceptional administrative support to the Greenlea Board of Directors and Senior Management Team by demonstrating a drive to do things better.  This is an important role in building relationships across the company. The applicant must be able to adapt to a constantly evolving role and have the confidence to work autonomously.§Key tasks will include preparation and distribution of monthly board papers including setting the agenda, attendance and minutes of all board and other meetings, payroll processing of monthly salaries, collating the fortnightly staff newsletter and managing travel itineraries. You will also act as an Administrator to the Greenlea Foundation Charitable Trust and organise all staff events.§With demonstrated previous experience as an Executive Assistant, you will have strong organisational, project management and problem solving skills and the ability to remain calm and objective when under pressure. A high level of discretion and computer literacy will be essential.§This is the perfect role with a company that lives and breathes their values and are proud of their talented and dedicated team.§Don't miss out on this opportunity!§ §        §All applicants MUST have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa to be considered for this position.§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§January 2021 Start§§Greenlea Premier Meats is a family owned and operated company, energetic and an innovative player in the New Zealand Beef Industry.  To achieve Greenlea's Vision of “Quality Foods that Grow People and our Planet”, the organisation needs people who understand the clear responsibilities and accountabilities of their role, who demonstrate excellent performance and embody the Greenlea values of:§Integrity - Excellence - Innovation - One Team§We are looking for an experienced Executive Assistant professional, who will provide exceptional administrative support to the Greenlea Board of Directors and Senior Management Team by demonstrating a drive to do things better.  This is an important role in building relationships across the company. The applicant must be able to adapt to a constantly evolving role and have the confidence to work autonomously.§Key tasks will include preparation and distribution of monthly board papers including setting the agenda, attendance and minutes of all board and other meetings, payroll processing of monthly salaries, collating the fortnightly staff newsletter and managing travel itineraries. You will also act as an Administrator to the Greenlea Foundation Charitable Trust and organise all staff events.§With demonstrated previous experience as an Executive Assistant, you will have strong organisational, project management and problem solving skills and the ability to remain calm and objective when under pressure. A high level of discretion and computer literacy will be essential.§This is the perfect role with a company that lives and breathes their values and are proud of their talented and dedicated team.§Don't miss out on this opportunity!§ §All applicants MUST have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa to be considered for this position.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50661976.txt	§Senior Court Judges' Associate §§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Court Judges' Associate §§Advertiser: §Ministry of Justice§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §PA, EA & Secretarial§§§§§§Senior Court Judges' Associate §§Auckland High Court§§Permanent, full-time§§ §§Te āhuatunga a te tūranga/About the Role§Are you an experienced and professional executive assistant open to an interesting role?§We are looking for a person who will provide high level executive management and administration support to ensure the Judge is able to focus on their responsibilities for the orderly and efficient conduct of the business of the court.§ §Mō te tīma/About our Team§At Tāhū o te Ture - the Ministry of Justice, we're committed to working together for a fair and safe Aotearoa.§ §§Joining the Ministry of Justice means you will become part of an inclusive organisation that values you and the communities we serve. §It's our promise to ensure our workplace is one where our people feel healthy and safe, supported and able to be themselves at work. We value respect as the foundation for building a positive workplace culture and one where diversity is welcomed and celebrated. §§ §§He pūkenga tou/Skills and Experience§§Extensive experience providing executive support within the court systems or a legal firm is desired but not essential§Advanced level of proficiency in office procedures, business processes and database management§Advanced IT capability in a wide range of applications plus the ability to quickly learn and keep up-to-date with constantly changing technology trends§Typing speed of at least 80 wpm with a very high level of accuracy and presentation§§You will also need to be available for domestic travel on a regular basis, sometimes at short notice and for extended periods.§ §Tono mai/How to Apply§To apply, click the Apply button below to be directed to our Careers Website. You can view a detailed position description here, as well as complete an online application form by attaching your CV and cover letter.§Applications close at 5pm on Tuesday 20 October 2020.§If you have any questions, please contact §recruitment@justice.govt.nz§§§§

jobTitle: Media Coordinator Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50662018.txt	§Media Coordinator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Media Coordinator§§Advertiser: §NZME§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Porirua & Kapiti Coast§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Client & Sales Administration§§§§§§New Zealand Media and Entertainment is where people come together. §From the Cape to Bluff audiences gather in huge numbers to read, listen and engage with NZME.§We keep Kiwis in the know about what matters most to them. We dig into what’s going on in the world and why, along with the latest and greatest in entertainment.§ §We do it across over 50 of New Zealand’s leading media brands – each with its own voice, and each powered by the country’s top media personalities, journalists, broadcasters, writers, and commercial thinkers.§ §Combining radio, digital and print we reach over 3.3 million Kiwis every week. Whether you’re looking to target a mass audience or tap a niche or local market – NZME will put you in front of the right people.§ §THE ROLE:§ §We’re looking for the next superstar to join our team based in the Kāpiti Coast District. You’ll be great with detail, quick to learn new systems, love a fast-paced environment, and enjoy dealing with people. Multitasking will be your forte, you thrive on a busy environment and are a superstar when it comes to organisation. This role is an essential part of the team and integral to our success.§ §RESPONSIBILITIES:§ §Working across our Print, Radio and Digital platforms you’ll work with a team who require a high level of communication, admin and sales support. Your customer service skills will be of the highest quality, you will need to feel comfortable with multiple deadlines and can manage both your internal and external customers priorities.§ §THE PERKS:§ §Your future team-mates are a great bunch who enjoy working hard, striving for success and having fun along the way. Why don’t you send us your CV? (Be sure to include a cover letter introducing yourself).This is a great role to springboard your next step into the media world, and we’re here to help you do exactly that. And for all this, we’re offering an incredibly inspirational crew to work with, in a supportive and open environment who all live and breathe our values to: Be Connected, Be Curious and Be Confident in our aim to be the home of the best talent in New Zealand. This is the opportunity you’ve been waiting for, apply now with CV and covering letter displaying your brilliance.§ §Applicants for this position must have NZ residency or a valid NZ work permit.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§

jobTitle: Pasifika Liaison - Palliative Care Services (Fixed Term until 30 June 2021) Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50662106.txt	§Pasifika Liaison - Palliative Care Services (Fixed Term until 30 June 2021)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Pasifika Liaison - Palliative Care Services (Fixed Term until 30 June 2021)§§Advertiser: §Mary Potter Hospice§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Administrative Assistants§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §Pasifika Liaison - Palliative Care Services (Fixed Term until 30 June 2021) §    §    §      §        §Combine this opportunity to contribute your professional skills and expertise helping patients and families of one of Wellington's best loved charities and practice real work life balance.§        § §        §This role works closely with Pacific patients and their families to access and provide the care and support they need.  You will work closely with community multi-disciplinary teams.  In this role you will help implement the Pacific Service Plan, and work to increase awareness of Mary Potter Hospice and the services available to the Pacific community.§        § §        §Our values are very important to us and we apply them to all our people as well as patients and their families:§        §               Mana                           Respect§        §               Aroha                          Compassion§        §               Rangatiratanga           Dignity§        §               Manaakitanga             Hospitality§        §               Kaitiakitanga               Stewardship§        § §        §We are flexible in our approach to working hours and practice work life balance as part of our wellbeing programme for all staff.§        § §        §We will welcome applications from people with well-established networks across the Pacific communities, preferably with experience in the health sector including palliative care. The ability to speak conversational Samoan would be an advantage.  You will have strong relationship management skills and be comfortable supporting our staff to increase knowledge and understanding of Pacific cultures. You will also have a full driver’s license.§        § §        §If you think you might like to be part of our team here at Mary Potter Hospice we would love to hear from you.  A job description and application form can be obtained from our website www.marypotter.org.nz.  Please send a cover letter, CV and application form by §15th October 2020 §to Catherine Hart, Mary Potter Hospice, PO Box 7442, Newtown 6242 or email §catherine.hart@marypotter.org.nz§        § §        §For further information phone Vanessa Eldridge, Manager Day Services, 021 193 9808§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§Combine this opportunity to contribute your professional skills and expertise helping patients and families of one of Wellington's best loved charities and practice real work life balance.§ § § §This role works closely with Pacific patients and their families to access and provide the care and support they need.  You will work closely with community multi-disciplinary teams.  In this role you will help implement the Pacific Service Plan, and work to increase awareness of Mary Potter Hospice and the services available to the Pacific community.§ § § §Our values are very important to us and we apply them to all our people as well as patients and their families:§ §               Mana                           Respect§ §               Aroha                          Compassion§ §               Rangatiratanga           Dignity§ §               Manaakitanga             Hospitality§ §               Kaitiakitanga               Stewardship§ § § §We are flexible in our approach to working hours and practice work life balance as part of our wellbeing programme for all staff.§ § § §We will welcome applications from people with well-established networks across the Pacific communities, preferably with experience in the health sector including palliative care. The ability to speak conversational Samoan would be an advantage.  You will have strong relationship management skills and be comfortable supporting our staff to increase knowledge and understanding of Pacific cultures. You will also have a full driver’s license.§ § § §If you think you might like to be part of our team here at Mary Potter Hospice we would love to hear from you.  A job description and application form can be obtained from our website www.marypotter.org.nz.  Please send a cover letter, CV and application form by §15th October 2020 §to Catherine Hart, Mary Potter Hospice, PO Box 7442, Newtown 6242 or email §catherine.hart@marypotter.org.nz§ § § §For further information phone Vanessa Eldridge, Manager Day Services, 021 193 9808§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§

jobTitle: Team Coordinator, Christchurch Job in Canterbury - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50662340.txt	§Team Coordinator, Christchurch§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Team Coordinator, Christchurch§§Advertiser: §Grant Thornton New Zealand§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Sept 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §PA, EA & Secretarial§§§§§§§§§  §    §      §      §        §Team Coordinator, Christchurch §        §          §Grant Thornton New Zealand is a member of an ambitious global organisation providing audit, tax and advisory services to dynamic orgainisation’s to unlock their potential for growth. Our proactive teams led by approachable partners use insights, experience and instinct to understand complex issues for privately owned, publicly listed and public sector clients. §  § Our collaborative culture means we share ideas as well as the responsibility for making them happen, and our fresh thinking and agile working helps businesses, communities and our people to flourish§  § §About the Role§ We are a dynamic firm seeking a personable and experienced Team Coordinator! You will ensure the overall office runs smoothly and undertake the senior administrative and co-ordination function for our Business Advisory Services team.  §Your previous Team Coordinator / PA / Office Manager experience will ensure that you know how to maintain and work in an efficient admin function, have an eye for detail and manage competing priorities while delivering a high level of professional service. You will thrive in a team environment, ensuring all pieces come together as well as making improvements as you go. §  § §Responsibilities will include§ - supporting local partners with team co-ordination and month end processes § - assisting with organising team and client events § - co-ordination of one-off projects §  § §Skills needed§ - a proactive and efficient approach § - sound Microsoft Office suite knowledge and skills § - previous experience in similar role (professional services advantageous)§ - excellent communication skills §  § §Culture§ §At Grant Thornton we are committed to growing authentic and inclusive leaders who create a vibrant and innovative working environment that inspire and engage our people to perform to their potential. Our collaborative teams enjoy working together and ensure they are constantly learning, exceeding client requirements and expectations as a result.  §Our Partners are down to earth, approachable, and recognise and reward achievements of the team and individuals. We enable our team members to be themselves at work and match drive and commercial acumen with further opportunities to learn and advance. Our recently renovated open plan office promotes open communication, efficiency over excessive work hours and active social and sporting teams.§  § §Benefits§We offer a competitive remuneration package, a day to volunteer, flexible working arrangements and on-going professional development.§  § Applicants for this position require NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.§        §        §        §      §    §  §§§Grant Thornton New Zealand is a member of an ambitious global organisation providing audit, tax and advisory services to dynamic orgainisation’s to unlock their potential for growth. Our proactive teams led by approachable partners use insights, experience and instinct to understand complex issues for privately owned, publicly listed and public sector clients. §  § Our collaborative culture means we share ideas as well as the responsibility for making them happen, and our fresh thinking and agile working helps businesses, communities and our people to flourish§  § §About the Role§ We are a dynamic firm seeking a personable and experienced Team Coordinator! You will ensure the overall office runs smoothly and undertake the senior administrative and co-ordination function for our Business Advisory Services team.  §Your previous Team Coordinator / PA / Office Manager experience will ensure that you know how to maintain and work in an efficient admin function, have an eye for detail and manage competing priorities while delivering a high level of professional service. You will thrive in a team environment, ensuring all pieces come together as well as making improvements as you go. §  § §Responsibilities will include§ - supporting local partners with team co-ordination and month end processes § - assisting with organising team and client events § - co-ordination of one-off projects §  § §Skills needed§ - a proactive and efficient approach § - sound Microsoft Office suite knowledge and skills § - previous experience in similar role (professional services advantageous)§ - excellent communication skills §  § §Culture§ §At Grant Thornton we are committed to growing authentic and inclusive leaders who create a vibrant and innovative working environment that inspire and engage our people to perform to their potential. Our collaborative teams enjoy working together and ensure they are constantly learning, exceeding client requirements and expectations as a result.  §Our Partners are down to earth, approachable, and recognise and reward achievements of the team and individuals. We enable our team members to be themselves at work and match drive and commercial acumen with further opportunities to learn and advance. Our recently renovated open plan office promotes open communication, efficiency over excessive work hours and active social and sporting teams.§  § §Benefits§We offer a competitive remuneration package, a day to volunteer, flexible working arrangements and on-going professional development.§  § Applicants for this position require NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50662767.txt	§Administration Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Administration Manager§§Advertiser: §Federated Farmers Taranaki§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Sept 2020§§Location§§Taranaki§, §New Plymouth§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Other§§§§§§About the business and the role§ § § §Federated Farmers is a national membership-based organisation consisting of 24 provinces and employ professional staff who work for our member-farmers. As a democratic organisation, we give farmers a collective advocacy voice at both a regional, national and international level.§ §Taranaki Federated Farmers Provincial Executive are looking for a motivated, self-driven and enthusiastic individual to provide administrative support.§ § § §Job tasks and responsibilities§ § § §The role involves responsibility for the Taranaki Federated Farmers Province. This includes arranging executive meetings, organising and facilitating Taranaki wide events, working with members on issues and referring them to the right contact point. A basic understanding of all farming business related contractual agreements is preferred.§ §The administration manager will also facilitate the annual AGM, special events when needed & be responsible for the accounting needs of the province.§ §Hours Required: Part time (up to 30 hours) flexible working hours.  § § § §Skills and experience§ § § §To be successful in this role, you will need to have:§ §An interest and sound understanding of farming or a farming background§ User experience of Microsoft Office packages §A good understanding of running social media sites such as Facebook and Twitter§A good understanding of accounting fundamentals including Xero§Attention to detail with good problem solving skills §Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, trained in customer service and must be discrete§ A high degree of energy, be self-motivated with a flexible approach to your work and the tasks you perform.  Takes initiative with a willingness to take on extra work and responsibility if required.§A full drivers licence and own car§  §For further information and a job description please email: §Taranaki@fedfarm.org.nz§To apply for the role, either apply via Seek, or email your CV and covering letter to §Taranaki@fedfarm.org.nz§ § § §Applications close 5pm Sunday October 11§ § § §§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50662813.txt	§Reception / Broker Support§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Reception / Broker Support§§Advertiser: §LINK§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Salary§§$45,000 - $49,999§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Receptionists§§§§§§ABOUT LINK§ §LINK is the largest and most awarded business brokerage in the world, with strong local presence in New Zealand, Australia, the USA and the Philippines.§ §LINK’s core customers are buyers and sellers of businesses, and we are super proud of our growing reputation for delivering the highest level of customer service. This is built on integrity, honesty, uncompromising quality and a passion for connecting sellers with the right buyers. Our team is dedicated to helping every owner maximise the value of their business and enjoy a streamlined sale and transition period.§ § § §POSITION DESCRIPTION§ §We are looking for a Receptionist/Broker Support. It is important you will have a naturally cheerful and welcoming demeanour.  § §You will be organised, have high attention to detail and the desire to help where needed. This role is fast-paced, supporting multiple brokers throughout the LINK group. Experience in the real estate industry is an advantage.§ §This role is an opportunity for someone with great administration skills, a good eye for detail, and a team player who will get stuck in and do what it takes.§ §Reporting to the Operations Manager, this role is responsible for processing sale and purchase contracts and basic administration tasks for the Brokers.§ §As part of a centralised Broker Support team, you will need to have great communication skills, a can-do attitude, and be a team player.§ §You will be technically confident in the Microsoft Suite and be able to turn around administration requests quickly with high attention to detail.§ §You will need to be technically savvy, and you will become the guru to all aspects of the deal process and our internal systems, you will become the go-to person for deals, and general administration tasks.§ § § §RESPONSIBILITIES§ §Front of house reception, meeting & greeting § §Manage the preparation of Sale and Purchase contracts§ §Accurately load and maintain data into required software§ §Effectively communicate with lawyers and other professionals§ §Follow-up and track approval of commission payments and refunds§ §Assist other operational roles and undertake general administration duties as required§ § § §REQUIREMENTS/SKILLS REQUIRED§ §A minimum of 1-2 years’ administration experience§ §Intermediate MS Office§ §Microsoft CRM Dynamics exposure preferred§ §Basic understanding of real estate law would be an advantage§ §High attention to detail§ §Good priority and task management§ §Strong communication skills (both written and verbal)§ §Strong administration skills§ §Great team player§ § § §HOW TO APPLY§ §Submit your application online.§ §Please include a cover letter clearly stating your fit for this role. Only resume’s that include a relevant cover letter will advance into the process.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have experience in an administration role?§§§

jobText: TXT/50663854.txt	§PA/Team Administrator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§PA/Team Administrator§§Advertiser: §Ministry of Business, Innovation and Employment§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §PA, EA & Secretarial§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §PA/Team Administrator §      §        §For the PA/Team Administrator role we are looking for someone who can demonstrate:§        §          §A proven track record of experience and achievement in providing personal and administrative support to managers and teams§          §Demonstrated agility in supporting a large team and responding to changes in priorities§          §Wide ranging knowledge of administration systems and processes§          §Sound relationship management skills§          §Excellent diary management skills§          §Proactive and uses initiative§          §Good standard of computer literacy and word processing§          §Ability to work effectively in a team environment and to prioritise work to achieve MBIE outcomes§        §        §Salary Range $53K-$60k§        §If you enjoy:§        §          §A fast paced environment§          §Dealing with lots of different people§          §Solving problems while remaining calm§          §Working on interesting content§        §        §Then this job will definitely keep you engaged.§        §Background on Regional Skills Leadership Groups§        §The Government recently announced its intention to establish Regional Skills Leadership Groups (RSLGs). RSLGs will identify workforce and skills needs in their region, both now and in the future, and advise on actions to cultivate these.§        §The Groups will feature regional industry leaders, economic development agencies, worker representatives, iwi, and government representatives.§        §The RSLGs are a key part of the Reform of Vocational Education, as the Tertiary Education Commission will take their advice into account when making investment decisions. They also link with the recently-announced reform of temporary work visas. Planning at a regional level can help address skills shortages in the short term, while facilitating the training of more New Zealanders with the skills our workforces need.§        §Members of RSLGs will provide a local leadership voice and common view into the region's investments in skills and training. They will develop Regional Workforce Plans, which project labour supply needs and outline how to create better and more attractive jobs across the region. §        §Why MBIE?§        §MBIE offers significant opportunity for developing experience across a broad variety of areas. We proactively support development through on-the-job learning and we'll help you manage a healthy work-life balance; with flexi-time, healthcare and financial benefits, along with sports teams and social activities. §        §How to find out more and apply§        §Please follow the online process to submit your up to date CV and cover letter.§        §All applications must be submitted via our on-line process.§        §Please find the position description on the MBIE site where you make your application§        §If you have any questions please email §steve.scannell@mbie.govt.nz§ or call §04 901 8335§        §Applications close at 5pm on Wednesday 14th October §        § §        § §      §      §      §    §    §  §§§For the PA/Team Administrator role we are looking for someone who can demonstrate:§§A proven track record of experience and achievement in providing personal and administrative support to managers and teams§Demonstrated agility in supporting a large team and responding to changes in priorities§Wide ranging knowledge of administration systems and processes§Sound relationship management skills§Excellent diary management skills§Proactive and uses initiative§Good standard of computer literacy and word processing§Ability to work effectively in a team environment and to prioritise work to achieve MBIE outcomes§§Salary Range $53K-$60k§§If you enjoy:§§A fast paced environment§Dealing with lots of different people§Solving problems while remaining calm§Working on interesting content§§Then this job will definitely keep you engaged.§Background on Regional Skills Leadership Groups§The Government recently announced its intention to establish Regional Skills Leadership Groups (RSLGs). RSLGs will identify workforce and skills needs in their region, both now and in the future, and advise on actions to cultivate these.§The Groups will feature regional industry leaders, economic development agencies, worker representatives, iwi, and government representatives.§The RSLGs are a key part of the Reform of Vocational Education, as the Tertiary Education Commission will take their advice into account when making investment decisions. They also link with the recently-announced reform of temporary work visas. Planning at a regional level can help address skills shortages in the short term, while facilitating the training of more New Zealanders with the skills our workforces need.§Members of RSLGs will provide a local leadership voice and common view into the region's investments in skills and training. They will develop Regional Workforce Plans, which project labour supply needs and outline how to create better and more attractive jobs across the region. §Why MBIE?§MBIE offers significant opportunity for developing experience across a broad variety of areas. We proactively support development through on-the-job learning and we'll help you manage a healthy work-life balance; with flexi-time, healthcare and financial benefits, along with sports teams and social activities. §How to find out more and apply§Please follow the online process to submit your up to date CV and cover letter.§All applications must be submitted via our on-line process.§Please find the position description on the MBIE site where you make your application§If you have any questions please email §steve.scannell@mbie.govt.nz§ or call §04 901 8335§§Applications close at 5pm on Wednesday 14th October §§ § §§§§

Hill Corrections Facility§§Advertiser: §Department of Corrections§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Rest of Waikato§§Work Type§§Full Hill Corrections Facility (SHCF).§Mō te tūnga | About the role §This is a varied role with a wide range of duties.  You will be required to provide accounts, payroll and administration support to internal and external customers.  Other duties will include reception cover, telephone support, checking of incoming and outgoing prisoner mail, data entry and general administration.§You will enjoy full New Zealand driver licence for this role.§If you believe you have these skills and can hit the ground running, we would love to hear from you!§The salary range for this role is $45,518 - $54,120 per annum.  The work profile for this position is Monday to Friday, working a 40-hour week.§Applicants must be a New Zealand citizen, New Zealand Resident Permit holder, Australian citizen or an Australian resident who holds a current Australian Resident Return Visa.§Tono ināianei |§ §Apply now§For reporting and transparency, it is important that all applications are submitted through our careers site including a cover letter and CV.  §Closing date has been extended to Monday 12 §October 2020, 9:00pm (NZ time)§.§If you want to find out more about a career with us, visit §careers.corrections.govt.nz§ or email our team at §careers@corrections.govt.nz§§Mō mātou | About us§'Kotahi anō te kaupapa, ko te oranga o te iwi'§ - §There is only one purpose to our work:  the wellness and wellbeing of our people.§Our staff come from different backgrounds, cultures, education and experience - and together their purpose is to motivate people in our care to make positive changes in their lives, to help make our communities safer.§Ara Poutama Aotearoa is a name that has been gifted to us by Iwi and conveys the responsibility we have to support and guide those in our care to reach their potential.  Our strategy, Hōkai Rangi (https://arapoutama.page.link/Eit5), provides a clear direction of travel - one that builds on the good things that are already happening, and, most importantly, how we can innovate to find new ways of doing things to achieve better outcomes for Māori, whānau and communities. §It is an exciting time and we continue to seek out talented individuals who are committed to an inclusive, vibrant workplace. We recognise and celebrate the uniqueness of individuals, and that of the collective talent in our whānau.§§§§

You need to be willing to pitch in across client support, communications, policy writing, finance and whatever else comes up as no two days will be the same!§        §This is a great opportunity for someone looking to take the next step in their administration career or returning to the workforce wanting part time hours in a flexible work environment.§        § §        §Key Responsibilities§        §          §Coordinating meetings, minute taking and report writing.§          §Supporting the Service Delivery Manager in business policy writing and client contract variations.§          §Assisting with monthly financial reporting.§          §Working with the wider Service Delivery team to update the Website and its content.§          §General administration duties.§        §        § §        §About you§        §          §Excellent communicator and a great listener.§          §Must be flexible with a willingness to learn, our client is quite niche and you may not have much idea about the industry but you will have the opportunity to learn.§          §At least 2 years’ experience working as an administrator or coordinator, PAs and EAs will be considered. The puni also provides governance support, strategy, planning and performance advice, public sector effectiveness monitoring and statutory entity monitoring including nominations and appointments.§The role§To enable us to influence increases in level of achievement attained by Maori, we are looking for an Administrator to provide administrative services to support the efficient and effective day to day operation of the SGPSP Puni as required.§To be successful in this role you must have§:§Cultural competency in Te Ao Maori and proficiency in pronunciation of te reo Maori, knowledge and understanding of the Tiriti o Waitangi§Well-developed communication skills, both oral and written and a demonstrated commitment to the provision of quality services.§Understanding of the machinery of government§High level of proficiency with Microsoft packages and sound keyboard skills§Demonstrated self-motivation, the ability to set objectives and establish priorities, organise work and resources to ensure priorities and objectives are met on time and to a high quality§The ability to work in and as a member of a team and present self in a professional light.§Honesty, integrity and understanding of the significance of confidentiality§In return you will enjoy the benefits of working in a supportive environment, in an organisation which plays a key role in 'Whānau Taurikura' - 'Thriving Whānau'.§For a copy of the job description and to apply please go to the careers section of our website.§Applications close §Wednesday 14 October 2020§.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50665414.txt	§PA/Team Administrator - Invercargill §§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§PA/Team Administrator - Invercargill §§Advertiser: §Ministry of Business, Innovation and Employment§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Southland§, §Invercargill§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §PA, EA & Secretarial§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §PA/Team Administrator - Invercargill §      §        §For the PA/Team Administrator role we are looking for someone who can demonstrate:§        §          §A proven track record of experience and achievement in providing personal and administrative support to managers and teams§          §Demonstrated agility in supporting a large team and responding to changes in priorities§          §Wide ranging knowledge of administration systems and processes§          §Sound relationship management skills§          §Excellent diary management skills§          §Proactive and uses initiative§          §Good standard of computer literacy and word processing§          §Ability to work effectively in a team environment and to prioritise work to achieve MBIE outcomes§        §        §If you enjoy:§        §          §A fast paced environment§          §Dealing with lots of different people§          §Solving problems while remaining calm§          §Working on interesting content§        §        §Then this job will definitely keep you engaged.§        §Salary Range $53-$60k§        §Background on Regional Skills Leadership Groups§        §The Government recently announced its intention to establish Regional Skills Leadership Groups (RSLGs). RSLGs will identify workforce and skills needs in their region, both now and in the future, and advise on actions to cultivate these.§        §The Groups will feature regional industry leaders, economic development agencies, worker representatives, iwi, and government representatives.§        §The RSLGs are a key part of the Reform of Vocational Education, as the Tertiary Education Commission will take their advice into account when making investment decisions. They also link with the recently-announced reform of temporary work visas. Planning at a regional level can help address skills shortages in the short term, while facilitating the training of more New Zealanders with the skills our workforces need.§        §Members of RSLGs will provide a local leadership voice and common view into the region's investments in skills and training. They will develop Regional Workforce Plans, which project labour supply needs and outline how to create better and more attractive jobs across the region. §        §Why MBIE?§        §MBIE offers significant opportunity for developing experience across a broad variety of areas. We proactively support development through on-the-job learning and we'll help you manage a healthy work-life balance; with flexi-time, healthcare and financial benefits, along with sports teams and social activities. §        §How to find out more and apply§        §Please follow the online process to submit your up to date CV and cover letter.§        §All applications must be submitted via our on-line process.§        §Please find the position description on the MBIE site where you make your application§        §If you have any questions please email §steve.scannell@mbie.govt.nz§ or call §04 901 8335§        §Applications close at 5pm on Wednesday 14th October §        § §        § §        § §      §      §      §    §    §  §§§For the PA/Team Administrator role we are looking for someone who can demonstrate:§§A proven track record of experience and achievement in providing personal and administrative support to managers and teams§Demonstrated agility in supporting a large team and responding to changes in priorities§Wide ranging knowledge of administration systems and processes§Sound relationship management skills§Excellent diary management skills§Proactive and uses initiative§Good standard of computer literacy and word processing§Ability to work effectively in a team environment and to prioritise work to achieve MBIE outcomes§§If you enjoy:§§A fast paced environment§Dealing with lots of different people§Solving problems while remaining calm§Working on interesting content§§Then this job will definitely keep you engaged.§Salary Range $53-$60k§§Background on Regional Skills Leadership Groups§The Government recently announced its intention to establish Regional Skills Leadership Groups (RSLGs). RSLGs will identify workforce and skills needs in their region, both now and in the future, and advise on actions to cultivate these.§The Groups will feature regional industry leaders, economic development agencies, worker representatives, iwi, and government representatives.§The RSLGs are a key part of the Reform of Vocational Education, as the Tertiary Education Commission will take their advice into account when making investment decisions. They also link with the recently-announced reform of temporary work visas. Planning at a regional level can help address skills shortages in the short term, while facilitating the training of more New Zealanders with the skills our workforces need.§Members of RSLGs will provide a local leadership voice and common view into the region's investments in skills and training. They will develop Regional Workforce Plans, which project labour supply needs and outline how to create better and more attractive jobs across the region. §Why MBIE?§MBIE offers significant opportunity for developing experience across a broad variety of areas. We proactively support development through on-the-job learning and we'll help you manage a healthy work-life balance; with flexi-time, healthcare and financial benefits, along with sports teams and social activities. §How to find out more and apply§Please follow the online process to submit your up to date CV and cover letter.§All applications must be submitted via our on-line process.§Please find the position description on the MBIE site where you make your application§If you have any questions please email §steve.scannell@mbie.govt.nz§ or call §04 901 8335§§Applications close at 5pm on Wednesday 14th October §§ § § §§§§

Processing Officers work as an integral part of a dedicated team delivering top class processing functions for the Ministry of Justice to support the facilitation of Domestic Violence Programmes. We value respect as the foundation for building a positive workplace culture and one where diversity is welcomed and celebrated. §§He pūkenga tou/Skills and Experience§To be successful in the role:§§Be able to communicate effectively and patiently with customers§Have excellent computer skills with good level of speed and accuracy§Be comfortable interacting with a wide range of people§§Calling on your previous customer service experience and talent for multi-tasking, you'll play a key role in the administration of domestic violence programme referrals for the Ministry of Justice. jobText: TXT/50665623.txt	§Contract Administrator - Auckland§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Contract Administrator - Auckland§§Advertiser: §Citycare§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Manukau & East Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Contracts Administration§§§§§§Contract Administrator (Auckland)§Citycare is a leading provider of maintenance, management and construction services across New Zealand, benefiting 1.8 million people. We keep an eye on the future, working with our clients to create new infrastructure and amenity assets for the wellbeing and enjoyment of our communities.§Our support team span the length and breadth of New Zealand, supporting our range our maintenance and construction contracts. Our vision is to build better people, better places, better communities through our shared values of "we discover, we deliver, we care".§About the role§We are looking for a highly motivated, self-starter Contracts Administrator to join our Property team based in East Tamaki, Auckland to help achieve our business aims.§This role offers a variety and challenges and we are looking to recruit someone who is a highly motivated, self-starter, with a strong contracts administration background to join the CityCare team. You must have a high attention to detail and manage multiple high-level tasks.§The role includes§Prepare and compile monthly claims, reconcile, investigate and resolve issues/errors§Reconcile claim payment schedules to invoice claims§Other financial tasks including invoicing, maintaining debtors, work in progress accruals at month end, and providing various financial reports.§Work order management including creating and closing work orders and updating information in various systems.§Administrative tasks including maintaining accounts payables, minute taking for meetings, project close out documentation and pipeline maintenance.§Before you hit the apply button, please check you have the following: -§Possess a tertiary qualification in Accountancy, Business Administration or similar field.§You are an experienced contract administrator looking to develop into an accountancy position, with at least 2 years' experience and who has worked alongside operational teams§Experience in subcontractor management§Experience in ERP system, Pronto Xi 750§Microsoft Office experience. Excel will be one of your many strengths, with proven ability with formulas, pivots and other tools.§You must be able to prioritise your workload and partner effectively with all levels of the business.§Preferred experience with local or central government, full facility maintenance contracts§Must be eligible to work in New Zealand.§Benefits & Culture§City Care is an expanding and successful company, providing training and opportunities to succeed and develop.§An employer that appreciates you and your work§You will be working in a wider support team function§Remuneration for this role will range from $24 - $26 per hour§Know that the work you're doing is supporting our vision §"to build great communities"§If this sounds like you, and you are as passionate as we are about producing quality work then please visit §https://www.citycare.co.nz/careers-at-citycare§.§Any questions? Please contact Lisa Meiring on 027 565 7407. Applications close Thursday, 15th October 2020 at 5pm.§All successful applicants will need to pass a pre-employment medical, drug screening test and occupational health and safety orientation test.§Please note this role is anticipated to commence Monday, 23rd November 2020§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Compliance Officer Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50665814.txt	§Compliance Officer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Compliance Officer§§Advertiser: §Armstrong's§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Other§§§§§§Armstrong's is New Zealand's leading independent automotive dealer, representing 16 different brands across 13 dealerships nationwide! If you're driven, passionate, and want to be a part of a growing business that offers real career opportunities for those committed to helping drive the future of our business, then we want you on our team!§Newly created opportunity§This newly created role is perfect for someone with a solid background in administration (ideally customer relations or customer retention), with a passion for the environment, health and safety. This is a great opportunity for someone wanting to step up in their administration career. Not only will you be building on your existing professional skills, you will gain exposure to customer relations management, customer lifecycle management, Toitu and health and safety. Based at our Grey Lynn dealership, you will champion compliance for all three Auckland City Toyota dealerships.§As Compliance Officer, you will strive to achieve three things:§ § §Timely and effective reporting and online customer care§ §Assisting Auckland City Toyota to operate as environmentally friendly as possible§ §Creating and fostering a fun and interactive health and safety culture§ § §A big part of your day will include:§ § §Assisting with the booking of online customer service enquiries§ §Creating and distributing data quality reports§ §Working with dealership managers around customer lifecycle management§ §Organising, documenting and implementing dealership initiatives around sustainability§ §Preparation for Toitu audits§ §Promoting Armstrong's health and safety strategies and building a culture of health and safety reporting and awareness§ § §What you'll bring to the table:§ § §Passion for creating processes and procedures§ §Customer focused and team player mentality§ §Interest in compliance, health and safety and the environment§ §Ability to multi-task and work across multiple systems at the same time§ §Flexible nature and can do attitude§ §Attention to detail§ §Quick learner§ § §If you're someone who prefers the comfort of a structured, specific and solidified role, that's great, but perhaps this role isn't for you. We require a self-motivated individual who is flexible and driven to find areas requiring improvement in our current operation. Previous experience in health and safety isn't a requirement, as long as you are willing to grow your knowledge in this area, and champion all things health and safety.§If this sounds like you, please express your interest by attaching your current CV and a cover letter outlining why you're perfect for this role.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§Do you have experience in an administration role?§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§

Being organized, efficient and self-motivated is a necessity. §You will also ensure the Directors and their respective engagement teams are supported in terms of all the logistics§ involved with getting to and from client site (managing flights, transfers, accommodation etc).§ §Role Responsibilities§ §Business Development Activities§ (approx. §60%§)§ § §Support Business Development (BD) activities§:§ § §Follow up on introductory emails and determine best approach to secure meetings with new contacts (calls, email etc)§ §Regular review of existing contacts and follow up to schedule meetings§ §Weekly review of BD activities with Director to determine priorities and problem solve issues§ § § §Company and contact research to§:§ § §Maintain CRM data integrity§ §Assist with BD campaigns (under guidance of Director)§ §Brief Director on companies, contacts in preparation for meetings§ § § §Create and maintain§ §CRM (Salesforce) §data -  companies, contacts, opportunities and tasks associated with BD activities § §Proposal support §(document preparation, compilation, proofreading, printing and binding)§ §Schedule account plan meetings and circulate account plan reports§ §Diary management§ §(approx. 15% focus)§ - be two steps ahead of your Director and anticipate their needs§ §Logistics§ §(approx. 15% focus)§ - proactively team up with Directors to ensure you give them  most possible leverage for their time§ §People Development Support §(approx. 5%)§ – support the Directors to deliver on their Development Leader and people management responsibilities§ § § §About You § §This role will appeal to an organised, proactive and efficient professional. jobTitle: Executive Assistant - Kaiāwhina Huarangi - The Liggins Institute Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50668128.txt	§Executive Assistant - Kaiāwhina Huarangi - The Liggins Institute§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Executive Assistant - Kaiāwhina Huarangi - The Liggins Institute§§Advertiser: §The University of Auckland§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §PA, EA & Secretarial§§§§§§The opportunity | Te Whiwhinga mahi§  §We are looking for a skilled and experienced EA or PA to join our team. The role will support the National Science Challenge. The role also provides office coordination support for the wider department and is an integral part of the smooth running of our team.§  §This can be a fast-paced role at times and requires someone who can manage diaries, time, and competing priorities with ease. As a friendly face and first point of contact for many internal and external stakeholders, you will enjoy providing support and a high level of service, while also sometimes empowering and guiding others to find the answers they seek. In seeking your own answers, you will be resourceful in sourcing information and build strong relationships to collaborate well with other EAs and colleagues within the university and colleagues across other National Science Challenge across the country.  §  §You will enjoy ownership of the work that you do and be empowered to develop your own systems of efficiency and process improvements, and well as contribute ideas to the continuous improvement of the wider function.§  §About you | He kōrero mōu  §  §To be successful in this position you will have the following experience§ § §EA/PA experience, supporting senior management level roles.§ §Excellent time management, prioritisation and organisation.§ §Exceptional professional written and spoken communication.§ §Resourceful and skilled at finding new information, acquiring new skills and getting answers. Knowledge of university systems will be advantageous. § §Skilled at negotiation and politely guiding others to ensure all stakeholders are well supported and get what they need in a way that is sustainable of your time.§ §Intermediate to advanced Microsoft Office skills.§ §A problem solver, collaborator and someone who enjoys developing efficiencies and improvements.§ §For more detailed information on the role accountabilities and requirements, please review this Position Description§ §Here§.§  §About the team |  Mō tō mātou rōpū§  §Our team sits within the Liggins Institute, and you will enjoy a close-knit, high performing culture, driven by a shared vision every child should have the best possible start in life. A Better Start is the §National Science Challenge§ working to help children, teenagers, their whanau, and family achieve the best possible start in life. Our job is to find practical, evidence-based solutions that make a measurable difference for tamariki and contribute to research that is truly life-changing for future generations.§  §What we offer | Ngā āhuatanga kei a mātou§  §The University of Auckland is committed to providing an excellent working environment through:§ § §Flexible employment practices§ §Career development programmes§ §A competitive salary with five weeks’ annual leave§ §We also offer a company superannuation scheme, a generous parental leave allowance, discounted onsite childcare and a number of other discounts on internal and external services.§  §For more information please visit our §Staff Benefits§ page.§  §How to apply | Me pēhea te tuku tono§  §Applications should be submitted online, before the closing date of §Wednesday 14th October 2019§. Please include your CV and cover letter outlining your suitability for this role.§  §Should you want to find out more about this opportunity, please contact Cathrine Waetford - Operations Manager BeST NSC, §cathrine.waetford@auckland.ac.nz§ with an initial expression of interest and any questions you may have or wish to discuss.  §  §Additional Information§  §The University is committed to meeting its obligations under the Treaty of Waitangi and achieving equity outcomes for staff and students in a safe, inclusive and equitable environment. For further information on services for Māori, Pacific, women, LGBTQITakatāpui+, people with disabilities, parenting support, flexible work and other equity issues go to www.equity.auckland.ac.nz.§§§§

jobTitle: Programmes Administrator Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50669883.txt	§Programmes Administrator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Programmes Administrator§§Advertiser: §Commonwealth Parliamentary Association (CPA)§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Porirua & Kapiti Coast§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Administrative Assistants§§§§§§The Commonwealth Parliamentary Association (CPA)§ founded in 1911 exists to connect, develop, promote and support Commonwealth Country Parliamentarians and their staff to identify benchmarks of good governance and the implementation of the enduring values of the Commonwealth. The CPA collaborates with member-country Parliaments and other organisations, including the intergovernmental community, to achieve its Statement of Purpose.§An exciting opportunity has arisen for the CPA Headquarters, based in the United Kingdom, to seek to appoint from its regions throughout the Commonwealth, an enthusiastic individual as a Programmes Administrator, to join its Programmes Team at CPA Headquarters.§Should the successful appointment be made from New Zealand, the role will be based in New Zealand with support provided by the New Zealand Parliament, and managed remotely by a Programmes Manager, from the Programmes Team at the CPA Secretariat Headquarters. This position requires a self-motivated, resilient and organised individual who is committed to the aims of the Commonwealth Parliamentary Association and is keen to benefit from international work experience.§Job Description and Person Specification§: Programmes Administrator§Job title§: Programmes Administrator§Reporting to§: Programmes Manager§Supervisory responsibility§: N/A§Key relationships§: Programme Assistants, Financial Accountant, Finance Assistant§Term§: 1-year Fixed Term contract with possibility of extension/ Permanency§Salary§: On application§Benefits package include:§• 5 Weeks Annual Leave§• Flexible Working Arrangements (equipment to be provided, if required)§• Eye Test and Glasses Subsidy§• Employer contribution to applicable superannuation scheme§• Opportunity to travel to the United Kingdom (where possible) for key Programmes Team events§Method of application:§CV and Covering letter, stating how you fulfil the requirements of the role to be sent to: §recruitment@cpahq.org§Closing Date for applications§: 18 October 2020§Interviews will be held remotely during w/c 26 October 2020§Enquiries or further questions about the role can be sent to:§recruitment@cpahq.org§Commonwealth Parliamentary Association (CPA): §Statement of Purpose§The CPA connects, develops, promotes and supports Parliamentarians and their staff to identify benchmarks of good governance and the implementation of the enduring values of the Commonwealth.§The CPA collaborates with Parliaments and other organisations, including the intergovernmental community, to achieve its Statement of Purpose.§Commonwealth Heads of Government have recognised the Parliaments and Legislatures of the Commonwealth as essential elements in the exercise of democratic governance and have endorsed the efforts of the Association as the parliamentary partner of the Commonwealth’s governmental and non-governmental sectors.§CPA activities focus on the Commonwealth’s commitment to its fundamental political values, including: just and honest government, the alleviation of poverty, fundamental human rights, international peace and order, global economic development, the rule of law, equal rights and representation for all citizens of both genders, the separation of powers among the three branches of government and the right to participate in free and democratic political processes.§Job Description§Purpose of role:§Under the direction of the Programmes Manager (based at CPA Headquarters in the United Kingdom), the Programmes Administrator provides operational and administrative assistance to the CPA Programmes Team, performs a variety of administrative, coordination and logistical services in support of the operations of the CPA.§Primary Duties or Responsibilities§Operational and Administrative Support§• Drafts provisional letters and correspondence, where necessary/appropriate and under the direction of the Programmes Manager;§• Assists other team members in preparing and formatting documents, including PowerPoint presentations;§• Develops and maintains an efficient electronic filing system for the Programmes Team using SharePoint;§• Tracks participant/attendee responses in relation to the various programmes and events delivered by the Projects Team;§• Maintains and updates the Programme Team’s databases and mailing lists using Excel and iMIS;§• Proofreading and editing of documents as instructed by the Programmes Managers;§• Organises regular team meetings and conference calls/video-conferences, often across different time zones, including the preparation and distribution of meeting documents;§• Takes minutes of team meetings and other meetings as and when required;§• Maintains and updates the CPA HQ website, as and when required by the Editor;§• Provides assistance to the Secretary-General’s Private Office when preparing for external visitors including (but not limited to) Members of Parliament and parliamentary staff;§• Performs other related duties in accordance with instructions as and when required.§Travel Management§• Provide programme support to staff preparing for deployment including (but not limited to) updating travel plans and itineraries, and calculating staff per diems;§• Communicates with travel agency to obtain estimated airfares and hotel accommodation quotes;§• Reconciles travel expenditures for programme participants and submits claims for authorisation and payment.§Workshops and Events§• Under the direct supervision of the Programmes Managers, the Programmes Administrators will undertake the following tasks:§- Liaise with host parliaments to coordinate logistical arrangements for workshops that take place abroad;§- Liaises with host branches and other outside agencies regarding venue, travel, hotels, and with Catering Services staff for provision, room organisation and logistics;§- Coordinates registration process and acts as contact person for the participants.§• Under the guidance of the Head of Public Outreach and/or the Editor, assist in the dissemination of all internal and external material, including publicity and background documents for local and international events; coordinates appropriate mailings or distribution.§Person Specification§Essential§• Demonstrated ability to work independently, manage own time, prioritise activities, plan projects or groups of activities, and to manage aspects within specified timeframes§• Previous experience of manging general administrative tasks§• Excellent accuracy and attention to detail.§• Good organisational and prioritising skills to manage conflicting demands§• Effective time and diary management§• Ability to communicate information effectively and accurately using appropriate communication tools.§• Excellent interpersonal and customer services skills with an excellent telephone manner§• Ability to maintain professionalism and remain calm in a busy and pressured environment§• High standard of literacy and numeracy§• Excellent working knowledge of the Microsoft Office Suite§• Experience of working effectively as part of a team with people from different geographical regions, backgrounds and cultures.§• Ability to work flexibly to meet the needs of the organisation i.e. cover for annual leave, sickness and training, work outside of normal business hours.§• An understanding of the Data Protection Act (and equivalent legislation in the hosting jurisdiction) and handling of confidential and sensitive information§Desirable§• Project/programme management qualification§• Qualification in Business Administration or Customer Service or relevant§Experience§Knowledge of, or a passion for, democratic institutions and democracy education§§§§

jobTitle: Administration and Registry Assistant Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50670086.txt	§Administration and Registry Assistant§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Administration and Registry Assistant§§Advertiser: §Te Kupenga – Catholic Leadership Institute§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Administrative Assistants§§§§§§Background§  §Te Kupenga has been formed from the merger of two Catholic tertiary education providers – Good Shepherd College (GSC) in Auckland and The Catholic Institute of Aotearoa New Zealand (TCI).  They merged into a single organisation – §Te Kupenga – Catholic Leadership Institute§ -  on 1 January 2020. §  §Te Kupenga§ is owned by the six diocesan Bishops acting as Trustees and governed by a newly-formed Board.  §Te Kupenga§ incorporates three operating entities: §the §Catholic Theological College§, responsible for providing approved tertiary qualifications primarily to people exercising or preparing for ministry within the New Zealand Catholic Church, including seminarians and teachers in Catholic schools; §the §National Centre for Religious Studies§, responsible for curriculum design and resourcing for religious education in Catholic schools and support for adult faith formation; and §the §Nathaniel Centre§, responsible for research and advocacy on bio-ethical issues. §  §Purpose & style§  §The purpose of this position is to provide administrative support in the Auckland office of Te Kupenga, with a particular focus on supporting the Dean of the Catholic Theological College with secretarial duties, and the Registrar (who is based in Wellington) with matters related to Auckland students and courses. §  §This will be a 30hrs or FT role for a 6-month fixed term, with the possibility of permanency.§  §Responsibilities & key tasks§  §The Administration and Registry Assistant is accountable as follows:§  §Secretarial/Executive support for the Dean§ § §Coordinate appointments on behalf of the Dean, including making appointments, receiving requests for appointments, and ensuring the Dean is aware of what information is required for his effective participation in meetings§ §Assist the Dean with writing minutes, preparing presentations, and uploading content to websites and online learning platforms§ §Undertake filing, photocopying, printing and other general secretarial support required by the Dean§ §Process correspondence and communications on behalf of the Dean as requested (including mail, emails, and phone calls)§ §Coordinate the Auckland based administrative tasks on behalf of the Registrar § § §Liaise regularly with the Registrar and Programme Coordinators about key tasks associated with supporting the courses taught in Auckland§ §Liaise with, and be a point of contact for, Auckland based lecturers/teachers ensuring they have the necessary administrative support § §Coordinate bookings of rooms/venues for courses§ §Contact schools and liaise with school contacts as necessary§ §Ensure any feedback from lecturers/teachers is passed on to the Programme Coordinators or Dean as appropriate§ §Assist with the administrative elements related to § §The Exam Timetable§ §Student Applications/Enrolments § §Attendance Records/Grade Sheets§ §Data entry in the student management system and on-line learning system§ § § §General operations support§ § §Support with monitoring and uploading content on the organisation’s websites and social media, when requested§ §Support the Manager (Auckland) and Operations Manager (Wellington) at busy times with administrative tasks as required§ §Provide any executive support required by the Chief Executive when he is working from Auckland§ §Person Specification§ § §Works collaboratively with other staff members, students, and the public§ §Has strong computing skills§ §Has the ability to manage and update websites§ §Excellent written and oral communication skills§ §Strong time management skills§ §Ethical, respectful and collaborative in working relationships§ §Applications§  §Applications consisting of a §cover letter, CV§, and details of at least§ two referees§ can be addressed to Marina Schmits, Operations Manager, by email m.schmits@tekupenga.org.nz. §  §Applications close on §Friday 16 October at midday.§ §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Which of the following Microsoft Office products are you experienced with?§§§

jobTitle: Operations Coordinator Job in Canterbury - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50670098.txt	§Operations Coordinator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Operations Coordinator§§Advertiser: §New Zealand Trustee Services§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Salary§§Package includes life and health insurance!§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Office Management§§§§§§About us§ §New Zealand Trustee Service’s vision is to provide New Zealanders with the knowledge of how to best protect and preserve their assets.  Based out of Auckland and Christchurch, we have been providing independent trustee services since 2004, providing our clients with a range of services in the setting up and ongoing administration of various types of trusts including, but not limited to Family Trusts, Inheritance Trusts and Business Trusts. We provide independent advice solely with the benefit of the client in mind with no external influence. As such we are seen as the trusted advisors by our clients centred on the desire to build a long lasting relationship through integrity and expertise.§ §About the role§ §The Operations Coordinator works closely with the Operations Manager (based in Auckland) to ensure the smooth day-to-day operation of the Christchurch branch through performing key responsibilities including, but not limited to, business administration, relationship management, team leadership and Risk and Compliance.§ § §Oversee the completion and report on the status of works to be completed against targets and follow up as required. § §Ensure correct processes are in place and are followed by the team, including documenting and maintenance of work flow processes, identifying training needs and overseeing professional development of staff in conjunction with the Operations Manager.§ §Assist with the processing of Debtors and handle complaints or issues with clients.§ §Ensuring that the Christchurch team complies with all regulations and statutes that it operates under. Ensure all new trusts are set up correctly and assist with preparation of required documents if needed.§ §Identify and maintain business relationships with vendors and service providers for office management.§ §Qualifications, Skills and Experiences§ § §Ability to follow process/procedures and compliance protocols§ §2+ years office administration experience§ §Proven relationship management experience§ §2+ years facilities or office management experience (preferred)§ §Ideally, experience in the financial service sector§ §Understanding of, or experience in, the trustee industry (beneficial)§ §What's in it for you…§ §New Zealand Trustee Services is part of the wider Complectus Group, which includes our sister company Perpetual Guardian, another well regarded New Zealand trustee services provider. Our collective goal is to strive to be one of New Zealand's best work places. Our people are passionate about what they do and have a genuine interest in the well-being of their clients. We recruit, train, empower and reward our team members to deliver comprehensive solutions and services to our clients.§ §In return for your efforts, you will be connected to a strong team of like-minded professionals and be provided with training and career development avenues for you to continually develop and grow with us. In addition, we provide a competitive package including great medical and life insurance benefits.§ §If you have all the skills and abilities listed above, don't hesitate and apply now! Applications will close on §18 October 2020.§ §Please note that all applications must be submitted via Seek and include an up-to-date CV and covering letter. § §Note§: Candidates with eligibility to be employed in New Zealand §immediately §will be strongly preferred.§ § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§§§
