jobText: TXT/50670325.txt	§Office Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Office Manager§§Advertiser: §Auckland Radiology Group§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Office Management§§§§§§§§§  §    §      §      §        §Office Manager §        §          § §          §OFFICE MANAGER – Morrin Road, St Johns §          §Auckland Radiology Group is a wholly NZ radiologist owned and operated company dedicated to excellence in radiology services.  Our commitment to providing the highest levels of care to patients and referrers also extends to staff.§          §Our Radiologists and clinical teams are highly valued experts in their fields. With 18 branches serving the greater Auckland Region this dedicated, collegial team of professionals work hard towards the further success and growth of the company and the radiology profession as a whole.§          §We are seeking an experienced Office Manager who is able to provide operational expertise and management to our newest “high tech” radiology branch opening early in 2021. As the primary contact for our patients and referrers in the region, you will be expected to deliver a professional service with a strong focus on customer service and care.§          §This role provides leadership, guidance and mentoring to a small team of Medical Receptionists.  If you are passionate about people leadership and have management experience in a similar environment we would love to hear from you.§          §In addition, our ideal candidate will have the following knowledge, skills and experience:§          §            §Understanding of radiology services including MRI, CT and Interventional bookings§            §Demonstrated experience in successfully managing the interactive relationship of patient and referrers, facilitating bookings, queries, complaints and grievances and ensuring that privacy, empathy and confidentiality are maintained§            §Fantastic communication skills, and sound judgement with a proven ability to build and maintain effective working relationships§            §Willingness to be involved in the front line§          §          §In return you will be offered a rewarding career and a competitive remuneration package.§          §If you feel that you have the appropriate skills for this challenging role then we would love to hear from you.  Apply now through SEEK.  For further information, contact Liz Eyles, Administration Manager on 09-529 4852.§        §        §        §      §    §  §§§ § §OFFICE MANAGER – Morrin Road, St Johns § §Auckland Radiology Group is a wholly NZ radiologist owned and operated company dedicated to Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §PA, EA & Secretarial§§§§§§The New Zealand Rural General Practice Network is a not for profit incorporated society and is the only nationwide membership-based organisation in New Zealand representing the specific interests of rural general practice.  The Network also provides a rural GP recruitment and locum support service through the award winning NZLocums recruitment division.§ §Due to internal staff movement, a position has become available within the Network to provide high level secretariat support to the Chief Executive, Board and Senior Management Team.  As part of this varied role, the successful candidate will also be required to assist with the overall efficient running of the office by providing administration support for other functions such as facilities management.§ §Experience in supporting a Chief Executive and proven minute taking experience at a Board level are imperative. § §Working alongside an office of 13 staff, we envisage the successful candidate to have exceptional interpersonal skills, hold a high degree of confidence and professionalism with a great sense of humour and positive demeanour. § §Key responsibilities include –§ § §Preparation and planning of Board and sub-committee meetings§ §Board paper compilation and minute taking§ §Travel and accommodation arrangements§ §Diary management and video conferencing§ §Facilities management assistance§ §Office administration§ §The ideal candidate will possess -§ § §Outstanding organisational and time management skills§ §Strong multi-tasking ability§ §Excellent communication skills§ §High level attention to detail and accuracy§ §Ability to work well under pressure§ §A positive, hardworking nature with a strong, supportive work ethic§ §Be proactive and have the ability to use initiative to identify opportunities or improvements§ §Solid computer literacy and proficiency in MS Office Suite and cloud-based applications§ §Applicants for this position must have NZ residency or a valid NZ work permit.  Based in central Wellington, we offer a great working environment.§ §Applications close 4.00pm Friday 16 October 2020.§ §Apply online by sending a CV and cover letter. All applications will be treated with the strictest of confidence.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as an office administrator?§§§

You are customer focused with excellent communication skills – person to person, on the phone and writing emails.   You’re a whizz on the computer, familiar with Microsoft Office and quick to learn new software and systems.  Being efficient and accurate with good time management you are reliable and go the extra mile to get the job done to meet deadlines.§  §The position:§ § §Monitoring group builders web-based schedules and aligning our schedule accordingly§ §Checking pre-production plans and specifications for accuracy§ §Scanning documents for production hand over§ §Data entry and checking data integrity§ §Co-ordinating customer enquiries, entering remedial requests, preparing quotes§ §Back up reception; answering phone, greeting customers, assisting in the showroom§ §Admin Support to Operations, CAD & Sales teams as required§ §It’s a busy role so keeping calm under pressure is important as well as having a sense of humour to help get you through.  We are open to candidates from a variety of backgrounds; Admin, Ops or a student looking to start their career.  There are opportunities for the right person.  Be quick to send us your application as we are super busy and need someone to start ASAP.§  §Please send your CV and cover letter by clicking Apply Now - or send directly to:§  §Colin Campbell - Managing Director§  §colin.campbell@mastercraft.co.nz§  § §§§§

jobTitle: Executive Assistant Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50671327.txt	§Executive Assistant§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Executive Assistant§§Advertiser: §H2R Consulting§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §PA, EA & Secretarial§§§§§§§§§  §    §      §      §        §Executive Assistant §        §          §The National Emergency Management Agency (NEMA) provides national leadership to New Zealand’s distributed emergency management system. NEMA’s primary focus is on the performance and capability of the emergency management system as a whole, across all hazards and all risks and the 4 Rs of risk reduction, readiness, response and recovery. We are going through an exciting phase of growth and there will be more opportunities with NEMA over the coming months.§          §NEMA values diversity and inclusion. We want our workforce to reflect the diversity of our communities. We value and respect the contributions of our people with diverse backgrounds, experiences, skills and perspectives. We support flexible ways of working that bring out the best in you. §          §NEMA recognises the continuing partnership Te Tiriti o Waitangi between Mâori and the Crown. We are committed to doing our part to deliver on the Crown’s commitments to Mâori under Te Tiriti. We strive to actively build te Ao Mâori perspectives and capability into our day to day work, values and practices. §          §This Executive Assistant position sits within the System Capability Unit which is tasked with leading the identification, design and implementation of strategies that build capability of the emergency management system across the 4Rs, risk reduction, readiness, response and recovery. §          §The Unit does this through the development of a suite of initiatives focusing on the professionalisation of the Emergency Management workforce. The Unit engages with a wide range of stakeholders from throughout Aotearoa.§          §The Executive Assistant will be responsible for providing dependable personal secretarial and administrative support to the Manager System Capability. This will involve overseeing and coordinating the Manager System Capability’s working day to enable them to fully meet the demands of their position. As well as providing secretariat and administrative support to the System Capability team members to ensure the provision of an effective and efficient office management system.§          §As the Executive Assistant you will bring the following attributes:§          §            §Ability to multitask, reprioritise and react to issues that arise during the day whilst keeping calm and professional in demanding situations§            §Demonstrated experience providing efficient and effective executive support§            §A high level of computer literacy in Microsoft package, including Visio with the ability to adapt to new technologies§            §Excellent secretarial and process management skills with experience in taking minutes or willingness to learn§            §Ability to interpret the Manager’s needs while proactively looking beyond their day to day workload and anticipating situations which will affect them§            §Excellent relationship management skills, able to deal in the appropriate manner with a wide range of staff and senior stakeholders§            §A high level of integrity, discretion, and tact to handle confidential and private information with excellent judgement, especially under pressure§          §          §Due to the security requirements of this role, applicants must be a New Zealand citizen or New Zealand Permanent Resident. §          §To apply for this role, click on the Apply Now button and scroll down.   If you have any questions, please contact Gemma Odams on §04 4999 471§ or §gemma.odams@h2r.co.nz§ referring to vacancy number 26376.§ §Applications close 11.59pm 18 October 2020.§        §        §        §      §    §  §§§The National Emergency Management Agency (NEMA) provides national leadership to New Zealand’s distributed emergency management system. NEMA’s primary focus is on the performance and capability of the emergency management system as a whole, across all hazards and all risks and the 4 Rs of risk reduction, readiness, response and recovery. We are going through an exciting phase of growth and there will be more opportunities with NEMA over the coming months.§ §NEMA values diversity and inclusion. We want our workforce to reflect the diversity of our communities. We value and respect the contributions of our people with diverse backgrounds, experiences, skills and perspectives. We support flexible ways of working that bring out the best in you. § §NEMA recognises the continuing partnership Te Tiriti o Waitangi between Mâori and the Crown. We are committed to doing our part to deliver on the Crown’s commitments to Mâori under Te Tiriti. We strive to actively build te Ao Mâori perspectives and capability into our day to day work, values and practices. § §This Executive Assistant position sits within the System Capability Unit which is tasked with leading the identification, design and implementation of strategies that build capability of the emergency management system across the 4Rs, risk reduction, readiness, response and recovery. § §The Unit does this through the development of a suite of initiatives focusing on the professionalisation of the Emergency Management workforce. The Unit engages with a wide range of stakeholders from throughout Aotearoa.§ §The Executive Assistant will be responsible for providing dependable personal secretarial and administrative support to the Manager System Capability. This will involve overseeing and coordinating the Manager System Capability’s working day to enable them to fully meet the demands of their position. As well as providing secretariat and administrative support to the System Capability team members to ensure the provision of an effective and efficient office management system.§ §As the Executive Assistant you will bring the following attributes:§ § §Ability to multitask, reprioritise and react to issues that arise during the day whilst keeping calm and professional in demanding situations§ §Demonstrated experience providing efficient and effective executive support§ §A high level of computer literacy in Microsoft package, including Visio with the ability to adapt to new technologies§ §Excellent secretarial and process management skills with experience in taking minutes or willingness to learn§ §Ability to interpret the Manager’s needs while proactively looking beyond their day to day workload and anticipating situations which will affect them§ §Excellent relationship management skills, able to deal in the appropriate manner with a wide range of staff and senior stakeholders§ §A high level of integrity, discretion, and tact to handle confidential and private information with excellent judgement, especially under pressure§ §Due to the security requirements of this role, applicants must be a New Zealand citizen or New Zealand Permanent Resident. § §To apply for this role, click on the Apply Now button and scroll down.   If you have any questions, please contact Gemma Odams on §04 4999 471§ or §gemma.odams@h2r.co.nz§ referring to vacancy number 26376.§ §Applications close 11.59pm 18 October 2020.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50671769.txt	§Business Support Administrator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Business Support Administrator§§Advertiser: §Autism New Zealand§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§2 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Hutt Valley§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Administrative Assistants§§§§§§About the organisation and the role§ § §The purpose of the role is to:§ §Provide co-ordination and administration of all National Office operations and projects§Provide administration support to the Chief Executive, Board and other staff nationally§Provide administration support to HR§Manage the CRM database and ensuring quality control§Mange information and IT support queries§Manage the day-to-day running of the reception and shared office§Support the Communications Advisor with fundraising activities§ § §Job tasks and responsibilities§ § §The Business Support Administrator is responsible for:§ §1. Administration support§ §Assist National Office with general administration, ad hoc projects and reception.§In conjunction with the Information Support Coordinators, oversight of all branch administration and business processes.§Ensure policies, procedures and guidelines are followed, reviewed and updated including all Health & Safety, and Employment obligations§Preparation of HR documentation and administration§Run and manage staff morale projects §Meeting minutes are taken and written up accurately as required§Assist in the preparation of publications. § §2. Membership and database quality control§ §Coordinate membership services for National Office and branches§Regularly update the CRM databases with details of participants, programmes, and other information as required reviewing and updating the CRM Guidelines and training staff§Review data and ensure quality control of the CRM database§Prepare reports and dashboards on statistics and service performance§ §3. Information and IT support queries§ §Oversight of smooth running of all IT services and equipment and queries resolved in a timely manner§Provide training to staff on Microsoft Teams, Dynamics 365 and Outlook§Coordination of the Data sub-group§ §4. Manage the day-to-day running of the reception and shared office§ §Provide reception duties including opening and closing of the office§Coordinate all aspects of the day-to-day running of the office such as cleaners, IT support and security§Liaise with and hold regular meetings with the tenants and dealing with any complaints or issues or raising if appropriate to management§Ensure the health and safety requirements of the office are met and any issues are raised to management§Developing and maintaining all documentation and processes in relation to the office§Implement and manage a room booking system§Be the first point of contact on all queries regarding the office§Coordinate and organise events § §5. Fundraising§ §Assist in coordinating fundraising projects – including the development and distribution of materials, sponsorship and public relations§Maintain donor records on the database, and assist in coordinating direct marketing to donors, following the stakeholder engagement plan§Maintain the gifts register and production of receipts and thank you letters§Manage the fundraising process for all external fundraisers§Assist in coordinating and developing the Regular Giving Programme and Bequests to increase income§ § § § §Skills and experience§ § §Knowledge, skills, and experience§ §Excellent project management skills§Highly competent in use of Microsoft Office and Databases.§Ability to prioritise and manage several tasks at once, with excellent time management skills§Experience in HR administration§Experience in office management§Experience with travel and accommodation coordination and bookings for both small and large number of people§Experience in finance administration§A knowledge of, and experience with the Autism Spectrum and related conditions.§Tertiary degree is desirable.§ §Personal qualities§ §Empathetic and enthusiastic§Proactive and with initiative, energetic, and resilient§Ethical, responsible, and reliable§Professional, well planned and very organised – with the ability to prioritise and be adaptable§Excellent written and verbal communication skills§Excellent relationship management skills§Patient, with the ability to remain calm in stressful circumstances§Ability to relate well to a wide range of people – staff, families, teachers, agencies, professionals, and suppliers§Ability to work both independently and collaboratively as part of a team – understanding that sharing information empowers all the team, and is a necessary part of the role§Genuine respect and interest for people on the Autism Spectrum, and their families/whānau or caregivers, and professionals.§ § § § §How to appply§ § §Applications close Sunday 18th October 2020.§For enquiries or a full job description, you are welcome to contact §hr@autismnz.org.nz§.§ § § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How many years' experience do you have as an administration officer?§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

We also help New Zealanders into their own homes, through our home ownership products and services.§        §As one team, we share in our tikanga, showing us who we are and how we live up to our vision. Join us and play your part.§        §Ngā mahi - What you'll do§        §One of our fantastic team members is heading off on parental leave, and as such we are now looking to recruit a Tenancy Liaison Administrator to provide administrative support to our Tenancy Liaison Teams in Wellington and the South Island.§        §As our Tenancy Liaison Administrator you will be integral to the Tenancy Liaison Teams' ability to operate efficiently and effectively. We will also support your personal and career development through on-the-job learning, training courses, secondments and study opportunities.§        §We offer competitive salaries, five weeks annual leave and a benefits package including insurances, flexible working and career development. These benefits are described here https://careers.kaingaora.govt.nz/a-great-place-to-work/benefits.§        §Our Values - Kotahitanga | One Team§        §We have important work to do and our aspirations are big. We also do our best when we take personal responsibility to achieve our shared vision and maintain a working environment we are proud of. jobTitle: Education, Training and Committees Coordinator Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50673414.txt	§Education, Training and Committees Coordinator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Education, Training and Committees Coordinator§§Advertiser: §ANZCA§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§2 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Other§§§§§§About Us§  §The Australian and New Zealand College of Anaesthetists (ANZCA) incorporating the Faculty of Pain Medicine, is an internationally recognised specialist medical education institution responsible for the training, examinations, specialist qualification, and continuing professional development of all anaesthetists and pain medicine specialists in Australia and New Zealand. §  §ANZCA is at the forefront of specialist medical education and continuously evolves to meet the changing demands of the profession and the patients it serves. The New Zealand National Office (NZNO) is responsible for ensuring ANZCA is represented in New Zealand through the management of the New Zealand-based activities of the college and the relationship with New Zealand government and non-government agencies.§  §We want to create an inclusive environment where people have purposeful work, feel valued and connected, and are challenged and inspired to grow.§  §Position Overview & Key Responsibilities§  §Your role as the Training, Education & Committees Coordinator is responsible to the College Council and New Zealand National Committee (NZNC) via the Executive Director, New Zealand National Office for the ANZCA training and education activities in New Zealand. This involves attending to a broad range of administrative tasks, including providing support for the Faculty of Pain Medicine and College of Intensive Care Medicine (CICM) examinations. In addition, you will also provide administrative services to the College of Intensive Care Medicine.§  §Your role includes but is not limited to:§ § §Providing coordination and administrative support for training and examinations for ANZCA, the Faculty of Pain Medicine and the College of Intensive Care Medicine (CICM).§ §Supporting Training Accreditation Committee hospital inspections and visits.§ §Administering the New Zealand Trainee Committee, including coordination for meetings and the Part Zero courses.§ §Providing coordination and committee support for the College of Intensive Care Medicine (CICM) New Zealand National Committee§ §You will collaborate with the Training and Assessments unit based in our ANZCA office in Melbourne and join a small and lively New Zealand National Office.§  §About you§  §As an experienced administration professional, you will bring to this role strong initiative and a proactive approach including the ability to maintain your composure and exercise appropriate judgment to problem solve effectively.§  §In addition, you must demonstrate: §  §Extensive experience in an administrative role in a professional environment that has included:§ § §Experience supporting professional examinations, meetings and/or events§ §Experience supporting professional committees including taking minutes§ §Working knowledge of committee operating policies and protocols.§ §Extensive planning & organising, time management, and logistics management skills§ §Meticulous attention to detail, excellent written communication, and well developed interpersonal skills.§ §Working knowledge of committee operating policies and protocols§ §Knowledge of the New Zealand health system and a working knowledge of §te reo me ōna tikanga§, Māori language and protocols is desirable§ §This role requires some weekend and evening work balanced out with time off in lieu.§  §What we can offer you:§ § §A rewarding opportunity to showcase and expand your administration experience in a diverse and stimulating role§ §A culture that invests in the professional development of our people§ §Excellent staff benefits – additional leave over the Christmas period, EAP, Health and Wellbeing offerings and staff recognition program.§ §ANZCA is an equal opportunity employer and our commitment to creating and supporting an inclusive culture is reflected in our diverse mix of talented people passionate about delivering their best. We embrace and value the diverse society we live within and consider all qualified applicants without regard to race, colour, national origin, religion, disability, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation or age.§  §For more information about ANZCA visit www.anzca.edu.au.§  §Applications close: 5pm on Friday 16 October 2020. §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§What's your expected annual base salary?§Extensive experience in an administration role in a professional environment? §Extensive experience working with professional authorities and committees? §Sound knowledge of the NZ health system and a working knowledge of te reo me ona tikanga, Maori language and protocols? §§§

jobText: TXT/50673682.txt	§Merchandising Support Administrator (p/t)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Merchandising Support Administrator (p/t)§§Advertiser: §Market Pulse§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§2 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Administrative Assistants§§§§§§Market Pulse is a field management, merchandising and outsourced services business. We work with brands to increase their consumer sales through their retail partners.  This involves training in-store sales staff, developing brand evangelism, merchandising and improving sales conversion.  §  §We are now seeking a part-time (20 hours/week) Merchandising Support Administrator in Auckland.  You'll be joining an established team working with our telco partner and will report to the Merchandising Manager.  Your role will require you to build strong relationships with our merchandising team across New Zealand, as well as becoming an expert around our client’s brand presence in stores nationwide.  Your primary responsibilities will be supporting our Merchandising Manager, training our merchandising team, assisting with quality assurance and merchandising in-field locations.§  §Key components of the role;§  §- General assistance to our Merchandising Manager§  §- Managing ongoing training of our field team§  §- Ongoing recruitment and allocation of our field team§  §- Participating in quality assurance of our merchandising activities§  §- Problem Identification and Resolution of merchandising issues§  §- Assistance with merchandising planogram creation§  §-  Liaison with our Field Sales Reps§  §- Supplier purchase tracking and management support§  §- Supplementary in-store merchandising when required§  § §  §This is a part-time, 20 hour/week role primarily centred on office work with occasional in-field requirements. The ideal candidate can work four days a week mid-morning to mid-afternoon, with some flexibility for unforeseen requirements. It is a Fixed Term Contract for six months, with potential to expand to a longer-term contract. We are happy in these current circumstances to allow some work from home after the initial training and settling-in period.§  § §  §You will be fully trained by the existing team to ensure you can deliver the high standards expected, but you should also ideally meet all or most of the following criteria;§ § §IT savvy with a practical understanding of telecommunications products/services.§ §MS Office Proficiency, with strong spreadsheet management and lookup skills§ §Strong communication skills with the confidence to train one on one.§ §Smart, professional, well-spoken, and reliable.§ §Retail orientated with the ability to perceive and execute visual detail.§ §Ability to perform a day’s worth of low-intensity merchandising work when required.§ § §  §The successful applicant must have their own vehicle and be willing to travel when required.§  §Apply now and include your CV and a cover letter.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§

jobText: TXT/50674726.txt	§Administration Assistant§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Administration Assistant§§Advertiser: §Goal Digger Career Solutions§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§2 Oct 2020§§Location§§Bay of Plenty§, §Rotorua§§Salary§§Remuneration to reflect experience§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Administrative Assistants§§§§§§§​Small, hard-working team §Able to offer some flexibility with work§Plenty of variety, room to grow.§§We are a small, hard-working team with a fantastic bunch of clients we work with regularly. At Goal Digger, we offer full-circle employment support, from career counselling and career transition, through to complex HR matters. We work with individuals, as well as around 60 businesses.  We love what we do, and we are pretty busy, so it is time to get a little dusting of help.§We are offering a part-time role with us, which may suit a variety of personal circumstances because we can have a bit of flexibility with how we set our hours of work. This is a role which would require you to work in our office (we have good chocolate biscuits and coffee, plus cafe's near by!).  Initially, we would like to offer a minimum of five hours a week with days and hours to be negotiated.  It would be helpful to have flexibility to work more than five hours a week however, when times get busy or there are projects to do.§What we could do with some help with:§Accounts administration (Xero)§Communication, dealing with enquiries over the phone, at reception and via email§Preparing client files §Appointment and interview bookings, and reminders§Word processing of documents (a proofreading guru would be ideal)§Social media§Database work§Note taking§Ordering of office supplies§General errands§and who knows where this could go!§We need someone who is seriously confidential, this is a non-negotiable and we are pretty firm on this.  You will need to sign a confidentiality agreement.§We need someone who can pick up on what is going down and be adaptable to the needs of the day.  Things change quickly, so if you are rattled by not being able to complete the task you set out, working with us might be a bit challenging.  We are a team of two, you would need to be able to accept direction from either of us.§Whilst work is pretty serious, we like to enjoy our time at the office too.  As a pretty light-hearted team, we are easy to get along with.  We are looking for the right person, to join us for the long term.§Before you apply, a few things to think about:§This is a genuinely very part-time role.  If you are not really wanting part-time work, this isn't the right opportunity for you (we may have others).  There would be times when you have to be in the office on your own.  We are certainly not micro-managers, so it's pretty important you can take your list and run with it.§You need to have a really good command of the English Language, both written and oral. You need to be currently based in New Zealand and have the legal right to work here too. §If you would like further information about this gem of a role, get in touch by emailing §recruit@goaldigger.co.nz§.§We look forward to reading all about you in your cover letter and CV.§§§§

jobTitle: Office Administrator Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50675144.txt	§Office Administrator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Office Administrator§§Advertiser: §Castalia Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§2 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Salary§§$45,000 - $55,000 pro-rated§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Administrative Assistants§§§§§§We are seeking an enthusiastic and well-rounded individual to assist and support our Wellington-based team as an Office Administrator. This position would be ideal for someone with previous office management experience, looking for part-time work with a growing and dynamic team of professionals. The Office Administrator would be expected to work 4 days a week, between the hours of 9:30 am and 2:30 pm.§ §About the Company§ §Castalia is an international strategic consultancy firm with offices in Wellington, Paris, Sydney, and Washington DC.  Castalia’s team includes over 50 professional staff qualified in finance, law, economics, and utility management.  As well as full-time staff, Castalia draws on a diverse range of experts worldwide.§ §Key Responsibilities§ §The Office Administrator in the Wellington office is expected to provide comprehensive administration, accounts, and documentation support for Castalia’s Wellington office. The Office Administrator will receive direction from the Managing Director, and other directors and managers of the New Zealand and Pacific Practice. The Office Administrator will also work closely with the office managers based in Sydney and Washington DC plus the team of professional staff based in Wellington. The key tasks for this role include:§ § §Reception and administrational assistance and support§ §Information and Records Management, §including filing, updating the office manual, and keeping our contacts database up to date§ §Documentation Assistance,§ including proof-reading, formatting documents, scanning, photocopying, and binding§ §Accounts Support,§ including local accounts payable, petty cash, and VISA statements§ §General Responsibilities and Approach§ § §Abide by all Castalia policies, codes of conduct, and practice§ §Where a conflict in priority arises, take direction on projects and priorities from the Managing Director. These priorities may vary from time to time§ §Be flexible within the broad remit of this position§ §Part-time, 4 days a week§ §Hours of work: 9:30 am to 2:30 pm with up to one hour for lunch.§ §Person Specifications§ §Required§ § §Excellent oral and written communication skills, including a professional and diplomatic telephone manner and face-to-face communication skills§ §Ability to write in a clear and concise manner.§ §Ability to provide information and support to staff and a variety of external Castalia contacts while maintaining high standards of confidentiality§ §Organisational skills and an ability to maintain and develop an effective and smooth running reception area§ §Excellent skills in the use of Outlook, MS Word, MS PowerPoint, and Adobe§ §Ability to work on own initiative; plan, initiate, and prioritise work and work to deadlines, both as an individual and within a team§ §Ability to learn on the job and develop a thorough understanding about Castalia.§ §Accounts payable experience§ §2 years of office management experience§ §Desired§ § §Experience in procurement or contract management§ §Experience in editing and publishing§ §Experience with MYOB§ §How to Apply§ §If this opportunity sounds exciting, and you have the skills and experience required, please send your resume and cover letter to §Melissa.Bolton@castalia-advisors.com§ § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as an office administrator?§Do you have experience in an administration role?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§

jobTitle: Legal Assistant/Office Assistant Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50678105.txt	§Legal Assistant/Office Assistant§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Legal Assistant/Office Assistant§§Advertiser: §Immigration Advisers NZ Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§2 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Administrative Assistants§§§§§§We are looking for a courteous, responsible and friendly go getter who would like to be part of a progressive immigration advisory firm as we continue our move to a paper-lite and electronic file environment.  We are a well-established, reputed, dynamic, expanding immigration advisory company based in Auckland CBD.§ §We pride ourselves in providing outstanding client service. Our clients are from all over the world and their cases cover all visa types including Temporary, Residency, Appeals and Ministerial applications. As this industry is a "people-focused' industry, there is a need to appreciate and acknowledge the cultural norms and values of immigrants from all cultures.§ §The Role§ §This role is full of variety with no two days being the same. If you are someone who can juggle multiple tasks with a smile, has a can-do attitude, bucket loads of initiative, and a knack for building relationships with people from all levels and backgrounds, this role can suit you. We’re looking for someone who will bring proactive pragmatism to the role and can efficiently work on CRM .§ §The role includes:§ § §Professional telephone manners and exceptional communication skills§ §Exceptional mail management skills and multitasking§ §Research, prepare and format emails, letters, reports and other documents§ §Secretarial work and some account handling § §High degree of familiarity with MS Office § §Preparation and collation of legal documents.§ §Ensuring compliance with occupational health and safety regulations§ §Ensuring work complies with sector relevant government legislation, policies and procedures§ §Job requirements§ § §Be able to multitask § §A tertiary qualification § §Confident and outgoing personality§ §Experience of working on CRM and Xero§ §Experience of working in immigration industry§ §Excellent written and verbal communication skills§ §Great with prioritising work and being a team player.§ §Initiative and ability to take ownership of a range of tasks.§ §A service mentality - your priority is to help and support the team§ §Legal experience is not essential but it'll be advantageous. Candidates with high level of personal presentation having bright and friendly personality, with abundant initiative would be preferred. In exchange, you will have the opportunity to develop your skills and be part of a fast growing company with a great culture. A competitive salary package will be offered depending on your experience. §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as an office assistant?§Which of the following Microsoft Office products are you experienced with?§Do you have experience in an administration role?§Which of the following accounting packages are you experienced with?§§§

jobTitle: Admin Co-Ordinator - PlaceMakers Job in Waikato - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50679911.txt	§Admin Co-Ordinator - PlaceMakers§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Admin Co-Ordinator - PlaceMakers§§Advertiser: §Fletcher Building Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§4 Oct 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Hamilton§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Data Entry & Word Processing§§§§§§Data entry super star looking to take on a little bit more!§§§PlaceMaker’s is a dynamic, interesting and fast paced environment to work in. We also happen to be one of New Zealand's leading and largest suppliers of building materials and a very successful business unit within the wider Fletcher Building Group.§§§In Hamilton we have a team of approx. 30 people strong who make up part of what we call our National Estimating Unit. This unit provides residential and light commercial construction quoting and pricing services to our branches across the country.§§The workload is growing and so we are looking for a new team member to join the existing team of 3 Co-ordinators. §§The role:§§To explain, a customer or builder asks any of our branches across NZ for pricing assistance or quotes. These requests are loaded into a system unique to our business and once logged into this central database they flow through to the Co-ordination team. These are then booked into a tracking system and allocated to the right Estimator / team to work on. Once complete, the information is then checked before being sent back to the branch through the central database.§§§So key things we are looking for are as follows:§§A very strong eye for detail§Tested data entry and processing skills§An interest in systems along with good Excel abilities. §Good communication skills§Someone who is a perfectionist by nature!§An inquisitive mind as we want you to ask questions and we want you to ask why things are done certain ways. This role won’t suit someone who struggles to speak up.§A flexible and adaptable way of working, as you will provide cover for any of the other three team members§A great work ethic and desire to work collaboratively with others. §Someone who works best in a busy environment where you have a lot on in the day and the challenge is to get through it all without compromising on accuracy. §§All of our systems are in-house systems so we will provide you with the training and support you will need. But we will be looking to you to be eager to listen, learn and take on board the importance of your role in providing a great service to our customers around the country. And this is why someone who is capable of processing things quickly and accurately is absolutely a key requirement for us.  §§This role is designed for someone with proven data entry skills who is looking to gain a few more admin skills.§§§This is a permanent full time role Monday to Friday – 40 hours per week. §§§PlaceMaker’s is a fantastic place to work which could result in further career opportunities. So if you’d like to be considered, go ahead and apply!§§§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

We work with our clients and candidates to build great relationships so we can match the right person for the right role.  § §Here's our latest opportunity!§The Company§ Produco are expert Food Safety and Regulatory Compliance specialists who provide quality solutions to Food and Beverage manufacturers and the Dairy industry. With the goal of being ‘Practical, Approachable, and Educational’, they have seen continued and sustained growth over the last few years, which looks very much set to continue next year.  The highly qualified team is largely remote, and with their schedules growing, it is now time to bring on an experienced Business Support Manager (BSM) to ensure that the detail is looked after as business builds.§  § §The Role§ This is a true ‘all-rounder’ role and will be the glue that holds the business together.  You will be responsible for the lifecycle of projects, from developing quotes through Workflow Max, right through to closing off projects and gathering client testimonials. Because of the volume of projects on the go at any given time, a huge part of the Business Support Manager’s role will be workforce and workflow planning, and liaising with both the clients and consultants to ensure everything is tracking as it should.§  § The BSM will be responsible for supporting in the management of Produco’s online presence through all social channels, as well as supporting in website management.  There will be some accounts involved in the role, but it isn’t heavily financial, and event management will fall under the BSM’s responsibilities.§  § §The Person§ What we are really looking for is someone who can get sh*t done. We really need a candidate who is used to looking after the detail and is the kind of person to get excited about a new system or process. This role really requires someone with a great level of maturity and a high level of computer literacy who can get in and get going.§  § Sound like you? jobTitle: Senior Information Management Advisor / Kaitohutohu Matua Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50680077.txt	§Senior Information Management Advisor / Kaitohutohu Matua§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Information Management Advisor / Kaitohutohu Matua§§Advertiser: §Greater Wellington§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§4 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Records Management & Document Control§§§§§§We are looking for an experienced Senior Information Management Advisor to join our established team who are dedicated and passionate about protecting data. You will provide specialist advice to the team and the customer on information and records management for the Council. You will be the ambassador for protection of our information assets and work with the people of Greater Wellington to maintain the safety of our data.§About Greater Wellington§There is a lot more to us than meets the eye. Here at Greater Wellington Regional Council, we are working on the big things that will impact everyone in our region. Ensuring we have uninterrupted access to drinking water, staying safe from the threat of flooding, protecting and enhancing the environment, improving the quality of our fresh water, ensuring we are all connected through our public transport network and planning ahead for the potential impact of climate change across our region. We are people who are genuinely passionate about the work we do, because we believe what we do counts.§Our benefits§We provide a diverse range of benefits including flexible working options that help our staff balance their own lifestyle and needs with their work commitments. We're also all about growing our people through professional development and experience across everything the council does.§ICT Transformation 2020§Our ICT Department is going through a significant change and to facilitate this we have reorganised our teams and created several new roles. This is a great opportunity to join the team during this exciting period of growth where you will have an opportunity to partner with the business to lead digitalisation.§We have a great team of passionate people and are looking for others to join us as we strive to become the coolest little IT shop in local government.§About the role§The Senior Information Management Advisor is a part of the Data & Information Management Team. The Senior Information Management Advisor's purpose is to actively increase the awareness, culture and maturity of practice of GW's Information Management to ensure we capture, extract and leverage the value in the information in our business, while ensuring the safety and privacy of that information.§To be successful in the role you will ensure we capture, refine, organise and share GW's information using best practice structures, processes and technology.  This role is an excellent opportunity for you to coach, mentor and develop the Information Management team to ensure that GW's records and documents are appropriately stored, listed and maintained in a secure manner and that best practices are adhered to.  §Skills and experience required§§Tertiary qualification in relevant discipline and/or 10+years' experience in an IT Information Management role with at least 2 years at a senior level, within similar sized organisations.§Proven experience raising organisational capability through the development and application of Information Management policies, frameworks & tools.§Able to design and implement records and information management processes and process improvement.§Experience with data and information technologies, including common data platform capabilities.  A good understanding of the capabilities of Microsoft stack is a particular requirement for GW, along with strong Microsoft Office applications knowledge.§Demonstrated experience in strategy development and implementation, preferably in information management.§Experience in advising and supporting people within the organisation on record and information management, data classification and information security.§Excellent relationship building and interpersonal skills.§Facilitation and presentation skills and experience will be a significant an advantage along with the ability to explain difficult concepts to non-technical users.§Experience in developing & leading workshops related to Information Management policies and practices§§How to apply§To view the job description and to apply for the role, click on the "Apply" link.§For further information, please contact §askCIO@gw.govt.nz§§Applications Close:§ Monday, 19 October 2020§Only people with the right to work in New Zealand may apply for this position. For advice on obtaining a New Zealand work or residence visa, please visit §www.immigration.govt.nz§§§§

jobTitle: Office Administrator - Action Education Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50680174.txt	§Office Administrator - Action Education§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Office Administrator - Action Education§§Advertiser: §Youthline Auckland§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§4 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Administrative Assistants§§§§§§Action Education Office Administrator (Part Time - 20 hours per week, Fixed Term)§  § § § §Timely and relevant services and follow up to best meet the client needs§ §Excellent administrative and office management support to the Action Education team§ §Proactive and reactive communication to relevant internal and external stakeholders§ §20 hours per week during office hours with flexibility around evening and weekend work as required§ §Office based in Grey Lynn§ §1-year fixed-term§ § §  §Action Education is looking for an efficient administrator who will provide excellent administrative and office management support to the Action Education team. You will work with a team of professionals and mentors undertaking youth development through youth programmes, activities and events designed to promote healthy creative self-expression.§  § §  §Action Education is an arts based organisation focused on youth development. We believe that fundamental to the wellbeing of young people is their ability to express their identity. We provide spaces, platforms and tools for young people to reflect on their experience, connect with others and express who they are through creativity.§  § §  §Reporting to the Action Education Manager, you will be a professional administrator who have strong administration skills and a good working knowledge of database systems, Microsoft Word, Outlook and Excel, and most importantly an enthusiasm in youth development and community engagement.§  § §  §Your main responsibilities will be:§ § §Having oversight of administrative and reporting requirements for all Action Education activities§ §Keeping calendars, inboxes and reporting dates in check so Action Education’s clients and stakeholders receive timely and relevant services and follow up that best meet their needs§ §Managing logistics of meetings, programmes and events to ensure a smooth operation of all Action Education activities§ §Keeping up-to-date documents, handbook, resources and data entry§ §Ensuring all reporting are written and submitted timely§ §Ensuring client confidential information is kept safely and securely§ §Maintaining Action Education website contents (simple updates)§ §Providing a regular communication through a variety of channels including (but not restricted to) social media, Email and newsletters§ § §  §This is a busy and responsible position, so you will have good planning, time management and excellent computer skills.  You will have strong relationship skills and be able to support and guide our teams to deliver exceptional services to young people through all our services.§  § §  §Your personal philosophy will include having a strengths-based approach to working with people, and a willingness to embrace diversity.§  § §  §This is a part time position of 20 hours per week; however, you will need flexibility around weekend and evening work at times for special events.§  § §  §Please click on the "apply" link to register your candidacy and CV along with a cover letter detailing why you believe you are the right person for this job. Please note, while we appreciate the time you’ve taken to apply for this position, we will only be contacting suitable candidates.§  § §  §Application closes at 5PM Friday 16th October 2020.§  § §  §If you would like the position description, please contact §HR@youthline.co.nz§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Which of the following Microsoft Office products are you experienced with?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§

Engari, he toa takitini.§        §Success is not the work of one, but the work of many.§        §Permanent§        §80 hours per fortnight - rotating roster§        §We have a fabulous opportunity for a compassionate person to join our Administration Service, based in our Maternity Reception.§        §You'll need to be self-motivated and results driven as well as enjoy working in a fast paced and ever-changing environment. jobTitle: Court Registry Officer Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50680211.txt	§Court Registry Officer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Court Registry Officer§§Advertiser: §Ministry of Justice§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§4 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Hutt Valley§§Salary§§$48,853 - $68,968§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Administrative Assistants§§§§§§Te āhuatunga a te tūranga/About the Role§§This role is based at Hutt Valley Distrcit Court. §In this role you will work with a team responsible for the successful operation of the Court. You will liaise with multiple stakeholders who are interacting with the Justice system. This includes being able to communicate confidently with Judges within the courtroom and their chambers, as well as other members of the judiciary.§The roles tasks include but is not limited to:§§Court Taking - this is the facilitation of running the court. This includes introducing Judges (in English and Te Reo Maori), working closely with them in the Courtroom and Chambers, managing jurors and general administration of the court.§Customer Service - interacting with customers on any court related matter. Customer queries can come in via face to face, phone or email interactions - so you will need to be confident with all methods.§§Case management - this involves ensuring files are accurate and up to date. This part of the role involves a large component of data entry.§§Mō te tīma/About our Team§At Tāhū o te Ture - the Ministry of Justice, we're committed to working together for a fair and safe Aotearoa.§At the Ministry of Justice we deliver people centred services to provide access to justice for all. Te tuku ratonga ā-tangata kia āhei atu ai te katoa ki te ture.§Creating a continuous learning environment is important to us. As the successful applicant, you will bring your thirst for knowledge and improvement. You will have an individual training plan and be supported to carry out the role. As a Court Registry Officer this includes exercising Deputy Registrar Powers. §As an organisation we empower our people with building their wellbeing knowledge, offering a range of wellbeing tools and support.§§Joining the Ministry of Justice means you will become part of an inclusive organisation that values you and the communities we serve. §It's our promise to ensure our workplace is one where our people feel healthy and safe, supported and able to be themselves at work. We value respect as the foundation for building a positive workplace culture and one where diversity is welcomed and celebrated. §§He pūkenga tou/Skills and Experience§With pride in your work, you will strive to deliver a service to our customers with high accuracy and professionalism.§Our customers are diverse, and our workforce reflects this. This role is no different and would suit a variety of backgrounds. Whether you have an interest in the Justice system, returning to the workforce, have a passion for working with customers this is your chance to join us on our journey to deliver people centred justice services for all.§To be successful, you will need to be:§§Detail orientated and observant - the court has many different processes and case information needs to be accurate;§Self-aware -our customers are unique, and you will be confident working, both individually and as a team, across a range of situations;§Multi-task -some of our processes are repetitive, but you'll be able to manage conflicting priorities and move from one task to another quickly;§Willing to learn - legislation and processes in the courts is always changing and you will be able to adapt and take onboard feedback.§Resilience - there are times when working in the courts, you will be working on sensitive cases and sometimes at high volume.§§Tono mai/How to Apply§Starting salaries are generally between $48,853 and $57,473 and are dependent on skills and experience.§Only applicants with the right to work in New Zealand will be considered for this position.§To apply, click the Apply button below to be directed to our Careers Website. You can view a detailed position description at the site, as well as complete an online application form by attaching your CV and cover letter.§For tracking purposes, all applications must be submitted via our online process.§Applications close on 11 October 2020.§If you have any questions please contact §recruitment@justice.govt.nz§ §§§§

jobTitle: Front Office Representative Job in Otago - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50680230.txt	§Front Office Representative§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Front Office Representative§§Advertiser: §Origin Oral Surgeons§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§4 Oct 2020§§Location§§Otago§, §Dunedin§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Administrative Assistants§§§§§§About the business§ § § §Origin Oral Surgeons is a specialist practice, catering to Dentists and Dental Specialists in the Otago and Southland region. Our practice is purpose built to deliver patient care to the highest standard. Led by specialist oral surgeon, Dr. Soo-Wee Ong, we pride ourselves on delivering exceptional surgical care and have our patients best interest at heart.       § §Being housed in Vogel Street, we have unlimited access to the hottest cafes and bakeries in Dunedin.  § § § § § §About the role§ § § §As our Front Office Superstar, you will be working alongside the surgical team to provide outstanding care to our patients. § §The successful applicant's main responsibilities include § § §Patient liaison § § §Bridge between the clinical and administrative§ § §Performance of a variety of administrative, financial, and marketing roles for our patients§ § §As our patients primary point of contact, you will set and uphold our standards, for all their experiences with us§ § §We understand the ideal environment for a Front Office Representative is one where they can:§ § §Experience a level of work that will strengthen their own skill set.§ § §Work within a team who support and encourage professional development through training and mentorship.§ § §Demonstrate their exceptional ability to communicate with patients and the broader team in a collaborative environment. § § §Beat the boredom with no two days the same§ § § § §Benefits and perks§ § § §We encourage all to apply. We are looking for more than just administrative skills, and "attention to detail". We are looking for a person with the right attitude and who can align with our practice values and culture.§ §Non-negotiable Requirements:§ § §Exceptional human relation skills§ § §Ability to juggle multiple balls at once § § §Maintain a positive and upbeat attitude in the face of adversity § § §Bonus, but not essential:§ § §Hold a current CPR certificate§ § § § §Skills and experience§ § § §If this sounds like you, we want to hear from you. Email us your resume to §home@originsurgeons.nz§ with a cover letter outlining;§ § §A bit about who you are§ § §Your approach to administration and your unique communication style and examples where you have used your style.§ § §Why working as part of a team is important to you.§ § §Provide an example where you have juggled multiple tasks at once§ § §Tell us your best "Dad" joke.§ § §Only applicants who respond to all five (5) points above will be considered.§ § § § §§§§

jobTitle: Temp Receptionists/Administrators - Ad Agencies/Music Companies Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50680281.txt	§Temp Receptionists/Administrators - Ad Agencies/Music Companies§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Temp Receptionists/Administrators - Ad Agencies/Music Companies§§Advertiser: §Metro Recruitment Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§4 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Receptionists§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Temp Receptionists/Administrators - Ad Agencies/Music Companies §      §        §Experienced Reception temps needed to work with our many fabulous clients located primarily in the Auckland inner city. Our clients cover a range of creative and corporate environments including Advertising agencies, music companies and lots more. Previous office experience combined with fabulous presentation is essential.§        §We are seeking FABULOUS front-line temps who have excellent personal presentation, are polished and professional, have a can-do attitude, are 100% reliable, quick to pick things up and who our clients will love having work in their offices.§        §If you are flexible, quick to learn and enjoy the variety of different work environments that temping offers, then we would love to hear from you! It is the perfect way to grow your experience in different industries and to earn money while you are in between jobs or are visiting N.Z. on a work visa.§If this sounds like you then don't delay, we'd love to hear from you today!  Please email your Resume to Brooke at Metro Recruitment via SEEK§      §      §      §    §    §metro§recruitment§.co.nz§  §§§Experienced Reception temps needed to work with our many fabulous clients located primarily in the Auckland inner city. Our clients cover a range of creative and corporate environments including Advertising agencies, music companies and lots more. Previous office experience combined with fabulous presentation is essential.§ §We are seeking FABULOUS front-line temps who have excellent personal presentation, are polished and professional, have a can-do attitude, are 100% reliable, quick to pick things up and who our clients will love having work in their offices.§ §If you are flexible, quick to learn and enjoy the variety of different work environments that temping offers, then we would love to hear from you! It is the perfect way to grow your experience in different industries and to earn money while you are in between jobs or are visiting N.Z. on a work visa.§If this sounds like you then don't delay, we'd love to hear from you today!  Please email your Resume to Brooke at Metro Recruitment via SEEK§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§How many years' experience do you have as a receptionist?§§§

jobTitle: Building Coordinator Job in Bay of Plenty - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50680311.txt	§Building Coordinator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Building Coordinator§§Advertiser: §Classic Group§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§4 Oct 2020§§Location§§Bay of Plenty§, §Tauranga§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Other§§§§§§We're gutsy and ambitious. We're down to earth. We're smart and curious. We are people obsessed. We understand.§ §Classic is a success story that so far spans 20+ years. A couple of guys with different skills had a shared vision to build homes for Kiwis. They wanted to build better homes with quality and affordability taking centre stage.§ §Now the second largest residential builder in New Zealand, Classic Builders has built over 6,000 homes across Aotearoa.§ §But we can't do this alone – we rely on the tenacity of our people, the heart of our business.§ §We are looking for a Building Coordinator to join the team in our flagship Tauranga Branch. This is a key role which forms the link between the sales and construction processes, and helps to ensure that our clients have a smooth build and an amazing experience.§ §This role is perfect for someone who is great at building relationships with people, loves to chip in and be part of a team, has excellent time management and prioritisation abilities and (preferably) has some experience in the construction industry. § §Accountabilities include:§ § §Administration responsibilities throughout the different stages of the build process § §Coordinate with interior designers§ §Facilitate the process of clients making changes to their builds§ §Ensure the project management system is kept up to date with correct information§ §Facilitate the council code of compliance processes§ §What we are looking for:§ § §Proficiency in using Microsoft Office – Word, Excel & Outlook§ §Minimum two years in an office or administration role§ §Knowledge of the building industry is a bonus§ §Core to what we do at Classics is our values, so if these resonate with you and the way you work, then you'll fit in fine:§ § §We care§ §We work as one team§ §We are daring§ §We deliver excellence§ §If this sounds like a bit of you, apply by clicking the link! §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have experience in an administration role?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§

We provide expertise tailored to key industry sectors that include Health, Business & Industry, Resources, Defence, PPP, Leisure, Sport & Entertainment, Laundries, Education and Government. §        §We're passionate about finding better ways of doing things. to join our expanding South Auckland team.  These are full time roles for two years fixed term, reporting to the Team Leader responsible for the effective delivery of administration services to planned programmes of work.  §        §Your responsibilities will include: §        §          §Manage the data interface between the Work Supervisors and the Works Management System (WMS)§ co-ordination§          §Efficient and accurate keyboarding skills§          §Able to work within a fast–paced environment with daily deadlines§          §Knowledge or an understanding of the Domestic Building and Construction Industry terminology is an advantage§        §        §Benefits and Culture:§        §This is a fantastic opportunity to join a high profile, progressive organisation offering training and career development while establishing your career within a successful and innovative team. §        §Apply online now by clicking the 'apply' button.§        §Spotless Facilities Services (NZ) is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating a diverse and inclusive culture.§ §        §Please note:§ As a pre-requisite for these roles, candidates will be required to undertake a pre-employment medical and drug screen, police clearance and security check. Candidates must have the right to work in New Zealand.§      §      §      §    §    §www.downer.co.nz§ jobTitle: Programme Coordinator Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50680465.txt	§Programme Coordinator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Programme Coordinator§§Advertiser: §Ministry of Education§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§4 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Other§§§§§§Pathways and Progress§Permanent§Wellington§Kia ora, Bula Vinaka, Fakaalofa lahi atu, Fakatalofa atu, Kia orana, Malo e lelei, Malo ni, Talofa lava, Tena koutou katoa and welcome.§Help shape the future of education§At the Ministry of Education, we work together to shape an education system that delivers equitable and excellent outcomes.§Our organisation is made up of more than 3,000 talented and committed people around New Zealand, from a wide range of backgrounds and cultures.§While we work in different groups and on different things, we all strive every day to make the biggest difference we can for every child, young person and adult student in our education system.§About Early Learning and Student Achievement (ELSA)§The Early Learning and Student Achievement Group sets the system-level learning for every child and student. Working between policy and customer facing functions, there is a significant political, stakeholder and public interest in the high performance of this group and the education curriculum and teaching workforce outcomes we seek for New Zealand.§About Pathways and Progress§The role of the Pathways and Progress group is to set the direction for what students learn, how they progress and how school leaders and teachers can achieve that for every child and student across school years 1 to 13.§The group uses evidence and educational trends to design targeted solutions, resources, tools and services that lift educational achievement for all.§The group co-designs and co-develops innovative initiatives that achieve policy intentions, plan successful implementation strategies and monitor to ensure a return on investment.§About this role§We are seeking a Programme Coordinator to support the Aotearoa New Zealand Histories programme of work.§The Programme Coordinator supports the work of the Programme Manager to provide planning and management of the work programme. The support the Programme Coordinator provides will be to ensure the team delivers on its various work streams. The Programme Coordinator will record the activities, maintain team reporting and provide analysis and advice to managers that support decision-making around processes and systems, resource allocation and work priorities. This role provides project support across the group as required. It is strongly customer focused, in a busy group and is critical in providing written responses to general enquiries and producing other forms of communication such as diagrams and presentations.§About you§The person in this role has significant experience working in project and programme environments. You can anticipate project/programme needs, work at pace and manage set tasks and projects, as well as noticing pressure points and taking the initiative to resolve them. Your personal qualities include taking pride in producing written work and other forms of communication of the highest quality every time, and you have a proven ability to get the job done. You have the kind of interpersonal savviness that means you relate well with all kinds of people. Your background experience and skills contribute to the team providing high quality services to the sector and across the ministry.§Able to write well§Interpersonal savvy§Well-organised and able to manage multiple pieces of work§Certifications in project disciplines are desirable§Are you ready to make a difference?§We welcome candidates from diverse backgrounds, including Māori, Pacific and those with disabilities, who will enrich our understanding of the education system.§As a government agency, the Ministry is committed to keeping to the Treaty of Waitangi's guiding principles in our work for and with Māori students, their whānau, hapū and iwi.§There is more information in the position description attached, please take a look and if this opportunity sounds like you, please apply now using the 'apply online' button.§For further information, please contact Rachael Barber on §+64 4 463 1977§ or email §rachael.barber@education.govt.nz§Click here to view the role description§§Applications close midnight to Wednesday, 14 October 2020.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§
