jobTitle: Executive Assistant Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50680824.txt	§Executive Assistant§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Executive Assistant§§Advertiser: §Manukau Institute of Technology§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§4 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Manukau & East Auckland§§Salary§§Prof-development days, staff discounts §§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §PA, EA & Secretarial§§§§§§§§§  §    §      §        §Executive Assistant §        §          §An opportunity to make a real impact using your initiative to build a positive brand by delivering an excellent level of customer service§          §Otara East Tamaki§          §We are passionate, we are genuine, we are honest, and we care for others in order to nurture the ability of others to achieve; Manaakitanga. We are Manukau Institute of Technology (MIT) and are at the forefront of changing lives through vocational education, with a strong vision of getting people into great jobs. We seek an energetic, driven self-starter to join our inclusive, supportive, culturally diverse Pasifika and Student Journey teams.§          §Supporting the Deputy Chief Executive Pasifika and Student Journey this is a pivotal role ensuring the smooth operation of the office of the DCE Pasifika and Student Journey. This position plays a key part in working hand in hand with the DCE, as a trusted advisor and proactive problem-solving assistant.§          §Some of the overall responsibilities:§          §            §Providing general administrative support to the DCE.§            §Liaising widely with the Pasifika and Student Journey Leadership Team and gathering data the DCE needs for meetings, including statistics and reports.§            §Screening and responding to calls, emails, requests and correspondence.§            §Organising and maintaining the DCE's diary by co-ordinating their external commitments, internal meetings and other urgent appointments.§            §Booking travel arrangements as required.§            §Collating staff information on behalf of the DCE and preparing the appropriate documentation and reports.§            §Supporting administration functions related to staff appraisals, employment contracts, student issues and development plans and establishing and maintaining all files.§            §Supporting the planning of external engagement activities of the DCE and liaising as necessary with external parties§          §          §Your ability to multitask, use your initiative and communicate will be the true measure of how successful you will be in this role. We seek a confident, resilient, proactive and solution driven Executive Assistant who is able to anticipate needs and be the eyes and ears and the key point of contact for all of the DCE's day to day management of team activities. You will help build a positive brand by delivering an excellent level of customer service to all internal and external stakeholders.§          §If have worked in a similar role and bring experience from large complex organisations' you will thrive in this busy role with an opportunity to show case your problem solving and customer service ethos.§          §Join us, we would love to hear from you.§          §Job Reference: 27093§          §For a copy of the Job Description or to apply visit §https://careers.manukau.ac.nz/home§          §Applications Close:§ Monday, 19th October, 2020§          §§        §        §        §      §      §        §Kua herea matou ki te whai i te tuturutanga o Te Tiriti O Waitangi§ WE ARE COMMITTED TO CREATING AND MAINTAINING A CULTURALLY§ SENSITIVE WORK ENVIRONMENT IN RELATION TO TE TIRITI O WAITANGI§          § WE ARE REAL, MANAAKITANGA, WE ARE CONNECTED, WE ARE EXCELLENT§        §        §For more information contact§          §workingatMIT@manukau.ac.nz§          §manukau.ac.nz | 0800 62 62 52§        §      §    §  §§§An opportunity to make a real impact using your initiative to build a positive brand by delivering an excellent level of customer service§Otara East Tamaki§We are passionate, we are genuine, we are honest, and we care for others in order to nurture the ability of others to achieve; Manaakitanga. We are Manukau Institute of Technology (MIT) and are at the forefront of changing lives through vocational education, with a strong vision of getting people into great jobs. We seek an energetic, driven self-starter to join our inclusive, supportive, culturally diverse Pasifika and Student Journey teams.§Supporting the Deputy Chief Executive Pasifika and Student Journey this is a pivotal role ensuring the smooth operation of the office of the DCE Pasifika and Student Journey. This position plays a key part in working hand in hand with the DCE, as a trusted advisor and proactive problem-solving assistant.§Some of the overall responsibilities:§Providing general administrative support to the DCE.§Liaising widely with the Pasifika and Student Journey Leadership Team and gathering data the DCE needs for meetings, including statistics and reports.§Screening and responding to calls, emails, requests and correspondence.§Organising and maintaining the DCE's diary by co-ordinating their external commitments, internal meetings and other urgent appointments.§Booking travel arrangements as required.§Collating staff information on behalf of the DCE and preparing the appropriate documentation and reports.§Supporting administration functions related to staff appraisals, employment contracts, student issues and development plans and establishing and maintaining all files.§Supporting the planning of external engagement activities of the DCE and liaising as necessary with external parties§Your ability to multitask, use your initiative and communicate will be the true measure of how successful you will be in this role. We seek a confident, resilient, proactive and solution driven Executive Assistant who is able to anticipate needs and be the eyes and ears and the key point of contact for all of the DCE's day to day management of team activities. You will help build a positive brand by delivering an excellent level of customer service to all internal and external stakeholders.§If have worked in a similar role and bring experience from large complex organisations' you will thrive in this busy role with an opportunity to show case your problem solving and customer service ethos.§Join us, we would love to hear from you.§Job Reference: 27093§For a copy of the Job Description or to apply visit §https://careers.manukau.ac.nz/home§Applications Close:§ Monday, 19th October, 2020§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50680905.txt	§Integrity Intervention Officers - Lower Hutt§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Integrity Intervention Officers - Lower Hutt§§Advertiser: §Ministry of Social Development§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Hutt Valley§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Administrative Assistants§§§§§§§§§  §    §Integrity Intervention Officers - Lower Hutt §    §      §        §Job Ref: 33043§        §Full Time, Fixed Term Positions until June 2022§Start date: 30th November 2020§        §Integrity and Debt vision is to make a critical difference for New Zealanders by working with clients early to do the right thing and help them minimise or potentially avoid a debt. §        §We consist of three business units, across multiple locations, providing product and processing support to New Zealanders.  Our approach is to leverage and share capability, where practical, across our various locations to effectively and efficiently meet client demand. § §We are currently recruiting for full time Integrity Intervention Officer roles in Lower Hutt, Wellington on a fixed term basis until June 2022.§ §We are looking for people with the following attributes: §        §          §Excellent client service skills.§          §The ability to problem solve.§          §Strong verbal and written communication skills.§          §Proven ability to self-manage, work well under pressure and meet agreed deadlines.§          §Proven ability to adapt and accept change in addition to working well within a team environment. §          §Comfortable navigating technology such as different applications on a PC.  §          §Previous product and processing experience is desirable. §        §        §Benefits:§        §          §Supportive team environment.§          §Regular coaching and development.§          §Salary $45,968 with potential to earn up to $60,727 per annum (based on annual salary reviews).§        §        §How to apply:§        §Please apply online with your CV. You do need to upload a cover letter outlining your relevant experience and skills against the attributes as listed above. §        §If you currently work for MSD please apply through your myHR careers portal at work.  All other candidates please click the ‘apply now’ button.  We look forward to your online application.  §        §To view the position description, click the following link: §http://www.msd.govt.nz/hr/documents/position-descriptions/service-delivery/5.-client-service-support/integrity-intervention-officer-march2020.docx§ §        §For any further discussion about the role, contact Tania Linton, Service Manager at §Tania.Linton001@msd.govt.nz§        §Applications close: Sunday, 11 October 2020 at 10pm.§        §Joining us§        §Joining MSD means being part of a whānau that celebrates the diversity each individual represents.  We show manaaki, we care about the wellbeing and success of people and want everyone to thrive, and be who they are in a supportive and inclusive working environment. We work together to make a difference for communities while doing the right thing with integrity. We are a Treaty partner committed to strengthening relationships with§ §Māori,§ §Hapū§,§ Iwi and communities to realise their own potential and aspirations.§        §If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to tell us when you apply so we can assist you through the recruitment process.§      §      §The Ministry of Social Development is one of New Zealand's largest government agencies. Our work to achieve better social outcomes affects almost every New Zealander, now or in the future.§        §https://jobs.msd.govt.nz/§      §    §    §  §§§Job Ref: 33043§ §Full Time, Fixed Term Positions until June 2022§Start date: 30th November 2020§ §Integrity and Debt vision is to make a critical difference for New Zealanders by working with clients early to do the right thing and help them minimise or potentially avoid a debt. § §We consist of three business units, across multiple locations, providing product and processing support to New Zealanders.  Our approach is to leverage and share capability, where practical, across our various locations to effectively and efficiently meet client demand. § §We are currently recruiting for full time Integrity Intervention Officer roles in Lower Hutt, Wellington on a fixed term basis until June 2022.§ §We are looking for people with the following attributes: § § §Excellent client service skills.§ §The ability to problem solve.§ §Strong verbal and written communication skills.§ §Proven ability to self-manage, work well under pressure and meet agreed deadlines.§ §Proven ability to adapt and accept change in addition to working well within a team environment. § §Comfortable navigating technology such as different applications on a PC.  § §Previous product and processing experience is desirable. § §Benefits:§ § §Supportive team environment.§ §Regular coaching and development.§ §Salary $45,968 with potential to earn up to $60,727 per annum (based on annual salary reviews).§ §How to apply:§ §Please apply online with your CV. You do need to upload a cover letter outlining your relevant experience and skills against the attributes as listed above. § §If you currently work for MSD please apply through your myHR careers portal at work.  All other candidates please click the ‘apply now’ button.  We look forward to your online application.  § §To view the position description, click the following link: §http://www.msd.govt.nz/hr/documents/position-descriptions/service-delivery/5.-client-service-support/integrity-intervention-officer-march2020.docx§ § §For any further discussion about the role, contact Tania Linton, Service Manager at §Tania.Linton001@msd.govt.nz§ §Applications close: Sunday, 11 October 2020 at 10pm.§ §Joining us§ §Joining MSD means being part of a whānau that celebrates the diversity each individual represents.  We show manaaki, we care about the wellbeing and success of people and want everyone to thrive, and be who they are in a supportive and inclusive working environment. We work together to make a difference for communities while doing the right thing with integrity. We are a Treaty partner committed to strengthening relationships with§ §Māori,§ §Hapū§,§ Iwi and communities to realise their own potential and aspirations.§ §If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to tell us when you apply so we can assist you through the recruitment process.§§§§

jobTitle: Building Services Administrator Job in Canterbury - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50681146.txt	§Building Services Administrator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Building Services Administrator§§Advertiser: §Stats NZ§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Oct 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Receptionists§§§§§§§About Us | §Mō mātou§§At Tatauranga Aotearoa, Stats NZ, our vision is to unleash the power of data to change lives.  As New Zealand’s official data and statistics agency, we are tasked with leading the way for New Zealand’s data future, enabling data-led innovation across society, the economy, and the environment.§The role | Mō te tūnga§  §We have a fixed term opportunity due to parental leave until July 2021 for a customer service champion. As the Building Services Administrator you will join the Corporate Offices team who are responsible for ensuring our Christchurch offices runs effectively to provide a well-functioning workplace. §Our team provides a wide range of services to our staff including Corporate Reception, day-to-day running of our Christchurch Office including, facility management, staff inductions, meeting room management, mail and couriers, assisting with travel queries, along with all the daily requirements of running our office. §Working within a team of three, you will join us to be the first point of contact for clients and staff at our reception.  You will be someone who can connect easily with people and with your positive outlook and attitude willing to undertake a variety of tasks each day. You will be comfortable to switch priorities if urgent matters arise. Your role will include being a first aider and building fire warden, training will be provided.§This is a fantastic opportunity to learn about our organisation because your role is involved with all parts of the business. You will gain an abundance of skills and knowledge that well set you up for any career path you decide to pursue in the future.§Salary midpoint for this position is $52,931 negotiable depending on the skills and experience of the successful candidate. §About you | §Mōu§  §To be successful you will have:§  §Previous reception and administration experience or within a service delivery role§  §Excellent relationship, interpersonal and listening skills with the ability to communicate within all levels of the organisation§  §A calm, flexible manner and able to roll within a fast-paced office environment§  §Experience and confidence using technology including the latest meeting room technology to its full capability§  §Proven ability to quickly learn new system and are technically savvy§  §Knowledge/familiarity or a commitment to learn/understand Te Ao Maori, including ensuring opportunities at Stats NZ reach the Maori community§§What’s in it for you? | Ngā hua ka riro ki a koe §You’ll be joining an inclusive environment where people, regardless of gender, race, disability, religion or background are supported to be able to do their best work. This includes:§  §A      flexible approach to work hours (37.5 hours per week) and arrangements.§  §A      collaborative team environment with people who truly love what they do.§  §Access      to a wide variety of benefits including banking, discounted health      insurance, cash-up & purchasing of annual leave, flu vacs, eye tests and more. §Want to know more about Stats NZ? Check us out on our website http://careers.stats.govt.nz/  §  §How to apply | Me pēhea te tuku tono?  §  §Apply now as we will be screening applications as we receive them in order to move swiftly to interview shortly after the advert closes. §  §Only applications submitted via our online system will be considered.§  §Any questions that haven’t been answered in this advert please email jobs@stats.govt.nz.§  §To view position description, paste this link https://bit.ly/3cOqq2F into your browser. §  §Closing date:  9 October 2020§  §Recruitment Agencies please note, any unsolicited CVs will not be accepted.§  §You must have the right to live and work in Aotearoa New Zealand to apply for this job.§§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Procurement Operations Specialist Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50681673.txt	§Procurement Operations Specialist§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Procurement Operations Specialist§§Advertiser: §Xero§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Contracts Administration§§§§§§Xero is a beautiful, easy-to-use platform that helps small businesses and their accounting and bookkeeping advisors grow and thrive. §  §At Xero, our purpose is to make life better for people in small business, their advisors, and communities around the world. This purpose sits at the centre of everything we do. We support our people to do the best work of their lives so that they can help small businesses succeed through better tools, information and connections. Because when they succeed they make a difference, and when millions of small businesses are making a difference, the world is a more beautiful place.§  §What we are looking for:§  §This role is perfect for someone at the beginning of their procurement career. With the support of the team, you will be responsible for delivering and contributing to a diverse range of procurement activities and initiatives and participate in projects that transform procurement processes, systems and practices. The day-to-day administration of procurement systems, procedures and processes as well as the generation of analysis and reporting relating to spend, performance and contract management are some of the areas you’ll be responsible for. By working collaboratively with the Procurement Operations Lead and the Procurement team you will also support operations initiatives, seek ways to improve team processes and procedures and support the wider Xero team by providing guidance and procurement expertise.§  §Note - this role is based in Wellington or Auckland§  §What you’ll bring with you:§ § §2-3 years experience in a similar role § §Experience in working with procurement and contract or financial management systems § §Excellent communication and influencing skills§ §Ability to successfully complete several tasks at the same time, maintain high levels of attention to detail, maintain documentation and record keeping and meet deadlines § §Analytical and reporting skills§ §Ability to learn new software tools§ §Internal stakeholder management and customer focused§ §Technically minded and ability to analyse information from multiple sources and make commercial decisions§ §A great attitude, self motivation and drive to make a real difference in a passionate and hardworking team.§ §How about the culture?§  §We’re a bunch of awesome, diverse humans who love coming into work. Everyone loves it for different reasons. We're a big big part of the small business community and you'll find Xeros attending and speaking at conferences, hosting meetups and generally being evangelical about small business and its value to the global economy.§  §We truly value our people and there’s an awesome package on offer that includes competitive base salary, Xero shares, Life Insurance and other benefits too.§  §Xero is an NZ Immigration Accredited Employer and Rainbow Tick certified too.§§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

This role is varied and requires you to take initiative and the ability to problem-solve on the go.   A strong understanding of confidentiality is a must.§The position requires multitasking and learning the office and computer-based systems of a school office. Ideally, this person will have previous school office experience, and/or be a fast learner. They will also need to be well organised and able to manage a variety of tasks. §You will have the ability to liaise and work collaboratively with all sectors of our school community. It is important that you can relate to the culture and values of our school.§Duties will include:§Responsibility for the payment of school accounts, accurate data entry using xero, and working with financial reports§Day to day management of Ed Pay (school payroll) §A detailed understanding of school accounts and preparation for annual audit.§Day to day word processing including light PA duties to Principal and Leadership Team as required§Promotions and communications as required§Occasional answering phones and reception cover as required§In addition to the above, the candidate will have the following essential attributes:§Strong IT skills, proficiency with Google programmes; Excel and Word would be advantageous§Knowledge of Human Resources management. §Critical thinking and effective solution focussed problem-solving skills§Excellent written and verbal communication skills and interpersonal skills§Detail-oriented, organised, and able to complete tasks on time§Confidence in working autonomously and/or within a team environment§A strong willingness to uphold the culture and values of our school§Strong interpersonal skills. Friendly and approachable manner§An ability to work well with a diverse range of team members, be able to be diplomatic, professional and use a sense of humour as appropriate§A police vetting report will be required as part of our selection process. §Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa. §For any further information or to discuss this position please contact Maree at §principal@rai.school.nz§All applications must be emailed to §principal@rai.school.nz§ including your CV and covering letter.§Applications for this position close at 9am Wednesday  21st October 2020.  §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Which of the following Microsoft Office products are you experienced with?§Do you have experience in an administration role?§How many years' experience do you have in an accounting role?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§

jobTitle: Surf Club Administrator Job in Waikato - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50683002.txt	§Surf Club Administrator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Surf Club Administrator§§Advertiser: §Tairua Surf Life Saving Club§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Thames & Coromandel§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Office Management§§§§§§Tairua Surf Life Saving Club (TSLSC) love being part of the Tairua community; and, thankfully locals and holiday makers alike have made us feel welcome over the many, many years that we have been part of the town.§Every year in every way, we grow that little bit further as a club.  The next year sees great plans ahead, as we build new club rooms and extend our efforts to attract, retain and develop lifeguards to keep our beach safe from drownings and injuries.§Whilst we have a dedicated team of volunteer committee members, parent helpers and lifeguards, with our ambitions we really need an extra pair of hands in our team. §We are seeking a locally based Club Administrator who thrives on organising, getting things done and mastering the admin. As an experienced administrator, you will be assisting and supporting the committee with:§Coordinating the summer programme of events (Junior Surf Programme and Saturday Surf Programme) from organising training days through to recruiting lifeguards §Helping with fundraising efforts and assisting with funding applications§Supporting marketing activities §Being our person on the ground as we build our new club house§Rest assured, you will be guided and supported all the way – we just need to know that very little fazes you on the administration front; and that you can work within agreed timelines with a cool head. With your proactive nature and ease at using your initiative; your ability to work independently and without supervision; yet, very much being part of a team – you will own this newly created role, helping us get even closer to the Tairua community whilst supporting us to realise our vision as a club.§The role will be 20 hours a week on average across the year – less during winter months and higher during the summer months when our programmes are in full flow.§If you are thinking §‘this role is for me’§ or §‘I know just the person for this role’§ – please reach out to Sharn, Club Secretary for an informal chat or a copy of the position description on 027 226 8104; and/or email Sharn at §sharn_j@yahoo.com§ [link removed]§Deadline for applications §22 October 2020§ with the successful candidate starting as soon as possible.§ § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Which of the following Microsoft Office products are you experienced with?§Do you have experience in an administration role?§§§

jobTitle: Business Support Manager Job in Otago - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50683602.txt	§Business Support Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Business Support Manager§§Advertiser: §MTS Paint§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Oct 2020§§Location§§Otago§, §Queenstown & Wanaka§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Office Management§§§§§§Business Support Manager§  §Commercial and Residential Painting and Timber Care §  § §  §An opportunity has opened to join our professional and friendly team in Queenstown, Central Otago§  §About the business§  §We are a well§-established business §that has more than §10- years§ experience in the industry providing local homeowners and businesses with painting and timber care.§  §  §  §About the role§  §The business support manager will work both on site painting with the team as well as doing administrative work from home or the company office. They will manage administration for employees and clients, write business procedures and documentation, assist in project management, and use project management software. They need to have a good understanding of the business financials and be able to work closely with the business director. They need to be able to manage the marketing, advertising, and social media for the business. They need to have the ability and skills to fill in and help when needed on site in various contracting roles. §  § §  §Skills and experience§ § §You need to have at least three years of administrative experience§ §Experience working in the painting and cedar care industry is a major plus§ §Experience with painting and cedar care§ §Strong writing and communication skills§ §Bachelor's degree preferred§ §You need to be computer literate—specifically with Microsoft Office and Google Drive§ §Experience with social media, marketing, and advertising—a university degree in one of these fields is a plus§ §Enjoy dealing with people and work as part of a team§ §Must be physically fit and able to fill in on site when/if needed§ §Eligible to work in New Zealand§ § §  §Tasks & responsibilities§ § §Have painting and cedar care industry knowledge and prior work experience§ §Have excellent communication skills (both written and verbal) with both staff and third parties. Communicate with staff regarding the operations of the business§ §Be able to work independently to reach goals§ §Have the ability to multitask and meet deadlines§ §Run the social media, advertising and marketing for the company§ §Be in charge of payroll, invoicing and quoting§ §Assist the Director by overseeing work, being the first point of contact on behalf of the Director, answering communication, phone calls and emails on behalf of the Director, maintaining the Director’s appointment diaries and making any traveling arrangements needed§ §You will also be preparing company documents and reports, attending meetings on behalf of the Director and taking notes and ensuring that all company documents are well arranged and stored§ §You will be directly reporting to the company Director and will need to ensure that the company’s operations run smoothly§ §You will have a relatively good understanding of Queenstown real estate § § §  § §  §The application form will include these questions:§ § §Do you have at least three years of experience in an administration role?§ §Do you have experience with commercial and residential painting?§ §Do you have experience in social media, marketing, and advertising? § §Which of the following Microsoft Office products are you experienced with?§ § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following Microsoft Office products are you experienced with?§Do you have experience in an administration role?§How many years' experience do you have as an administrative assistant?§§§

$29.99 per hour§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Other§§§§§§We are fortunate to be hiring new team members due to ongoing growth in our businesses.  We are looking for candidates who are available to work part-time and some full-time hours.  You need to have a clean drivers licence, your own vehicle and be willing to undergo police checks, credit checks and other tests.§You will be a well organised individual and systematic and will be working predominantly in our house clearing and Deceased Estate side of our businesses.§Packing experience will help§A desire to move into a Team Leader role when trained.§Viewing the videos on our websites will give you an insight to the work we do.  You can find these on:  §https://www.elderlyassist.co.nz§https://clutterbusters.co.nz§After reading our website, reading our No Cowboys reviews  and viewing the videos on it please send your CV and a covering letter to:  §recruitment@elderlyassist.co.nz§.  Please don't apply unless you have viewed some videos.  We're sorry we can't take calls (we are busy assisting our clients) but we are happy to answer questions by email.§Our contractors (many have worked for a number of years) tell us that they find the work we do incredibly rewarding and enjoy the flexibility working for us gives them.  Many of our contractors started as assistants and  moved into Team Leading roles and some are now in key management roles.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§How many years of people management experience do you have?§Do you own or have regular access to a car?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§What's your preferred work type?§What's your expected hourly rate?§§§

jobTitle: Regional Support Coordinator (North Island & South Island) Job in Waikato - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50684083.txt	§Regional Support Coordinator (North Island & South Island)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Regional Support Coordinator (North Island & South Island)§§Advertiser: §Ministry for Primary Industries§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Oct 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Hamilton§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Administrative Assistants§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §        §Whatungarongaro te tangata toitu te whenua§          §As man disappears from sight, the land remains§        §        §Regional Support Coordinator (North Island & South Island) §        §          §Regional Support Coordinator - North Island (Hamilton)§          §Fixed Term to June 2021§          §New Zealand's §Mycoplasma bovis§ Eradication Programme, is a world first effort to eradicate this cattle disease. Getting rid of this disease will help protect the productivity of our dairy and beef industries, part of our multi-billion dollar export economy and New Zealand way of life. The environment is dynamic, as the Programme adapts quickly to increase the effectiveness of our eradication methods, works to reduce the impact on affected farmers, and ultimately leave New Zealand's biosecurity system stronger.  We're passionate about what we do and enjoy working with like-minded people who want to see New Zealand farming free from this disease in the future.§          §Kōrero mō te tūranga - About the Role§          §The Regional Support Coordinator will provide a range administrative support to staff within the North Island and South Island regional offices. This is a fast moving and evolving environment, so you will need to adapt and develop to deliver results.§          §In this role you will facilitate the smooth running of the regional office by providing general administration tasks, and acting as a subject matter expert for MPI corporate systems and databases. Other duties but not limited to include:§          §            §Organising various meetings and taking minutes§            §Booking travel arrangements§            §Admin assistance and document preparation§            §Look into and identify any relevant system and process improvements§            §Facilitation of building issues - Security and management of supply contracts§            §Reception duties which includes receiving/inducting visitors and contractors and maintaining the visitors book.§          §          §Mōu - About You §          §This is a fast pace workplace, so we do require someone who is flexible who has an appreciation for good time management. You will provide information, recommendations and advice to the management team about the district’s future staffing and deployment needs. §        §You will be managing rosters in a changeable high-paced environment while having to manage competing demands. You will be self-motivated with a strong attention to detail and enjoys problem solving. §        §The role is based in Nelson and the successful applicant must reside in, or near, the area. §        § §        §Key Accountabilities:§        §          §Accurately forecasting district workload based on trends §          §Manage the planning, development, and the day-to-day variations of a 24/7 roster for the Tasman District §          §Manage all leave requests by District staff and checks to see if they can be accommodate based on the planned roster§          §Reports on performance issues relevant to the rostering of staff and the delivery of services required by the management team §        §        § §        §What you’ll bring§        §Being part of the Police whānau is about being our best to ensure our communities are safe and feel safe. Our Core Competencies provide a shared understanding of the behaviours, leadership and technical competence required for success at each level of Police. Whilst we are looking for skills, knowledge and experience relevant to the role, we also place high importance on your state of mind, the alignment of your values with ours, your ability to contribute to and build high performing teams, and the way that you lead yourself or others. §        § §        §          §Previous Workforce management experience or systems related experience§          §Good written and verbal communication skills§          §Ability to build and maintain strong stakeholder relationships§          §Experience using Excel for reporting§          §Knowledge of KRONOS and SAP is desirable§          §Must be a NZ citizen or permanent resident to apply for the role§        §        § §        §This role is set at Individual Contributor level, this means your key purpose is “to deliver or enable others to deliver Our Business”.§        § §        §We will ask you questions based on "How we will deliver Our Business - Core Competencies" and the appropriate role level, i.e. Individual Contributor. We’re open to discussing flexible working options that work for both you and the business. §        § §        §For more information on the above, please copy and paste this URL: https://www.police.govt.nz/careers§        §How to apply§        §If this position sounds like you, click apply now. You will provide information, recommendations and advice to the management team about the district’s future staffing and deployment needs. § §You will be managing rosters in a changeable high-paced environment while having to manage competing demands. You will be self-motivated with a strong attention to detail and enjoys problem solving. § §The role is based in Nelson and the successful applicant must reside in, or near, the area. § § § §Key Accountabilities:§ §Accurately forecasting district workload based on trends § §Manage the planning, development, and the day-to-day variations of a 24/7 roster for the Tasman District § §Manage all leave requests by District staff and checks to see if they can be accommodate based on the planned roster§ §Reports on performance issues relevant to the rostering of staff and the delivery of services required by the management team § § § §What you’ll bring§ §Being part of the Police whānau is about being our best to ensure our communities are safe and feel safe. jobText: TXT/50684141.txt	§Business Support Level 2, Policy and Strategy§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Business Support Level 2, Policy and Strategy§§Advertiser: §Inland Revenue§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Administrative Assistants§§§§§§§§§  §    §      §Business Support Level 2, Policy and Strategy §    §    §      §      §      §      §        §The Policy & Strategy group at Inland Revenue advises Government on a range of tax and social policy issues.§ § We research and develop policy options, and present policy recommendations to senior officials and Ministers. We also prepare the legislation arising from those policy recommendations and support it through the legislative process.§ § We are looking for someone to join our Business Support team and take on a role that delivers high quality and effective administrative support to our Managers. In this role you will work across the wider group to deliver a consistently high level of service that is customer focused and adds value. Day to day, you’ll be working on:§ § · Diary and email management§ § · Organising meetings, agendas and meeting action points§ § · Event, travel and catering requirements§ § · Assisting with purchase orders§ § · Drafting correspondence e.g. email, letters and documents§ § · Working with our internal systems§ § To be successful you will need the ability to organise and plan, to multi-task and to juggle competing priorities. Have excellent communications skills, organisational and time management skills are a must. jobText: TXT/50684216.txt	§Part-Time Workshop Administrator - Wellington§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Part-Time Workshop Administrator - Wellington§§Advertiser: §Fulton Hogan§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Hutt Valley§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Administrative Assistants§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Part-Time Workshop Administrator - Wellington §      §        §Who are we looking for?§        §Due to Fulton Hogan’s ongoing growth within the Region, we are looking for a Workshop Administrator to join our team based in Petone and deliver the good work Fulton Hogan is known for.§        §The job§        §As Workshop Administrator you will be responsible for the smooth running and management of our preventive and planned maintenance administration functions. You will use your administration knowledge and skills to assist our team in delivering outstanding customer service.§        §You will be responsible for ensuring all parts, work orders and job cards are ready and all paperwork is completed and entered into the system post servicing and repairs. You will also update customers on repairs and manage external subcontractors.§        §This is a part time role working 4 to 6 hours a day, Monday to Friday. This is the perfect kick-starter role for an individual with basic administrative knowledge and data entry skills.§        §You’ll also §        §          §Understand and embrace our living safely approach.§          §Take personal responsibility for the safety of your workmates, the environment, public and yourself.§          §Ensuring all work is carried out in compliance with the relevant job and work instruction.§          §Meet and exceed customer expectations.§        §        §Experience and attributes;§        §          §Full Class 1 drivers’ license.§          §Relevant administration experience.§          §Competent in Microsoft Office Suite.§          §Experience using Maximo and/or JDE advantageous.§          §Understanding of administration procedures.§          §Experience data inputting, scheduling and planning.§          §Strong attention to detail and ability to work unsupervised.  §          §Be self-motivated and driven to succeed.§        §        §We’re Fulton Hogan §        §You’ve probably seen us around. On the roads, building sites, and in cities, towns and locations all over New Zealand, Australia and the South Pacific. We build and maintain infrastructure that improves the quality of life for those living in our communities. Everything from roads and bridges to energy, water and communication. You will use your administration knowledge and skills to assist our team in delivering outstanding customer service.§You will be responsible for ensuring all parts, work orders and job cards are ready and all paperwork is completed and entered into the system post servicing and repairs. You will also update customers on repairs and manage external subcontractors.§This is a part time role working 4 to 6 hours a day, Monday to Friday. This is the perfect kick-starter role for an individual with basic administrative knowledge and data entry skills.§You’ll also §§Understand and embrace our living safely approach.§Take personal responsibility for the safety of your workmates, the environment, public and yourself.§Ensuring all work is carried out in compliance with the relevant job and work instruction.§Meet and exceed customer expectations.§§Experience and attributes;§§Full Class 1 drivers’ license.§Relevant administration experience.§Competent in Microsoft Office Suite.§Experience using Maximo and/or JDE advantageous.§Understanding of administration procedures.§Experience data inputting, scheduling and planning.§Strong attention to detail and ability to work unsupervised.  §Be self-motivated and driven to succeed.§§We’re Fulton Hogan §You’ve probably seen us around. On the roads, building sites, and in cities, towns and locations all over New Zealand, Australia and the South Pacific. We build and maintain infrastructure that improves the quality of life for those living in our communities. Everything from roads and bridges to energy, water and communication. We’re big and growing, but this will always be a family business.We know we’re only ever as good as our people, which is why we’re committed to hiring, developing and retaining the best in the industry.§Sounds like you? §If this sounds like the exciting next step in your career, and you are as passionate as we are about producing quality work with an uncompromising attitude towards safety, then apply today at www.fultonhogan.com/careers§All successful candidates must under-go and pass a pre-employment medical and drug screen.§§§§

jobTitle: Law Firm Office Manager Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50684333.txt	§Law Firm Office Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Law Firm Office Manager§§Advertiser: §Carter Chung Law§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Office Management§§§§§§We are a busy, boutique law firm in central Wellington, specialising in private client and small business work. We have a friendly and supportive team environment with a great work/life balance, and a diverse, long standing client base.§ §We are looking for someone to manage and co-ordinate our office administration, procedures and staff.§ §Main tasks include:§ § §Staff management (7 legal staff and 3 administration staff)§ §Recruitment of new staff§ §Implementing, monitoring, and reviewing firm’s policies and procedures - including Anti Money Laundering procedures§ §Managing firm’s billing§ §Managing overdue invoices§ §Some trust accounting work, such as posting disbursements§ §Other general administration duties§ §We are striving to make use of new technologies and we operate a paperless system where possible.§ §To be suitable in the role you will have:§ § §Office management experience, ideally in a professional services firm§ §Fantastic attention to detail§ §Excellent written and verbal English communication skills§ §A high level of computer literacy§ §A drive to examine existing software, systems, processes and procedures and suggest changes that will benefit the firm§ §Openness to change and continuous improvement of the firm’s systems and procedures§ §Ideally you will have experience in a law firm and an understanding or experience with relevant laws such as the Anti Money Laundering Act and law firm trust account regulations.§ §Please submit your CV to Hannah Carter by email (§hannah@carterchung.co.nz§) or email Hannah if you would like to have a confidential discussion about the role.§ § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as an office manager?§Which of the following Microsoft Office products are you experienced with?§Do you have experience in an administration role?§§§

jobText: TXT/50684357.txt	§Project Coordinators§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Project Coordinators§§Advertiser: §DOWNER NZ§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Administrative Assistants§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Project Coordinators §      §        §Downer New Zealand is a leading provider of integrated services.  Our commitment to building long term relationships and supporting our customers with high calibre services and solutions; the talents of our people; and consistent excellence in operational delivery sets us apart.§        §Downer New Zealand is a significant player in the telecommunications industry within New Zealand.  We are growing our business through delivering consistent service, excellence and results and through developing inspirational leadership with our people and customers.  We have exciting opportunities for experienced Project Coordinators to join us on 9 month fixed term contracts.  Reporting to the Field Support Manager, the Project Coordinator will support the business by coordinating and integrating multiply activities across multiple functional lines.§        §The Role:§        §This is a busy position and requires a structured approach in order to build constructive relationships and prioritise workload. There will also be a high degree of liaising with our clients and suppliers both internal and external to produce required outcomes while ensuring customer satisfaction to the highest level. §        §Responsibilities will include:§        §          §Identify resources needed and request resource assignation§          §Ensuring that correct Project documentation, access requests and equipment are available, complete, current, stored and submitted appropriately§          §Track and report progress on a weekly basis§          §Manage day-to-day operational aspects of a Work stream and scope, including variation§          §Effectively communicate relevant job information to stake holders – Internal and External while ensuring that Downer New Zealand’s financial processes and procedures are adhered to.§        §        §About You: §        §To be successful in this challenging and exciting role you will ideally have the following skills and attributes;§        §          §Well organised and disciplined§          §Have excellent verbal and written communication skills with a high literacy and numerical standard§          §The ability to work under pressure§          §While a technical background it not essential it would be an advantage§          §Be computer literate, with intermediate level excel skills§          §Excellent attention to detail§          §Enjoy being part of and contributing to a team.§        §        §What we offer: §        §This is an outstanding opportunity to work in our diverse business. The environment is challenging and rewarding. We offer the opportunity to join our diverse and inclusive culture, and be part of a great team working in a collaborative environment. We offer a competitive remuneration package, flexible working arrangements, and our focus for our people is training and development, so this gives excellent opportunities to enhance your skills and advance your career.  §        §If this sounds like the opportunity for you, head to www.downercareers.co.nz and enter reference number 573949 to apply.    §        §Downer NZ is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating a diverse and inclusive culture.§        §Our workplaces are drug and alcohol free - all successful applicants will be required to undertake a Pre-Employment drug test and medical. §        §Due to the fast-paced nature of Downer, our vacancy close dates may be subject to change, so don't delay and make sure you apply as soon as possible. §        §Please note we have an in-house recruitment team that manage all our vacancies. No candidates presented through an agency will be considered for any of our roles advertised, unless previously arranged. We would strongly encourage all candidates interested in these roles, to apply directly online through the portal provided otherwise your application will not be considered.§      §      §      §    §    §www.downer.co.nz§  §§§Downer New Zealand is a leading provider of integrated services.  Our commitment to building long term relationships and supporting our customers with high calibre services and solutions; the talents of our people; and consistent excellence in operational delivery sets us apart.§Downer New Zealand is a significant player in the telecommunications industry within New Zealand.  We are growing our business through delivering consistent service, excellence and results and through developing inspirational leadership with our people and customers.  We have exciting opportunities for experienced Project Coordinators to join us on 9 month fixed term contracts.  Reporting to the Field Support Manager, the Project Coordinator will support the business by coordinating and integrating multiply activities across multiple functional lines.§The Role:§This is a busy position and requires a structured approach in order to build constructive relationships and prioritise workload. The environment is challenging and rewarding. We offer the opportunity to join our diverse and inclusive culture, and be part of a great team working in a collaborative environment. We offer a competitive remuneration package, flexible working arrangements, and our focus for our people is training and development, so this gives excellent opportunities to enhance your skills and advance your career.  §If this sounds like the opportunity for you, head to www.downercareers.co.nz and enter reference number 573949 to apply.    §Downer NZ is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating a diverse and inclusive culture.§Our workplaces are drug and alcohol free - all successful applicants will be required to undertake a Pre-Employment drug test and medical. §Due to the fast-paced nature of Downer, our vacancy close dates may be subject to change, so don't delay and make sure you apply as soon as possible. §§Please note we have an in-house recruitment team that manage all our vacancies. jobTitle: Business Mentor Coordinator Job in Manawatu - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50684422.txt	§Business Mentor Coordinator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Business Mentor Coordinator§§Advertiser: §Central Economic Development Agency Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Oct 2020§§Location§§Manawatu§, §Palmerston North§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Client & Sales Administration§§§§§§Central Economic Development Agency (CEDA) aims to drive and facilitate the creation and growth of economic wealth for Manawatu and beyond.  §We are a team of passionate people, driven to grow and develop the region. Our vision for the region: by 2025 Manawatu will be New Zealand’s most progressive region, where great minds, future focused businesses and diverse cultures come together to grow the prosperity of, and deliver for, its communities, New Zealand and beyond. §An exciting opportunity has arisen for a part-time (20 hours per week) Business Mentor Coordinator who will be responsible for the effective delivery and administration of the Business Mentors New Zealand programme.   §The aim of the programme is to match Business Mentors with small and medium sized businesses seeking support, and the coordinator role is responsible for making theses matches happen.      §Key responsibilities include: §Initial point of contact for all Business Mentor enquires§Matching, and rematching where required, of all Business Mentor requests received through registration on the Business Mentors website§Maintenance of the pool of Business Mentors including recruitment of new Mentors§Administration and maintenance of Business Mentors NZ Database§Facilitation of regular business mentor gatherings/seminars§To be successful you will have the following: §Bachelor Degree in Business (desirable) or equivalent practical experience in a commercial business environment, including Start ups§Strong written and verbal communication skills§Excellent interpersonal skills and the ability to work with clients from a variety of backgrounds, and match these clients to suitable mentors§Experience in administrative systems and procedures and proficient in the use of CRM databases§The programme plays an important part in facilitating much needed mentorship support for businesses.   §If you are a self-starter able to work independently and in a team environment, with a high level of professionalism, personal integrity and the ability to work under pressure, then apply now with your CV and a cover letter. §Enquiries can be directed to §jacqui.middleton@ceda.nz§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have experience in a role which requires relationship management experience?§§§

jobTitle: Contracts Administrator  - Carterton Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50685092.txt	§Contracts Administrator  - Carterton§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Contracts Administrator  - Carterton§§Advertiser: §Fulton Hogan§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Rest of Wellington Region§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Contracts Administration§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Contracts Administrator - Carterton §      §        §What are we looking for?§        §Due to Fulton Hogan’s ongoing growth within the Region, we have a new vacancy for a Contracts Administrator to join our team and deliver the good work Fulton Hogan is known for.§        §What you’ll be doing;§        §Based out of Carterton, the position of the Contracts Administrator is a key role in the management team for the Wairarapa Maintenance Contracts (including Wellington Water Alliance) in the Wellington region.  The primary functions associated with the role include the input of data relating to the management of the Maintenance Contracts, including financial data, work programming, claiming and logging and tracking council requests for service.  The role encompasses assistance with the preparation of weekly and monthly works programs and claims and the maintenance of Fulton Hogan’s Maximo Maintenance database, the RAMM Contractor Database and Council customer Systems.§        §What You’ll have;§        §          §At least 2 years’ experience working as a contracts/project coordinator or equivalent, ideally within construction or a similar industry.§          §RAMM/MAXIMO experience would be an advantage.§          §Customer service & internal stakeholder experience.§          §Ability to develop and manage relationships with clients, subcontractors & other employees.  §          §Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.§          §Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite.§          §Strong attention to detail & problem solving skills.§          §Ability to gather data, compile information and prepare reports.§        §        §Fulton Hogan Philosophy §        §We build and maintain critical infrastructure that connects and enhances communities across New Zealand, Australia and the Pacific. Everything from roads and bridges, to airports and utilities. We’re committed to ensuring the Good Work we do will make a positive difference to the quality of life for our people, our customers and the communities we all call home.  Our continued success relies on generating new and diverse ideas, which is why our ‘Good Work’ culture encourages ownership and empowerment, while never forgetting the importance of balancing life’s priorities. §        §Sound like you?§        §If this sounds like and you would like to help build on our Good Work culture, then we would like to hear from you, apply today at www.fultonhogan.com/careers§        §All successful candidates must under-go and pass a pre-employment medical and drug screen.§        § §      §      §      §    §    §  §§§What are we looking for?§Due to Fulton Hogan’s ongoing growth within the Region, we have a new vacancy for a Contracts Administrator to join our team and deliver the good work Fulton Hogan is known for.§What you’ll be doing;§Based out of Carterton, the position of the Contracts Administrator is a key role in the management team for the Wairarapa Maintenance Contracts (including Wellington Water Alliance) in the Wellington region.  The primary functions associated with the role include the input of data relating to the management of the Maintenance Contracts, including financial data, work programming, claiming and logging and tracking council requests for service.  The role encompasses assistance with the preparation of weekly and monthly works programs and claims and the maintenance of Fulton Hogan’s Maximo Maintenance database, the RAMM Contractor Database and Council customer Systems.§What You’ll have;§§At least 2 years’ experience working as a contracts/project coordinator or equivalent, ideally within construction or a similar industry.§RAMM/MAXIMO experience would be an advantage.§Customer service & internal stakeholder experience.§Ability to develop and manage relationships with clients, subcontractors & other employees.  §Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.§Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite.§Strong attention to detail & problem solving skills.§Ability to gather data, compile information and prepare reports.§§Fulton Hogan Philosophy §We build and maintain critical infrastructure that connects and enhances communities across New Zealand, Australia and the Pacific. Everything from roads and bridges, to airports and utilities. We’re committed to ensuring the Good Work we do will make a positive difference to the quality of life for our people, our customers and the communities we all call home.  Our continued success relies on generating new and diverse ideas, which is why our ‘Good Work’ culture encourages ownership and empowerment, while never forgetting the importance of balancing life’s priorities. §Sound like you?§If this sounds like and you would like to help build on our Good Work culture, then we would like to hear from you, apply today at www.fultonhogan.com/careers§All successful candidates must under-go and pass a pre-employment medical and drug screen.§ §§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Administration Officer (20 hours per week) - Oamaru Job in Otago - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50685129.txt	§Administration Officer (20 hours per week) - Oamaru§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Administration Officer (20 hours per week) - Oamaru§§Advertiser: §Ministry of Social Development§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Oct 2020§§Location§§Otago§, §Rest of Otago§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Administrative Assistants§§§§§§§§§  §    §Administration Officer (20 hours per week) - Oamaru §    §      §        §Job Ref: 35141§        §Permanent, Part Time, Monday to Friday 9am to 1pm (20 hours per week)§        §We an opportunity for an experienced administration professional to join our team. It is an important role, delivering high quality, efficient and proactive administrative support to the Service Centre Manager and wider team.§        §About the role§        §In this busy and varied role you are responsible for fleet management, maintaining office and stationery supplies, maintaining registers, leave and attendance records, arranging for equipment servicing, building issues, coordinating reviews, official information act requests and other adhoc duties as required to ensure the smooth running of the office.§        §You are also responsible for working with Security and Front of House staff to ensure that all Visitors and Contractors to the office are inducted correctly into the office, maintaining health and Safety standards is a big focus. §        §Position Description: §        §http://www.msd.govt.nz/hr/documents/position-descriptions/service-delivery/4.-client-service-delivery/administration-officer-jan-2020.docx §        §About you§        §You are a team player who works well under pressure. A busy environment is where you thrive and you pride yourself on delivering customer service. No task is too big or too small, you take everything in your stride and get things done.  §        §You have§        §          §Intermediate to Advanced skills in Microsoft Office, particularly Word, Outlook, PowerPoint and Excel.§          §Proven expertise supporting a team in an administrative capacity.§          §Experience maintaining and improving office systems.§          §Exceptional relationship building skills – you enjoy meeting people from varied backgrounds.§          §Well-developed communication and interpersonal skills.§          §Full NZ Driver’s Licence and ability to drive Ministry vehicles as required.§        §        §We offer§        §          §A salary between $44,165 and $60,727 per annum (pro-rata), in line with skills, experience and performance.§          §A challenging, fascinating and rewarding career with a team committed to the highest standards of work.§          §Training and professional development opportunities. §        §        §How to apply§        §Apply online with your CV and a cover letter outlining your suitability for the position.  §        §Please note:§        §          §If you currently work for MSD please apply through your myHR careers portal at work through your internal profile§          §As this is a Level 4/5 ANZSCO role, preference is given to those with NZ Citizenship or Permanent Residency at the time of application. §        §        §Applications close: Monday, 12 October 2020 at 10pm.§        §Joining us§        §Joining MSD means being part of a whānau that celebrates the diversity each individual represents. We show manaaki, we care about the wellbeing and success of people and want everyone to thrive, and be who they are in a supportive and inclusive working environment. We work together to make a difference for communities while doing the right thing with integrity. We are a Treaty partner committed to strengthening relationships with§ §Māori,§ §Hapū§,§ Iwi and communities to realise their own potential and aspirations.§        §If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to tell us when you apply so we can assist you through the recruitment process.§      §      §The Ministry of Social Development is one of New Zealand's largest government agencies. Our work to achieve better social outcomes affects almost every New Zealander, now or in the future.§        §https://jobs.msd.govt.nz/§      §    §    §  §§§Job Ref: 35141§ §Permanent, Part Time, Monday to Friday 9am to 1pm (20 hours per week)§ §We an opportunity for an experienced administration professional to join our team. It is an important role, delivering high quality, efficient and proactive administrative support to the Service Centre Manager and wider team.§ §About the role§ §In this busy and varied role you are responsible for fleet management, maintaining office and stationery supplies, maintaining registers, leave and attendance records, arranging for equipment servicing, building issues, coordinating reviews, official information act requests and other adhoc duties as required to ensure the smooth running of the office.§ §You are also responsible for working with Security and Front of House staff to ensure that all Visitors and Contractors to the office are inducted correctly into the office, maintaining health and Safety standards is a big focus. § §Position Description: § §http://www.msd.govt.nz/hr/documents/position-descriptions/service-delivery/4.-client-service-delivery/administration-officer-jan-2020.docx § §About you§ §You are a team player who works well under pressure. A busy environment is where you thrive and you pride yourself on delivering customer service. No task is too big or too small, you take everything in your stride and get things done.  § §You have§ § §Intermediate to Advanced skills in Microsoft Office, particularly Word, Outlook, PowerPoint and Excel.§ §Proven expertise supporting a team in an administrative capacity.§ §Experience maintaining and improving office systems.§ §Exceptional relationship building skills – you enjoy meeting people from varied backgrounds.§ §Well-developed communication and interpersonal skills.§ §Full NZ Driver’s Licence and ability to drive Ministry vehicles as required.§ §We offer§ § §A salary between $44,165 and $60,727 per annum (pro-rata), in line with skills, experience and performance.§ §A challenging, fascinating and rewarding career with a team committed to the highest standards of work.§ §Training and professional development opportunities. § §How to apply§ §Apply online with your CV and a cover letter outlining your suitability for the position.  § §Please note:§ § §If you currently work for MSD please apply through your myHR careers portal at work through your internal profile§ §As this is a Level 4/5 ANZSCO role, preference is given to those with NZ Citizenship or Permanent Residency at the time of application. § §Applications close: Monday, 12 October 2020 at 10pm.§ §Joining us§ §Joining MSD means being part of a whānau that celebrates the diversity each individual represents. We show manaaki, we care about the wellbeing and success of people and want everyone to thrive, and be who they are in a supportive and inclusive working environment. We work together to make a difference for communities while doing the right thing with integrity. We are a Treaty partner committed to strengthening relationships with§ §Māori,§ §Hapū§,§ Iwi and communities to realise their own potential and aspirations.§ §If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to tell us when you apply so we can assist you through the recruitment process.§§§§

You will be working in an exciting fast paced environment where your ability to process information, make sound decisions and respond to deadlines will be key in securing the role.§          §We are looking for:§          §            §An individual with real spark and personality who will contribute both professionally and personality-wise to the great culture in the office§            §Someone who enjoys hard work along with variety§            §Ability to develop and maintain active candidate networks§            §Someone who can handle the administration component of the role but also be proactive in assisting the company as a whole§          §          §Core tasks will include:§          §            §Providing crucial administrative support to our Recruitment Consultant§            §Ensuring candidates are regularly contacted and assisting the Consultant to identify suitable candidates for vacancies§            §Reporting on recruitment activities and compliance§            §Performing visa and criminal record checks as requested§            §General marketing administration support§            §Assisting in accounts payable and weekly time sheets§            §General business administration support§            §Managing / developing company documentation and systems§            §Managing office systems and keeping things up to date§          §          §You will be highly organised with the ability to multitask and prioritise multiple deadlines. jobTitle: Senior Office Administrator - Levin Job in Manawatu - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50685356.txt	§Senior Office Administrator - Levin§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Office Administrator - Levin§§Advertiser: §MASH Trust§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Oct 2020§§Location§§Manawatu§, §Rest of Manawatu§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Office Management§§§§§§ §About us:  §MASH provides a wide range of support services for people with mental health conditions, intellectual or physical disabilities, alcohol and addiction struggles and youth respite care. These services are offered either at the residential homes we support, or people who require support in their own homes, or in the community. MASH operates throughout the lower North Island in the Wellington, Kapiti, Horowhenua, Palmerston North, and Hawkes Bay regions.§About the Job:  §Based in Levin, this role provides administrative support to the office but will also be part of a larger administrative support team. Duties include EA support to the GM Disability Services, back-up support for the governance function, reception, office management and project support as we embark on our strategic work plan. This is a true all-rounder role where you have to roll your sleeves up and be prepared to be part of everything.§About You:§  Your ability to multitask, use your initiative and communicate will be the true measure of how successful you will be in this role. We seek a confident, resilient, proactive and solution driven administrator who can anticipate needs and be the eyes and ears and the key point of contact for all day to day management of team activities. You will help build a positive brand by delivering an excellent level of customer service to all internal and external stakeholders.§Your skills and attributes will include: §· proven EA experience, preferably involving knowledge of administration policies, systems, and procedures§· a strong commitment to delivering excellent service§· stellar communication skills (verbal and written)§· an ability to anticipate and discretely respond to upcoming needs and commitments§· excellent time management and prioritisation skills§· an ability to build and nurture positive relationships with both internal and external stakeholders.§· Research and reporting skills§· Advanced word-processing, publishing, and spreadsheet skills.§· A good sense of humour §· Empathy and understanding of people with disabilities.§· Experience in project and event management.§· A relevant tertiary qualification would be advantageous but is not essential.§For a copy of the Job Description visit §JD-Senior-Administrator---Disability-October-2020.doc§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

Office and internet functions§Ability to work flexible hours§Excellent customer relationship skills§Ability to work well in team environment§So, if you have an energetic personality that possess a application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have experience in an administration role?§Which of the jobTitle: Receptionist Job in Waikato - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50685496.txt	§Receptionist§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Receptionist§§Advertiser: §Rauawaawa Kaumatua Charitable Trust§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Oct 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Hamilton§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Receptionists§§§§§§About the business§ § §Rauawaawa Kaumatua Charitable Trust is a Not for Profit, Hamilton based community organisation specialising in the care of Kaumatua, specifically those over the age of 55.§ § §About the role§ § §Receptionist§ §(Ref: RC20)§ - Full time§ §This role requires a person that is a great communicator, excels in customer service, runs the reception area effectively, has catering experience, and is able to help Rauawaawa achieve it's mission of "Hei manaaki nga Kaumātua" or Enhancing the quality of life and wellbeing of Kaumātua.§ § § §This role works across the organisation and reports to our Administration Team Manager. The Receptionist is a key member in our COMMUNITY BASED team. We are seeking a highly self motivated professional that is able to exercise confidentiality, work independently and demonstrate a sound health and safety approach, good work ethic and initiative. Work hours are between, Monday to Friday, 8.30am - 5pm.§ § § §PLEASE DO NOT APPLY ONLINE. To be considered for this role all applicants MUST contact reception@rauawaawa.co.nz to request an official application form for completion and submission by Friday the 16th October, 5pm.§ § §Benefits and perks§ § §This is a great opportunity for someone who would like to extend their community experience to focus on Kaumatua and be part of an active, innovative and progressive organisation. § §If you require a work environment that offers a great cause and team to work with as well as contribute to your training needs then we look forward to your application. § § §Skills and experience§ § §To be considered for this role the ideal candidate needs to:§ §(1) Be self driven, motivated and have the ability to work within a team;§ §(2) Have at least two years experience in administration, finance or customer services with intermediate skills in Word, Excel and typing;§ §(3) Possess strong relationship and communication skills;§ §(4) Knowledge of Te Reo and Tikanga Māori would be an advantage; and§ §(5) Hold a clean FULL NZ DRIVERS LICENSE.§ §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Which of the following Microsoft Office products are you experienced with?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§Do you have a current Police Check (Criminal Record Check) for employment?§§§
