jobTitle: Team Administrator Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50685730.txt	§Team Administrator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Team Administrator§§Advertiser: §Maritime New Zealand§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Administrative Assistants§§§§§§Maritime New Zealand is the national regulatory, compliance and response agency that looks after the safety, security and environmental protection of coastal and inland waterways. Our mission is to lead and support the maritime community to ensure our seas and waterways are safe, secure and clean – on behalf of all New Zealanders. §Our §Certification team §process applications and issue certificates relating to seafarers, surveyors, recognised authorised persons, operations and other people holding certificates issued by Maritime NZ (MNZ). §Our §Regional Compliance team§ work to improve safety outcomes within the maritime industry. We focus our efforts on supporting operators to comply by informing, educating, and auditing our commercial operators and seafarers. §No day will be the same for the administrator, with your abundance of energy and drive you’ll be taking complete ownership of team administration duties. You’ll need to be a great communicator, be able to work independently and use your initiative. §Both roles are very similar providing administration support across the busy teams so you will need to be comfortable working on a range of tasks and be prepared to learn new systems, processes and policies specific to Maritime NZ. §As part of the Certification team you will also monitor the application inbox, arrange allocation of applications, record correspondence received and respond to applicant’s general queries.§You will have great attention to detail and with a natural solutions focused attitude. You will also bring;§  §Strong Microsoft Office skills and confidence to pick up new systems and databases;§  §Comfortable providing remote support to regional based team members;§  §Previous experience working as a team administrator in a busy role;§  §Excellent communication skills with the ability to forge strong relationships across a wide range of stakeholders;§  §Strong customer service focus with a ‘can do’ attitude;§  §Ability to self-direct, take the initiative and plan your own workload without supervision;§  §Ability to be flexible and adaptable and stay calm under pressure; and§  §Assisting with financial accounts, travel bookings and general admin support across the team when required.§This is an opportunity to make a real impact on the way we do things and we will support you to grow your own skills and knowledge along the way. Our success as an organisation is underpinned by our people. §Please apply on-line directly through the Maritime NZ website by going to Careers with Us. Here you can upload your CV and cover letter. For tracking and evaluation purposes, all applications must be submitted via our on-line process.§You must have the legal right to live and work in New Zealand.§For further inquiries, please contact Jo Attewell at §jo.attewell@maritimenz.govt.nz§.§This role closes Friday 16th October 2020 at 5pm. §For a copy of the Job Description visit §Certification-Administrator-PD---October-2020.pdf§,§Compliance-Administrator-Central-PD---October-2020.pdf§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Administration Coordinator Job in Manawatu - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50685918.txt	§Administration Coordinator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Administration Coordinator§§Advertiser: §NZDF§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Manawatu§, §Palmerston North§§Salary§§$45801 - $50622 including 4% super contribution§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Administrative Assistants§§§§§§§§§  §    §Administration Coordinator §    §      §        §What you will do§You will be responsible for providing a range of administrative support to the 1 Command Support Regiment based at Linton Military Camp.§This includes:§        §          §Coordinating internal and external correspondence; §          §Meeting and greeting visitors to the office and over the phone;§          §Assisting with the preparation and formatting of documents; §          §Taking minutes; §          §Maintaining the unit registry; §          §Assisting staff with admin requirements; and§          §Assisting the Command team when required.§        §        §What we need§ §We’re looking for an experienced administrator who enjoys being part of a busy, active team. Your strong organisational and planning skills will enable you to effortlessly manage multiple demands with ease, while remaining flexible and adaptive to changing needs and priorities.§You'll also possess:§        §          §Sound judgement and the ability to manage your own space and take action when required;§          §Exceptional customer service skills and engage positively with all internal and external stakeholders; §          §Proven ability to build strong bonds within your team; and§          §The maturity to communicate confidently across the organisation, building positive working relationships.§        §        §Who we are§ §The 1 Command Support Regiment is a New Zealand Army unit based at Linton Military Camp. Its purpose is to provide combat-ready command support and decision support personnel and equipment, within agreed force generation timelines, in order for 1 (NZ) Brigade to successfully deliver against outputs.§Every hour of every day, 365 days of the year, the New Zealand Defence Force (NZDF) is contributing to the defence, security and well-being of Aotearoa / New Zealand.  As a modern, professional military, it is our goal to maintain well trained, equipped and disciplined armed forces that can react to crisis at short notice.  §Why Us§NZDF is an inclusive organisation that is open to flexible working arrangements and welcomes applications from people regardless of gender, ethnicity, disability, sexual orientation, age, beliefs/opinions, or family circumstances.§ §In return for your expertise, dedication and hard work, NZDF is offering remuneration reflective of your experience, along with:§        §          §Great benefits for you and your family§;§          §Full time ongoing work;§          §Fully funded life cover up to $300,000;§          §5 weeks annual leave per year. §        §        §Starting salary for this role will be approximately $48,000, inclusive of 4% employer superannuation.§        §How to Apply§To view the Position Description and to Apply Online please visit our §Defence Careers§ website, or use the links on this page.§Please note:§ If you are an existing NZDF employee (excluding contractors) you must apply through our Internal Vacancies site, via the HR Toolkit.§Applications close on §Wednesday 14 October 2020§.§Please note: §Applicants must be legally entitled to work in New Zealand (NZ) and be able to obtain and maintain the required level of NZ Government security clearance for the position applied for. The minimum citizenship and residency criteria for security clearances to be granted by the NZ Defence Force are as follows:§Higher level Security Clearance§        §          §most preferably a NZ citizen who §has resided continuously§ in this country for the last §10 years§, OR§          §is a citizen of, §and/or has resided continuously§ in one or more of the following countries for the last §10 years§: either Australia, Canada, NZ, UK or the USA; §and§ has a background history that is verifiable and can be assessed as appropriate by the NZSIS towards a recommendation of suitability for a security clearance at a higher level.§        §        §If you do not meet these minimum criteria, we will not be able to accept your application.§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§What you will do§You will be responsible for providing a range of administrative support to the 1 Command Support Regiment based at Linton Military Camp.§This includes:§ § §Coordinating internal and external correspondence; § §Meeting and greeting visitors to the office and over the phone;§ §Assisting with the preparation and formatting of documents; § §Taking minutes; § §Maintaining the unit registry; § §Assisting staff with admin requirements; and§ §Assisting the Command team when required.§ §What we need§ §We’re looking for an experienced administrator who enjoys being part of a busy, active team. Your strong organisational and planning skills will enable you to effortlessly manage multiple demands with ease, while remaining flexible and adaptive to changing needs and priorities.§You'll also possess:§ § §Sound judgement and the ability to manage your own space and take action when required;§ §Exceptional customer service skills and engage positively with all internal and external stakeholders; § §Proven ability to build strong bonds within your team; and§ §The maturity to communicate confidently across the organisation, building positive working relationships.§ §Who we are§ §The 1 Command Support Regiment is a New Zealand Army unit based at Linton Military Camp. Its purpose is to provide combat-ready command support and decision support personnel and equipment, within agreed force generation timelines, in order for 1 (NZ) Brigade to successfully deliver against outputs.§Every hour of every day, 365 days of the year, the New Zealand Defence Force (NZDF) is contributing to the defence, security and well-being of Aotearoa / New Zealand.  As a modern, professional military, it is our goal to maintain well trained, equipped and disciplined armed forces that can react to crisis at short notice.  §Why Us§NZDF is an inclusive organisation that is open to flexible working arrangements and welcomes applications from people regardless of gender, ethnicity, disability, sexual orientation, age, beliefs/opinions, or family circumstances.§ §In return for your expertise, dedication and hard work, NZDF is offering remuneration reflective of your experience, along with:§ § §Great benefits for you and your family§;§ §Full time ongoing work;§ §Fully funded life cover up to $300,000;§ §5 weeks annual leave per year. § §Starting salary for this role will be approximately $48,000, inclusive of 4% employer superannuation.§ §How to Apply§To view the Position Description and to Apply Online please visit our §Defence Careers§ website, or use the links on this page.§Please note:§ If you are an existing NZDF employee (excluding contractors) you must apply through our Internal Vacancies site, via the HR Toolkit.§Applications close on §Wednesday 14 October 2020§.§Please note: §Applicants must be legally entitled to work in New Zealand (NZ) and be able to obtain and maintain the required level of NZ Government security clearance for the position applied for. The minimum citizenship and residency criteria for security clearances to be granted by the NZ Defence Force are as follows:§Higher level Security Clearance§ § §most preferably a NZ citizen who §has resided continuously§ in this country for the last §10 years§, OR§ §is a citizen of, §and/or has resided continuously§ in one or more of the following countries for the last §10 years§: either Australia, Canada, NZ, UK or the USA; §and§ has a background history that is verifiable and can be assessed as appropriate by the NZSIS towards a recommendation of suitability for a security clearance at a higher level.§ §If you do not meet these minimum criteria, we will not be able to accept your application.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50685921.txt	§Senior Administration Support§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Administration Support§§Advertiser: §Enable§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Manawatu§, §Palmerston North§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Administrative Assistants§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Senior Administration Support §      §        §VID: 5382§        §MidCentral District Health Board advocates for affirmative action and actively seeks Maori into our workforce to reflect the community we serve.§        §Who are we§        §Enable New Zealand – a part of the MidCentral District Health Board – provides assistive technology, information and services to support disabled people to live everyday lives in their communities. The head office is located in Palmerston North, with sites in Christchurch and Hamilton.§        §The Opportunity§        §In this role you will be responsible for leading and managing administrative support for Enable New Zealand to the highest quality through excellent customer focused relationship management, systems management and office management services. You will proactively deliver senior administrative support to members of Enable New Zealand to the highest quality through excellent customer focused relationship management, systems management and office management services.§        §Key Accountabilities§        §          §Provide high quality administrative support.§          §Lead the administration support team.§          §Provide project support when required.§          §Manage and coordinate the casual staff pool.§          §Develop and maintain key internal and external relationships.§        §        §What you’ll bring§        §          §Significant experience in providing high level senior administration support, preferably in the public service.§          §Leadership and management of team members, able to mentor, guide and delegate.§          §Experience in developing and maintaining quality office systems is essential.§          §Superior computer literacy and skills, including all Microsoft products is essential.§          §Time management and work management skills are essential.§          §Excellent written and oral communication skills, including excellent listening skills.§          §The ability to relate to a wide variety of people with consideration and diplomacy is essential.§          §High-level attention to detail, presentation layout and accuracy.§          §Knowledge of the Health and Disability Sector is desirable.§        §        §What you will get in return§        §Enable New Zealand is a trusted provider, delivering outstanding service, advice and value, so that New Zealanders can maximise their participation in the community. Reporting to the Director, Commercial and Finance, you will have full autonomy in the shape and management of the administration team. You will be a part of a positive and productive working environment, driven by values and a people-centred culture.§        §For more information in regards to this role, please contact Kelly Toon at Kelly.Toon@enable.co.nz§        §MidCentral District Health Board employs more than 2500 staff at Manawatu, Palmerston North, Tararua and Horowhenua and Otaki districts.§        §Palmerston North Hospital is a 350 bed secondary hospital, which services an urban population of 80,000 and a total population catchment of 168,000. In addition, the hospital is a teaching hospital, and is associated with both Auckland and Otago medical schools.§        §Palmerston North is a major university city and is at the hub of key routes to the central North Island ski fields, and river adventures. Wellington the capital city, is only a two hour journey by road, as are the wine growing regions of Hawke's Bay and Wairarapa.§        §Applications close 18 October 2020.§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§VID: 5382§  §MidCentral District Health Board advocates for affirmative action and actively seeks Maori into our workforce to reflect the community we serve.§  §Who are we§  §Enable New Zealand – a part of the MidCentral District Health Board – provides assistive technology, information and services to support disabled people to live everyday lives in their communities. The head office is located in Palmerston North, with sites in Christchurch and Hamilton.§  §The Opportunity§  §In this role you will be responsible for leading and managing administrative support for Enable New Zealand to the highest quality through excellent customer focused relationship management, systems management and office management services. You will proactively deliver senior administrative support to members of Enable New Zealand to the highest quality through excellent customer focused relationship management, systems management and office management services.§  §Key Accountabilities§ § §Provide high quality administrative support.§ §Lead the administration support team.§ §Provide project support when required.§ §Manage and coordinate the casual staff pool.§ §Develop and maintain key internal and external relationships.§ §What you’ll bring§ § §Significant experience in providing high level senior administration support, preferably in the public service.§ §Leadership and management of team members, able to mentor, guide and delegate.§ §Experience in developing and maintaining quality office systems is essential.§ §Superior computer literacy and skills, including all Microsoft products is essential.§ §Time management and work management skills are essential.§ §Excellent written and oral communication skills, including excellent listening skills.§ §The ability to relate to a wide variety of people with consideration and diplomacy is essential.§ §High-level attention to detail, presentation layout and accuracy.§ §Knowledge of the Health and Disability Sector is desirable.§ §What you will get in return§  §Enable New Zealand is a trusted provider, delivering outstanding service, advice and value, so that New Zealanders can maximise their participation in the community. Reporting to the Director, Commercial and Finance, you will have full autonomy in the shape and management of the administration team. You will be a part of a positive and productive working environment, driven by values and a people-centred culture.§  §For more information in regards to this role, please contact Kelly Toon at Kelly.Toon@enable.co.nz§  §MidCentral District Health Board employs more than 2500 staff at Manawatu, Palmerston North, Tararua and Horowhenua and Otaki districts.§  §Palmerston North Hospital is a 350 bed secondary hospital, which services an urban population of 80,000 and a total population catchment of 168,000. In addition, the hospital is a teaching hospital, and is associated with both Auckland and Otago medical schools.§  §Palmerston North is a major university city and is at the hub of key routes to the central North Island ski fields, and river adventures. Wellington the capital city, is only a two hour journey by road, as are the wine growing regions of Hawke's Bay and Wairarapa.§  §Applications close 18 October 2020.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50686609.txt	§Regional Support Coordinator - South Island §§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Regional Support Coordinator - South Island §§Advertiser: §Ministry for Primary Industries§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Administrative Assistants§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §        §Whatungarongaro te tangata toitu te whenua§          §As man disappears from sight, the land remains§        §        §Regional Support Coordinator - South Island §        §          §Regional Support Coordinator - South Island (Christchurch)§          §Fixed Term to June 2021§          §New Zealand's §Mycoplasma bovis§ Eradication Programme, is a world first effort to eradicate this cattle disease. Getting rid of this disease will help protect the productivity of our dairy and beef industries, part of our multi-billion dollar export economy and New Zealand way of life. The environment is dynamic, as the Programme adapts quickly to increase the effectiveness of our eradication methods, works to reduce the impact on affected farmers, and ultimately leave New Zealand's biosecurity system stronger.  We're passionate about what we do and enjoy working with like-minded people who want to see New Zealand farming free from this disease in the future.§          §Kōrero mō te tūranga - About the Role§          §The Regional Support Coordinator will provide a range administrative support to staff within the North Island and South Island regional offices. This is a fast moving and evolving environment, so you will need to adapt and develop to deliver results.§          §In this role you will facilitate the smooth running of the regional office by providing general administration tasks, and acting as a subject matter expert for MPI corporate systems and databases. Other duties but not limited to include:§          §            §Organising various meetings and taking minutes§            §Booking travel arrangements§            §Admin assistance and document preparation§            §Look into and identify any relevant system and process improvements§            §Facilitation of building issues - Security and management of supply contracts§            §Reception duties which includes receiving/inducting visitors and contractors and maintaining the visitors book.§          §          §Mōu - About You §          §This is a fast pace workplace, so we do require someone who is flexible who has an appreciation for good time management. You'll be customer focused with solid interpersonal skills and have advanced written and oral communication skills.§          §To be successful as a Regional Support Coordinator ideally you will be able to bring the following to the role as well as the above:§          §            §Proven experience working in an office environment§            §You will have business support systems and processes knowledge  §            §Experience in reception duties§            §Strong attention to detail with data entry experience§            §You will have experience working and building relationships with managers, staff and clients§          §          §MPI offers a high level or professional development and ongoing training to employees.§          §Mō te Manatū Ahu Matua - About MPI§          §The Ministry for Primary Industries is helping to seize export opportunities for our primary industries, improve sector productivity, ensure the food we produce is safe, increase sustainable resource use, and protect New Zealand from biological risk.§          §See the benefits of working at MPI - Ngā hua o te Mahi i te Manatū Ahu Matua§          §See the benefits of working at MPI§ §          §At MPI we are open to requests for flexible working on hiring. Please talk to us at interview about the flexibility you need and we will explore what's possible for the role.§          §How to Apply - Me pēhea te tuku tono§          §To apply for this role, you must hold the right to work in New Zealand or be eligible to obtain it.  To view the position description and/or apply for the role please click "§APPLY NOW§" or visit the MPI Careers Site. For tracking and reporting purposes, all applications must be submitted through our online career's portal. §          §For detailed information on this role please refer to the position description or contact §steven.adam@mpi.govt.nz§          §Applications close: Thursday, 15th Oct 2020.§          §The Ministry for Primary Industries is committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values inclusion and diversity. Your unique talents and experience will help us deliver exceptional services to our communities in Aotearoa. In return you'll enjoy an inclusive and flexible working environment in a diverse team of people while you're growing your career here in NZ and internationally. We actively encourage applications from all backgrounds. If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to tell us when you apply so that we can assist you through the recruitment process.§        §        §        §      §    §    §  §§§Regional Support Coordinator - South Island (Christchurch)§Fixed Term to June 2021§New Zealand's §Mycoplasma bovis§ Eradication Programme, is a world first effort to eradicate this cattle disease. Getting rid of this disease will help protect the productivity of our dairy and beef industries, part of our multi-billion dollar export economy and New Zealand way of life. The environment is dynamic, as the Programme adapts quickly to increase the effectiveness of our eradication methods, works to reduce the impact on affected farmers, and ultimately leave New Zealand's biosecurity system stronger.  We're passionate about what we do and enjoy working with like-minded people who want to see New Zealand farming free from this disease in the future.§Kōrero mō te tūranga - About the Role§The Regional Support Coordinator will provide a range administrative support to staff within the North Island and South Island regional offices. This is a fast moving and evolving environment, so you will need to adapt and develop to deliver results.§In this role you will facilitate the smooth running of the regional office by providing general administration tasks, and acting as a subject matter expert for MPI corporate systems and databases. jobTitle: Receptionist/Office Administrator Job in Canterbury - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50686671.txt	§Receptionist/Office Administrator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Receptionist/Office Administrator§§Advertiser: §Boffa Miskell Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Receptionists§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Receptionist/Office Administrator §      §        §We have an exciting opportunity for a friendly, professional and highly organised Receptionist / Office Administrator to join our Christchurch Team. Our modern Christchurch office overlooks the Ōtākaro/Avon River and is centrally located, close to all the amenities of the vibrant city centre. §        §As a Receptionist / Office Administrator you’ll work collaboratively with the three other members of our Business Services Team to provide essential receptionist and administration support and services to our busy consultants and the wider team. You will take pride in ensuring that the reception and office space looks its best, while providing an exceptional welcome to our clients and visitors.§        §Your day will be spent on a diverse range of tasks, including managing reception, organising our meeting rooms and resources, ensuring the office remains organised and tidy, supporting our clients and team, co-ordinating meetings and events, and doing those all-important tasks that keep the office ticking over. You will also assist with the organisation of internal catering and events, document formatting, and booking travel.§        §We are looking for someone with a positive attitude, who is willing to jump in and help where necessary. The successful applicant will also have the following skills, attributes, and experience:§        §          §At least two years’ comparable experience in reception or office administration;§          §Are highly organised, proactive and reliable;§          §Advanced Office365 skills (most importantly Word and Excel), and experience using InDesign (desirable, but not essential);§          §Ability to manage and deliver multiple tasks in a timely fashion;§          §Strong customer services skills;§          §Consistently demonstrates a high level of accuracy and has an excellent eye for detail;§          §Excellent written and verbal communication skills, and the ability to communicate effectively both in-person and over the phone;§          §A collaborative working style and the ability to get on with a diverse range of people;§          §Problem-solving skills to troubleshoot on-the-fly;§          §A full and current’s drivers’ licence (preferably with manual driving ability).§        §        §Boffa Miskell is a leading New Zealand professional services consultancy, that is focused on better outcomes for our environment. We are entirely employee-owned and growing, with an increasingly diverse portfolio of clients and projects. We offer a supportive, flexible and collaborative working environment and value having an inclusive and diverse workplace. We offer ongoing opportunities for professional and personal development to ensure that our people can excel and grow.§        §If this sounds like you, we're looking forward to receiving your application by Tuesday, 20 October 2020. §        §Please note, we will be considering applications for this role as they are received, so we encourage you to submit your application to us as soon as possible. §        §No recruitment agency enquiries please. Applicants must have the legal right to work in NZ.§        §Check out some of the projects and activities we’re involved in by visiting our website or social media pages: §        §https://www.facebook.com/BoffaMiskell/§http://instagram.com/boffamiskell§https://www.linkedin.com/company/boffamiskell/§      §      §For more information about us, visit our website: §www.boffamiskell.co.nz§      § §      §Send us your CV and, where applicable, examples of your work. Please address to:§      §Katherine McKenzie § Boffa Miskell Ltd, PO Box 110, Christchurch 8140 § Or email: §joinus@boffamiskell.co.nz§ § §For confidential enquiries please contact Katherine on §03 364 4778§ § §        §Closing date: Tuesday, 20 October 2020 §        §      §    §  §§§We have an exciting opportunity for a friendly, professional and highly organised Receptionist / Office Administrator to join our Christchurch Team. Our modern Christchurch office overlooks the Ōtākaro/Avon River and is centrally located, close to all the amenities of the vibrant city centre. § §As a Receptionist / Office Administrator you’ll work collaboratively with the three other members of our Business Services Team to provide essential receptionist and administration support and services to our busy consultants and the wider team. You will take pride in ensuring that the reception and office space looks its best, while providing an exceptional welcome to our clients and visitors.§ §Your day will be spent on a diverse range of tasks, including managing reception, organising our meeting rooms and resources, ensuring the office remains organised and tidy, supporting our clients and team, co-ordinating meetings and events, and doing those all-important tasks that keep the office ticking over. You will also assist with the organisation of internal catering and events, document formatting, and booking travel.§ §We are looking for someone with a positive attitude, who is willing to jump in and help where necessary. The successful applicant will also have the following skills, attributes, and experience:§ § §At least two years’ comparable experience in reception or office administration;§ §Are highly organised, proactive and reliable;§ §Advanced Office365 skills (most importantly Word and Excel), and experience using InDesign (desirable, but not essential);§ §Ability to manage and deliver multiple tasks in a timely fashion;§ §Strong customer services skills;§ §Consistently demonstrates a high level of accuracy and has an excellent eye for detail;§ §Excellent written and verbal communication skills, and the ability to communicate effectively both in-person and over the phone;§ §A collaborative working style and the ability to get on with a diverse range of people;§ §Problem-solving skills to troubleshoot on-the-fly;§ §A full and current’s drivers’ licence (preferably with manual driving ability).§ §Boffa Miskell is a leading New Zealand professional services consultancy, that is focused on better outcomes for our environment. We are entirely employee-owned and growing, with an increasingly diverse portfolio of clients and projects. We offer a supportive, flexible and collaborative working environment and value having an inclusive and diverse workplace. We offer ongoing opportunities for professional and personal development to ensure that our people can excel and grow.§ §If this sounds like you, we're looking forward to receiving your application by Tuesday, 20 October 2020. § §Please note, we will be considering applications for this role as they are received, so we encourage you to submit your application to us as soon as possible. § §No recruitment agency enquiries please. Applicants must have the legal right to work in NZ.§ §Check out some of the projects and activities we’re involved in by visiting our website or social media pages: § §https://www.facebook.com/BoffaMiskell/§http://instagram.com/boffamiskell§https://www.linkedin.com/company/boffamiskell/§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have experience in an administration role?§§§

jobTitle: Office Administrator Job in Bay of Plenty - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50686807.txt	§Office Administrator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Office Administrator§§Advertiser: §Roommates Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Bay of Plenty§, §Tauranga§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Administrative Assistants§§§§§§We have a great opportunity to fill a fast paced and dynamic Full Time administration role, overseeing the day to day operational, logistical, financial and administrative duties for a well established local business.§About the business:§We are a locally owned and operated businesses based in Tauriko.  We have several varying businesses operating out of the one warehouse and office location, which makes for a collaborative and exciting work place. §About the role:§We're in search of an administration and organisation superstar to join our team and cover all general office duties including financials, customer service, operations and logistics for one of our fast growing companies. §Within this role you would predominantly be working sole charge throughout the day, but in constant communication with offsite staff and with the support and guidance of the Office Manager.§Key responsibilities include:§Daily bank reconciliations§Accounts receivable & payable§Providing quotations§EOM accounts including GST§Administrative and operational support for offsite staff§Constant Debtor control§Handling general phone and email enquiries from customers§ §About the team:§Our close knit team love to have a laugh and all muck in together to just get the job done. We're looking for someone that's open minded, who isn't afraid of rolling their sleeves up and  who has a good sense of humor and work ethic.§The remuneration will be dependant upon the level of skill, experience and the compatibility the successful applicant brings.§Skills and Experience Required:§ A motivated individual with a good work ethic, and an enthusiastic positive attitude.§Highly organised, efficient and comfortable with re-prioritising your workload and shifting from one task to another throughout the day if required. §Outstanding customer service and communication skills via phone and email. This role is not for the faint of heart - you need to have the compassion and desire to help people in need, but also have the confidence to crack down when it comes to debt collection.§A good foundational knowledge of administration and experience in accounts and customer service§ §- Please apply with CV and cover letter - §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§

jobTitle: People and Culture Manager Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50686824.txt	§People and Culture Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§People and Culture Manager§§Advertiser: §ArchiPro Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Office Management§§§§§§Our entrepreneurial culture and warm family atmosphere will surround you with a fun and dynamic work environment you will only find at ArchiPro. Currently Team of 50, quickly growing to a team of 100+§ §Here is our founder's and CEO story as featured on M2 Magazine; https://m2magazine.co.nz/refugee-to-digital-powerhouse-the-man-who-set-out-to-transform-an-industry/§ §ArchiPro§ §At ArchiPro, our platform empowers millions of people embarking on their building journey - from homeowners and local artisans to architects shaping NZ’s most iconic buildings - fueled by our mission to simplify the building process, our goal is to provide people with an easy-to-access, one-stop destination for all things Architecture and Building. § §Over the last few years, ArchiPro has grown from an idea, to one of the most iconic brands within the Construction Industry in New Zealand… and we are just getting started. This is an amazing opportunity to step in at an exciting time of significant growth and take things to the next level.  The strength of ArchiPro is our people.  For anyone else it's just a job; For us at ArchiPro, it's our sole purpose.§ §The Role§ §We are looking for a PRO who thrives in a fast-paced environment and has an infectious positive can do attitude.  You will be exceptionally ambitious, motivated and driven to meet your day to day deadlines. This role requires someone who is super approachable and loves to help and impact other team members jobs by supporting them with day to day administrative duties.§ §You will have a variety of responsibilities in all aspects of people management, ensuring their experience at ArchiPro is the best one out there.  Being in charge of all things office management, this role will suit someone who is used to juggling multiple projects on the go whilst keeping a smile in your face.§ §You’ll have experience in a start-up or high-growth context and be willing to roll up your sleeves to get things done.  We’re looking for someone who can hit the ground running at a time when we are on the cusp of significant growth.§ §People and Culture Responsibilities§ § §Provide world-class onboarding experience to all the new team members joining the business§ §Setting up their work stations in advance and assisting with equipment related issues as needed§ §Develop and maintain a cutting-edge, highly personalised learning model for all our employees, that combines tools for on-the-job learning and feedback with a range of diverse, engaging, and easily accessible learning resources§ §Develop and deliver a people and culture plan and policies to support the organisation's strategic plan§ §Support all aspects of Human Resources, including recruitment, retention,, reward, well-being, engagement, learning and development.§ §Responsible for providing policy and procedural advice to team members§ §Play the role of a true business partner in coaching, motivating and fostering strong working relationships with both the leadership team and operations.§ §Being a big part of the internal team culture-assisting with booking team activities and generally being a PRO to boost team morale§ §Organising team’s social events alongside the support of the Social Committee§ §Day to day smooth running of the office including:§ § §Being the welcoming face to everyone who enters our office§ §Maintaining general tidiness of the office, entry area and rooms§ §Answering and directing all inbound calls with an inspiring tone and energy § §Maintaining stationary and kitchen supplies§ §Organising travel arrangements§ §Taking minutes in meetings§ §Taking minutes in meetings§ §Liaising with landlord§ ​​​​​​​§ §Skills and Attributes§ § §Professional, interactive communication, both verbal and written§ §Well presented, self motivated individual with exceptional interpersonal skills.§ §Problem-solving with excellent attention to detail is a must.§ §You have the ability to prioritise work, meet deadlines and work accurately under time pressures.§ §You have great attention to detail, organisation, accurate data entry and typing skills.§ §Computer literacy in MS Word, Excel and Outlook (intermediate level)§ §Financial administration experience is desirable but not essential§ §A passion for your work, and alignment with our organisational mission and values§ §Ability to build rapport and trust with a wide variety of stakeholders and demonstrate empathy§ §Perks and Benefits§ § §Central, contemporary office space in Parnell, in the heart of the design and architecture cityscape§ §Being part of a quickly-growing PRO team - the possibilities are endless here§ §On tap coffee, fruit, wine and beer§ §Friday team huddle and drinks§ §Monthly team building functions§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years of people management experience do you have?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§§§

jobTitle: Group Services Administrator - Faculty of Medical Health Sciences Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50686834.txt	§Group Services Administrator - Faculty of Medical Health Sciences§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Group Services Administrator - Faculty of Medical Health Sciences§§Advertiser: §The University of Auckland§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Administrative Assistants§§§§§§Job Description§ §The University of Auckland is a truly great place to work. Offering five weeks’ annual leave, over 300 courses and workshops designed to support your professional development, and standout facilities for staff members who are also parents, it’s easy to see why we've just been voted one of New Zealand’s most attractive employers.*§ §Find out more about some of the great reasons to work for us at §Career development and benefits.§ §The School of Pharmacy within the Faculty of Medical and Health Sciences seeks a positive and efficient Group Services Administrator with a focus on stakeholder service.  The purpose of this role is to work as a member of the Group Services team providing administrative support for the School’s teaching and academic activities.  You will undertake a range of activities primarily focused around teaching support and course administration, including assessment and examination administration for both undergraduate and postgraduate courses.  These are core activities with processes driven by the University’s teaching schedule and deadlines.  You may be required to provide support to other schools within the Faculty when the need arises.§ §You will work with a diverse range of stakeholders, in a dynamic and complex environment!§ §For more detailed information on the role accountabilities and requirements, please review this Position Description §here§. § §To succeed in this role, you will need the following skills and experience:§ § §Some administration experience, ideally gained in a tertiary environment. You’ll need to be fully proficient in the use of Microsoft Word, Excel and Outlook;§ §Immaculate attention to detail, with excellent organisational skills and the ability to effectively manage a busy workload;§ §Excellent interpersonal, written, and verbal communication skills, as you will be working collaboratively as part of a high-performing team with an outstanding customer focus for the school’s key stakeholders.§ §This position is permanent, part-time 37.5 hrs per week, based at our Grafton campus.§ §For further information, please contact Kathryn Siow, Group Services Team Leader, at §k.siow@auckland.ac.nz§.§ §How to apply§ §Applications must be submitted online, by the closing date of §Tuesday 13th October 2020§ to be considered. Please include your CV and cover letter outlining your suitability for this role.  § §All applications must be submitted through the University of Auckland Careers website.  § §If this sounds like the next step in your career, apply today!§ §Additional Information§ §The University is committed to meeting its obligations under the Treaty of Waitangi and achieving equity outcomes for staff and students in a safe, inclusive and equitable environment. For further information on services for Māori, Pacific, women, LGBTQITakatāpui+, people with disabilities, parenting support, flexible work and other equity issues go to www.equity.auckland.ac.nz.§§§§

jobTitle: Security Administrator Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50686882.txt	§Security Administrator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Security Administrator§§Advertiser: §NZDF§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Salary§§$46319 - $54039 including 4% super contribution§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Administrative Assistants§§§§§§§§§  §    §Security Administrator §    §      §        §What you will do§As Security Administrator within New Zealand Defence Intelligence, you will support the compliance of security regulations for NZDF Headquarters secure floors. You will own the process for visitors and enforce the requirements in a professional and assertive manner, when required.§A typical day could include:§        §          §Recording and coordinating visitors to secure floors;§          §Maintenance of security records;§          §Conducting data transfers between NZDF networks;§          §Assistance with scheduling Video Telephone Conferences (VTC);§          §First line troubleshooting for VTCs and AV equipment;§          §Escorting visitors around secure areas;§          §Assisting with the management of classified information and equipment;§          §Assisting with the resetting passwords; and§          §Establishing and managing effective relationships with stakeholders and customers.§        §        §You will also have the opportunity to upskill and learn more about Security within Defence as a key part of a small team who works together to get the job done. §What we need§ §This dynamic role requires excellent and professional customer service skills. You must be able to deal with all levels of the organisation and manage requests appropriately in a timely manner.§You will have:§        §          §Strong IT skills and knowledge, particularly confident using Microsoft Office and SharePoint;§          §High attention to detail even when under pressure;§          §Excellent written and oral communication skills; and§          §The ability to adapt and manage your time to suit changing priorities.§        §        §Ideally, you will be familiar with the Defence Force, have knowledge and awareness of military structure and hold a full and valid NZ drivers licence.§Who we are§ §The Chief of Defence Intelligence (CDI) is the principal provider of intelligence and security advice to the Chief of Defence Force (CDF) and the New Zealand Defence Force Executive Leadership Team (ELT).  It achieves this by: supporting the ELT in the formulation of strategic intelligence and security direction; implementation of direction from CDF and the ELT through its organic branch capabilities or through the technical direction of Joint Force intelligence and security resources.§Every hour of every day, 365 days of the year, the New Zealand Defence Force is contributing to the defence, security and well-being of Aotearoa / New Zealand.  As a modern, professional military, it is our goal to maintain well trained, equipped and disciplined armed forces that can react to crisis at short notice. §Why Us§NZDF is an inclusive organisation that is open to flexible working arrangements and welcomes applications from people regardless of gender, ethnicity, disability, sexual orientation, age, beliefs/opinions, or family circumstances.§ §In return for your expertise, dedication and hard work, NZDF is offering remuneration reflective of your experience, along with:§        §          §Great benefits for you and your family§;§          §Full time ongoing work;§          §Opportunities for career development;§          §5 weeks annual leave per year. §        §        §How to Apply§To view the Position Description and to Apply Online please visit our §Defence Careers§ website, or use the links on this page.§Please note:§ If you are an existing NZDF employee (excluding contractors) you must apply through our Internal Vacancies site, via the HR Toolkit.§Applications close on §Tuesday 13 October 2020§.§Please note: §Applicants must be legally entitled to work in New Zealand (NZ) and be able to obtain and maintain the required level of NZ Government security clearance for the position applied for. The minimum citizenship and residency criteria for security clearances to be granted by the NZ Defence Force are as follows:§Higher level Security Clearance§        §          §You must have been an NZ Citizen for at least 10 years.  Alternatively, you must hold NZ Permanent Residence or hold a current NZ Residency Class Visa and have been a citizen of UK, USA, Canada or Australia for 10 years.§          §You must be able to obtain and maintain a Top Secret Special (TSS) security clearance.  Ordinarily to obtain this level of clearance candidates must have 15 years of verifiable background history in countries where a meaningful background check can be undertaken and assessed as appropriate by the NZ Security Intelligence Service.§        §        §If you do not meet these minimum criteria, we will not be able to accept your application.§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§What you will do§As Security Administrator within New Zealand Defence Intelligence, you will support the compliance of security regulations for NZDF Headquarters secure floors. You will own the process for visitors and enforce the requirements in a professional and assertive manner, when required.§A typical day could include:§ § §Recording and coordinating visitors to secure floors;§ §Maintenance of security records;§ §Conducting data transfers between NZDF networks;§ §Assistance with scheduling Video Telephone Conferences (VTC);§ §First line troubleshooting for VTCs and AV equipment;§ §Escorting visitors around secure areas;§ §Assisting with the management of classified information and equipment;§ §Assisting with the resetting passwords; and§ §Establishing and managing effective relationships with stakeholders and customers.§ §You will also have the opportunity to upskill and learn more about Security within Defence as a key part of a small team who works together to get the job done. §What we need§ §This dynamic role requires excellent and professional customer service skills. You must be able to deal with all levels of the organisation and manage requests appropriately in a timely manner.§You will have:§ § §Strong IT skills and knowledge, particularly confident using Microsoft Office and SharePoint;§ §High attention to detail even when under pressure;§ §Excellent written and oral communication skills; and§ §The ability to adapt and manage your time to suit changing priorities.§ §Ideally, you will be familiar with the Defence Force, have knowledge and awareness of military structure and hold a full and valid NZ drivers licence.§Who we are§ §The Chief of Defence Intelligence (CDI) is the principal provider of intelligence and security advice to the Chief of Defence Force (CDF) and the New Zealand Defence Force Executive Leadership Team (ELT).  It achieves this by: supporting the ELT in the formulation of strategic intelligence and security direction; implementation of direction from CDF and the ELT through its organic branch capabilities or through the technical direction of Joint Force intelligence and security resources.§Every hour of every day, 365 days of the year, the New Zealand Defence Force is contributing to the defence, security and well-being of Aotearoa / New Zealand.  As a modern, professional military, it is our goal to maintain well trained, equipped and disciplined armed forces that can react to crisis at short notice. §Why Us§NZDF is an inclusive organisation that is open to flexible working arrangements and welcomes applications from people regardless of gender, ethnicity, disability, sexual orientation, age, beliefs/opinions, or family circumstances.§ §In return for your expertise, dedication and hard work, NZDF is offering remuneration reflective of your experience, along with:§ § §Great benefits for you and your family§;§ §Full time ongoing work;§ §Opportunities for career development;§ §5 weeks annual leave per year. § §How to Apply§To view the Position Description and to Apply Online please visit our §Defence Careers§ website, or use the links on this page.§Please note:§ If you are an existing NZDF employee (excluding contractors) you must apply through our Internal Vacancies site, via the HR Toolkit.§Applications close on §Tuesday 13 October 2020§.§Please note: §Applicants must be legally entitled to work in New Zealand (NZ) and be able to obtain and maintain the required level of NZ Government security clearance for the position applied for. The minimum citizenship and residency criteria for security clearances to be granted by the NZ Defence Force are as follows:§Higher level Security Clearance§ § §You must have been an NZ Citizen for at least 10 years.  Alternatively, you must hold NZ Permanent Residence or hold a current NZ Residency Class Visa and have been a citizen of UK, USA, Canada or Australia for 10 years.§ §You must be able to obtain and maintain a Top Secret Special (TSS) security clearance.  Ordinarily to obtain this level of clearance candidates must have 15 years of verifiable background history in countries where a meaningful background check can be undertaken and assessed as appropriate by the NZ Security Intelligence Service.§ §If you do not meet these minimum criteria, we will not be able to accept your application.§§§§

You will also support teachers by providing high-quality advice and guidance on registration and certification processes.§ §You will have capacity for high volume and detail-oriented work, balanced with supporting your teammates and providing a level of service to teachers that is professional and confidential. An eye for detail, the ability to work in a methodical and accurate manner, and great customer service skills are key for this role.§ §What we are looking for:§ § §1 to 3 years of experience in a fast-paced customer service environment§ §Experience applying judgement based on policies and legislation§ §Energy, a positive outlook, and the desire to be part of a highly engaged team§ §A methodical, systematic approach to managing your own workload to meet targets§ §Excellent oral and written communication skills§ §The ability to work effectively in a diverse workplace with strong commitment to te Tiriti o Waitangi§ §To Apply§ §Click Apply and send us your CV and cover letter.§ §For a copy of the Position Description, visit www.teachingcouncil.nz/vacancies.§ §Applications close at 5pm on Tuesday, 13 October 2020.§ §Please note that to apply for this position you must live and have a legal right to work in New Zealand.§ §Successful appointment is conditional upon Criminal Record check and psychometric tests.§ § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have experience in an administration role?§Do you have customer service experience?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§

jobText: TXT/50687539.txt	§Secretarial Support - Clinical Support Services, Nelson Hospital§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Secretarial Support - Clinical Support Services, Nelson Hospital§§Advertiser: §Nelson Marlborough Health§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Tasman§, §Nelson§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §PA, EA & Secretarial§§§§§§§Are you an experienced administrator with great customer service skills?§Permanent 0.9 FTE position§Highly component at managing appointments via wait-lists§Medical typing an advantage, however training can be provided§Ngā mōhiohio e pā ana ki tēv nei mahi (About this position)§We are looking for an efficient administrator with outstanding communication and organisational skills to join our clinical services support team at Wairau Hospital. You will provide administrative support to our consultants and clinical teams. This will include accurate data management and maintenance of our patient information system, managing elective surgery bookings via wait-lists, and ensure the efficient and accurate processing of documentation. You may also be required to undertake typing of medical documents.§This is a permanent position working 72 hours a fortnight (0.9 FTE). Hours of work will be Monday to Friday between the hours of 7.00AM and 5.30PM.§The starting salary for this role is $47,580 (pro-rata). Our preferred applicant may be required to undertake a computer skills assessment.§Ko wai he kaitono tōtika? (Who is an appropriate applicant?)§You'll respect the importance of maintaining patient confidentiality and will have demonstrated the ability to manage a busy workload. You'll be bright, outgoing and possess excellent interpersonal skills, and will provide a consistently high standard of customer service to our team. It's essential that you have a sound knowledge of the MS Office Suite and are a competent typist (50+ wpm). Dictaphone experience and knowledge of medical terminology would be advantageous.§Ā mātou rōpū (About our team)§Nelson Marlborough Health is the main health provider for the top of the south. Nearly 3,000 strong, we are Nelson and Marlborough's largest employer, which means the opportunities here are endless. Our main locations are Nelson and Wairau Hospitals but we are spread across the region and service all parts of the community. Our work can be challenging, but we are up for it. We have a great team and we work hard to make a difference. We value integrity, innovation, respect and teamwork.§Ētahi atu mōhiohio (More Information)§https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC34XErxkHJ5YAn59o6SrhnA§Ngā huanga o tēnei mahi (The benefits of this position)§We provide a great place to work with professional development opportunities, job security, and workplace wellness programmes.§You will enjoy the satisfaction of fulfilling an important role within the hospital, assisting with managing patients from initial specialist appointment, through the hospital service and back into the community.§Me pēhea ahau e tono ai? (How do I apply?)§Keen to apply now, it's easy. Click on apply now and complete our online application form.§Any questions please contact our recruitment team on §vacancies@nmdhb.govt.nz§ or §03 546 1274§.§N20-414.§Applications close: Thursday, 22 October 2020.§Nelson Marlborough Health strongly endorses Te Tiriti o Waitangi.§We believe that to achieve equity in health outcomes for Māori we need a workforce reflective of the population it serves. We strongly encourage applications from candidates who identify as Māori and we recruit for cultural competence.§He waka eke noa. We are all in this together.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Sales & Underwriting Support - Broker Personal Lines Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50687607.txt	§Sales & Underwriting Support - Broker Personal Lines§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Sales & Underwriting Support - Broker Personal Lines§§Advertiser: §IAG NZ Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Manukau & East Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Contracts Administration§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Sales & Underwriting Support - Broker Personal Lines §      §        §At NZI, we're one of New Zealand's largest and most well-known insurance brands, offering an extensive selection of flexible, comprehensive insurance services for people and businesses throughout the country.§        §Our NZI Broker Personal Lines team underwrite domestic insurance for the whole of New Zealand under the NZI banner. We're an award-winning team, providing exceptional service to a nationwide network of brokers. We're working hard to grow our business and we also play a vital role in working with our commercial branch network and ensuring that we protect the commercial insurance business that is associated with our personal lines risks.§        §The opportunity§        §Vital to our overall success, you'll provide crucial support to the Account Managers in managing their relationships with allocated brokers to achieve planned growth and profit objectives. You'll provide general administrative and clerical support to the wider sales and underwriting teams and support the underwriting, renewal and new business processes.§        §This is a permanent opportunity commencing on 23rd November 2020. This is a work from home role however a requirement that you are based near one of our main Hubs in Auckland, Hamilton, Wellington, Christchurch, Palmerston North or Dunedin.§        §What we're after§        §To succeed in this role, you'll need to be customer focused with strong communication skills. You'll be an exceptional multi-tasker - flexible enough to change direction at the drop of a hat and able to prioritise your workload effectively. You'll bring a positive, passionate attitude and the desire to learn about sales and underwriting. Your proven administration and customer service experience will help you to settle into this role with ease, while any previous exposure to underwriting and/or experience working with brokers would be a strong advantage.§        §Who are we:§        §IAG is NZ's largest general insurer and operates under the State, AMI, NZI, and Lumley brands, as well as underwriting insurance for some of NZ's leading banks. jobText: TXT/50688875.txt	§Contracts Administrator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Contracts Administrator§§Advertiser: §Talent ID Business Systems Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Bay of Plenty§, §Rotorua§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Contracts Administration§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Contracts Administrator §      §He mahi ngātahi – Working in partnership§    §Come and join the team at TRILITY based in the heart of the Bay of Plenty, Rotorua. Their full range of services includes financing, design and construction, operations and maintenance, asset management, utility services, and equipment solutions. Their capabilities span the full life cycle of water, delivering services to millions of people every day.§ §        §TRILITY, in partnership with Rotorua Lakes Council, is looking to fill the role of Contracts Administrator. This is a new role, within a brand-new team for a brand-new client, so you’ll have a real opportunity to make your mark and add value. Reporting to the Asset Manager, you will be responsible for administering assigned contracts within defined timelines.   Essentially you will become the contract expert with an intimate understanding of the terms of all assigned contracts with the mandate to brief other stakeholders on the requirements of each contract, whilst ensuring that the administration obligations for the contact are fulfilled.  You will ensure that TRILITY’S values of being progressive and working with integrity and commitment are demonstrated throughout all aspects of the contract administration with both internal and external stakeholders. § §        §This role is the conduit between client, partners and subcontract staff and this role will contribute to TRILITY’S reputation by maintaining good relationships and ensuring the smooth running of contracts and development of future relationships.§ §        §Key accountabilities of the role include;§ § § §        § §        §          §Ensure TRILITY’S systems for Safety, Quality and Environment are fully utilised§          §Assist with drafting and compiling of contract documents for procurement, maintenance and minor construction projects§          §Administer financial obligations of assigned contracts§          §Assist with administration of variations to assigned contracts§          §Assist with the identification and assessment of contract risk§          §Administer notices and other assigned contractual obligations§          §Monthly reporting§        § To be successful in this role you will need to be an experienced and technically competent administrator with at least five years of experience working with building or maintenance contracts and a sound knowledge of contract law.  You’ll also have a good working knowledge of procurement and buying processes and an understanding of building and maintenance trades and work processes.  Commercial acumen is key, along with a fluent understanding of financial administration with regard to contacts.  Should you also have knowledge of the water or wastewater sector that would be a real advantage.  §        §If you seek a challenging new role where you will be part of a brand new team, you are ambitious, smart, adaptable, motivated and always striving to achieve your best whilst demonstrating sound judgement then this could be the role for you.  This role is 32 hours per week. It is preferred that the successful candidate resides in the Rotorua region.§ §        §A fantastic opportunity to join this progressive company, based in a vibrant and thriving city with an abundance of lifestyle activities and outdoor pursuits on offer.  Please send your application letter and CV online to Kellie Hamlett, Recruitment Specialist at Talent ID Recruitment Ltd.  §      §      §Kellie Hamlett §    §    §  §§§He mahi ngātahi – Working in partnership§    §Come and join the team at TRILITY based in the heart of the Bay of Plenty, Rotorua. Their full range of services includes financing, design and construction, operations and maintenance, asset management, utility services, and equipment solutions. Their capabilities span the full life cycle of water, delivering services to millions of people every day.§ § §TRILITY, in partnership with Rotorua Lakes Council, is looking to fill the role of Contracts Administrator. This is a new role, within a brand-new team for a brand-new client, so you’ll have a real opportunity to make your mark and add value. Reporting to the Asset Manager, you will be responsible for administering assigned contracts within defined timelines.   Essentially you will become the contract expert with an intimate understanding of the terms of all assigned contracts with the mandate to brief other stakeholders on the requirements of each contract, whilst ensuring that the administration obligations for the contact are fulfilled.  You will ensure that TRILITY’S values of being progressive and working with integrity and commitment are demonstrated throughout all aspects of the contract administration with both internal and external stakeholders. § § §This role is the conduit between client, partners and subcontract staff and this role will contribute to TRILITY’S reputation by maintaining good relationships and ensuring the smooth running of contracts and development of future relationships.§ § §Key accountabilities of the role include;§ § § § § § §Ensure TRILITY’S systems for Safety, Quality and Environment are fully utilised§ §Assist with drafting and compiling of contract documents for procurement, maintenance and minor construction projects§ §Administer financial obligations of assigned contracts§ §Assist with administration of variations to assigned contracts§ §Assist with the identification and assessment of contract risk§ §Administer notices and other assigned contractual obligations§ §Monthly reporting§ § To be successful in this role you will need to be an experienced and technically competent administrator with at least five years of experience working with building or maintenance contracts and a sound knowledge of contract law.  You’ll also have a good working knowledge of procurement and buying processes and an understanding of building and maintenance trades and work processes.  Commercial acumen is key, along with a fluent understanding of financial administration with regard to contacts.  Should you also have knowledge of the water or wastewater sector that would be a real advantage.  § §If you seek a challenging new role where you will be part of a brand new team, you are ambitious, smart, adaptable, motivated and always striving to achieve your best whilst demonstrating sound judgement then this could be the role for you.  This role is 32 hours per week. It is preferred that the successful candidate resides in the Rotorua region.§ § §A fantastic opportunity to join this progressive company, based in a vibrant and thriving city with an abundance of lifestyle activities and outdoor pursuits on offer.  Please send your application letter and CV online to Kellie Hamlett, Recruitment Specialist at Talent ID Recruitment Ltd.  §§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§

The role requires a high level of administration and secretarial support to the Director involved along with assistance with handling incoming calls.§ §This is an important role, so we need a vibrant person with great people skills, a positive approach to their work and the ability to cope with pressure and remain calm and professional throughout the day.§ §Key Skills required:§ §Proven experience and expert knowledge of Microsoft office, in particular Word, Excel and Outlook is paramount.§ §Exceptional communication and relationship building skills§ §Excellent organisation and planning skills with an ability to prioritise§ §Ability to adapt and abide by culture of company§ §Good Knowledge about employment policies, legislation and procedures.§ §Managing and responding to all business communications§ §Liaising with senior management§ §Ensuring that all invoices are completed accurately and on time.§ §To be Successful in this role you will need§ §Must have Tertiary qualification in Business /management/equivalent§ §New Zealand work experience in administration work will be preferable.§ §You may be asked to work on weekends and public holidays if needed.§ §If you are looking for a new opportunity with one of the market leaders and enjoy a role where you can add value.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§

$69,999§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Contracts Administration§§§§§§About us§ § § §Multi Services Solutions Group (MSS Group) is a privately owned and operated company with operations in both Australia and New Zealand.§ §TRAK is a subsidiary of MSS Group- this business has been operation for over 30 years, and has a team of 100 based in Penrose, Auckland.§ §For more information about TRAK please visit: www.trak.co.nz/§ § § §Qualifications & experience§ § § §Minimum of 3 years' experience in a Contract Admin, Project Admin, Project Coordination or similar related position.§Experience in the Construction or Facilities Management industry preferred§ § § §Tasks & responsibilities§ § § §Preparation and co-ordination of quotes, budgets and purchase orders for approval and distribution to clients and subcontractors.§Preparing and review various company contracts, including purchases, sales and business partnerships.§Responsible for new sub-contractors onboarding and pre-qualification process using Rapid Induct.§Engagement with key stakeholders is essential, which will include scheduling regular meetings with Project/Construction Managers using video conferencing technology, and recording decisions, assigned tasks and tracking next steps§Monitor job status for every project, from inspection, quotation/ proposals, contractual agreement, budget approvals, variance approvals, work and PO's, progress payments, completion of works - including QA, certificates of completion, equipment audits, other handover requirements.§Foster and maintain positive working relationships with clients and customers§Work collaboratively with team members, enabling a cohesive and positive working environment.§Ensure full compliance with MSS Group business systems, including the Quality Management System (QMS), Occupational Health & Safety System (OH&S) and Environmental Management System (EMS) and processes§ § § §Benefits§ § § §Career progression, mentor-ship & training available§On month handover with current employee§Fixed Term contract, with potential to become permanent§Onsite Parking§Uniform provided§ § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§

As an employee, you will experience some great benefits! Discounted parking, 5 weeks annual leave and double the sick leave! We are located in Ellerslie business park with all the amenities close by!§        § §        § §        §About Us§        § §        §NZ Health Partnerships is supported and owned by New Zealand's 20 District Health Boards (DHBs). By thinking, acting and investing collaboratively through us, DHBs can achieve greater efficiencies than they would by operating independently. We provide a range of programme and national services for DHB's including shared banking, collective insurance, procurement and an Oracle ERP system build and implementation.§        § §        §New Zealand Health Partnerships is focused on creating financial efficiencies for DHBs, to have direct and indirect clinical benefits. You will serve as the primary point of contact for internal and external customers and provide liaison with all visitors to NZHP, as well as managing key relationships with external suppliers.§ §The role oversees the communal spaces, common resources and common office management related processes, including ensuring other key roles are adhering to these. You'll need to be comfortable doing everything from ordering the milk to looking at process improvement.§ §You will have responsibility for, but not limited to:§§Overall office management, ensuring communal spaces organised, equipped and ready for use and ordering of office consumables and supplies, and carpark allocation and management.§Day to day office administration to support operational requirements including visitor management, reception (phone), courier and mail management§Manage technology and office equipment requirements, including training / support;§Oversee and coordinate special projects and events.§§Please note, this is a fixed term opportunity to November 2022.§ §About You§ § §To be successful in the role you will have proven relatable experience in similar positions, within complex and corporate environments. You will need to be comfortable working from the office 5 days a week.§ §We will also be looking for strong experience in:§§Communicating across all levels and up to Executive and C-Suite;§Customer service and employee engagement;§Database administration and basic project management.§§ §Bring your experience along to the team! As an employee, you will experience some great benefits! Discounted parking, 5 weeks annual leave and double the sick leave! We are located in Ellerslie business park with all the amenities close by!§ § §About Us§§ §NZ Health Partnerships is supported and owned by New Zealand's 20 District Health Boards (DHBs). By thinking, acting and investing collaboratively through us, DHBs can achieve greater efficiencies than they would by operating independently. We provide a range of programme and national services for DHB's including shared banking, collective insurance, procurement and an Oracle ERP system build and implementation.§ §New Zealand Health Partnerships is focused on creating financial efficiencies for DHBs, to have direct and indirect clinical benefits.
