jobTitle: Office and Accounts Administrator Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50692642.txt	§Office and Accounts Administrator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Office and Accounts Administrator§§Advertiser: §Construct Health Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Rodney & North Shore§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Administrative Assistants§§§§§§About the business§ § § §Construct Health is a professional health and safety consultancy dedicated to assisting small to medium-sized enterprises and large corporates through the challenging and multi-faceted discipline of health and safety management and safety systems.§ § § §About the role§ § § §To assist us we are looking for a warm, welcoming and approachable individual to join our team.§ §As the Office and Accounts Administrator you will be an integral member of our team with the role requiring the candidate to provide high-level of support to the Director and our health and safety practitioner team and client base.§ §The successful candidate will be professional and articulate, have excellent written and verbal communication skills and will strive to deliver an exceptional level of service to both internal and external stakeholders.§ §The role requires someone who has a proven background in book-keeping or office accounting and is proficient in the use of Xero accounting software and account management.§ §Experience in the construction industry would be an added advantage.§ §Excellent time management skills and someone who can work on their own initiative is essential. § §Daily responsibilities include:§ §Monthly invoicing, bill payments and reconciliations§Payroll management§Preparation of presentations and proposals as assigned§Writing, editing and proofreading comprehensive reports in a variety of formats for delivery to clients and other external stakeholders§Answering telephone calls - timely, accurately and professionally§Contribution to the development and updates of administrative systems to improve and ensure efficiency§Additional general administrative tasks as required and requested § § § § § §Benefits and perks§ § § §The role is based in our Rosedale (Albany) office and is centrally placed to local motorway and public transport networks. There is plenty of free on-street parking.§ §This is part-time position of approx. 30 hours a week, Monday to Friday.§ § § §Skills and experience§ § § §Medium to advanced proficiency in MS Office, particularly having the ability to generate and create professional reports using Excel, Word, Visio and PowerPoint§Proficiency in the use of Xero and CRM§Willingness to learn new software systems for both internal and external processes§Excellent time management skills and the ability to prioritise work§Attention to detail and problem-solving skills§Ability to identify improvement and smart solutions in business applications§ § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following accounting packages are you experienced with?§Which of the following Microsoft Office products are you experienced with?§How many years of bookkeeping experience do you have?§Do you have previous invoicing experience?§§§

jobText: TXT/50692727.txt	§Truck Dealership Receptionist / Admin§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Truck Dealership Receptionist / Admin§§Advertiser: §Modern Transport Engineers 2002 Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Hamilton§§Salary§§$20 - $24.99 per hour§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Receptionists§§§§§§Sinotruk NZ are seeking an Administrator to join our team in Te Rapa, Sinotruk NZ is part of the Modern Transport Group of Companies, which is at the forefront of heavy transport solutions in Australasia. We are a well-established group specializing in the manufacturing and maintenance of large transport trailers, Heavy Earthmoving Equipment & Trucks for both the domestic and Australian markets.§Benefits:§ § §Top remuneration package§ §Fantastic opportunities to develop§ §Small dedicated team with loads of opportunity to grow with the team§ §The Role:§ §As a Receptionist / Admin you will be responsible for the day to day running of the office but not limited to:§ § §Standard office administrative duties, daily e-mails, telephone calls and filing§ §Sorting of daily correspondence and parcels incoming and outgoing, maintaining a register system, filling of correspondence and ensuring follow up on queries related from correspondence.§ §Maintaining appointment diaries and making travel arrangement for management§ §Greeting clients, assessing their needs and referring them to the appropriate person to assist§ §Capturing and maintaining the Fleet Management Program§ §Maintaining a vehicle register including maintenance expenditure, service intervals, logbooks, incident reports, WOF and registrations§ §Accurate and timely data entry of accounts payable and receivable and complete the processes required through to end of month§ §Ordering, Invoicing & receipting of parts§ §Candidate Requirements:§ § §Strong English communicator both written and verbal§ §Great listener and can be incorporated in a project team environment§ §Keen to learn and develop new skills and knowledge§ §Good phone manner§ §Good communication skills & the ability to work within a team environment§ §Organized, and able to be responsible for document registers and parts tracking systems§ §What you need to do now:§ §If you are interested in this role, click 'apply now' or for more information on starting dates, rates and any similar positions available, please send your CV to §RaewynH@modtrans.co.nz§If this job isn't quite right for you but you are looking for a new position, please contact us for a confidential discussion on your career.§Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have experience in an administration role?§§§

jobText: TXT/50693377.txt	§Governance and Executive Secretariat§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Governance and Executive Secretariat§§Advertiser: §Stats NZ§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §PA, EA & Secretarial§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Governance and Executive Secretariat §      §        §          §            §Two opportunities available §            §About Us | Mō mātou§            §At Tatauranga Aotearoa Stats NZ, our vision is to unleash the power of data to change lives.  As New Zealand’s official data and statistics agency, we are tasked with leading the way for New Zealand’s data future, enabling data-led innovation across society, the economy, and the environment. §            §The role | Mō te tūnga§            §            §The Governance and Executive Secretariat will provide top-notch secretarial support to our Governance Advisory Board, our external Risk and Assurance Committee, our Core Leadership Team, as well as a number of other internal and across-government groups. §            §The Secretariat will be responsible for the smooth operation of those groups, their connection with each other as well as with the Executive and the wider organisation. Day-to-day tasks include: §            §              §Meeting support and logistics, including minute taking §              §Managing efficient flow of information between the groups and the wider organisation – making sure everyone has the right information at the right time §              §Supporting the groups in the planning of and reporting on their work programme, including forward agendas and actions §              §Developing and managing of the groups’ finances and budgets §              §and other activities associated with the operation of those groups. §            §            §The Secretariat will work closely with others in the Office of the Chief Executive, as well as management and teams across the organisation. We have two roles and one Secretariat team member will also provide administrative support to the Executive Assistant of our Chief Executive (at 0.2 FTE). §            §Starting salary: $75,000 - $90,000 negotiable, depending on skills and experience. §          §          §            §About you | Mōu§            §You have extensive experience in a Secretariat role for a Board, or other Governance and Executive groups and significant expertise in governance and Board operations, as well as a high level of comfort working with C-suite people, and in dealing with complex and technical subject matter areas. §            §You are an organisational and administrative wizard and are bringing your can-do attitude, your passion for easy and efficient processes, and your attention to detail to the role. Strong relationship management skills are also crucial, and you will be comfortable engaging with Board members and senior leaders alike, and able to build rapport and trust with staff from across the organisation quickly. §            §You will be an expert user of the standard MS Office suite and have a solid understanding of video conference technology. §            §What is in it for you?§            §            §You’ll be joining an inclusive environment where people, regardless of gender, race, disability, religion or background are supported to be able to do their best work. This includes: §            §              §Opportunity to develop and grow your career §              §Balance with life and work commitments §              §An environment that’s safe, where you can be yourself §            §            §How to apply | §Me pēhea te tuku tono §            §If the above matches your skills and experience, click apply and upload your CV and cover letter. jobTitle: Enquiries Administrator & Call Centre Relief (casual) Job in Tasman - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50693435.txt	§Enquiries Administrator & Call Centre Relief (casual)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Enquiries Administrator & Call Centre Relief (casual)§§Advertiser: §Nelson Marlborough Health§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Tasman§, §Nelson§§Work Type§§Casual/Vacation§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Receptionists§§§§§§§Do you have a passion for solving problems and helping people?§Do you have excellent communication and customer service skills?§Do you have the flexibility to work on a casual basis?§Varied, challenging and interesting work§Ngā mōhiohio e pā ana ki tēnei mahi (About this position)§We are looking for an experienced administrator with excellent customer service skills to provide casual relief for our busy Enquiries Desk and Call Centre at Nelson Hospital. Our Enquiries Desk is staffed between 8.00AM and 4.30PM, Monday to Friday. Our Call Centre is staffed 24/7 and shifts range from: 0700 to 1530, 1500 to 23:00 and 23:00 to 0700.§This §casual§ position, covering staff leave and sickness, has no fixed hours of employment. It will therefore be important that you have the flexibility to work across a range of shifts, sometimes at short notice.§This diverse role would suit someone who enjoys helping people and the challenge of working under pressure while maintaining a calm and welcoming presence.§Ko wai he kaitono tōtika? (Who is an appropriate applicant?)§You will be the type of person who is always willing to go the extra mile to deliver excellent customer service. You will a clear and confident communicator and will manage the demands of the role by being highly organised and efficient.§You will be confident in the use of Microsoft applications and will ideally have PC based switchboard experience. However, if you're a quick learner, and are up for the challenge, we are happy to provide call centre training.§It will be important that you have the flexibility to work across a range of shifts and sometimes at short notice.§Other key qualities for success in this role include:§A professional and positive can-do attitude§Well-presented, reliable and resilient§Attention to detail§Flexibility to provide relief cover, sometimes at short notice§Ā mātou rōpū (About our team)§Nelson Marlborough Health is the main health provider for the top of the south. Nearly 3,000 strong, we are Nelson and Marlborough's largest employer, which means the opportunities here are endless. Our main locations are Nelson and Wairau Hospitals but we are spread across the region and service all parts of the community. Our work can be challenging, but we are up for it. We have a great team and we work hard to make a difference. We value integrity, innovation, respect and teamwork.§Ētahi atu mōhiohio (More Information)§https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC34XErxkHJ5YAn59o6SrhnA§Me pēhea ahau e tono ai? (How do I apply?)§Keen to apply now, it's easy. Please fill in our online application form §https://nmdhb.careercentre.net.nz/Job§For general enquiries please contact our recruitment team on §vacancies@nmdhb.govt.nz§ or §03 546 1274§.§For role specific information please contact Laureen McLean, Team Leader - Call Centre, §Laureen.McLean@nmdhb.govt.nz§N20-415§Applications close on Thursday, 22 October 2020.§Nelson Marlborough Health strongly endorses Te Tiriti o Waitangi.§We believe that to achieve equity in health outcomes for Māori we need a workforce reflective of the population it serves. We strongly encourage applications from candidates who identify as Māori and we recruit for cultural competence.§He waka eke noa. We are all in this together.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50693501.txt	§Quality Coordinator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Quality Coordinator§§Advertiser: §Everest – all about people§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Hamilton§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Records Management & Document Control§§§§§§§§§  §    §      §Quality Coordinator §    §    §      §At Everest, we are all about people. We work with our clients and candidates to build great relationships so we can match the right person for the right role.  § §Here's our latest opportunity!§ §The Company§ Resultz Group believe everyone has the right to be safe from drug and alcohol harm at work, and to live in meth-free homes. Our client works with businesses across New Zealand to eliminate drug and alcohol harm in the workplace and help property owners identify and manage meth contamination. Their expert team provides mobile and on-site testing for alcohol and drugs, guidance on employment law and rehabilitation, and hands-on support to develop and roll out drug and alcohol policies.§  § §The Role§ As Quality Coordinator you will ensure the processes needed for the company’s quality management systems (ISO 17020 and ISO 15189) are expertly maintained and prepared for audit purposes.  You will be responsible for implementing and maintaining internal audits and regular checks, acting on compliance findings and managing non-conformances from external audit results as required.   You will also be responsible for customer service, management reporting, document control and being the main go-to person for IANZ accreditation.  Resultz Group is a small, nimble team so anyone taking on this role needs to be prepared to help out others when required. §  § §The Person§ Are you an easy going individual with a can-do attitude who can get stuff done? If so, this is the role for you! Resultz Group are on the path to becoming NZ’s number one drug testing agency and they need a super organised, efficient person to help them along. As the Quality Coordinator you will liaise with stakeholders and clients so your communication and customer service skills must be second to none. The successful candidate will have experience in the internal audit space and be confident to maintain documentation to ensure successful completion of audits.   §  § Sound like you? If so, this is the role for you! Resultz Group are on the path to becoming NZ’s number one drug testing agency and they need a super organised, efficient person to help them along. jobText: TXT/50693583.txt	§ICU Database Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§ICU Database Manager§§Advertiser: §Capital and Coast District Health Board§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Data Entry & Word Processing§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §ICU Database Manager §      §        §Nau mai, haere mai ki Ūpoko ki te uru hauora.§        §Location: Wellington Regional Hospital§        §Contract: Permanent -  Part Time 0.5 FTE (20 hours per week) §        §Salary:     $80,000 - $105,000 Pro Rata§        §About the role§        §We are looking for a part-time ICU Database Manager who will play a pivotal role in the CCDHB & HVDHB Department of Intensive Care's current and future service needs and intensive care clinical practice. The functions of the role are in accordance with the College of Intensive Care Medicine minimum standards for Tertiary level III Intensive Care Units operational requirements. §        §Duties§        §          §Taking responsibility and ownership of data collected for & submitted to both the Intensive Care Departments' clinical databases, specifically the Australia and New Zealand Intensive Care Society (ANZICS) Adult & Paediatric Patient Databases.§          §Taking responsibility and ownership of the Intensive Care Departments' Central Line Associated Bacteraemia (CLAB) Database and the Department Quality CLAB Programme and CCDHB Quality Safety Indicator for CLAB.§          §To extract information (approved by the Clinical Directors) useful for assisting with service requirements, investigation, analysis and documentation of data and the provision of information to ensure business/user requirements are delivered within the Department, CCDHB & HVDHB.§          §Accountability for these applications to ensure both service and security compliance.§          §Education and Training of Clinical & Research Staff on Intensive Care Department administration, data collection, documentation processes and data requirements.§          §Expert knowledge of the most recent ANZICS data dictionary for adult and paediatric databases.§        §        §Skills & Experience§        §          §A relevant tertiary qualification coupled with at least 5 years of experience in IT and/or Project/Quality Management§          §A technical knowledge of and experience with clinical database management§          §Experience in health and/or quality§          §Self management and organisation abilities §          §Ability to think and apply innovative responses to problems or challenges §          §Flexibility to cope with carrying out multiple tasks at the same time§          §Meeting tight deadlines and prioritising work levels§          §Ability to deal with sensitive situations, §          §Display discretion to maintain confidentiality at all times§          §Demonstrate competent, well-developed verbal and written communication skills. §        §        §About our organisation§        §Capital and Coast DHB (CCDHB) is located centrally in Wellington and has over 6,000 full-time equivalent staff, making us one of the major employers in the Wellington region. CCDHB operates two hospitals – Wellington Regional Hospital in Newtown and Kenepuru Hospital in Porirua – as well as the Kapiti Health Centre at Paraparaumu. §        §The Mental Health, Addiction and Intellectual Disability Service (MHAIDS) spans three DHBs - Wairarapa, Hutt Valley and Capital and Coast DHB’s and includes local, regional, and national services. The local MHAIDS services are provided from multiple sites within the 3DHB sub-region – greater Wellington, Hutt Valley and Wairarapa. §        §Here at CCDHB we embrace diversity and welcome applications from people of all gender identities, ages, ethnicities, sexual orientations, disability and religions. A workforce that is diverse and inclusive means that we are better positioned to understand and serve our community.§        §CCDHB is a pro-equity Health Organisation, with a particular focus on Māori and Pacific Peoples.§        §CCDHB provides a range of specialist services including neurosurgery, oncology, neonatal intensive care and community-based services including district nursing, rehabilitation services, social work, alcohol and drug services, and home support services to a population of around 900,000 people.§        §How to apply§        §Applications close Sunday 25th October 2020 and can only be accepted when submitted through our CCDHB Careers Website. For further information on this role, email §recruitment@ccdhb.org.nz§ and indicate the job title and vacancy number vacancy number in the subject line.§        §Ma tini, ma mano, ka rapa te whai§        §By joining together we will succeed§      §      §      §    §    §capitalhealth.careercentre.net.nz§  §§§Nau mai, haere mai ki Ūpoko ki te uru hauora.§ §Location: Wellington Regional Hospital§ §Contract: Permanent -  Part Time 0.5 FTE (20 hours per week) § §Salary:     $80,000 - $105,000 Pro Rata§ §About the role§ §We are looking for a part-time ICU Database Manager who will play a pivotal role in the CCDHB & HVDHB Department of Intensive Care's current and future service needs and intensive care clinical practice. The functions of the role are in accordance with the College of Intensive Care Medicine minimum standards for Tertiary level III Intensive Care Units operational requirements. § §Duties§ § §Taking responsibility and ownership of data collected for & submitted to both the Intensive Care Departments' clinical databases, specifically the Australia and New Zealand Intensive Care Society (ANZICS) Adult & Paediatric Patient Databases.§ §Taking responsibility and ownership of the Intensive Care Departments' Central Line Associated Bacteraemia (CLAB) Database and the Department Quality CLAB Programme and CCDHB Quality Safety Indicator for CLAB.§ §To extract information (approved by the Clinical Directors) useful for assisting with service requirements, investigation, analysis and documentation of data and the provision of information to ensure business/user requirements are delivered within the Department, CCDHB & HVDHB.§ §Accountability for these applications to ensure both service and security compliance.§ §Education and Training of Clinical & Research Staff on Intensive Care Department administration, data collection, documentation processes and data requirements.§ §Expert knowledge of the most recent ANZICS data dictionary for adult and paediatric databases.§ §Skills & Experience§ § §A relevant tertiary qualification coupled with at least 5 years of experience in IT and/or Project/Quality Management§ §A technical knowledge of and experience with clinical database management§ §Experience in health and/or quality§ §Self management and organisation abilities § §Ability to think and apply innovative responses to problems or challenges § §Flexibility to cope with carrying out multiple tasks at the same time§ §Meeting tight deadlines and prioritising work levels§ §Ability to deal with sensitive situations, § §Display discretion to maintain confidentiality at all times§ §Demonstrate competent, well-developed verbal and written communication skills. § §About our organisation§ §Capital and Coast DHB (CCDHB) is located centrally in Wellington and has over 6,000 full-time equivalent staff, making us one of the major employers in the Wellington region. CCDHB operates two hospitals – Wellington Regional Hospital in Newtown and Kenepuru Hospital in Porirua – as well as the Kapiti Health Centre at Paraparaumu. § §The Mental Health, Addiction and Intellectual Disability Service (MHAIDS) spans three DHBs - Wairarapa, Hutt Valley and Capital and Coast DHB’s and includes local, regional, and national services. The local MHAIDS services are provided from multiple sites within the 3DHB sub-region – greater Wellington, Hutt Valley and Wairarapa. § §Here at CCDHB we embrace diversity and welcome applications from people of all gender identities, ages, ethnicities, sexual orientations, disability and religions. A workforce that is diverse and inclusive means that we are better positioned to understand and serve our community.§ §CCDHB is a pro-equity Health Organisation, with a particular focus on Māori and Pacific Peoples.§ §CCDHB provides a range of specialist services including neurosurgery, oncology, neonatal intensive care and community-based services including district nursing, rehabilitation services, social work, alcohol and drug services, and home support services to a population of around 900,000 people.§ §How to apply§ §Applications close Sunday 25th October 2020 and can only be accepted when submitted through our CCDHB Careers Website. For further information on this role, email §recruitment@ccdhb.org.nz§ and indicate the job title and vacancy number vacancy number in the subject line.§ §Ma tini, ma mano, ka rapa te whai§ §By joining together we will succeed§§§§

jobText: TXT/50693640.txt	§Administration Coordinator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Administration Coordinator§§Advertiser: §New Zealand Riding for the Disabled§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Porirua & Kapiti Coast§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Administrative Assistants§§§§§§New Zealand Riding for the Disabled (NZRDA) is a registered charity operating through more than 50 RDA Groups in local communities throughout New Zealand, predominantly supported by volunteers.  Each year more than 3,000 people participate in goal-based horse riding and therapeutic horse-related activities.  They face physical, intellectual, emotional and social challenges and their participation is life changing.§Our Vision is to Reach More Riders, Change More Lives.§To support our groups to do this we are looking for an Administrator  to join our small team. Working closely with Business Services Team you will be responsible for:§Ensuring the day to day needs of the office are met - that phones are answered, emails sorted, meeting rooms are booked, catering is arranged, travel is planned etc.  §Supporting our marketing campaigns and maintaining records of donations as well as helping maintain our social media presence.§To be successful in this role you must be flexible, and be able to demonstrate your experience and ability to:§Supporting the day-to-day running of the office§Provide reception duties including opening and closing of the office§Coordinate all aspects of the day-to-day running of the office such as cleaners, IT support and security§Ensure the health and safety requirements of the office are met and any issues are raised to management§Book travel and accommodation for the team§Be the first point of contact on all queries regarding the office§Coordinate and organise events§Work with the Business Services Team to provide IT administration for all office systems Office 365, Zoom, Salesforce§Prepare reports and dashboards on statistics and service performance§Ensure policies, procedures and guidelines and employment obligations are followed§Assist in the preparation of publications§Fundraising & Marketing§Assist in coordinating fundraising projects – including the development and distribution of materials, sponsorship and public relations§Maintain donor records on the database, and assist in coordinating direct marketing to donors§Production of receipts and thank you letters§Assist in coordinating and developing the Regular Giving Programme and Bequests to increase income§Personal Skills & Attributes§Competent in use of Microsoft Office and understanding of the Salesforce platform and/or other CRM§Exposure to MYOB§Ability to prioritise and manage several tasks at once, with excellent time management skills§Ability to work collaboratively with both internal and external customers, colleagues and stakeholders§Professional, ethical, responsible, and reliable§Excellent written and verbal communication skills§Excellent relationship management skills§Patient, with the ability to remain calm in stressful circumstances§Ability to relate well to a wide range of people§If you like variety, want to be part of a very cool team and have previous experience in administration then this is an excellent opportunity. The role is based at our new National Office in Porirua.§If you are interested in this role please send your CV and a covering application letter to §jill.laplanche@rda.org.nz§ no later than 5pm, Friday 16 October 2020.§All applications will be treated confidentiality.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as an administration officer?§Do you have customer service experience?§§§

jobText: TXT/50693939.txt	§Department Coordinator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Department Coordinator§§Advertiser: §Reserve Bank of New Zealand§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Administrative Assistants§§§§§§Te tūranga – The role§As a Department Co-ordinator supporting our Finance and Human Resources teams you will be responsible for providing administrative support and services to the Managers and teams. This includes diary and email management, meeting and event management, budget support, travel and office management activities. §Supporting the Group EA and the wider Executive Support team, you will work collaboratively across the Bank to ensure consistent delivery of support services, policies and practices, along with developing, implementing and refining office management systems and processes.§This role is 30 hours a week over 5 days however, we are flexible on the hours worked per day. §Ō pūkenga – About you§To be successful in this role you will bring:§A team-oriented approach to work with a strong commitment to excellence and continuous improvement§Experience with diary management, invoice coding and event coordination§Strong planning and organisational skills §Discretion in dealing with confidential and sensitive information§A positive “can do” attitude and willingness to learn§§Ngā painga – What we offer§We offer an inclusive and flexible working environment to enable our people to bring their whole selves to work and embrace each other’s uniqueness. Our benefits include flexi-leave, a wellness package, a working from home subsidy, generous parental leave provisions, a range of learning and development opportunities, and access to numerous social, networking and sporting activities.§Ko wai matou - Who we are§All New Zealanders have dreams, hopes, plans and goals. To achieve them we need a stable economy and safe banking system built on integrity, innovation and inclusion. And that's exactly what we at the Reserve Bank of New Zealand - Te Pūtea Matua enable. A trusted system that gives Kiwis the confidence to make the spending and savings decisions that matter most to them.§We have a clear goal: to improve the economic wellbeing and living standards of all New Zealanders so that we, and the generations to come, continue to enjoy this great country.§We are hugely passionate about what we do and the impact it has on Kiwi businesses, communities and whānau. Enabling New Zealand’s financial system takes expertise, determination and a strong commitment to working collaboratively with our partners. We carry this responsibility with great pride and encourage you to apply if this resonates with you.§To find out more please review the position description on our website and for specific queries contact Claire Neville on §04 471 3938§. §Please submit your application online by Friday the 16th of October 2020.  §Please note - With the New Zealand border being closed and new visa applications not being considered until after November 2020 we are only able to consider candidates who are currently residing in NZ or who already have NZ Citizen / Perm Residency status.§ §§§§

We utilize trucks and trailers which are appropriate for various lines of work for contractors, builders, landscapers and the general public.§ § § § § §About the role§ § § §We are looking for an experienced office administrator to manage the Landscape Supplies division at our head office in Warkworth.§ §Working directly with management, customers and suppliers§You will be responsible for debtor/creditor management§Accounts payable§Accounts management§Email inquiries§Social media and marketing§Balance sheet management§General team support§General Office duties§ § § §Benefits and perks§ § § §You can be part of a fast paced industry with steady growth.§Work/Life balance with flexible hours§Opportunity to grow and develop into other roles§Great area to live§ § § §Skills and experience§ § § §To be successful in this role, you will need to have:§ §User experience of Microsoft Office packages §A good understanding of running social media sites such as Facebook§A good understanding of accounting fundamentals including MYOB and POS systems§Attention to detail with good problem solving skills §Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, trained in customer service and must be discrete§ A high degree of energy, be self-motivated with a flexible approach to your work and the tasks you perform.  Takes initiative with a willingness to take on extra work and responsibility if required.§A full drivers licence and own car§ § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§How many years' experience do you have as an office administrator?§Which of the following accounting packages are you experienced with?§Do you have customer service experience?§Do you have experience using MYOB?§§§

As a Global company and a strong leadership culture, we provide interesting and challenging career opportunities that span a variety of disciplines and geographic locations. We are always looking for dedicated people who can join us on our mission to improve lives around the world.§ §Find out more about our teams and discover where you might fit in the Arjo family!§ §What is the Opportunity? § §A fantastic opportunity now exists for an enthusiastic and experienced §Customer Service Administrator §to join our passionate, highly driven and successful business based at our Auckland site.§ §Your role will involve:§ §Reporting to the National Operations Manager you will have proven track record of providing customer service and administrative support to internal and external customers.§ §Key Responsibilities:§ § §Answer incoming calls in a prompt and efficient manner. Respond or escalate requests in a knowledgeable and helpful approach;§ §Take Inbound Rental Calls and provide rental administration assistance;§ §Process Rental transactions received by phone or email into the rental management system;§ §Be first point of contact for all Private customer enquiries and provide assistance where required;§ §Liaise with Sales, Aftermarket, Operations department representatives and customers to identify and respond to customer expectations;§ §Assist with input and checking of customer orders;§ §Assist the Customer Care Team with distributor requests, customer queries and general customer support;§ §Develop and establish a thorough understanding of Arjo products, features and brand;§ §Enter Sales orders into the system in an accurate, efficient and effective method;§ §Assist the NZ sales teams with CRM and quoting tasks upon request;§ §Follow up on customer satisfaction, ensure performance of goods purchased, and modify and improve services provided.§ §To be successful in this position, you will possess:§ § §Minimum 2 years’ experience in a customer service role, ideally in a medical or healthcare related industry;§ §Minimum 2 years’ customer service experience working with ERP systems;§ §Exceptional customer service focus, with advanced communication and interpersonal skills and excellent written and spoken English;§ §Advanced working knowledge of MS Office;§ §Proven record of efficient data entry and compliant handling;§ §Advanced organisational, time management skills;§ §Be a role model for company culture, present with a professional and helpful corporate image. § §Our purpose§ §Everything we do, we do with people in mind. Our customers’ needs and challenges are what drive us and our employees are our beating heart. Dedicated to creating the best possible outcomes for our customers, they are the ones who fulfil our promise every day.§ §To us it matters not only what we do, but also how we do it. There are four components of our culture that guide our approach:§ §Diversity & Inclusion - §we view diversity as a driver of innovation & a catalyst for our global growth§ §Winning as a team - §where members of our team are empowered to make decisions at the right level§ §Leadership style - §being visible, connecting with others and leading by example§ §Guiding Principles - §Our Guiding Principles are vital in building our culture, our attitudes and behaviours, within Arjo. These principles are embedded in Arjo and contribute to building a sustainable and winning culture;§ § §Move from PowerPoint to Action§ §Take Ownership§ §Create Value and Efficiency§ §Empower and work as One Team§ §Encourage Growth and Leadership§ §Equal Employment Opportunity:§ §Arjo is an equal opportunity employer committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values diversity and inclusion, to all qualified persons without regard to race, gender, colour, disability, national origin, age, religion, union affiliation, sexual orientation, veteran status, citizenship, gender identity and/or expression, or other status protected by law.§ §Successful applicants will be required to undergo relevant §referee§ §checks §prior to appointment.§ §For those with a passion to improve outcomes for others, a rewarding career at Arjo awaits. We look forward to receiving your application!§ §Click the APPLY button and include your resume and cover letter.§§§§

jobTitle: Receptionist / Admin Support Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50695578.txt	§Receptionist / Admin Support§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Receptionist / Admin Support§§Advertiser: §Dimension Data New Zealand§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Receptionists§§§§§§Your career here is about believing in yourself, and taking on great opportunities and new challenges.§  §It’s about growing your skills and expertise in your current role and preparing yourself for the future.  That’s why we encourage you to take every opportunity to grow your career within our great global team.§  §Are you ready to take the next step in your career?§  §The primary goal of the Receptionist is to deliver a friendly, efficient customer service and to create a warm and welcoming atmosphere for NTT guests, with the key aim of retaining and attracting new clients.§  § §  §What you'll be doing§  §1. Deliver a friendly, efficient customer service and to create a warm and welcoming atmosphere for NTT guests.§  §2. Provide a complete reception support service with limited or no guidance.§  §3. Take responsibility for the reception area, maintaining a professional and pleasant interface with visitors and/or guests, clients and employees.§  §4. Route emergency calls, forwarding them to the appropriate internal stakeholders, ensuring that the call reaches the appropriate person.§  §5. Perform administrative duties such as typing, capturing and updating information on the relevant systems and sorting of mail when required.§  §6. Supply routine, non-interpretative and simple information on request to clients and keeps updated on daily business activities to respond to and provide clients with current information.§  §Additional Responsibilities:§ § §PA duties for 4 members of the Senior Leadership Team, including diary and travel management, and expense claiming§ §Office event coordination§ §Office Inductions§ §Ad-hoc admin support for the Dunedin office§ § §  §What would make you a good fit for this role?§  §Standard career level descriptor for job level:§• Uses skills and policies to complete work§• Work is semi-routine§• Occasionally deviates from routine§• Can complete own routine work§• Gets instructions on new work only§• Typically requires moderate level of related experience§  § §  §If you believe that you can do anything, we're here to help you do it.§  § §  §Equal opportunity employer§  §NTT is proud to be an equal opportunity employer with a global culture that embraces diversity. We are committed to providing an environment free of unfair discrimination and harassment. We do not discriminate based on age, race, color, sex, religion, national origin, disability, pregnancy, marital status, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, veteran status, or other protected category.§  § §  §Please note, you must be already be located in New Zealand with NZ citizenship/residency to be considered for this role.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50695664.txt	§Assistant Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Assistant Manager§§Advertiser: §Pure Pac Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Otago§, §Rest of Otago§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Office Management§§§§§§Pure Pac Ltd is an integrated packhouse and marketing cooperative based in Cromwell, Otago. We are committed to delivering the highest quality cherries to our export and domestic customers around the world. Managing the packing and marketing for 75ha of orchards in the Cromwell Basin we are one of the largest cherry packing and marketers in New Zealand operating a state of the art packhouse.§  § §  §We are on the lookout for an Assistant Manager to join our team.  As our company continues to expand, we are looking to fulfill this important, full time role.  To make this role your own you will be required to show abilities in Accounting, Customer Relations, Compliance Management, Human Resources and be interested in assisting the Sales Manager when required.§  § §  §This is a broad, diverse role that requires someone with a hands-on approach to all tasks.  You will be tech savvy with a good understanding of excel and the ability to learn our internal systems.  You will be required to assist the Corporate Services Manager with operational management over harvest and day to day administrative tasks outside of harvest.  An interest in marketing or online sales channels would also be an advantage.§  § §  §As our cherry season is so condensed you must be available 7 days a week over the harvest period which runs from Mid-December - start of February, be prepared to work long days and not afraid of hard work.  Outside of harvest however, you can enjoy a much more relaxed environment that allows for more of a work-life balance all while enjoying the many benefits of living in beautiful Central Otago.§  § §  §You will be a team player that enjoys working with others, as well as autonomously when required.  You will have a can-do attitude and be someone who inspires others with your drive, passion and energy.  You will be someone who strives to meets KPIs and has a desire for success.§  § §  §Duties include:§ § §Assist with office accounting including accounts payable and accounts receivable, bank reconciliation, GST/PAYE knowledge§ §Overseeing timesheeting and payroll§ §Assist with development and adherence to budgets§ §Liaise with our logistics partners to arrange transport of our product both domestically and internationally§ §Work with the Corporate Services Manager to ensure all compliance requirements are met for the different industry bodies, including H&S§ §Manage our systems and work on continual developments with our software partners§ §Assist with managing our HR policies and procedures§ §Liaising with company clients developing long term relationships when required§ §Assist with expansion of online sales strategy and channels§ §Able to lead the team during the busy harvest period§ § §  §Applicants for this position MUST have the legal right to work in NZ.§  § §  §To apply or for further information please email hr@purepac.nz or upload your CV to seek.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following Microsoft Office products are you experienced with?§Do you have experience using Xero?§§§

Microsoft Office suite§          §Experience in continuous improvement§          §Ability to multi task, prioritise and work under pressure§        §        § Applications close | §Rā Katinga :  Wednesday, 14 Oct 2020§        § §        §For a copy of the position description: §www.nzta.govt.nz/careers§        §For further information, email: §careers@nzta.govt.nz§        §To be considered for this position you must have a legal right to live and work in New Zealand.§        §NZ Transport Agency is an equal opportunity employer (EOE). At the Agency we recognise the importance of diversity and inclusion and are committed to providing a working environment that embraces these values. Please do let us know if you need any support or have any access requirements that will help you through the recruitment process.§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§An opportunity to showcase your strong administrative and time management skills§Support and contribute to the daily operation of the Customer Service Support team and Contact Centre§Part time position : 20 hours per week§§ About us | Ko wai mātou§ § §At Waka Kotahi NZ Transport Agency, it all starts with our people. Safety is a top priority for Waka Kotahi and we, as the Regulatory Services group, aim to improve safety and reduce the risk of harm by being a firm and fair regulator ensuring compliance - it is the essence of why we do what we do.  For more information, please visit §www.nzta.govt.nz/regulatory/§§ §§The opportunity | Te Whiwhinga mahi§As a Customer Service Administrator, you will undertake administrative tasks that help support the functions within the Customer Service Support team and Contact Centre.§Your strong attention to detail skills will be showcased here and your ability to plan and manage your daily workload is important to ensure tasks are completed in a timely manner in line with the Waka Kotahi's policies, procedures and legislative requirements.§ §About you | Ko koe tēnei§To be successful in this role, you will bring:§§A minimum of two years' experience in an administration role§Strong customer focus§Collaborative working style and can work well as part of a team§A desire and ability to build strong relationships throughout the Agency§High level of agility along with ability to work under pressure and meet tight time frames§Ability to plan and manage workload§Well-developed written and verbal communication skills§Take accountability for the responsibilities of the position and own actionsHigh standards of accuracy and attention to detail§Demonstrated expertise in the use of the Microsoft Office suite§Experience in continuous improvement§Ability to multi task, prioritise and work under pressure§§ Applications close | §Rā Katinga :  Wednesday, 14 Oct 2020§ §For a copy of the position description: §www.nzta.govt.nz/careers§For further information, email: §careers@nzta.govt.nz§§To be considered for this position you must have a legal right to live and work in New Zealand.§NZ Transport Agency is an equal opportunity employer (EOE). You will be responsible for coordination of all administrative activities, including office admin, reception and internal events. you will have the opportunity to grow your career within the admin function. In everything we do, the wellbeing and best interest of children are paramount.§Oranga Tamariki - Ministry for Children currently is seeking for an experience Workplace Administrator to join our Papanui Site - where you will be part of a multidisciplinary team who works closely and is passionate in supporting Oranga Tamariki in delivering positive outcomes for tamariki and rangatahi.§In this role, customer service is essential. You will be assisting the Deputy Secretary in a range of tasks and helping other Managers in the Division.§You will need to be confident engaging with senior stakeholders, anticipate what's needed and be happy to use your excellent organisation skills to help the wider team.§What we're looking for is:§a proven track record as a Personal Assistant or Executive Assistant working to a senior manager§ability to work to tight deadlines§an experienced user of MS Office applications§discretion and experience in working with sensitive information§excellent relationship management skills§good writing and editing skills.§If you fit most of these criteria and have a flexible approach and can-do attitude, we are keen to hear from you.§The Ministry offers:§22 days annual leave and 3 Ministry leave days§'Flexible by default' working arrangements§3% KiwiSaver employer contribution on top of your gross salary§We are the Government's lead civilian advisor on defence. Nā mātou hoki, ngā taputapu nunui i hoko, hei āheitanga i roto i ngā ringa o ngā tāne me ngā wahine o Te Ope Kātua o Aotearoa.§Please note§: Successful candidates will be required to obtain and maintain a high level security clearance. jobTitle: Administration and Student Service Coordinator Job in Otago - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50696796.txt	§Administration and Student Service Coordinator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Administration and Student Service Coordinator§§Advertiser: §Talent International Institute§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Otago§, §Dunedin§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Administrative Assistants§§§§§§Administration and Student service coordinator is an experienced, efficient, and an organized person from the tertiary education sector who is able to integrate, coordinate, and collaborate between various TII functions. The purpose of this role is to ensure that TII campus is meeting its obligations with regards to providing students with academic and non-academic services in order to meet their needs; providing pastoral care under NZQA Code of Practice (Code); managing office operations; and dealing with various stakeholders.§  §The candidate is required to be fluent in Chinese (Mandarin) and English.§  §Tasks’ Description§  §Planning & Leadership§ § §Show initiative and considerate of people’s personal, cultural, religious, and other needs at work§ §Plan, organize, and lead various staff and student activities§ §Student Services§  §Academic§ § §Receive applications of admission from students/agents§ §Process the admission applications and issue offers of admission§ §Issue fee receipts§ §Complete enrolments§ §Plan and schedule, and conduct/coordinate student orientations§ §Complete and maintain student files according to TII policies and procedures in-line with the statutory requirements§ §Ensure that students comply at all times with valid visas, insurance, public trust, English proficiency, and other study requirements§ §Ensure that students are provided with up-to-date policies and they understand and sign all documents as required§ §Non-Academic§ § §Student handbooks are kept up-to-date and provided to students during their orientation and enrolment time§ §Provide students with information and advice and/or refer them to the appropriate source for guidance and further information§ §Ensure that complete administration for U-18 students including paperwork, communication with parents/guardians/caregivers/agents; homestay visits; and police vetting is done timely§ §Take or recommend corrective/disciplinary actions including issuing warning letters to the students when required§ §Manage students’ risk register and coordinate with other departments to ensure that student at risk are managed efficiently§ §Issue students with information and official letters as attendance letter, academic transcripts/certificates, academic results§ §Compliance§ § §Comply with NZQA Code requirements with regards to students’ admissions, enrolments, records keeping, U-18 students’ management, and pastoral care§ §Ensure that various functions are performed with the context of applicable EER KEQs and associated tertiary indicators§ §Comply with TII applicable policies and procedures§ §Ensure that all TII students’ academic and non-academic records are maintained in-line with NZQA requirements§ §Meeting and providing required assistance to the visitors form compliance agencies as NZQA, INZ, Police, and other government bodies§ §Manage Public Trust functions and meet statutory requirements of student fee protection§ §Participate, conduct and analyze self-review activities such as student evaluations, course evaluations, staff evaluations, and satisfaction surveys; and produce summary reports for various functions§ §Communications§ § §Effectively and professionally communicate with TII stakeholders including students, agents, parents, NZQA, INZ, ENZ, MoE, TEC, and other stakeholders§ §Takes and makes telephone calls in a professional and courteous manner with an aim of providing required information to the TII stakeholders and meeting their needs over the phone.§ §To meet with students, caregivers, parents, guardians, and/or homestay parents.§ §To proactively identify issues and problems affecting TII students in their academic programs and in other aspects of their student life, providing advice and support to students with a primary objective of helping them resolve issues and attain the graduate profile characteristics.§ §To provide immediate feedback to the Principal and/or other relevant Managers on student issues and information on risks that may be identified through student meetings or by referral from staff.§ §Office Maintenance§ § §Maintains work area materials (e.g. student applications, newsletters, event calendars, etc.) for the purpose of providing resource information to visitors, students, staff.§ §Distributes items within the site (e.g. special delivery and overnight mail/packages, messages, application packets, Home School applications, etc.) for the purpose of ensuring receipt to addressee and/or providing material/s.§ §Maintain the office ambiance to ensure a professional and tidy look of TII§ §Liaise with cleaners and manage their performance to ensure that premises including toilets and kitchen are always kept tidy and clean§ §Ensure that TII health and safety policies and procedures are followed at all times for students, staff, and visitors; required information of persons on site are collected and maintained for health and safety reasons§ §Technology§ § §Proficient in using or willing to learn and be proficient in the student's management system (EnrolPro)§ §Well conversant with MS Office applications, particularly with Word, Outlook, Excel, and PowerPoint§ §Able to efficiently use calendrers and organizers electronically§ §Maintain TII social media, such as Facebook page, linked in§ §Develop Professionally§ § §Take responsibility for self and staff professional development§ §Develop professional development plans of staff and conduct performance reviews periodically§ §Participate in professional development sessions as required from time to time§ §Display Professionalism§ § §Always maintain highest appearance standards§ §Absenteeism is minimal and for genuine reasons§ §Consistent adherence to policies regarding late arrivals, phone usage, and usage of the office§ §All students and staff are treated with respect§ §Cooperation with other staff is demonstrated§ §Quality management system policies and procedures are complied with§ §Staff, advisory group or other meetings are attended as required§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as a service coordinator?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§What's your preferred work type?§§§

jobTitle: Office Administrator Job in Northland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50696846.txt	§Office Administrator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Office Administrator§§Advertiser: §OneSchool Global NZ§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Northland§, §Rest of Northland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Administrative Assistants§§§§§§With 17 campuses across New Zealand, OneSchool provides an innovative learning and teaching programme to over 1,500 students in partnership with more than 150 staff. Our focus on high standards and student-driven learning has resulted in achievement levels for our students that are well above the national average.§ §Our modern Maungaturoto Campus is seeking an experienced, technology savvy Office Administrator with strong organisational and relationship skills on a full -time basis (40 hours per week) to provide administrative support to their teaching and non-teaching staff.§ §Key responsibilities include:§ § §Managing the school office in an efficient and organised manner;§ §Providing administration support to management, teaching and non-teaching staff, and students;§ §Assisting with IT issues to ensure the smooth running of the site;§ §Invoicing and preparation of monthly accounts for payment.§ §We welcome applications from candidates who meet the following criteria:§ § §A high level of computer literacy;§ §Experience as an administrator in a busy working environment;§ §A personable, patient and caring individual with a positive attitude towards children;§ §A professional manner and excellent organisational skills.§ §The successful candidate will have at least three years’ administrative experience, preferably in an education setting, a positive, can do attitude, be highly organised and methodical, and possess excellent verbal and written communication skills.§ §Applicants will need to have the right to work in New Zealand. Unfortunately, applications from abroad will not be considered.§ §For further information, please contact Iain Longden on §recruitment@nz.oneschoolglobal.com§ or to apply, please visit the §vacancy listing§ on our website.§ §Closing: §Friday, 23 October 2020 (unless an appointment is made sooner)§§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as an office administrator?§Do you have experience in an administration role?§§§

jobText: TXT/50696879.txt	§Office Administrator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Office Administrator§§Advertiser: §Rotorua Pacific Islands Development Charitable Trust§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Bay of Plenty§, §Rotorua§§Salary§§$0 - $29,999§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Administrative Assistants§§§§§§Rotorua Pacific Islands Development Charitable Trust work closely with the Rotorua Pacific Island families, their children and the wider Pacific community.  Our Vision is Pacific Peoples moving forward and Mission is for our Pacific peoples and children achieve and succeed in all areas of life. § §We are seeking a person with general administration skills and administration software. Accuracy with numbers is key, attention to detail a must and data entry skills important. § §You will be working with the Trust team, based at our central Rotorua office, you will be the face of our organisation, welcoming clients and assisting visitors with trust enquiries and completing general office administration duties.§ §Office Administrator duties and responsibilities:§ § §Responding to phone calls and emails in order to keep the business’ operations running smoothly.  Manage emails, letters, packages, phone calls and other forms of correspondence§ §Support bookkeeping and budgeting procedures for the company Support § §Support Whanau Ora navigator as needed§ §Create and update clients databases and records, personnel and other data§ §Track and replace office supplies as necessary to avoid interruptions in standard front office procedures§ §Submit reports and prepare proposals and presentations as needed§ §Assist colleagues whenever there is an opportunity to do so§ §Work closely with Trust Manager as needed§ §Support programs and other events provided as other staff do so§ §The role will be 25 hours per week Mon-Friday including school holidays. Hours may vary and are between 10am to 4pm§ §You will be supported by the Rotorua Pacific Islands Development Charitable Trust Board, Trust Manager, Office Personnel. §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have experience in an administration role?§Which of the following Microsoft Office products are you experienced with?§Do you have experience in a data entry role?§How many years' experience do you have as an administration officer?§§§

jobText: TXT/50696994.txt	§Client Relations - Full-time - Palmerston North§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Client Relations - Full-time - Palmerston North§§Advertiser: §National Veterinary Care§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Manawatu§, §Palmerston North§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Client & Sales Administration§§§§§§§§§  §    §      §      §        §Client Relations - Full-time - Palmerston North §        §Pet Doctors Palmerston North is located in Palmerston North, New Zealand. Home to Massey University, it is a vibrant, youthful city set at the foot of the Tararua Mountain Range, with forested hills and native bushland. Our location surrounds offer majestic gorges, rugged beaches, sweeping mountain ranges and glow worm caves, all accessible within one day. And then there’s the coffee, golf by cable car, boutique shopping, and street art!§   § At Pet Doctors Palmerston North, we have a team of five Vets, ten Nurses, one support staff member and two cattery attendants.  We pride ourselves on delivering high standards of care and exceptional customer service. Our clinic cat, Blackie, keeps the dogs in line and is very good at fooling team members into believing she hasn’t been fed. There’s always something happening at Pet Doctors Palmerston North. Forty-four veterinary and veterinary nursing students spent a week or two at the clinic in 2018, it’s a very busy place!§   § We are currently seeking a §Full-time Client Relations Officer§ who has experience in customer service and can show a strong understanding of patient management systems and a general understanding of veterinary products.§   § §What does the position entail?§ § § §          §            §Dealing with accounts payable and debtor management§            §Managing and using Veterinary Practice Management software (EzyVet)§            §Processing client transactions§            §Managing stock§            §Understanding promotions and effectively communicating these to our clients.§            §Processing client reminders§            §Being a confident and engaging first point of contact for our valuable clients!§          §   § §What we are looking for?§ § § §          §            §Exceptional customer service and client relationship building skills§            §An ability to work efficiently, both independently and as part of the team§            §Excellent written and verbal communication skills§            §Hard-working and a hands-on approach to your work§            §A willingness to roll up your sleeves and get involved at all levels, with energy and drive§            §Effective time management and organisation skills.§          §   § §What can we offer you?§ § § §          §            §A great team environment and work culture§            §An interesting and diverse job§            §Remuneration commensurate with experience§            §Access to our Employee Assistance Program§          §   § §Apply Now!§   § Please apply online with your CV & Cover Letter.§        §        §        §      §    §  §§§Pet Doctors Palmerston North is located in Palmerston North, New Zealand. Home to Massey University, it is a vibrant, youthful city set at the foot of the Tararua Mountain Range, with forested hills and native bushland. Our location surrounds offer majestic gorges, rugged beaches, sweeping mountain ranges and glow worm caves, all accessible within one day. And then there’s the coffee, golf by cable car, boutique shopping, and street art!§   § At Pet Doctors Palmerston North, we have a team of five Vets, ten Nurses, one support staff member and two cattery attendants.  We pride ourselves on delivering high standards of care and exceptional customer service. Our clinic cat, Blackie, keeps the dogs in line and is very good at fooling team members into believing she hasn’t been fed. There’s always something happening at Pet Doctors Palmerston North. Forty-four veterinary and veterinary nursing students spent a week or two at the clinic in 2018, it’s a very busy place!§   § We are currently seeking a §Full-time Client Relations Officer§ who has experience in customer service and can show a strong understanding of patient management systems and a general understanding of veterinary products.§   § §What does the position entail?§ § § § § §Dealing with accounts payable and debtor management§ §Managing and using Veterinary Practice Management software (EzyVet)§ §Processing client transactions§ §Managing stock§ §Understanding promotions and effectively communicating these to our clients.§ §Processing client reminders§ §Being a confident and engaging first point of contact for our valuable clients!§ §   § §What we are looking for?§ § § § § §Exceptional customer service and client relationship building skills§ §An ability to work efficiently, both independently and as part of the team§ §Excellent written and verbal communication skills§ §Hard-working and a hands-on approach to your work§ §A willingness to roll up your sleeves and get involved at all levels, with energy and drive§ §Effective time management and organisation skills.§ §   § §What can we offer you?§ § § § § §A great team environment and work culture§ §An interesting and diverse job§ §Remuneration commensurate with experience§ §Access to our Employee Assistance Program§ §   § §Apply Now!§   § Please apply online with your CV & Cover Letter.§§§§

jobTitle: Office Manager Job in Bay of Plenty - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50697682.txt	§Office Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Office Manager§§Advertiser: §Goal Digger Career Solutions§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Bay of Plenty§, §Tauranga§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Office Management§§§§§§​§Do you have an eye for detail?§Seeking an organisational superstar§Accounts, admin and people person§Our client, Rowe Motors Limited are a close-knit, family owned business under new ownership with a great team and culture.  Providing towing solutions throughout the greater North Island for 74 years, they are looking for their next organisational superstar to join their busy team in Tauranga.  §The Office Manager is a key member of the team, ensuring the overall smooth running of the office.  Therefore, we are looking for a person who has experience in accounts, payroll, office management and a basic understanding of HR practices.§Some of the key skills and experience that the successful candidate will have are:§Extensive background in accounts administration, including invoicing and chasing up any overdue accounts§Payroll administration, (IMS) including filing of reports§Preparation of monthly management reports and ledger reconciliations§Experience completing GST and FBT returns §An understanding of HR processes and practices§Day-to day office management§Excellent computer literacy, including Xero, Word and Excel§This is a comprehensive full-time role, requiring a person who is analytical, trustworthy, reliable, level-headed and organised.  Attention to detail, planning, drive and team commitment, as well as being personable and an excellent communicator are stand out qualities of a leading performer in this role.§An understanding of the towing industry would be advantageous but is not essential, it is important you have an interest and can pick up on technical language and practices quickly.  It is also important you can handle all walks of life and people in stressful situations.§If you are a well-rounded, experienced office and accounts manager and believe you possess the skills and experience required, don’t hesitate to apply today. §You must have a full class 1 New Zealand Licence, have a legal right to work in New Zealand and have excellent spoken and written English.  §APPLICATION INFORMATION§A credit history check will form part of the application process.  Please do not contact our client directly, all applications will be received through our online portal.§For additional information or a copy of the job description, phone Cathe or Tammy-Lee on §07 393 2424§ or email §recruit@goaldigger.co.nz§Applications for this role will be screened as they are received.  Applications close 23 October 2020.  §§§§

jobTitle: Office Administrator Job in Tasman - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50698075.txt	§Office Administrator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Office Administrator§§Advertiser: §Rezource Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Tasman§, §Nelson§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Administrative Assistants§§§§§§From the Trust offices in Whakatū (Nelson) the Ngāti Koata team are dedicated to delivering initiatives that support the strategic goals and aspirations of the Iwi.  Including initiatives to reconnect members with their sense of identity and whakapapa, a strong foundation with kaumatua, and a variety of projects supporting the cultural, social, spiritual, political and economic wellbeing of their people and places.§Reporting to the Operations Manager, Ngāti Koata Trust are seeking an Office Administrator.  This position is crucial as the face of the Trust, you will be the first person our manuhiri speak and see.  You will meet and greet and show manaaki to manuhiri and kaumatua.  Provide effective and efficient administration, Executive Assistance and give support to our office team.§A key part to this role’s performance will be to apply your experience and knowledge of administration, effective communication / organisational skills and proficient computer skills.  Having some knowledge of te reo Māori, with an understanding of tikanga and mātauranga Ngāti Koata and/or Māori, is desired.§To be successful in this position you will be:§Able to improve productivity and deliver excellent service.§Committed to excellence.§Able to work both independently and as part of a small team.§Self-motivated, organised and confident, with excellent interpersonal skills.§Willing to learn with a can-do attitude.§Attention to detail and excellent time management skills.§Flexible, confident and have the ability to work under pressure.§Able to apply confidentiality.§We are looking for an individual who likes to work in a close-knit team environment where support of one another is fostered daily.  This position will be varied and provide you with opportunities to learn and grow, utilizing your administration and EA skills.  If interested we would like to hear from you today.§For confidential enquiries, please contact Chan Collin §0275 401 027§ or Sacha MacDonald 027 386 9288 or alternatively you may apply with a cover letter explaining your fit to the position, plus attaching your resume.  All enquiries and applications will be treated in strict confidence.§Applications Close: 21st October 2020§§§§

jobText: TXT/50698338.txt	§Business Administrator/ Reception§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Business Administrator/ Reception§§Advertiser: §Kāhui Tū Kaha§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Administrative Assistants§§§§§§He kaupapa hirahira tēnei mo tētahi tangata ngākau nui nei ki te hiki I te mana o te tangata, ā I te hapai I te ora o te tangata.  Mā te kanohi o te Ao Māori tēnei kaupapa e arahi ki tōna putanga whaihua. § §We are looking for an experienced receptionist/office administrator who is confident in dealing with all aspects of office and business administration. You will be the face and brand ambassador of the organisation therefore must be well presented, friendly and helpful.  Ideally you will have initiative as well as thrive in situations that require you to think on your feet.§ §About the role§ §This role is responsible for providing daily administration support in reception, general administration and event management. No two days will be the same as there will a variety of day to day tasks, you will need to have previous experience to ensure smooth operations across the organisation.§ § §To be successful in this role, you will need:§ § §Strong interpersonal skills and a friendly manner§ §Superb communication, planning and organisational skills§ §Ability to pick up new tasks quickly and have initiative§ §Commitment to Te Tiriti o Waitangi/cultural awareness and sensitivity§ §Previous administrations/office experience is a must§ §Possess a compassionate and non-judgmental attitude§ §Fully conversant with all Microsoft applications (Office 365, Word, excel, Outlook).§ §All applicants must have New Zealand Residency, a full and clean driver's licence and a clean police record.§ §About us:§ §Kāhui Tū Kaha is a community mental health and social housing organization under the auspices of Te Rūnanga ō Ngāti Whātua. It is a well-established and innovative provider and characterized by its diversity and commitment to health and social outcomes for everyone.§ §Our values are: Manaakitanga, Rangatiratanga, Whakawhanaungatanga§ §Toitū te kupu, toitū te mana, toitū te whenua. §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have experience in an administration role?§Which of the following Microsoft Office products are you experienced with?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§
