jobTitle: Assistant Operations Manager Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50700431.txt	§Assistant Operations Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Assistant Operations Manager§§Advertiser: §MAC International Property Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Salary§§$20 - $24.99 per hour§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Administrative Assistants§§§§§§About us§  §If the word "Airbnb" is familiar, we're off to a good start.§  §Our clients are property owners and investors. We are very fortunate to work alongside some amazing like-minded individuals, the natural go-getters of the world. Our clients trust us to fully takeover their property and manage it as short term accommodation, Airbnb is one example.§  §We are a boutique International Company, many of our clients have multiple properties with us, this gives us the ability to keep our team small and deliver personalised results. Quality vs quantity, and you'll see this in everything we do. §  §Here is our website - http://www.macproperty.co.nz§  §The Role§  §This role as Operations Assistant will be very diverse, your goal will be to eventually understand every nut and bolt within the company, to assist with whatever task needs doing at any given time. §  §You might be organizing repairs, or choosing decor for a new property, tightening a screw or paying invoices, handling a complaint or rescheduling an entire calendar like a Rubik’s Cube.§  §You’ll need to be a “jack of all trades” and a natural problem solver, thriving on “dancing on your feet” and loving the ever changing journey along the way.§  §Once you’ve mastered the role you will have the flexibility to work some hours from home, and choose when you’d like to work some of your hours. §  §Important skills to have§ § §Positive, can-do attitude§ §Assertive whilst being kind§ §Excellent interpersonal communication skills§ §Strong problem solving§ §Ability to multitask and remain calm under pressure§ §Exceptional verbal and written communication§ §Good conflict resolution skills§ §Adaptable to change§ §Attention to detail§ §Experience§ § §Microsoft Office, basic understanding § §Technology, smart phones and computers in general§ §Tasks & responsibilities§ § §Assisting the Company Director with the overall running of the company§ §Assisting the Company Director with personal errands § §Banking, paying invoices§ §Messaging guests – managing any issues they may have§ §Monitoring and adjusting pricing on various platforms – Airbnb etc § §Benefits§ § §Flexible working week, choose your days and hours§ §Work from home§ §No two days will be the same§ §Learn a variety of new skills§ §Additional Requirements§ § §This role will take some time to learn and grasp, we are looking to hire someone who is looking for a long-term opportunity, not short-term.§ §Flexibility to work more or less hours as required, it will vary, generally we expect there to be approximately 17 hrs per week. The minimum is 7 hours per week.§ §Valid full drivers licence and own vehicle is required§ §Reside in Auckland § §Flexibility to work weekends, if required§ §Applicants for this position must have NZ residency and speak extremely fluent English. § §How to Apply§  §If you believe this is for you, please email your CV and a cover letter to us, within the cover letter please also answer the following questions – § § §Why you for this role?§ §Tell us about your life right now?§ §What’s your favourite thing about you?§ §How would your best friend describe you?§§§§

jobTitle: Rhythm and Vines - Artist Liaison Assistant Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50700893.txt	§Rhythm and Vines - Artist Liaison Assistant§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Rhythm and Vines - Artist Liaison Assistant§§Advertiser: §SPRMRKT§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Administrative Assistants§§§§§§WHO WE ARE§  §SPRMRKT - Artist Touring & Logistics. §  §SPRMRKT is a service-orientated business, producing live concerts and festivals, specialising in delivering international artists, predominantly musicians. The management team consists of 5 part-time staff year-round located in Auckland, NZ, and Amsterdam, NL. The business also hires up to 35 casual workers for specific projects like Rhythm and Vines.§  §JOB DESCRIPTION §  §SPRMRKT’s MD and Rhythm and Vines Artist Liaison Manager (ALM) is seeking an assistant in the lead up to Rhythm and Vines Music Festival 2021 for three months, mid-October 2020 – mid-January 2021. The successful applicant may have the opportunity to continue the role and work on other potential concert tours Q1, 2021. §  §What is Artist Liaison? An Artist Liaison department works as a liaison between an artist and promoter (Rhythm and Vines Music Festival). This department ensures that both the artist and promoter clearly understand the logistics and business details of an upcoming event or tour.§  §For line-up and additional information visit www.rhythmandvines.co.nz§  §KEY COMPETENCIES§  §The role will incorporate a wide range of duties, although predominantly focusing on administrative preparation pre-show days and hospitable tasks during show days.§  §This role calls for an extremely detail-oriented, organized, and proactive person who has quick communication skills, advanced computer skills, excellent verbal and written skills. You’ll need to work efficiently on your own and alongside our existing team to meet deadlines while working under high pressure.§  §We are also seeking a logistical problem-solver who can make quick yet rational decisions. Someone calm, confident, and positive with exceptional customer service. Helpful by nature and who understands varied personality types.§  §Professional discretion is imperative. The successful applicant will be across sensitive information about high-profile artists. Artist Liaison staff are required to be inconspicuous and non-incentivized by the party going on around them.§  §This role is an exciting opportunity for someone who wants to learn a niche skillset and who has a passion for music. You will be working close to management with 10+ years of experience and within a company that can provide worldwide opportunities. We are a team of hard workers who also have a lot of fun.§  §We are confident that the successful applicant will find this job truly rewarding!§  §SPECIFIC DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES §  §General Administration Tasks § § §Prepare meeting agendas and maintain a weekly schedule§ §Take notes or dictation at meetings and transfer them into actions/tasks§ §Organise and maintain calendars and scheduling appointments§ §Deal with incoming email, often corresponding on behalf of the ALM§ §Maintain order specifically online filing and file naming§ §Maintain the Artist Liaison Department Budget in coordination with the ALM§ §Collect, record, and file all receipts. Each day!§ §Other ad hoc tasks as required§ §ALM Assistant Tasks§  §Pre-event:§ § §Willingness and capacity to work irregular hours§ §Correspond with artist’s or their managers and agents to help complete artist itineraries§ §Procurement - contact and coordinate suppliers and services§ §Update templates and documentation pertaining to information and design relevant to this year’s event§ §Maintain task-boards within our task management system Monday.com§ §Maintain department pack-in/out schedule§ §Collate and manage ‘Artist Guest List’§ §Collate and manage ‘Artist Accreditation’ with the Transport and Accommodation Coordinator and ALM§ §Create and manage ‘Artist Changing Room Schedule’ with the Transport and Accommodation Coordinator and Backstage Coordinator§ §Create and manage ‘Artist Interview Schedule’ with the Marketing Department and ALM§ §Collate and assist ‘Artist Catering’ numbers and allergies with the Rider Coordinator and ALM§ §Collate and assist ‘Artist Riders’ with the Rider Coordinator and ALM§ §Coordinate site requirements/requests with Event Management and ALM§ §Coordinate contra with Sponsorship departments and Sponsorship Agencies§ §Assist the AL Staff and Backstage Coordinator with staff requirements and communication§ §Maintain an operative working environment - Sometimes, we are all called on to be a team player (runner, cook, and cleaner, etc.)§ §Beatswitch - Industry-specific online advancing/administration system/form tasks:§ § §Learn essential features, functionality, and use cases§ §Transfer system settings, templates, and information from the 2019 event to this years event - No experience required (copy, paste, and update)§ §Manage artist bookings and ensure their data is up to date§ §Manage the artist CRM§ §Use the reporting functionality to gain essential insights by analyzing, calculating, and providing statistics§ §Onsite/Show Days:§  §Note show-days are long and go well into the early hours of the night. They require mental and physical endurance.§ § §Help to guide pre and post-event set-up and dismantling of artist liaison areas, including dressing rooms – aid in planning where things need to go so that when staff arrive, they can move forward in an efficient manner.§ §Manage distribution of APRA devices to each stage§ §Be available to assist the Backstage Coordinator and ALM at any time.§ §Be available to assist artist and guest entry inquiries.§ §Troubleshoot any problems that might arise within your pre-event responsibilities§ §Ensure all radios and iPads are checked in/out and are charged at the end of each show day§ §Help the Rider Coordinator and Backstage Coordinator pack-in/out artist dressing rooms§ §Help with any Artist/Tour Manager queries if the ALM or Transport and Accommodation Coordinator and Backstage Coordinator are not present.§ §Any other ad hoc duties that arise. There is always a job to be done!§ §Post-event:§ § §Contribute to final report/debrief§ §Assist with account reconciliation and subscription holds§ §Procurement/holds - contact and coordinate suppliers and services for next years event§ §Create and distribute ‘Thank You’ emails§ §EXPERIENCE§ § §Minimum two years of working experience (including part-time)§ §General business acumen - administration and fiscal skills§ §Experience within the hospitality, event, and travel industry would be of benefit but not essential§ §We use G-Suite (Gmail/Drive/G-Docs/G-Sheets), Monday.com, Beatswitch.com, Backstage (internal event program) Excel, and sometimes Adobe Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator). While previous experience is not required, we would love to know if you are proficient in any of these listed tools.§ §REMUNERATION§  §Fixed-term: $3750.00 fixed fee all-inclusive.§ § §Domestic travel to and from Gisborne, NZ§ §Accommodation in Gisborne, NZ§ §Meals (breakfast, lunch, dinner) when in Gisborne, NZ§ §Please note you are required to provide your own: § § §Laptop computer.§ §Mobile phone and monthly plan - Work-related charges outside of your standard plan will be reimbursed.§ §Start Date:§ 27 October 2020 (TBD)§  §End Date:§ 15 January 2021 §  §You will be expected to be available at all times from the start date to the end date (within reason); however, we have estimated below the weekly break down based on an average 6-hour working day. It is important to note this is a guide only - some days will be shorter some will be longer! The nature of our work ramps up closer to the event, workload becomes larger and more intense. § § §Mid-October: 2 days per week - Working from home§ §November: 3 days per week - Working from home§ §December: 5 days per week - Located in Auckland or Gisborne§ §Mid-January: 1 day per week - Working from home§ §You will be required to be in Gisborne, NZ; § § §7th - 11th December and or 16th - 24th December 2020 (home before Christmas eve)§ §26th December 2020 (morning) to 3 January 2021 (show-days)§ §We mentioned this job is about attention to detail - If you make it to the interview process, remember to ask which previous artist prefers their McDonald's cheeseburger - no onion, no mustard, no pickles.§  §Please note the ALM will be working from the Netherlands until 2nd November 2020 and, on return to NZ, will be in managed isolation from the 1st - 16th November. He will be working between Auckland, CBD, and Gisborne and it is preferred you are working together for the month of December.§§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§How many years' experience do you have in the hospitality & tourism industry?§How many years' experience do you have as an administrative assistant?§Are you available to travel for this role when required?§How many years' experience do you have as a customer services representative?§Do you have experience using Microsoft Excel?§§§

jobTitle: Database Administrator Job in Canterbury - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50700903.txt	§Database Administrator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Database Administrator§§Advertiser: §Workplace Safety§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Client & Sales Administration§§§§§§We are looking for an exceptional Database Administrator to work with the friendly team at our §SafeT Christchurch Branch.§ §You will be responsible for: §Maintenance and management of our database of safety products, customer and supplier information§Ensuring the seamless processing of customer orders and invoices§Answering phone queries and assisting customers with sales orders§General warehousing duties, assisting with inwards and outwards goods§ §Skills and experience requirements: §Computer literate with numerical and grammatical accuracy§Have excellent communication skills both written and verbal§Relevant industry experience is a bonus, and Infusion ERP software experience is preferred§Initiative and excellent problem solving skills.§ §What’s on offer? §On offer for the successful applicant is the opportunity to join an organisation that is committed to attracting, developing and retaining the right people who are highly competent and actively contribute to our long-term success. § §How to apply: §Apply now to get your career moving with a successful New Zealand owned and operated organisation.Simply click on ‘Apply for this job’, send through your cover letter and CV, and we’ll be in touch. § §About us: §SafeT literally hit the road some 20 years ago as the first personal protective equipment and apparel store and warehouse on wheels in New Zealand.§From just the one store and warehouse on wheels, we now operate a small mobile sales force fleet. We've also grown from supplying a few product lines to hundreds. §Safety footwear, safety clothing, safety gloves, eye and ear protection, hard hats, first aid kits, respiratory protection, you name it, we've got it. And if we haven't, we'll get it as part of our commitment to being a single source supplier.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have experience in an administration role?§Do you have customer service experience?§Do you have experience in a data entry role?§§§

jobTitle: Customer Services Administrator Job in Manawatu - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50701011.txt	§Customer Services Administrator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Customer Services Administrator§§Advertiser: §NZ Transport Agency§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Manawatu§, §Wanganui§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Administrative Assistants§§§§§§ §Job Description§ §An opportunity to showcase your strong administrative and time management skills§Support and contribute to the daily operation of the Customer Service Support team and Contact Centre§Part time position : 20 hours per week§§ About us | Ko wai mātou§ § §At Waka Kotahi NZ Transport Agency, it all starts with our people. The organisation's performance and success depends on the people who choose to make this a great place to work and make a difference for Aotearoa. Waka Kotahi has a strong future focus, understanding that new technologies and changing customer expectations mean the transport system we know today will not be the one we deliver in ten years time.§This is an exciting time for the Regulatory Services group as we set ourselves up for future success delivering end-to-end regulatory services that are sharply focused on outcomes and delivering our regulatory purpose and objectives.  We have a rare opportunity to drive positive change that will make a difference to the way we work and the outcomes we can deliver for the public. Safety is a top priority for Waka Kotahi and we, as the Regulatory Services group, aim to improve safety and reduce the risk of harm by being a firm and fair regulator ensuring compliance - it is the essence of why we do what we do.  For more information, please visit www.nzta.govt.nz/regulatory/§The opportunity | Te Whiwhinga mahi§As a Customer Service Administrator, you will undertake administrative tasks that help support the functions within the Customer Service Support team and Contact Centre.§Your strong attention to detail skills will be showcased here and your ability to plan and manage your daily workload is important to ensure tasks are completed in a timely manner in line with the Waka Kotahi's policies, procedures and legislative requirements.§About you | Ko koe tēnei§To be successful in this role, you will bring:§§A minimum of two years' experience in an administration role§Strong customer focus§Collaborative working style and can work well as part of a team§A desire and ability to build strong relationships throughout the Agency§High level of agility along with ability to work under pressure and meet tight time frames§Ability to plan and manage workload§Well-developed written and verbal communication skills§Take accountability for the responsibilities of the position and own actionsHigh standards of accuracy and attention to detail§Demonstrated expertise in the use of the Microsoft Office suite§Experience in continuous improvement§Ability to multi task, prioritise and work under pressure§§ Applications close | §Rā Katinga :  Wednesday, 14 Oct 2020§For a copy of the position description: www.nzta.govt.nz/careers§For further information, email: §careers@nzta.govt.nz§To be considered for this position you must have a legal right to live and work in New Zealand.§NZ Transport Agency is an equal opportunity employer (EOE). At the Agency we recognise the importance of diversity and inclusion and are committed to providing a working environment that embraces these values. Please do let us know if you need any support or have any access requirements that will help you through the recruitment process.§ §§§§

jobText: TXT/50701116.txt	§Fleet and Contract Administrator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Fleet and Contract Administrator§§Advertiser: §The Warehouse Group§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Rodney & North Shore§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Contracts Administration§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Fleet and Contract Administrator §      §        §We are searching for an exceptional administrator to join our finance team - someone who innately dots the i’s and cross’s the t’s!  Excellent stakeholder management and communication skills are also high on our wish list.§        §Our purpose at The Warehouse Group is ‘Helping Kiwis live better every day.” The Warehouse Group (TWG) is moving into an exciting phase as we transform our way of working as the retail industry continues to evolve.  As a Company we’ve gone agile to ensure our customers always come first.   To meet the ever-changing demands of our customers, we’re simplifying the way we work, speeding up decision making, and breaking down the hierarchy so we work better, faster. §        § §        §The Role§        §As the Administrator of both our vehicle fleet and non-trade supplier contracts, you are responsible for leading the process and will be the “go to” for related activities to support Finance, Operations and the overall organisation.  Key responsibilities include:§        §          §Ensuring that non-trade supplier contracts are correctly loaded and published into our Contract Management System§          §Developing simplicity for business users to effectively search for and locate contracts in our Contract Management System§          §Managing the company vehicle fleet and maintain accurate and up to date records of driver allocation and relevant cost centres§          §Developing and reporting monthly on vehicle costs (rates and types) to ensure alignment to agreed contracted pricing§        §        § §        §About You§        §Thorough, strong eye for detail, top notch critical and problem solving skills – this describes you down to a t.  Success in this role will be summed up with your ability to execute all of the above duties by being a helpful and trusted advisor to key stakeholders such as suppliers and our team members across TWG.  Living and breathing Agile attributes such as collaboration and a growth mindset will come naturally to you, along with thriving in a busy ever-changing environment. Our ideal candidate would also possess:§        §          §Previous administration experience§          §Excellent organisation skills§          §A relationship builder – at all levels§          §Outstanding communication skills, both written and oral§          §Ability to solve complex problems and identify relevant insights§        §        §    §        §About Us§        §What's in it for you? We offer a dynamic, supportive team environment within a business that cares about and recognises individuals. The business is at an exciting point in its life story.  By empowering our teams and increasing cross-collaboration, we aim to make TWG New Zealand’s best place to work!   §        §Does this move sound like something you’re up for? If you’ve read this far, go the whole way and apply now.§      §    §    §twg.co.nz§  §§§We are searching for an exceptional administrator to join our finance team - someone who innately dots the i’s and cross’s the t’s!  Excellent stakeholder management and communication skills are also high on our wish list.§ §Our purpose at The Warehouse Group is ‘Helping Kiwis live better every day.” The Warehouse Group (TWG) is moving into an exciting phase as we transform our way of working as the retail industry continues to evolve.  As a Company we’ve gone agile to ensure our customers always come first.   To meet the ever-changing demands of our customers, we’re simplifying the way we work, speeding up decision making, and breaking down the hierarchy so we work better, faster. § § § §The Role§ §As the Administrator of both our vehicle fleet and non-trade supplier contracts, you are responsible for leading the process and will be the “go to” for related activities to support Finance, Operations and the overall organisation.  Key responsibilities include:§ § §Ensuring that non-trade supplier contracts are correctly loaded and published into our Contract Management System§ §Developing simplicity for business users to effectively search for and locate contracts in our Contract Management System§ §Managing the company vehicle fleet and maintain accurate and up to date records of driver allocation and relevant cost centres§ §Developing and reporting monthly on vehicle costs (rates and types) to ensure alignment to agreed contracted pricing§ § § §About You§ §Thorough, strong eye for detail, top notch critical and problem solving skills – this describes you down to a t.  Success in this role will be summed up with your ability to execute all of the above duties by being a helpful and trusted advisor to key stakeholders such as suppliers and our team members across TWG.  Living and breathing Agile attributes such as collaboration and a growth mindset will come naturally to you, along with thriving in a busy ever-changing environment. Our ideal candidate would also possess:§ § §Previous administration experience§ §Excellent organisation skills§ §A relationship builder – at all levels§ §Outstanding communication skills, both written and oral§ §Ability to solve complex problems and identify relevant insights§ §    § §About Us§ §What's in it for you? We offer a dynamic, supportive team environment within a business that cares about and recognises individuals. jobTitle: Advisor, Correspondence and Events Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50701262.txt	§Advisor, Correspondence and Events§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Advisor, Correspondence and Events§§Advertiser: §Office of the Auditor-General§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Other§§§§§§§§§  §    §      §Advisor, Correspondence and Events §      §        §Advisor, Correspondence and Events§        §The Office of the Auditor-General | Te Mana Arotake(the Office) is focused on significantly enhancing its influence and impact on the public sector to deliver better results for New Zealand. The Office is dedicated to making a difference to the lives of New Zealanders, by helping to continuously improve the public's trust in public services and the value those services deliver.§        §The Office receives a lot of correspondence from a wide cross-section of New Zealanders, from members of the public to Parliamentarians. We've created a new role in our Communications and Engagement Team to manage the Office's centralised correspondence processes and systems, and to support the delivery of Office events. The Advisor, Correspondence and Events will work closely with staff from across the Office to ensure that all the correspondence we receive is responded to promptly.§        §In this role, you would be responsible for:§        §          §managing the processes and systems for the Office's response to correspondence;§          §drafting and sending initial responses;§          §tracking response timelines and providing regular reporting and analysis;§          §identifying opportunities for, and providing advice about, potential events to promote the work of the Office; and§          §co-ordinating events and assisting with delivering internal and external events, and other stakeholder engagement activities.§        §        §We're looking for someone with:§        §          §excellent planning, organisation, and logistics skills;§          §experience in managing administrative processes across an organisation;§          §excellent oral and written communication skills, with the ability to tailor messages for different audiences;§          §excellent interpersonal and relationship management skills; and§          §experience in event co-ordination and managing logistics.§        §        §Previous experience in a Ministerial/correspondence or equivalent role preferred.§        §Our benefits§        §          §Learning and development opportunities§          §We support flexible working§          §A unique operating environment with Parliament§        §        §We want a more diverse workforce that reflects contemporary New Zealand. We welcome applicants from all backgrounds. If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to tell us when you apply so that we can assist you through the recruitment process. §        §You must be able to gain and maintain a Confidential national security clearance. Ordinarily, this means that you must be a New Zealand citizen, a permanent resident, or hold a current residency class visa and intend to become a citizen when eligible. You must have a five-year checkable background in NZ, UK, USA, Canada, or Australia.  Use this online tool to self-check your eligibility for a security clearance. Please note that this tool is not part of the formal security clearance process: §http://www.protectivesecurity.govt.nz/eligibility-tool§        §For more information, please contact Sandy Hoggarth on §04 917 1500§ or §recruitment@oag.parliament.nz§.§        §To find out more about us, see our website: §www.oag.parliament.nz§.§        §You must apply online through jobs.govt.nz §(you'll find the application form and position description there, too§).§        §Applications close Sunday 25 October 2020§.§        § §        §What we stand for§        §People matter §|§ Our independence is critical §|§ We act with integrity and courage §|§ We're here to make a difference§        § §        § §      §      §Office of the Auditor-General/Audit New Zealand§ PO Box 3928, Wellington 6140§    §  §§§Advisor, Correspondence and Events§The Office of the Auditor-General | Te Mana Arotake(the Office) is focused on significantly enhancing its influence and impact on the public sector to deliver better results for New Zealand. The Office is dedicated to making a difference to the lives of New Zealanders, by helping to continuously improve the public's trust in public services and the value those services deliver.§The Office receives a lot of correspondence from a wide cross-section of New Zealanders, from members of the public to Parliamentarians. We've created a new role in our Communications and Engagement Team to manage the Office's centralised correspondence processes and systems, and to support the delivery of Office events. The Advisor, Correspondence and Events will work closely with staff from across the Office to ensure that all the correspondence we receive is responded to promptly.§In this role, you would be responsible for:§§managing the processes and systems for the Office's response to correspondence;§drafting and sending initial responses;§tracking response timelines and providing regular reporting and analysis;§identifying opportunities for, and providing advice about, potential events to promote the work of the Office; and§co-ordinating events and assisting with delivering internal and external events, and other stakeholder engagement activities.§§We're looking for someone with:§§excellent planning, organisation, and logistics skills;§experience in managing administrative processes across an organisation;§excellent oral and written communication skills, with the ability to tailor messages for different audiences;§excellent interpersonal and relationship management skills; and§experience in event co-ordination and managing logistics.§§Previous experience in a Ministerial/correspondence or equivalent role preferred.§Our benefits§§Learning and development opportunities§We support flexible working§A unique operating environment with Parliament§§We want a more diverse workforce that reflects contemporary New Zealand. We welcome applicants from all backgrounds. If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to tell us when you apply so that we can assist you through the recruitment process. §You must be able to gain and maintain a Confidential national security clearance. Ordinarily, this means that you must be a New Zealand citizen, a permanent resident, or hold a current residency class visa and intend to become a citizen when eligible. You must have a five-year checkable background in NZ, UK, USA, Canada, or Australia.  Use this online tool to self-check your eligibility for a security clearance. Please note that this tool is not part of the formal security clearance process: §http://www.protectivesecurity.govt.nz/eligibility-tool§For more information, please contact Sandy Hoggarth on §04 917 1500§ or §recruitment@oag.parliament.nz§.§To find out more about us, see our website: §www.oag.parliament.nz§.§You must apply online through jobs.govt.nz §(you'll find the application form and position description there, too§).§§Applications close Sunday 25 October 2020§.§ §What we stand for§People matter §|§ Our independence is critical §|§ We act with integrity and courage §|§ We're here to make a difference§ § §§§§

The definition of Tuarā is to assist, help, support or maintain.§            §The Role§          §          §            §As the Te Tuarā Coordinator reporting to the Business Engagement Manager you will; §            §              §Provide administration support to the Business Engagement Manager, other Managers within the Te Tuarā team and the wider Corporate Group. §              §Coordinate team events including workshops, training and regular team meetings. §              §Coordinate projects and information for the team. §              §Develop and maintain efficient and effective systems and processes. §              §Assist with the preparation of technical and monitoring reports.§            §            §The skills and personal attributes we are looking for are: § §          §          §            §              §Minimum of National Level 3 Certificate. §              §Excellent English – written, verbal and comprehension. §              §High level of computer literacy with specific requirements for the MS office Suite. §              §Proven administration and coordination experience within a technical work environment. §              §Excellent relationship management and communication skills. §              §A full drivers licence & eligibility to work in NZ is required. §            §            §The successful candidate will be highly motivated and organised, reporting and contributing to the effectiveness of the Bay of Plenty Regional Council. §            §The Benefits§          §          §            §We’re a values driven organisation who really cares about people. jobTitle: Supporter Care Administrator Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50702012.txt	§Supporter Care Administrator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Supporter Care Administrator§§Advertiser: §cbm New Zealand§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Rodney & North Shore§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Administrative Assistants§§§§§§Supporter Care Administrator - cbm New Zealand§§Join a dynamic team on a global mission§Provide excellent supporter care to delight our valued supporters§Permanent part time role: 25-30 hours per week§§cbm (Christian Blind Mission) §is an international Christian development organisation, committed to improving the quality of life for people living with disabilities in the poorest countries of the world.§cbm§ envisions an inclusive world where all people with disabilities enjoy their human rights and achieve their full potential. We seek to achieve this by raising funds and awareness, and undertaking quality international programmes. These range from eye, ear and fistula surgery, through to inclusive education, mental health, disability-inclusive organic farming and responding to natural disasters.§Each year the global §cbm§ family impacts over 55 million people to prevent blindness and diseases. §cbm§ treats over 8 million people with medical conditions, and provides education and assistive devices to over 1 million people. It’s a deeply compelling mission, and we are proud of how our small NZ team contributes.§cbm§ New Zealand is an inclusive, equal opportunity employer§We welcome applications from those with disabilities.§cbm§ operates from a Christian kaupapa.§The Role§Along with the North Island Engagement Manager, this role is the first point of contact to deliver an exceptional supporter care experience. You will provide services that delight §cbm §supporters, sharing with them how they can transform the lives of people living with the double disadvantage of poverty and disability in the poorest countries in the world. This key hands on role actively maximises fundraising opportunities, encourages increased giving and retention, and develops and nurtures relationships with §cbm §supporters.§Location:         §Rosedale (Albany), Auckland§Hours:§              25 - 30 hours per week (Weekly spread of hours negotiable)§Type of Role:§    Permanent Part-time§Key Responsibilities§Be the first point of contact for §cbm§ supporters and potential supporters, answering queries by phone, post, handwritten notes and emails§Proactively develop relationships with supporters through outbound phone and email contact to inspire and motivate supporters to continue giving and re-engage§Delight and exceed supporter expectations to enhance the potential for increased giving over the long term and build loyalty to the mission of §cbm§Maintain integrity of supporter information held on CRM system through detailed and accurate recording§Become familiar with the mission of §cbm§ to answer §cbm§ supporter enquiries in the first instance§Assist with special projects and initiatives§Person Specification:  Knowledge and Experience§Possess a passion for serving others§3+ years excellent supporter care experience in a similar role in the charities sector§High degree of empathy with warm friendly people skills and ability to stay calm under pressure§Fluent English with strong verbal and written communications skills, persuasive phone manner, excellent listening skills and the ability to build rapport on the phone§MS Office proficient including Word, Excel and Outlook§Fast and accurate keyboard skills§Self-motivated with the ability to prioritise own workload§Excellent attention to detail skills with the ability to check own work§A highly positive and enthusiastic team player§Ability to work within a Christian framework and be sensitive to its various expressions across cultures and denominations§This role is 25 - 30 hours a week, ideally spread over 5 days, however there will be some flexibility for the right person. All hours will be worked between the hours of 8.30am to 5.30pm, Monday to Friday.§To Apply§Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.§If you are suitably qualified and would like to serve those living with the double disadvantage of poverty and disability overseas, then§ please apply including an updated CV with a cover letter addressed to Robyn Tane (Fundraising & Marketing Director) by email to § §jointheteam@cbmi.org.nz§ § Please outline your experience against the above listed key responsibilities, your relevant knowledge and skills (also based on the list above), and let us know why you would love to work for cbm. For a full job description please go to www.cbmnz.org.nz§ The cover letter should include details of the hours you are available for work.§The closing date for this role is Wednesday 21 October.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Which of the following Microsoft Office products are you experienced with?§Do you have customer service experience?§Do you have experience in an administration role?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§

jobTitle: Parent Education and Operations Support Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50702193.txt	§Parent Education and Operations Support§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Parent Education and Operations Support§§Advertiser: §Parents Centre NZ Inc.§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Porirua & Kapiti Coast§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Other§§§§§§About Parents Centre Aotearoa§Parents Centre is New Zealand’s leading provider of antenatal and postnatal education for new parents. Our programmes are available in 52 locations throughout Aotearoa New Zealand and are supported by 46 Centres, providing information, support and activities for parents. These volunteer-run Centres deliver support to parents at all stages throughout the antenatal and postnatal periods. Services include childbirth and parent education programmes, playgroups, toy libraries, lactation and breastfeeding programmes, toilet learning and other specialised information and activities to reduce the isolation experienced by many parents with babies and infants.  We believe that parenting is everything and that great parents grow great kids.§The National Support Centre is based in Mana, Wellington and is currently rolling out a new infrastructure that will enhance the services provided nationally and locally. A small but dedicated team provide programme management and delivery, finance, fundraising, IT support, marketing and partnership support.  We also publish a flagship magazine, Kiwiparent.§ §About the position: Parent Education and Operations Support§This position is a part-time (.4FTE) contract position, with some flexibility to increase the hours in the future.§The Parent Education and Operations Support has a key role in actively assisting in the delivery of high quality, evidence-based information for parents.§You will work directly to the Parent Education and Operations Manager to ensure the effective delivery of parent education through enabling the national booking system to work smoothly and effectively for parents and Centres; providing assistance in the management and evaluation of parent education facilitators and supporting Centres in their delivery. §You will play a key role in supporting parent education in Aotearoa New Zealand.  You will work closely with our 80 parent education facilitators and Centres throughout the country. §Ideally you will have a background in parent education, midwifery or a related field.  You will be experienced across a range of IT applications and have experience in managing relationships across a wide range of sectors.  You will also be able to communicate effectively orally and in writing.  You will also bring a positive, can-do attitude to your work in the team at the National Support Centre.§This position closes on 24 October 2020.§The job description can be found on the Parents Centre website: https://www.parentscentre.org.nz/files/Parent_Ed_Operations_Support_Position_Description.pdf§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have experience in an administration role?§Do you have customer service experience?§Which of the following Microsoft Office products are you experienced with?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§

jobText: TXT/50702734.txt	§Salesforce Administrator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Salesforce Administrator§§Advertiser: §Trustpower§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Oct 2020§§Location§§Bay of Plenty§, §Tauranga§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Client & Sales Administration§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Salesforce Administrator §      §        §§        §Looking for an opportunity to play a fundamental part in a transformational Salesforce journey? Well Trustpower's has just begun!§        §As an energy, broadband, and mobile retailer, Trustpowers ability to deliver exceptional customer service and exciting and dynamic propositions to market is key to our success. Embracing innovation and creativity, Trustpower provides a flexible and energising working environment.§        §Trustpower has recently started on an exciting journey to rebuild and establish Salesforce as its Product Master with the introduction of Salesforce CPQ. The roadmap ahead requires a committed and competent individual who is up for a rewarding challenge.§        §As a Salesforce Admin in a growing Salesforce team, you will actively contribute to Trustpowers ongoing success by providing timely, consistent, automated and highly scalable solutions to deliver business outcomes and drive performance. This is an entry level position and whilst having experience with Salesforce is preferred, if you have the drive and attitude to succeed, we will reward you with providing all the training you will need to be a high achiever in this role.§        §Your responsibilities will include:§        §          §Configuration of Salesforce Core, CPQ, and Maps products to deliver high quality solutions.§          §Providing day to day support for 300+ Salesforce users.§          §Perform unit testing and peer review of solutions.§          §Maintain and interrogate platform data in order to deliver operational reporting and dashboards.§          §Assist in training of new users and grow the Salesforce.com skill set across the organization.§        §        §What do we expect you to bring?§        §          §Proven experience utilising systems thinking to solve complex problems and improve business processes.§          §High level of attention to detail.§          §Demonstrated ability to meet deadlines and handle and prioritize simultaneous requests.§          §Excellent written and verbal communication skills.§          §Experience proactively researching, learning, and applying new concepts and capabilities.§          §Analytical or system configuration experience is advantageous.§          §Above all, you have a proactive 'can-do' attitude and a focus on quality.§        §        §If you have any questions about the role, please contact Nadia Herriott (027 536 8562).§        §Applications close 4pm Friday, 23 October 2020.§      §      §        § Email: Please click the 'Apply Now' button below.§      §    §  §§§Looking for an opportunity to play a fundamental part in a transformational Salesforce journey? Well Trustpower's has just begun!§As an energy, broadband, and mobile retailer, Trustpowers ability to deliver exceptional customer service and exciting and dynamic propositions to market is key to our success. Embracing innovation and creativity, Trustpower provides a flexible and energising working environment.§Trustpower has recently started on an exciting journey to rebuild and establish Salesforce as its Product Master with the introduction of Salesforce CPQ. The roadmap ahead requires a committed and competent individual who is up for a rewarding challenge.§As a Salesforce Admin in a growing Salesforce team, you will actively contribute to Trustpowers ongoing success by providing timely, consistent, automated and highly scalable solutions to deliver business outcomes and drive performance. This is an entry level position and whilst having experience with Salesforce is preferred, if you have the drive and attitude to succeed, we will reward you with providing all the training you will need to be a high achiever in this role.§Your responsibilities will include:§§Configuration of Salesforce Core, CPQ, and Maps products to deliver high quality solutions.§Providing day to day support for 300+ Salesforce users.§Perform unit testing and peer review of solutions.§Maintain and interrogate platform data in order to deliver operational reporting and dashboards.§Assist in training of new users and grow the Salesforce.com skill set across the organization.§§What do we expect you to bring?§§Proven experience utilising systems thinking to solve complex problems and improve business processes.§High level of attention to detail.§Demonstrated ability to meet deadlines and handle and prioritize simultaneous requests.§Excellent written and verbal communication skills.§Experience proactively researching, learning, and applying new concepts and capabilities.§Analytical or system configuration experience is advantageous.§Above all, you have a proactive 'can-do' attitude and a focus on quality.§If you have any questions about the role, please contact Nadia Herriott (027 536 8562).§Applications close 4pm Friday, 23 October 2020.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Senior EA to the Chief Executive Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50702923.txt	§Senior EA to the Chief Executive§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior EA to the Chief Executive§§Advertiser: §Ministry of Social Development§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §PA, EA & Secretarial§§§§§§§§§  §    §Senior EA to the Chief Executive §    §      §        §Job Ref: 35123§        §Nau mai haere mai ki te manatū whakahiata ora §        §          §Are you an exceptional Senior Executive Assistant?§          §Are you solutions-focused?§          §Do you go the extra mile and anticipate what is needed – even before you are asked?§          §Can you juggle multiple priorities in a pressured environment?§ §        §        §This is an exciting opportunity to provide dedicated support to the Chief Executive of the Ministry of Social Development (MSD). MSD plays a key role in the social sector, working directly with New Zealanders of all ages to improve social wellbeing. We provide policy advice and deliver social services and assistance to young people, working age people, older people, and families, whānau and communities to improve social wellbeing. We are a busy organisation with a wide reach and impact and as a result don’t expect any two days as a Senior EA to the CE to be the same.§        §This role is more than just diary and email management. The Chief Executive you will be responsible for is responsible for delivering a large, varied and fast paced work programme. You will need to be two steps ahead with your support. She is looking for a Senior Executive Assistant who is dynamic, who has a high level of initiative and drive, is collaborative and can work across the broader public service. §        §You’ll be an important member of the wider CE Office and will need to work as part of a team, look to add value, bring a calm and positive approach. You will need to be approachable and have excellent interpersonal communication skills. To be successful in the role you will:§        §          §Be flexible and adaptable to frequent changes in priorities and demands.§          §Anticipate and fulfil the needs of the Chief Executive without requiring high levels of direction.§          §Build excellent relationships with people at all levels across the organisation.§          §Have outstanding organisational skills – be detail-oriented and proactive.§          §Enjoy working in a fast pace environment.§          §Have excellent communication skills – written and verbal.§          §Be willing to go the extra mile – always willing to learn.§        §        §If this sounds like you then please apply online with your CV and cover letter. Your cover letter will be a key part of our assessment process, so please highlight how your experience and capability relates to the competencies listed in the position description.§        §Current MSD Employees – please apply through your myHR portal at work. This will ensure that your myHR employee profile is visible as an internal candidate.§        §All applications must be made online. If this is not possible or if you have any further questions about the role, please contact Kieran Crickmar (Recruitment Partner) at §Kieran.crickmar001@msd.govt.nz§ §        §Applications close: Sunday, 25 October 2020.§        §Position Description§        §http://www.msd.govt.nz/hr/documents/position-descriptions/chief-executive-office/senior-ea-to-ce-sep-20.docx§        §Joining us§        §Joining MSD means being part of a whānau that celebrates the diversity each individual represents. We show manaaki, we care about the wellbeing and success of people and want everyone to thrive, and be who they are in a supportive and inclusive working environment. We work together to make a difference for communities while doing the right thing with integrity. We are a Treaty partner committed to strengthening relationships with§ §Māori,§ §Hapū§,§ Iwi and communities to realise their own potential and aspirations.§        §If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to tell us when you apply so we can assist you through the recruitment process.§      §      §The Ministry of Social Development is one of New Zealand's largest government agencies. Our work to achieve better social outcomes affects almost every New Zealander, now or in the future.§        §https://jobs.msd.govt.nz/§      §    §    §  §§§Job Ref: 35123§ §Nau mai haere mai ki te manatū whakahiata ora § § §Are you an exceptional Senior Executive Assistant?§ §Are you solutions-focused?§ §Do you go the extra mile and anticipate what is needed – even before you are asked?§ §Can you juggle multiple priorities in a pressured environment?§ § §This is an exciting opportunity to provide dedicated support to the Chief Executive of the Ministry of Social Development (MSD). MSD plays a key role in the social sector, working directly with New Zealanders of all ages to improve social wellbeing. We provide policy advice and deliver social services and assistance to young people, working age people, older people, and families, whānau and communities to improve social wellbeing. We are a busy organisation with a wide reach and impact and as a result don’t expect any two days as a Senior EA to the CE to be the same.§ §This role is more than just diary and email management. The Chief Executive you will be responsible for is responsible for delivering a large, varied and fast paced work programme. You will need to be two steps ahead with your support. She is looking for a Senior Executive Assistant who is dynamic, who has a high level of initiative and drive, is collaborative and can work across the broader public service. § §You’ll be an important member of the wider CE Office and will need to work as part of a team, look to add value, bring a calm and positive approach. You will need to be approachable and have excellent interpersonal communication skills. To be successful in the role you will:§ § §Be flexible and adaptable to frequent changes in priorities and demands.§ §Anticipate and fulfil the needs of the Chief Executive without requiring high levels of direction.§ §Build excellent relationships with people at all levels across the organisation.§ §Have outstanding organisational skills – be detail-oriented and proactive.§ §Enjoy working in a fast pace environment.§ §Have excellent communication skills – written and verbal.§ §Be willing to go the extra mile – always willing to learn.§ §If this sounds like you then please apply online with your CV and cover letter. Your cover letter will be a key part of our assessment process, so please highlight how your experience and capability relates to the competencies listed in the position description.§ §Current MSD Employees – please apply through your myHR portal at work. This will ensure that your myHR employee profile is visible as an internal candidate.§ §All applications must be made online. If this is not possible or if you have any further questions about the role, please contact Kieran Crickmar (Recruitment Partner) at §Kieran.crickmar001@msd.govt.nz§ § §Applications close: Sunday, 25 October 2020.§ §Position Description§ §http://www.msd.govt.nz/hr/documents/position-descriptions/chief-executive-office/senior-ea-to-ce-sep-20.docx§ §Joining us§ §Joining MSD means being part of a whānau that celebrates the diversity each individual represents. We show manaaki, we care about the wellbeing and success of people and want everyone to thrive, and be who they are in a supportive and inclusive working environment. We work together to make a difference for communities while doing the right thing with integrity. We are a Treaty partner committed to strengthening relationships with§ §Māori,§ §Hapū§,§ Iwi and communities to realise their own potential and aspirations.§ §If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to tell us when you apply so we can assist you through the recruitment process.§§§§

jobTitle: Personal Assistant Job in Marlborough - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50702938.txt	§Personal Assistant§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Personal Assistant§§Advertiser: §Booster Wine Group§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Oct 2020§§Location§§Marlborough§, §Blenheim§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §PA, EA & Secretarial§§§§§§Personal Assistant§  § §  §Seeking energetic professional Personal Assistant to support CEO of a NZ Wine Company. A tertiary education is required, law experience is preferred. Strong values and integrity are essential. (Must be honest and have a good sense of humour.) The position is Marlborough based, full-time, and some travel is required. We offer a competitive remuneration and package, the start date is flexible.§  § §  §Booster, through its Booster Tahi investment arm, is making significant investments in New Zealand’s agricultural business including avocados, kiwi fruit and, through investments in Awatere River, Waimea Estates, Bannock Brae and Sileni Estates, the wine industry.  It is here where this position is required as a Personal Assistant to our Marlborough based CEO. §  § §  §Responsibilities:§ § §Acting as a first point of contact: dealing with correspondence and phone calls§ §Managing diaries and organising meetings and appointments. Many PAs control access to the manager/executive§ §Booking and arranging travel, transport and accommodation§ §Organising events and conferences§ §Reminding the manager/executive of important tasks and deadlines§ §Typing, compiling and preparing reports, presentations and correspondence§ §Managing databases and filing systems§ §Typing meeting minutes§ §Implementing and maintaining procedures/administrative systems§ §Liaising with staff, suppliers and clients§ §Collating and filing expenses§ §Conducting research on behalf of the manager§ §Organising the manager’s personal commitments including travel or childcare§ § §  § §  §Package:§ § § §Proposed salary TBC includes use of work car§ §Must be based in Blenheim or closer to Awatere§ §No criminal convictions§ §Must have a tertiary education§ §Some law experience preferred§ § Wine allowance § § §  § §  §Please apply via the “Apply” button. §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§

jobText: TXT/50703029.txt	§Investment Coordinator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Investment Coordinator§§Advertiser: §Ministry of Business, Innovation and Employment§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Administrative Assistants§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Investment Coordinator §      §        §          §Opportunity to support the investment of high-quality economic, social and environmental outcomes for New Zealand§          §Take on a challenging and varied role where you can use your fantastic relationship, coordination and business process skills§          §Customer service focused role with the support of a hardworking and supportive team§        §        §Investment Coordinator (fixed-term until end of March 2021)§        §About the role§        §An exciting opportunity has come about for a motivated person to join the Investment Operations Team in the Science System Investment and Performance Branch as an Investment Coordinator, within the Labour, Science and Enterprise (LSE) group.§        §As an Investment Coordinator you will coordinate and support the business processes across Science investment portfolios within a dynamic environment.§        §You will plan, coordinate and organise various grant funding processes and best practice, by providing professional relationship management, contract administration and management.§        §Your role may include the following tasks:§        §          §Work with fund leads in the implementation of process support for investment and contracting processes including contestable and negotiated mechanisms;§          §Coordinate and support assessment processes for funding applications;§          §Management of contracting and payment processing with successful applicants;§          §Plan, coordinate and implement contract review processes and variations to contracts; and§          §Learn and work within the Ministry's Investment Management System (IMS) and provide customer support for internal and external users of the system.§        §        § §To be successful in this role you will need to demonstrate:§        §          §Relevant experience in best practice grant funding, contract administration and processing support;§          §Experience in planning, coordination and time management;§          §Have an aptitude to use the Ministry's Investment Management System (IMS);§          §The ability to communicate effectively (written and verbally) with a wide range of stakeholders, both internal and external;§          §Ability to manage positive relationships at all levels in the organisation;§          §Have an eye for detail and a high level of accuracy;§          §Be comfortable with ambiguity that change brings as we remain agile to a changing funding environment, demonstrating your resilience, multi-tasking skills and experience;§          §A proactive, solutions focused work style with a strong customer service focus and delivery; and§          §Some knowledge of the science system is beneficial but not essential.§        §        §Team Culture§        §We work collaboratively within the branch and with others in MBIE, other Government agencies, and stakeholders in a fast-paced and dynamic environment.  We recognise a common set of team values that promote a fun positive team culture that values professionalism, respect, accountability and communication.  Diversity is highly valued and managers work hard to ensure that all staff are given opportunities to develop their skills and expertise.§        §How to Apply§        §All applicants must be New Zealand citizens or hold a residence class visa. §        §Click on the §APPLY§ button below where a position description is also available. Your application must include your CV and a cover letter detailing your suitability for the position.§        §For more information about this vacancy please contact Steve Scannell on §steve.scannell@mbie.govt.nz§ quoting ref MBIE/1482999 if you have any further questions.§        §Applications close at 5pm on Wednesday 14th October 2020.§        § §        § §      §      §      §    §    §  §§§§Opportunity to support the investment of high-quality economic, social and environmental outcomes for New Zealand§§Take on a challenging and varied role where you can use your fantastic relationship, coordination and business process skills§§Customer service focused role with the support of a hardworking and supportive team§§Investment Coordinator (fixed-term until end of March 2021)§§About the role§An exciting opportunity has come about for a motivated person to join the Investment Operations Team in the Science System Investment and Performance Branch as an Investment Coordinator, within the Labour, Science and Enterprise (LSE) group.§As an Investment Coordinator you will coordinate and support the business processes across Science investment portfolios within a dynamic environment.§You will plan, coordinate and organise various grant funding processes and best practice, by providing professional relationship management, contract administration and management.§Your role may include the following tasks:§§Work with fund leads in the implementation of process support for investment and contracting processes including contestable and negotiated mechanisms;§Coordinate and support assessment processes for funding applications;§Management of contracting and payment processing with successful applicants;§Plan, coordinate and implement contract review processes and variations to contracts; and§Learn and work within the Ministry's Investment Management System (IMS) and provide customer support for internal and external users of the system.§§ §To be successful in this role you will need to demonstrate:§§Relevant experience in best practice grant funding, contract administration and processing support;§Experience in planning, coordination and time management;§Have an aptitude to use the Ministry's Investment Management System (IMS);§The ability to communicate effectively (written and verbally) with a wide range of stakeholders, both internal and external;§Ability to manage positive relationships at all levels in the organisation;§Have an eye for detail and a high level of accuracy;§Be comfortable with ambiguity that change brings as we remain agile to a changing funding environment, demonstrating your resilience, multi-tasking skills and experience;§A proactive, solutions focused work style with a strong customer service focus and delivery; and§Some knowledge of the science system is beneficial but not essential.§§Team Culture§We work collaboratively within the branch and with others in MBIE, other Government agencies, and stakeholders in a fast-paced and dynamic environment.  We recognise a common set of team values that promote a fun positive team culture that values professionalism, respect, accountability and communication.  Diversity is highly valued and managers work hard to ensure that all staff are given opportunities to develop their skills and expertise.§How to Apply§§All applicants must be New Zealand citizens or hold a residence class visa. §Click on the §APPLY§ button below where a position description is also available. Your application must include your CV and a cover letter detailing your suitability for the position.§For more information about this vacancy please contact Steve Scannell on §steve.scannell@mbie.govt.nz§ quoting ref MBIE/1482999 if you have any further questions.§Applications close at 5pm on Wednesday 14th October 2020.§ § §§§§

jobTitle: Coordinator: Qualification, Training, Compliance Job in Waikato - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50703174.txt	§Coordinator: Qualification, Training, Compliance§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Coordinator: Qualification, Training, Compliance§§Advertiser: §Waikato District Health Board§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Oct 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Hamilton§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Office Management§§§§§§§§§  §    §      §        §          §Coordinator: Qualification, Training, Compliance §          §Where you’ll be working: §Waikato Hospital§ §The details:§ §Permanent, 40 hours per week§ §            §The Waikato District Health Board, Attendant, Security and Parking Services is seeking a Qualification and Training Coordinator to join our service.§  §About the role:§            §The Attendant services is a key service area within the DHB which is responsible for the day to day movement of patients, mail, waste, equipment, files and shuttle services around the DHB.§  §            §The Attendant department currently employs around 120 staff working a 24 hour 7 day a week basis.§  §            §The Security and Parking operation is also a 24 hour, 7 day operation, utilising a group of contract staff of around 60 to provide the safety and security services to our staff, patients and visitors. §  §            §The role works in close partnership with the management team with our service to develop and implement effective NZQA training to our staff.§  §            §This is an exciting opportunity for an experienced, passionate and motivated coordinator to become an integral member of an innovative and progressive leadership team who are committed to a high level of customer service to the wider DHB.§  §            §We are looking for somebody who enjoys working in a complex and challenging environment. If you are passionate about making a tangible difference in people’s lives, this role could be for you!§  § §Responsibilities of the role:§ §            §              §Develop, implement, coordinate and support the staff through the delivery of NZQA qualification Levels 2, 3 & 4.§              §Co-ordinate the staff inductions process and ongoing training to ensure all training requirements are met.§              §Work with the administration staff to coordinate the training rosters. §              §Meet the key performance indicators (KPIs) established annually with the line Manager.§              §Maintain the training matrix and the staff induction training process through to the completion of the new staff training and inclusion onto the main work roster.§            § §Requirements:§ §            §              §Experience with co-ordinating  complex training requirements for large numbers of staff §              §Experience in working unsupervised in a clerical and administration role.§              §Experience in training and qualifications provision will be an advantage.§              §Must have a high level of accuracy and attention to detail§              §Demonstrated high level skills in Microsoft Excel and other Office products.§              §Use technology to improve processes.§              §Communicate well and listen effectively.§              §Organise processes/files in a logical way.§              §Be diplomatic, influence and collaborate with others, and deal with conflict.§              §Display initiative and be productive,§              §Work closely with others as part of a team environment.§              §High motivation and commitment to providing a quality service§              §Motivation and interest in continued quality and service improvement§              §Openness to innovation and improvements to address equity§            § §Why us:§            §We are a values based and inclusive organisation that is committed to deliver the best health outcomes for our total population. To do this we are working hard to develop a robust and capable workforce that reflects the population we serve. We strongly encourage applicants from all backgrounds with the necessary capability and who share our values to apply and would greatly value seeing more applicants from our Māori communities.§  §Your application:§            §Please apply directly online, and click here to review the position description. Applications are not able to be accepted via email. For any queries about the role please contact Rachael Devey in the Recruitment Team on §(07) 839 8899§ Ext. 97184 or email §rachael.devey@waikatodhb.health.nz§  § §            §Application closing date: 22 October 2020§ § § §Values§§Theme “People at Heart” – Te iwi Ngakaunui§            §              §                §Give and earn respect - Whakamana§              §              §                §Listen to me; talk to me – Whakarongo§              §              §                §Fair play – Mauri Pai§              §              §                §Growing the good – Whakapakari§              §              §                §Stronger together – Kotahitanga§              §            §          §          §          §        §      §    §  §§§Where you’ll be working: §Waikato Hospital§ §The details:§ §Permanent, 40 hours per week§ §The Waikato District Health Board, Attendant, Security and Parking Services is seeking a Qualification and Training Coordinator to join our service.§  §About the role:§The Attendant services is a key service area within the DHB which is responsible for the day to day movement of patients, mail, waste, equipment, files and shuttle services around the DHB.§  §The Attendant department currently employs around 120 staff working a 24 hour 7 day a week basis.§  §The Security and Parking operation is also a 24 hour, 7 day operation, utilising a group of contract staff of around 60 to provide the safety and security services to our staff, patients and visitors. §  §The role works in close partnership with the management team with our service to develop and implement effective NZQA training to our staff.§  §This is an exciting opportunity for an experienced, passionate and motivated coordinator to become an integral member of an innovative and progressive leadership team who are committed to a high level of customer service to the wider DHB.§  §We are looking for somebody who enjoys working in a complex and challenging environment. If you are passionate about making a tangible difference in people’s lives, this role could be for you!§  § §Responsibilities of the role:§ §Develop, implement, coordinate and support the staff through the delivery of NZQA qualification Levels 2, 3 & 4.§Co-ordinate the staff inductions process and ongoing training to ensure all training requirements are met.§Work with the administration staff to coordinate the training rosters. §Meet the key performance indicators (KPIs) established annually with the line Manager.§Maintain the training matrix and the staff induction training process through to the completion of the new staff training and inclusion onto the main work roster.§ §Requirements:§ §Experience with co-ordinating  complex training requirements for large numbers of staff §Experience in working unsupervised in a clerical and administration role.§Experience in training and qualifications provision will be an advantage.§Must have a high level of accuracy and attention to detail§Demonstrated high level skills in Microsoft Excel and other Office products.§Use technology to improve processes.§Communicate well and listen effectively.§Organise processes/files in a logical way.§Be diplomatic, influence and collaborate with others, and deal with conflict.§Display initiative and be productive,§Work closely with others as part of a team environment.§High motivation and commitment to providing a quality service§Motivation and interest in continued quality and service improvement§Openness to innovation and improvements to address equity§ §Why us:§We are a values based and inclusive organisation that is committed to deliver the best health outcomes for our total population. To do this we are working hard to develop a robust and capable workforce that reflects the population we serve. We strongly encourage applicants from all backgrounds with the necessary capability and who share our values to apply and would greatly value seeing more applicants from our Māori communities.§  §Your application:§Please apply directly online, and click here to review the position description. The primary role of the Assistant Facilities Administrator is to ensure that our utility bays, kitchens, meeting rooms and hubs are supplied and maintained. This will involve auditing supplies and physically restocking these areas. This can be physically tiring work as two thirds of your day will be out around our National Office. The role will also provide administrative/customer service support in the form of basic administration including car park bookings, courier and mailroom assistance and serving customers who visit or contact out office. §        §Skills and experience§        §To be successful in this role you will:§        §          §Be able to work to timeframes and have good time management.§          §Have an change.§          §Have an upbeat and positive attitude§          §Be practical, hands on and enjoy physical work.§        §        §If this sounds like you, we would like to hear from you.§ connections in Property and Facilities to deliver safe, fit for purpose work environments today and tomorrow.§        §How to Apply§        §To apply, click the 'Apply Now' button to upload your CV, cover letter and complete the online application form.  Note: Your cover letter will be a key part of our assessment process, so please highlight how your experience relates to the key accountabilities listed in the position description.§        §All applications must be made online. If this is not possible or if you have any queries, please contact us at §jobs@msd.govt.nz§        §Applications close: 14 October 2020.§        §Position Description§        §http://www.msd.govt.nz/hr/documents/position-descriptions/dce-people-and-capability/property-and-facilities/assistant-administrator-facilities-management-june-20.docx§        §Joining us§ be who they are in a supportive and inclusive working environment. Our work to achieve better social outcomes affects almost every New Zealander, now or in the future.§        §https://jobs.msd.govt.nz/§      §    §    §  §§§Job Ref: 35133§ §Casual/On-Call§ § §Do you have an eye for detail?§ §Enjoy being on your feet?§ §Great lifestyle opportunity§ §Are you looking for casual or on-call work to support your lifestyle or student allowance?§ §About the Role§ §We are seeking someone to work in our busy Office Services team in the Wellington CBD.
