jobTitle: Business Support Coordinator Job in Auckland - SEEK
advertiser: Kiwibots - The New Zealand Robotics Charitable Trust
jobText: TXT/50703321.txt	§Business Support Coordinator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Business Support Coordinator§§Advertiser: §Kiwibots - The New Zealand Robotics Charitable Trust§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Papakura & Franklin§§Salary§§$50,000 - $59,999 p.a. FTE - pro rata 0.2-0.3 FTE§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Client & Sales Administration§§§§§§Background§Kiwibots are future-proofing NZ by providing opportunities that grow the capability of our future innovators and creative thinkers.§In 2009, the NZ Robotics Charitable Trust (Kiwibots) was set up to facilitate events and programmes that immerse young New Zealanders in robotics, all while encouraging teamwork, collaboration, hands-on experiences and world-class technical education.§We are growing – and quickly. Increases in volunteers, events, workshops, and more schools with a variety of robotics platforms means we need the help of someone who is excited about STEM engagement and wants to be part of our success story.§Benefits§This role is designed to be §flexible§ and §remote§ to fit alongside someone’s lifestyle, whether they are caring for family, managing other part time work, returning to the workforce, or simply wish to pick up a line of work that aligns with their values that isn’t full-time. As well as being flexible and remote, this role has the opportunity to become permanent for the right candidate.§Key Responsibilities§In this role as Business Support Coordinator, you will be working alongside the National Manager to support the Regional Coordinators (RCs) and manage relationships with a variety of schools, businesses and independent groups. Outside of this, you will be supporting the ongoing success of our existing business projects and new programmes that we build. Note we require all staff, RCs and key volunteers of Kiwibots to be NZ Police vetted.§1. §Managing customer relationships§We need our Business Support Coordinator to effectively manage the relationships we have with teachers, parents, and schools so that the Kiwibots community are provided continuous support.§You will also be responsible for managing new relationships as teams start with Kiwibots and onboarding new volunteers. Experience in customer service, consulting or sales industries is attractive.§2. §Data Administration§Alongside the National Manager, you will help with the gathering and administration of data to use in reports, external communications. Some of these tasks include updating reports with current engagement metrics, filing of reports, minutes, updating of customer information and data entry.§3. §Fulfil role of Secretary for Board meetings§Our Board of Trustees meet each quarter and this role will be the Secretary for these meetings.§4. §Assist with events and projects§This role will be able to assist where possible on our events and projects to ensure the programme continues to be a success. The nature of some of this extra assistance may mean that time is of the essence, so someone who is happy to pick up a phone and do some calls and problem solving would be a fantastic fit!§5. §Attend regular meetings with Kiwibots team§Team meetings with all the RCs of NZ and the National Manager take place approximately once a month through video conference. §6. §Support the National Manager§As a growing organisation, we move quickly and have lots of things on the go at any given time. Parts of this role will be assisting (where appropriate) the National Manager with administration to catch things that otherwise may slip through the cracks.§7. §Demonstrate our values as ambassadors of Kiwibots§As a representative of Kiwibots, you’ll be building many great relationships with the people you engage with. In everything we do that represents our brand, we are:§-  §Kind §– we act with kindness and understanding, making sure people feel valued and heard§-  §Responsible §– we own our mistakes and look for ways to learn and improve§-  §Effective §– we action our tasks and do it well§-  §Honest §– we are transparent in communication§-  §Respectful §– we value the views of each person we work with and the contexts that surround every person, project, and engagement§-  §Enthusiastic §– as a volunteer organisation, we are all here for the love of it, and we want to exude that energy and passion with everyone we encounter§-  §Role models §– we showcase that STEM and robotics is for everybody, breaking down barriers of fear, finding pockets where we can improve accessibility, encouraging collaboration, and always act professionally.§Apply Now§So what are you waiting for - if the above sounds like you, please email National Manager, Janet Van on §j.van@kiwibots.co.nz§ with your application. Perhaps you have other skills like accounting knowledge, market research, graphic design or something we haven’t thought of – please get in touch to let us know! We are open to modifying this role to fit the right candidate and can’t wait to hear from you.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Which of the following Microsoft Office products are you experienced with?§Do you have customer service experience?§§§

We are looking for someone who has a good idea of how business runs and will bring initiative, with the ability to anticipate what support is required, rather than needing constant instruction.§  §This will be a great opportunity for those interested in the investment industry, to gain exposure to a broad range of investment strategies and practices.§  §Qualities and Experience you will need to bring:§ § §Superior administration skills. Well-developed use of MS Office suite, especially excel§ §Lateral thinking. Strong use of initiative, and ability to connect the dots.§ §Proactive work habits. Able to see where value can be added, without instruction§ §Comfortable in a small office team environment§ §Agile thinking that appreciates a non-cookie cutter approach.§ §A good head for business and some understanding of finance / accounting§ §Preferably 5+ years’ experience in a similar business support function§ §Preferably from a private business, or professional service environment, rather than a large corporate§ §An interest in business, investments and making money / financial performance§ §The right person will relish taking ownership of this position and will immerse themselves in understanding how the business operates, so that they can become a valued member of the team.§  §If you believe you have the qualities to become an integral part of this successful business, then apply in confidence today. Please do so by sending your CV and cover letter via Seek, or to §lisa@kingsrecruitment.co.nz§  § Please note: Only those short-listed will be contacted, and this will happen within 2 weeks of your application§  § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§

We are looking for two PA superstar’s who share Auckland DHB’s values of Haere Mai (welcome), Manaaki (respect), Tūhono(together) and Angamua (aim high).§        § The two roles available are Personal Assistant to the Chief Health Professions Officer and Personal Assistant to the Chief Nursing Officer.§        §About the Role:§        § In this role, you will be providing high-level PA support to either the Chief Health Professions Officer or the Chief Nursing Officer; you will be ensuring that their direct reports are able to work efficiently and effectively and meet all strategic objectives.§        § You will be working within and as part of the corporate business team of personal assistants to provide secretarial, administrative and executive assistance to the Executive Management team to ensure efficient, effective and customer-focused service delivery and to meet the day-to-day operating needs of the office.§        § In this varied role you will be managing travel arrangements; preparing paperwork; taking minutes for meetings and presentations; managing calendars, emails and phone calls; and assisting with recruitment activities.§        §Click here to view the position description for Personal Assistant to the Chief Health Professions Officer role§        §Click here to view the position description for the Personal Assistant to the Chief Nursing Officer role§        §About You:§        § You will be accurate and quality orientated in your approach to your work, with the ability to communicate effectively with multiple stakeholders with a customer service ethos. You will have at least 5 years’ experience in an executive support role at senior management/board level. If you have a business-related tertiary qualification and experience in a health or large complex organisation, this is preferred but not essential. Having an organised work ethic and sound MS Office skills is vital for this role.§        §What Next?§        § Open the door to this amazing opportunity, simply apply online today with your current CV and covering letter outlining why this role is for you.§        § For assistance, you can email Will Brosnan - Recruitment Coordinator on §WBrosnan@adhb.govt.nz§        §New Zealand or Australian Citizenship/Residency is required for this role.§        §If we receive a high number of applications for this position, we may have to close our advertising early. We recommend that you submit your application as early as possible.§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§ §Working for Auckland DHB is an opportunity for you to make a real difference in the health and wellbeing of our Auckland community. We are looking for two PA superstar’s who share Auckland DHB’s values of Haere Mai (welcome), Manaaki (respect), Tūhono(together) and Angamua (aim high).§ The two roles available are Personal Assistant to the Chief Health Professions Officer and Personal Assistant to the Chief Nursing Officer.§About the Role:§ In this role, you will be providing high-level PA support to either the Chief Health Professions Officer or the Chief Nursing Officer; you will be ensuring that their direct reports are able to work efficiently and effectively and meet all strategic objectives.§ You will be working within and as part of the corporate business team of personal assistants to provide secretarial, administrative and executive assistance to the Executive Management team to ensure efficient, effective and customer-focused service delivery and to meet the day-to-day operating needs of the office.§ In this varied role you will be managing travel arrangements; preparing paperwork; taking minutes for meetings and presentations; managing calendars, emails and phone calls; and assisting with recruitment activities.§Click here to view the position description for Personal Assistant to the Chief Health Professions Officer role§Click here to view the position description for the Personal Assistant to the Chief Nursing Officer role§About You:§ You will be accurate and quality orientated in your approach to your work, with the ability to communicate effectively with multiple stakeholders with a customer service ethos. You will have at least 5 years’ experience in an executive support role at senior management/board level. If you have a business-related tertiary qualification and experience in a health or large complex organisation, this is preferred but not essential. Having an organised work ethic and sound MS Office skills is vital for this role.§What Next?§ Open the door to this amazing opportunity, simply apply online today with your current CV and covering letter outlining why this role is for you.§ For assistance, you can email Will Brosnan - Recruitment Coordinator on §WBrosnan@adhb.govt.nz§New Zealand or Australian Citizenship/Residency is required for this role.§If we receive a high number of applications for this position, we may have to close our advertising early. We recommend that you submit your application as early as possible.§§§§§

jobTitle: Customer Service Representative/ Accounts and Office Administrator Job in Wellington - SEEK
advertiser: Try the SEEK app to find your dream job faster.
jobText: TXT/50704125.txt	§Customer Service Representative/ Accounts and Office Administrator§§Private Advertiser§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Customer Service Representative/ Accounts and Office Administrator§§Private Advertiser§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Administrative Assistants§§§§§§Since our foundation in 1982, we have grown from a small team providing cleaning services to the brand we are today; offering a complete and innovative range of facility maintenance services.§ §We are renowned for being a people-first organisation. In an industry where the market is competing at the cheapest price for labour, we have persisted in paying extra and taking on additional cost to look after our people – and we have been richly rewarded in the loyalty and long-term service of our staff.§ §Our business is growing, and we have an exciting opportunity for a full-time Administrator to join our team in Wellington. We are a growing industry and there are opportunities in this role to move in a permanent position to another department within the company, if such an opening arise. § §This is a busy and varied role that would suit a multi-tasking self-starter. You will be required to provide customer service support and general administrative support to our team and customers, including:§ § §Enhancing the TPS customer base and managing the existing customer accounts;§ §Updating Rosters and reporting on Flexitime;§ §Responsible for invoice reconciliation and resolving any relevant queries;§ §Ordering uniforms, office stationery and managing the stationary stock;§ §Responsible for monthly and quarterly client reporting;§ §Creating quotes for Managers§ §Updating the cleaning specifications.§ §Responsible for creating and managing new employment contracts/proposals, variation letters and forms;§ §Responsible for chasing up TOU process and sending emails to contractors;§ §Managing Freshdesk tickets;§ §Collecting bills and updating the system accordingly;§ §Updating client usage reports;§ §Organising meetings, taking notes and sending out action points the relevant teams;§ §Sending out requests for installations or call outs;§ §Creating PO numbers for TPS staff;§ §Being the first point of contact for customers over the phones; and§ §Responsible for any other administration duties as required.§ § § §The successful candidate will have the following:§ § §Relevant experience in a business, management, or sales related role.§ §Excellent written and oral communication skills, including the ability to write and deliver proposals and presentations.§ §Excellent facilitation and negotiation skills, and the ability to close deals.§ §Committed and motivated to deliver your best for yourself and who you represent.§ §We’re looking for someone who can hit the ground running, so if you enjoy a challenge and prioritise your customers, please forward your CV and cover letter to Rebecca Withers at §rebeccaw@tps.co.nz§ . § §Applicants for this position should have New Zealand residency or a valid New Zealand Work Permit§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Which of the following Microsoft Office products are you experienced with?§Do you have experience in an administration role?§How many years of accounts receivable experience do you have?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§

jobText: TXT/50704155.txt	§Administrator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Administrator§§Advertiser: §Forté Recruitment Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Oct 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Salary§§$50,000 - $53,976 per annum§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Administrative Assistants§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Administrator §      §        §Our client is involved in supporting people with mental illness through community based services. No two days will be the same in this role and your key tasks will include:§        §          §Meeting coordination; working with multiple diaries and bringing people together§          §Minute taking for internal meetings§          §Finance administration; coding, petty cash and reconciling purchase orders§          §Administration assistance with leases and utility bills§          §Support to community based houses with supplies, orders, data entry and administration support§          §Booking catering, flights and accommodation§          §Providing support, diary coordination and administration needs for managers§          §Setting up AV requirements and virtual meetings§          §Managing relationships to connect stakeholders§        §        §To be considered for this role you will need:§        §          §A strong and stable administration background§          §Good Microsoft Office skills, these will be tested§          §Strong customer service skills§          §A full driver’s license§          §The ability to prioritise multiple tasks - you will receive lots of requests§          §A positive attitude and can do nature - pitching in is important in this role§          §Strong IT skills, this role will use Zoom, Teams and bespoke programs§          §Confidence in your skills and the ability to add value to the team§        §        §This is a fantastic opportunity to join a successful and passionate team who understand the importance of and encourage a strong work/life balance. They are a lovely, close knit team and the opportunity has arisen for a skilled Administrator to join their Christchurch based team from their modern Middleton based office.§ §This is a busy role with plenty of variety, you will need to be flexible, adaptable and able to work in a changeable environment.  You will be supporting managers and working closely with both office based and remote staff as well as working closely with another administrator. jobText: TXT/50704705.txt	§People & Culture Administrator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§People & Culture Administrator§§Advertiser: §Beca§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Administrative Assistants§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §People & Culture Administrator §      §        §§        §People & Culture Administrator§Play a key role in our People & Culture team working closely with our People Advice & Talent Acquisition teams. If you enjoy working in a fast-paced environment where you have the opportunity to shape the way our people work this is the role for you! We have over 45 gurus in our Group People and Culture team, so you will have the opportunity to work alongside some of the best in the industry. You will gain invaluable experience across the wider People & Culture team, which includes Talent Acquisition, Diversity & Inclusion, Organisational Development, Remuneration and Reward as well as HR Systems.§        §The opportunity§Our People Advice team are the first point of contact for providing Beca’s people leaders and employees with advice and guidance on all facets of the employee lifecycle. We are looking for a skilled Administrator to join our team in Auckland. Every day will look different and will present new challenges, overall, you will own our online employment change request system and be responsible for assisting throughout the employee lifecycle preparing and formatting employment variations and new letters of employment. Liaising with stakeholders across our business you will get in alongside our people leaders and influence the way they work. As we continue to innovate and automate you will be involved in implementing new technologies into our people processes.§        §You will be joining a close-knit team, who strive to ‘make everyday better’ delivering exceptional customer service for our internal stakeholders. We support each other, share our knowledge and problem-solve together, as well as having fun and a good laugh along the way. We welcome applicants from diverse backgrounds and have flexibility on how this role can be structured in terms of location and flexible working hours.§        §About you§You're an enthusiastic and experienced administrator with a passion for helping others. Confident and proactive, you can build relationships at all levels of the organisations. With great communication skills, highly flexible and adaptable you can juggle demands and delivery on time with accuracy. You will be known for your organisation and planning skills and be technologically savvy with Microsoft Office365. You will love to get involved with the team and what they do, and you take an active role in contributing to the culture of our team.§        §What we offer§A career with Beca will provide you with:§        §          §Professional development opportunities.§          §A supportive and caring work environment where you can bring your whole self to work.§          §Flexible working arrangements to balance your personal / family commitments.§          §Opportunities to learn from our industry experts and technical gurus across the Asia-Pacific.§          §Highly supportive environment of sharing and collaboration.§          §Excellent benefits provided to all staff - including discounted health insurance and a huge number of social club events.§        §        §Beca prides itself on supporting a diverse and inclusive culture - open to inputs from creative people of all§genders, ethnicity, identity, thought and experiences.§        §Ready to make the move?§If you want to make everyday better, apply online today on the link below. If you have any questions, call Autumn English - Talent Acquisition Business Partner on + §64 9 336 5954§. Applications close 23 October 2020.§        §About Beca§Beca is one of Asia Pacific's largest independent advisory, design and engineering consultancies. 2020 is a landmark year for Beca, representing both the dawn of a new decade and the beginning of our 2nd century. Throughout this year, we will celebrate our innovators, our thinkers, our explorers and our entrepreneurs; past, present and future.§        §We are a team of 3300-plus who brings a wide range of perspectives and expertise to every client and challenge, creating resourceful, smart solutions from our collective experience and insights.§        §While our experience has been 100 years in the making, it’s the fresh talent we’re nurturing, the innovative thinking we’re developing and the connections that we’re forging that gets us most excited for the future. www.beca.com.§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§§People & Culture Administrator§Play a key role in our People & Culture team working closely with our People Advice & Talent Acquisition teams. If you enjoy working in a fast-paced environment where you have the opportunity to shape the way our people work this is the role for you! We have over 45 gurus in our Group People and Culture team, so you will have the opportunity to work alongside some of the best in the industry. You will gain invaluable experience across the wider People & Culture team, which includes Talent Acquisition, Diversity & Inclusion, Organisational Development, Remuneration and Reward as well as HR Systems.§The opportunity§Our People Advice team are the first point of contact for providing Beca’s people leaders and employees with advice and guidance on all facets of the employee lifecycle. We are looking for a skilled Administrator to join our team in Auckland. Every day will look different and will present new challenges, overall, you will own our online employment change request system and be responsible for assisting throughout the employee lifecycle preparing and formatting employment variations and new letters of employment. Liaising with stakeholders across our business you will get in alongside our people leaders and influence the way they work. As we continue to innovate and automate you will be involved in implementing new technologies into our people processes.§You will be joining a close-knit team, who strive to ‘make everyday better’ delivering exceptional customer service for our internal stakeholders. We support each other, share our knowledge and problem-solve together, as well as having fun and a good laugh along the way. We welcome applicants from diverse backgrounds and have flexibility on how this role can be structured in terms of location and flexible working hours.§About you§You're an enthusiastic and experienced administrator with a passion for helping others. Confident and proactive, you can build relationships at all levels of the organisations. With great communication skills, highly flexible and adaptable you can juggle demands and delivery on time with accuracy. You will be known for your organisation and planning skills and be technologically savvy with Microsoft Office365. You will love to get involved with the team and what they do, and you take an active role in contributing to the culture of our team.§What we offer§A career with Beca will provide you with:§Professional development opportunities.§A supportive and caring work environment where you can bring your whole self to work.§Flexible working arrangements to balance your personal / family commitments.§Opportunities to learn from our industry experts and technical gurus across the Asia-Pacific.§Highly supportive environment of sharing and collaboration.§Excellent benefits provided to all staff - including discounted health insurance and a huge number of social club events.§Beca prides itself on supporting a diverse and inclusive culture - open to inputs from creative people of all§genders, ethnicity, identity, thought and experiences.§Ready to make the move?§If you want to make everyday better, apply online today on the link below. If you have any questions, call Autumn English - Talent Acquisition Business Partner on + §64 9 336 5954§. Applications close 23 October 2020.§About Beca§Beca is one of Asia Pacific's largest independent advisory, design and engineering consultancies. 2020 is a landmark year for Beca, representing both the dawn of a new decade and the beginning of our 2nd century. Throughout this year, we will celebrate our innovators, our thinkers, our explorers and our entrepreneurs; past, present and future.§We are a team of 3300-plus who brings a wide range of perspectives and expertise to every client and challenge, creating resourceful, smart solutions from our collective experience and insights.§While our experience has been 100 years in the making, it’s the fresh talent we’re nurturing, the innovative thinking we’re developing and the connections that we’re forging that gets us most excited for the future. www.beca.com.§§§§

Application period closes November 8, 2020.   §Please submit CV and Cover letter to apply. §If you have any questions or want to know more about the role please email Veronica  to §admin@hcsengineeringsolutions.co.nz§. §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as an office manager?§Which of the following Microsoft Office products are you experienced with?§Which of the following accounting packages are you experienced with?§Do you have customer service experience?§§§

Until either effective treatment or a vaccine is widely disseminated, a robust all-of-government response is required to protect the position we have gained. DPMC is responsible for coordinating and where necessary leading that all of government response.§We currently have a great opportunity for an experienced Executive Assistant to join the Communications & Public Engagement Team of the COVID-19 AOG Response Group in DPMC. This role will provide PA support to the Head of Communication & Public Engagement, as well as the wider Communications team.§Key responsibilities:§Providing direct support to the Head of Communications and Public Engagement including email triaging and diary management with a focus on forwarding planning and managing scheduling of meetings to ensure they meet their key priorities§Providing full meeting logistics, including minute taking and action item follow up where required§Managing/supporting flows of communication across the team, the business unit and with key stakeholders and agencies.§Monitoring and triaging the Communications and Public Engagement team inboxes including responding to public queries where appropriate§Ensuring all administrative task/functions comply with DPMC policies and procedures and playing a key role in championing these in the team§Assist communications team with mandatory government reporting as appropriate§Support the managers to run the Communications and Public Engagement budget including processing invoices, coordinating monthly reporting, budgeting and reforecast processes§Office management: filing, ordering stationery, supplies and necessary equipment§Assisting with budget, personnel and IT processes as required§Key requirements:§2+ years' experience as an executive assistant in Senior Leadership Executive Support roles, ideally in the public sector§Strong written and verbal communicator and organiser§Able to address multiple issues and priorities in a fast-paced environment§Calm under pressure, with good attention to detail, and the ability to apply judgement to competing deadlines§Demonstrates well developed relationship management skills with the ability to manage complex relationships both internally and externally, and being a good team member§Confident user of wide range of technologies, experience with document management and finance systems, strong on process§Please apply online. We have a preference to proceed with a secondment, but we are open to offer a fixed term agreement for the right candidate.§The application period closes on §Sunday October 11th.§For further information, please contact §lidia.maestroni@dpmc.govt.nz§§§§

jobText: TXT/50705406.txt	§Fixed Term Events & Staffing Administrator§§Private Advertiser§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Fixed Term Events & Staffing Administrator§§Private Advertiser§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Oct 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Hamilton§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Office Management§§§§§§Purpose:§  § This 6-Month Fixed Term Resource Coordinator position is a busy and varied role which helps to support our Waikato team with the primary purpose of this role being to develop, grow, roster and coordinate an outstanding team of people and deliver our promise of Best People- Trusted Solutions. Key to this fast-paced role will be continuous system improvement and development to ensure that we can respond to the increased demand that success brings.§ Bring your drive, enthusiasm, motivation & commitment to our positive workplace that will inspire our employees, our customers and our team.§  §  § §Role Responsibility:§  § In addition to the co-ordination of our people, the responsibilities will include:§ § §Creating an exceptional company & team experience and culture for our employees which motivates and engages them§ §Ensure all casual events and full-time sites are adequately teams and front-line staff§ §Provide leadership to our new and current front-line staff across the entire business§ §Monitor, evaluate and provide performance feedback for staff across sites§ §Foster a high performing and exciting environment in order to be able to identify and attract the best people§ §Involvement in the organisation of staff training, inductions and stocktakes§ §Establish and maintain an outstanding working relationship with employees, clients and stakeholders- you will be the first point of contact for all staff conversation & queries § §Ensure all company policies and procedures are implemented and adhered to at a high standard§ §  § §The Ideal Candidate:§  § §Essential§ § §This role is heavily admin focused so well-developed computer and administrative knowledge/skills, including use of Microsoft Office Suite is essential§ §A high standard of written and oral communication§ §Be highly motivated, professional, presentable and well organised§ §Have a strong work ethic and ability to pay attention to detail§ §Strong analytical, problem solving and efficient decision-making skills§ §Proven teamwork & leadership skills, working with front-line staff & Managers- We are ONE TEAM!§ §Logistically- focused mind both in office & out at sites§ §Must be adaptable to change- the Events space can change very quickly!§ §Ability to enforce minimum Employment standards§ §Being in the Events Industry there is a huge need to be flexible with working hours, including weekend and evening availability when needed. § §Full clean New Zealand driving license and Criminal History Slate§ §  § §Desirable§ § §Friendly and outgoing in both an office and site environment§ §Ability to think outside the box and be a forward, strategic thinker§ §Experience in staffing or logistics database systems§ §Ability to multi-task and prioritise tasks§ §Willing to accept a challenge!§ §  §  § Our ideal candidate will have a high degree of perseverance and patience within their leadership skills and work style. They will be enthusiastic, personable and ready to help in making a difference within our organisation.§ There are exciting times ahead for Red Badge Group and this is a brilliant Fixed Term opportunity to develop to your potential within the Resourcing & Employee Relations space, while you help develop the best company in the business.§  §  § Find out more about Red Badge Group at…§  § http://www.facebook.com/#!?RedBadgeGroup§  § www.redbadge.co.nz§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§What's your expected annual base salary?§Do you have customer service experience?§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§Which of the following Microsoft Office products are you experienced with?§§§

This company today work with some of New Zealand’s most successful corporates, co-operatives, private equity firms, privately owned companies, partnerships, and multinational companies.§This Executive Assistant position reports into two of the Senior Partners, the purpose of this role is to deliver high quality administrative execution, building strong relationships and providing outstanding support to their external stakeholders. You will provide contribution to the development of their knowledge resource systems, practices, and processes to ensure that they maintain their position as the leading organisation in the New Zealand Market.§Key Accountabilities:§§Document creation and formatting in Word and PowerPoint, including precise proofreading. This covers a variety of documents including but not limited to proposals, long-lists, reports, reference reports etc§Provide dictaphone typing assistance to the Partners§Coordinating meetings both internally and externally. These can be extremely complex with large numbers of significant senior stakeholders and can often include different locations with varying time-zones. External participants will typically include executives, clients, Directors, Boards etc§Record and monitor all billings and assignment expenses, liaising with the Contract Accountant to produce invoices and bill the clients§Manage monthly expenses, along with the credit cards§As appropriate, organise travel (taxis, flights, accommodation) for staff or client’s§Other administrative and support duties which might be reasonably required from time to time§Key Skills:§§Significant attention to detail and the ability to multi-task§Friendly outgoing, confident demeanour – we are4 looking for someone with a fun personality that really thrives on office culture and genuinely loves being around people§Advanced Microsoft Office skills with a good technical mindset§Previous PA or EA experience§Be naturally organised - with the ability to autonomously juggle projects§Understand the pressures of a high paced operational environment§Expertly interact with people right across the business landscape and demonstrate sound communication skills§If you are in the market for a new role OR wanting to explore a potential new AMAZING opportunity, I welcome you to send your CV to us for a confidential chat! §Please apply now!§§§§

jobTitle: Support & Maintenance Coordinator (6 months fixed term) Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50709386.txt	§Support & Maintenance Coordinator (6 months fixed term)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Support & Maintenance Coordinator (6 months fixed term)§§Advertiser: §Advanced Flight Engineering§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Administrative Assistants§§§§§§About the business§Advanced Flight Engineering is responsible for the maintenance of a large fleet of helicopters based at the award winning facility of Auckland Heliport in Onehunga. We are a NZCAA Part 145 certified maintenance organisation. Our focus is to provide the best professional service to our customers by having efficient processes in place as well as excellent communication. Our core values are continuous improvement, teamwork, and commitment to customers.§The role§A 6-months fixed term position has become available to support our busy administration team.  In the role of §Support & Maintenance Coordinator,§ you will support a highly skilled engineering & admin team with a wide variety of tasks which include:§Prepare work packs for maintenance§Follow up on open orders with suppliers§Update Maintenance Software§Update aircraft data regularly §Create purchase orders to suppliers§Unpack parts and receive items into the system§Pack parts and prepare for shipment§Pick parts for maintenance and support stores tasks§Supplier communication§Update spreadsheets§Daily kitchen duties§For this role, we are seeking an individual with exceptional attention to detail. You will need to be self-motivated, flexible and have excellent written and verbal communication skills. As we are working with a variety of software programs it is important that you are very computer literate and have a very good understanding of Excel, Word and Outlook. §To apply please include a cover letter in which you demonstrate that you have the above skills and how you have successfully used them in the past.§For the right person, this role will be a great challenge and experience as it gives insight into the maintenance operation of a large helicopter fleet. We provide an exciting and professional work environment in central Auckland as part of a great team. §Due to the nature of this role, only New Zealand Citizens and Permanent Residents can be considered.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Which of the following Microsoft Office products are you experienced with?§How would you rate your English language skills?§Do you have experience in an administration role?§What's your expected hourly rate?§§§

jobTitle: Programme Coordinator Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50709390.txt	§Programme Coordinator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Programme Coordinator§§Advertiser: §New Zealand Police§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Other§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Programme Coordinator §      §        §Programme Coordination it starts with you! §        §Salary starting at $66.757,00§        §Based in Auckland§        §Full time, fixed term until 30th July 2021§        §        §About the role§        §The Service Group Team is a large operational team which is focused on continually improving the service provided to the NZ public and frontline staff. As such we have an opportunity available within the Service Improvement team and are looking for a skilled Programme Coordinator to assist with our service improvement initiatives and the pipeline of work.§        § §        §The Programme Coordinator will provide effective and efficient administrative support to the Principal Advisor for planning, reporting and project documentation along with communication and team coordination to support the development and delivery of projects.§        §        §Key Accountabilities:§        §          §Responsible for continuous improvement initiatives to ensure we're delivering the best service possible§          §Work collaboratively across the organisation with various workgroups and with our external partners.§        §        §        §What you’ll bring§        §Being part of the Police whānau is about being our best to ensure our communities are safe and feel safe. §        § §        §To support the delivery of these outcomes the Programme Coordinator will provide effective and efficient administrative support to the Principal Advisor for planning, reporting and project documentation along with communication and team coordination to support the development and delivery of projects.§        § §        §Our Core Competencies provide a shared understanding of the behaviours, leadership and technical competence required for success at each level of Police. Whilst we are looking for skills, knowledge and experience relevant to the role, we also place high importance on your ability to collaborate and partner with stakeholders.  You are resourceful, have attention to detail and are outcomes focused.  §        § §        §We're looking for people with experience in programme management and are confident to work across the business to enable successful change.§        §        §This role is set at Individual Contributor level, this means your key purpose is “to deliver or enable others to deliver Our Business”.§        § §        §We will ask you questions based on “How we will deliver Our Business – Core Competencies” and the appropriate role level, i.e. Individual Contributor. For more information on Our Core Competencies, please copy and paste this URL:  https://www.police.govt.nz/sites/default/files/publications/core-competencies-how-we-will-deliver-our-business.pdf. §        § §        §These questions will be unique and specific to the role, focusing on the aspects the hiring manager believes are most important for that position at the time. For more information on Our Values, please copy and paste this URL: https://www.police.govt.nz/sites/default/files/publications/nzp-our-values.pdf§        §        §To view the position description for this role please copy and paste this link into a new browser:§ §        §https://www.police.govt.nz/sites/default/files/pd/09-2020/programme_coordinator_-_pd.pdf§        §        §About us§        §Our mission is to be the safest country by delivering services that ensure New Zealand communities are confident, safe and secure. §        § §        §Working Flexibly§        §Your wellbeing inside and outside of work is important to us. We’re open to discussing flexible working options that work for both you and the business. §        §For more information on the above, please copy and paste this URL: https://www.police.govt.nz/careers§        §How to apply§        §If this position sounds like you, click apply now. You will be required to submit an application form. Before confirmation of hire, pre-employment checks will be undertaken. For further information on the application process, please copy and paste this URL: https://www.police.govt.nz/careers§        § §        §If you have any questions about this vacancy, please contact §Karl.Millington@police.govt.nz§§        §        §Applications close 5pm, Friday 23rd October.§        § §        § §  §        §      §      §      §    §    §  §§§Programme Coordination it starts with you! § §Salary starting at $66.757,00§ §Based in Auckland§ §Full time, fixed term until 30th July 2021§ § §About the role§ §The Service Group Team is a large operational team which is focused on continually improving the service provided to the NZ public and frontline staff. As such we have an opportunity available within the Service Improvement team and are looking for a skilled Programme Coordinator to assist with our service improvement initiatives and the pipeline of work.§ § § §The Programme Coordinator will provide effective and efficient administrative support to the Principal Advisor for planning, reporting and project documentation along with communication and team coordination to support the development and delivery of projects.§ § §Key Accountabilities:§ §Responsible for continuous improvement initiatives to ensure we're delivering the best service possible§ §Work collaboratively across the organisation with various workgroups and with our external partners.§ § §What you’ll bring§ §Being part of the Police whānau is about being our best to ensure our communities are safe and feel safe. § § § §To support the delivery of these outcomes the Programme Coordinator will provide effective and efficient administrative support to the Principal Advisor for planning, reporting and project documentation along with communication and team coordination to support the development and delivery of projects.§ § § §Our Core Competencies provide a shared understanding of the behaviours, leadership and technical competence required for success at each level of Police. Whilst we are looking for skills, knowledge and experience relevant to the role, we also place high importance on your ability to collaborate and partner with stakeholders.  You are resourceful, have attention to detail and are outcomes focused.  § § § §We're looking for people with experience in programme management and are confident to work across the business to enable successful change.§ § §This role is set at Individual Contributor level, this means your key purpose is “to deliver or enable others to deliver Our Business”.§ § § §We will ask you questions based on “How we will deliver Our Business – Core Competencies” and the appropriate role level, i.e. Individual Contributor. For more information on Our Core Competencies, please copy and paste this URL:  https://www.police.govt.nz/sites/default/files/publications/core-competencies-how-we-will-deliver-our-business.pdf. § § § §These questions will be unique and specific to the role, focusing on the aspects the hiring manager believes are most important for that position at the time. For more information on Our Values, please copy and paste this URL: https://www.police.govt.nz/sites/default/files/publications/nzp-our-values.pdf§ § §To view the position description for this role please copy and paste this link into a new browser:§ § §https://www.police.govt.nz/sites/default/files/pd/09-2020/programme_coordinator_-_pd.pdf§ § §About us§ §Our mission is to be the safest country by delivering services that ensure New Zealand communities are confident, safe and secure. § § § §Working Flexibly§ §Your wellbeing inside and outside of work is important to us. We’re open to discussing flexible working options that work for both you and the business. § §For more information on the above, please copy and paste this URL: https://www.police.govt.nz/careers§ §How to apply§ §If this position sounds like you, click apply now. You will be required to submit an application form. Before confirmation of hire, pre-employment checks will be undertaken. For further information on the application process, please copy and paste this URL: https://www.police.govt.nz/careers§ § § §If you have any questions about this vacancy, please contact §Karl.Millington@police.govt.nz§ § §Applications close 5pm, Friday 23rd October.§ § § § §  §§§§§

jobTitle: Supporter Services Administrator Assistant (Fixed Term) Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50709693.txt	§Supporter Services Administrator Assistant (Fixed Term)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Supporter Services Administrator Assistant (Fixed Term)§§Advertiser: §Oxfam New Zealand§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Salary§§$47,840 per annum pro-rated§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Administrative Assistants§§§§§§§Want to take that step up in your career with an organisation dedicated to challenging inequality?§§Join us at Oxfam, where we’re ending the injustice of poverty. § §For everyone. For good. § §The role§This role sits in the Supporter Services department within the Fundraising Directorate. The Fundraising Directorate’s role is to engage, educate and publicise the work of Oxfam within New Zealand so as to create more supporters who do more, give more and stay longer.§The temporary Supporter Services Administrator Assistant role provides additional capacity to the Supporter Services Administrator to better resource surge in supporter service needs throughout our busy October 2020 - January 2021 period. Your main focus will be on providing an engaging experience to our supporters through the effective handing of supporter queries and processing of unwrapped and ethical goods sales.§ § §Supporter Care§ § §Respond to inbound communications (phone, email, post) in a timely and supporter friendly manner for Unwrapped, Online ethical shop, cash and regular givers§ §Follow up with supporters whose items have been returned to ONZ§ §Contribute to supporter experiences, ensuring the processing of donations, thanking donors is executed accurately, timely and efficiently.§ §Work to reduce the number of cancellations of regular givers from inbound emails and phones calls§ §Conduct outbound calls to contact supporters to reinstate declined donations§ §Conduct outbound calls to contact supporters and correct their details§  § §Supporter Admin§ § §Guide and support volunteers to key data from orders for Unwrapped donations and ethical goods purchases in the website§ §Batch cash and cheque payment§ §As required, key data from mail order for Unwrapped donations and ethical goods purchases into the website§ §Process refunds or exchanges for ethical goods within the payment gateway and update records accordingly§ §Accurately record/respond to supporter complaints to procedure§ §Add and modify supporter details into CRM ensuring the organisation’s data integrity objectives including timeliness and accuracy are followed§ §Curate a knowledge base of commonly needed responses to supporter queries on Unwrapped and the ethical shop§ §Make recommendations about improving processes and guidelines for supporter information management.§  § §Our ideal candidate§ § §Experience in providing excellent customer service, including strong phone and email communication skills§ §Excellent attention to detail§ §Organisational and IT skills (particularly Microsoft Office applications)§ §Administrative and Data entry skills§ §Comfortable working in a sometimes fast-paced environment§ §Experience with CRM software, desirable§ §An understanding of ecommerce platforms, desirable§ §An active interest in the social justice and development§  § §To Apply: § §In return, we offer a fun, supportive work environment, and the opportunity to gain industry experience in the non profit sector. With your work, you will contribute to ending poverty! The starting salary for this fixed term role is §$47,840 per annum pro-rated, and is for 30 hours per week.§ This is an interim support role ideally starting from the §26 October 2020, and will be concluding on the 15 January 2021.§ §Copy & paste the following link into your web browser to submit your application via our job portal:§ https://oxfamnz.bamboohr.com/jobs/view.php?id=83&source=aWQ9MTA%3D§ §DO NOT APPLY VIA SEEK.§ §For the full job description, visit our job portal via the link above.§ §Applications closing date§ 14 October, 9:00am. Shortlisted candidates will be contacted for initial interviews to take place on the 15 & 16 October.§ § § §Note: Only candidates currently living in NZ with the right to work in New Zealand need apply. All offers of employment will be subject to satisfactory references and may also be subject to additional screening checks, which can include criminal record and medical checks.§ §We are committed to: preventing any type of unwanted behaviour at work including sexual harassment, exploitation and abuse, lack of integrity and financial misconduct; and promoting the welfare of children, young people and adults.  Oxfam expects all staff and volunteers to share this commitment through our Code of Conduct. We place a high priority on ensuring that we recruit only those who share and demonstrate our values.§ §Oxfam New Zealand is an equal opportunities employer and encourages diversity in the workplace.§ §§§§

jobTitle: Court Registry Officer - Nelson Job in Tasman - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50709774.txt	§Court Registry Officer - Nelson§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Court Registry Officer - Nelson§§Advertiser: §Ministry of Justice§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Oct 2020§§Location§§Tasman§, §Nelson§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Administration & Office Support§, §Administrative Assistants§§§§§§Court Registry Officer§§MOJ/1479767§§Nelson§§Fixed Term Full Time§§ §§Te āhuatunga a te tūranga/About the Role§§ §In this role you will work with a team responsible for the successful operation of the Court. You will liaise with multiple stakeholders who are interacting with the Justice system. This includes being able to communicate confidently with Judges within the courtroom and their chambers, as well as other members of the judiciary.§In this role, the tasks include but is not limited to:§ §§Court Taking - this is the facilitation of running the court. This includes introducing Judges (in English and Te Reo Maori), working closely with them in the Courtroom and Chambers, managing jurors and general administration of the court.§Customer Service - interacting with customers on any court related matter. Customer queries can come in via face to face, phone or email interactions - so you will need to be confident with all methods.  §Case management - this involves ensuring files are accurate and up to date. This part of the role involves a large component of data entry.§§ §Mō te tīma/About our Team§At the Ministry of Justice we deliver people centred services to provide access to justice for all. Te tuku ratonga ā-tangata kia āhei atu ai te katoa ki te ture.§ §Creating a continuous learning environment is important to us. As the successful applicant, you will bring your thirst for knowledge and improvement. You will have an individual training plan and be supported to carry out the role. As a Court Registry Officer this includes exercising Deputy Registrar Powers. §As an organisation we empower our people with building their wellbeing knowledge, offering a range of wellbeing tools and support.§ §§Joining the Ministry of Justice means you will become part of an inclusive organisation that values you and the communities we serve. §It's our promise to ensure our workplace is one where our people feel healthy and safe, supported and able to be themselves at work. We value respect as the foundation for building a positive workplace culture and one where diversity is welcomed and celebrated. §§ § §§He pūkenga tou/Skills and Experience§ §With pride in your work, you will strive to deliver a service to our customers with high accuracy and professionalism.§Our customers are diverse, and our workforce reflects this. This role is no different and would suit a variety of backgrounds. Whether you have an interest in the Justice system, returning to the workforce, have a passion for working with customers this is your chance to join us on our journey to deliver people centred justice services for all.§To be successful, you will need to be:§ §§Detail orientated and observant§ - the court has many different processes and case information needs to be accurate;§Self-aware§ - our customers are unique, and you will be confident working, both individually and as a team, across a range of situations;§Multi-task§ - some of our processes are repetitive, but you'll be able to manage conflicting priorities and move from one task to another quickly;§Willing to learn§ - legislation and processes in the courts is always changing and you will be able to adapt and take onboard feedback.§Resilient §- there are times when working in the courts, you will be working on sensitive cases and sometimes at high volume.§§ §Tono mai/How to Apply§§If successful, you will be invited to an onsite interview in Nelson.§Starting salaries are generally between $48,853 and $57,473 and are dependent on skills and experience.§Only applicants with the right to work in New Zealand will be considered for this position.§To apply, click the Apply button below to be directed to our Careers Website. You can view a detailed position description at the site, as well as complete an online application form by attaching your CV and cover letter.§For tracking purposes, all applications must be submitted via our online process.§Applications close on15 September 2020.§§ §To apply, click the Apply button below to be directed to our Careers Website. You can view a detailed position description here, as well as complete an online application form by attaching your CV and cover letter.§Applications close on 15 September 2020.§If you have any questions please contact §recruitment@justice.govt.nz§§§§
